Reviews.Title: “Great location, food and room”
Reviews.Author: topkat_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel 1898 in March one night only, but would come back again. Great location, room, spa, and amazing breakfast !!!!! I found a great deal £150 on one website that include breakfast in price and price was by far best, we stayed Wednsday to Thursday. Drink in hotel bar is not inexpensive but nice to have one(Guiness was 9 or 11 euro). All staff are helpfull. My opinion that its not a big difference in what you get if you book more expensive room unless you go for the one that have a terrace , i have checked with reception at choice of hotel room option and from the plan i saw.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: leah82-12
Reviews.Content: we stayed at hotel 1898 for four nights in april 2012 and have to say its the best hotel we have stayed in.we couldnt find any faults, hotel very clean, staff so friendly and helpful, spa very relaxing, roof top bar has got great views but can get quite windy. we didnt have breakfast at the hotel so cant comment on that as we went next door to star bucks for a light snack. (not big breakfast eaters!) our room was lovely! we booked a double room and was really pleased with it, lovely and clean! bed very comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Dark but quality”
Reviews.Author: Muggins69
Reviews.Content: Stayed there tuesday 17th April and the first thing that struck me was very dark and quiet, Room was lovely, aircom quiet, tv changed languages(free), lights had various settings and extras in bathroom and robes made it executive style, €215 included breakfast, buffet stlye but verything, staff couldnt do enough for you and would stay again. Prices in bar high though otherwise would get 5 rating, check out spa(free) if you go, pool very relaxing, roof top pool bit windy though

Reviews.Title: “Curate's egg”
Reviews.Author: ViICTORIA1
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed in our recent two night stay in the light of many previous glowing reviews. The obvious plus points of the hotel are it's central location and the good, varied buffet breakfast. The downside is the size of the smaller rooms, the decoration and the noise which even soundproofing fails to exclude. Our first impressions were of a very dark, cavernous and poorly lit entrance hall largely decorated in black. We realised that it was meant to be dramatic but it was deeply depressing. Our room was similarly decorated in shades of dark green/black with little light relief and a small window crammed into a corner. Not only was it miserable but very stuffy but when the window was opened a great wall of "music" erupted from the adjacent building which can only have been 10' opposite our window. It was so claustrophobic and noisy that we asked to be moved to a room with the same kind of decor but with a bigger window. We had to pay €70 but we had no option. The rooms are all reasonably furnished and the bathrooms and rooms are very clean. We had a problem getting any milk for the room tea -- it simply never arrived after it was requested and you are left with one small bottle of water on the first night with no subsequent replacements. The noise from La Rambla continued until the early hours when it was taken up by some residents screaming in the corridor outside our room.........it would be fair to say that this was not the hotel for us!

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona: Hotel 1898: Good hotel, but be critical which part you stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelGeeks2009
Reviews.Content: The first impression when you get into the hotel is a bit of a dark brown mahoney bit of an antique type of hotel, but soon you discover that attractive and a tastefully modern touch can be found everywhere in the hotel from reception lounge area to the library, even the hotels corridors, not always the most attractive place in any hotel. Everywhere you can find large b/w photos on the walls of every space, from restaurant to the spa, library, bar as well as in the corridors of the 7 floors of the hotel. Stayed in a room on the 3rd floor at the front side so facing the Rambla, the busiest street/walkway of Barcelona. That was a mistake, the first night as I heard all sorts of noises that you can imagine, street shouting during the small hours at night, cars, even the metro/underground/train could easily be heard. If you are sensitive for all kind of noises (despite the double glass windows) make sure you stay at the quieter side of the hotel. The reception gently moved me to the 6th floor away from the street. The beds are comfy, the interior of the rooms is rather spacious even in the cheaper room class, nicely colored Japanese red good lighting (can be dimmed, very nice), wooden floors and a modern, comfortable bathroom with full amenities. Internet is free (I like that, still too many hotels making this not a standard part of the room package against sometimes ridiculous prices). Breakfast is rich (good selection). The hotel has a small but nice indoor swimming pool and a SPA, although booking a massage wasn't easy as they only seemed to have one masseuse). One thing that could be improved is that there is no in room movie channel (not a big deal if you are an iPad fan with TV shows no your iPad, but still...). The front desk had some good and worthy recommendation for tapas, a must when you are in Spain. All in all: worth the bucks, but make sure you book a quiet room!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing terrace!”
Reviews.Author: Euroroad
Reviews.Content: Great central location and a magnificent terrace. Staff were great and rooms beautifully furnished.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional hotel with a great decoration”
Reviews.Author: Olabitz
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights during Christhmas 2011 in Barcelona in 1898. It was perfect. Location is best. Service is very good. I booked through Expedia.com and we got a very large room. I dont know if we were upgraded, but the room was far larger than others as I could see when other rooms were beeing serviced. The best part of the hotel is the decoration. The combination of old, colonial style, with modern fashion is amazing. Nothing cold -so common in modern style-, nothing kitsch: elegant, outstandind quality. We had only an inconvinience: after a night shower, we could open the bathtub tap, and it remained full of water. We called reception, and even if they send someone, he was not a technical employee, so they could not work it out. Yet, after some 'forcing' I suceeded in opening and empty the bath tub. Yet, this was a minor inconvinience, that did not ruin at all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel...will be back!”
Reviews.Author: LondonMarkMike
Reviews.Content: Checked in on Fri 13th April for a long weekend with my partner and two friends. Our friends had stayed here previously and enjoyed it so much they suggested it again for this trip. I am so glad they did as overall this is a gem of a hotel and an excellent hotel for exploring wonderful Barcelona! It is situated on La Rambla and is centrally located and convenient for most of the sites, especially the Old Town and Port area. It is a short ish cab ride from the airport too. Whilst the reception is dark it feels like you've walked into a Ralph Lauren show room. There is lots of black and browns, large furniture and heavy curtains and blinds, making it very stylish and sophisticated. It has a lot of beautiful period features which have been tastefully incorporated into the look and feel. We were allocated a room on the 6th floor (I requested a room on a high floor when I made the booking as I'd read reports about noise issues on lower floors) and I am pleased we were up high for a couple of reasons. Firstly, we simply had to leave our room, turn the corner, walk up a stair case and we were out on the beautiful roof deck complete with plentiful loungers, chairs, bar and swimming pool! The panoramic views across the city were wonderful and it is a great way to unwind after spending a day exploring the city. Secondly, it is very quiet up on the 6th floor and you have fantastic views out across the city skyline. The basement Spa is also delightful with a nice pool, steam room and sauna and massage facilities and gym. It is nice to have this facility to use and enjoy and a great way to relax. Whilst the rooms are not massive, it shouldn't take the shine of the hotel as hopefully you'll be out enjoying the city. The room are well appointed and decorated. The beds are very comfortable. The bathrooms is also nice. Generally the service in the hotel was of a good standard. We only experienced helpful, friendly and professional staff. Breakfast was of a good quality and at 22 euros per person seemed reasonable for the variety on offer. Check breakfast is included in your rate as ours wasn't even though we thought it was. We would definitely return to this hotel and would recommend strongly to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, love the pool.”
Reviews.Author: darkestperu
Reviews.Content: Booked last minute, based on Trip Advisor reviews using lastminute.com. Very easy to get to from the airport bus, in fact location could not be better. Reception and bar cool and rooms are great, had loads of fun at the roof top pool. Would recommend in every way, only downside is drinks are seriously expensive. Fave nearby bar and tapas Bar Lobo - awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Just as expected.”
Reviews.Author: pinkldy85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from Spain. Hotel 1898 was just as expected from the other tripadvisor reviews and the hotel website. We were in Room 401, a Classic corner unit. The room itself was well-appointed. The decor was quite sophisticated, in dark green, wood, and silver hardware. The bed was larger than the ones in the other hotels we stayed in during our trip. I would consider it a true king. The air conditioning worked perfectly. Wireless internet was free. As for toiletries, from what I can remember, you're provided with tooth brushes, a shaving kit, shower cap, comb, shampoo, lotion, body wash, and two pairs of slippers. The room has some neat technology. The mirror in the bathroom does not fog up. The light switch has various levels of intensity (regular, welcome, reading, relax, etc.). Room 401 has a small balcony (less than a foot in width so you can't go out there). There is no view. They provide one bottle of water upon check-in. However, all other water is from the mini bar, which is not free. No irons are provided. There are two swimming pools, one on the roof top and another on the bottom floor. The one on the bottom floor looks just like what you see on the website pictures. The roof top pool is kind of small. Although the pools are heated, we skipped the upstairs pool b/c it was too cold and rainy. Even if you don't go swimming in the roof top pool, the roof top deck is definitely worth checking out. The set up is nice and the views are amazing. There is a bar up there. (However, it wasn't open when we were there. Probably b/c it was too cold.) I can imagine that during warmer weather it would be very cool to hang out up there. There is a fitness room & spa. Unfortunately, we didn't have time to check out either. The fitness room did look well equipped with up-to-date machines. The spa also looked very nice. The hotel is located in a great spot. It is close to the Metro and right in the midst of all the fun on the Rambla. From the hotel we were able to walk to most sights. (My husband and I are walkers.) We did take the metro to Sagrada Familia. From Sagrada Familia, we walked a ways and caught a bus to Parc Gruell. We never got to Barceloneta, so I cannot attest to whether that distance is walkable. Judging from the map however, I'm sure it would have been fine. Our favorite places in Barcelona were the Picasso Museum, our self-tour of Gaudi's work (which, included Park Gruell, Sagrada Familia, & the homes on the Block of Discord), and the Catalan Concert Hall. The Concert Hall is beautiful. You can buy tickets for a tour during the day. Or, you can do what we did...We bought the cheapest tickets ($29/person) for a classic guitar concert at night. It was one of the most memorable moments we had in Barcelona. We used Rick Steves as our guide.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with horrible staff”
Reviews.Author: monster77
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is really beautiful and the location is very central. The Experior Room was very spacious and even faced the street it wasn't that noisy. The beds and pillows are wonderful and we slept very well. Breakfast is a bit expensive but worth it. It was a great buffet with wonderful fresh food. The Spa was very nice and clean. We loved it. The negative was that other tourists do use the Sauna without towels and they were very noisy...so it's not that easy to relax. The only negative i can admit was the hotel staff at the reception (especially the chief of reception), they were so arrogant. They do not even try to understand you if you don't speak catalan or english (italian is similar to spanish). And once you checked out and have another questions or need any advise the were rude and arrogant! Allover it was a very pleasant stay and we enjoyed the hotel very much!

Reviews.Title: “Bad start but...”
Reviews.Author: lennart27
Reviews.Content: We checked in at the H1898 inthe beginning of April. We had reserved a so called classical room as we wanted to avoid any street noise. The room was very small and facing a very small inner court. But that had been alright if the AC had functioned. It did not. After complaints, several service personell tried to fix it but without result.From the reception desk the only answer was: Stay in the room - it will take a few minutes for the AC to cool the room. We stayed for two hours, the temperature was all the time over 25 degrees. When we were about to give up and move to another hotel, the receptionist accepted that there was someting wrong and upgraded us to a somewhat bigger room with functioning AC. After that we enjoyed our stay at the H1898. We were even asked if we would, as a compensation, wish to move to an even better room. Having moved once, we declined, however. So, the conclusion is that the hotel is fine but the reception personell could be more friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “When is "Breakfast Included" not really included???”
Reviews.Author: nana541
Reviews.Content: Would have given 1898 a 5... But after a lovely stay they charged us for Breakfast even though my Rate Included Breakfast and not only that on the last day I did not even have Breakfast but they charged anyway....left a very bad taste in my mouth for this hotel so beware!! Seems their "Breakfast Included" rate is simply a discount on breakfast and not Free or Included...this is not spelled out at all on website or confirmation....just turned into another required fee which caused us to pay even more when one of us slept in and did not eat!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: VacationOslo
Reviews.Content: Very centrally located at Ramblas. Staff was very friendly and attentive. They were always one step ahead of us when it came to eg asking us if we wanted our luggage taken care of. Breakfast was very nice. The breakfast room did not have that many windows, so it was a bit dark. The bed room was nice. At the roof top there was a swimming pool and a bar to use. I would very much like to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to explore a truly great city!”
Reviews.Author: TIpperGee13
Reviews.Content: I have been fortunate enough to visit Barcelona maybe 5 or 6 times. I love this city. The food, the night life, the culture, the people. Everything. I have stayed in youth hostels to 5 star hotels in Barcelona but this was the first time I actually stayed on La Rambla. It was AMAZING! You really do feel like you are part of the city. It can be noisy and a little rowdy but being from London, I am use to this. The hotel is bang on La Rambla. Perfect for exploring Barri Gotic or El Raval. The hotel has an entrance on La Rambla and also a side entrance. Look for Carrefour Supermarket and it is just after that. Staff: Always ready to assist. Reception staff were very helpful. Bar staff very friendly. Rooms: We had a deluxe room looking over La Rambla. It is a little noisy but there is double glazing and the evening hustle and bustle didn't bother us at all. Rooms were modern and really clean. Bathrooms had shower over the bath. Bed VERY comfortable and there is a pillow menu. Room Service: Great food. Quick delivery. Not sure if it is 24 Hour. Spa: LOVELY! Just what you need after spending the day exploring the city. Sauna, Steam room, indoor swimming pool, massage showers etc. Very nice although the pool was a little cold. There is also a small gym. Bar: Nice bar area in lobby. Good menu and tapas/bar food menu. There is an outdoor pool and a bar on the roof but we didn't use it. Breakfast: We only had breakfast on one morning. We opted for the Hotel 1898 breakfast which was lovely. There is a Starbucks coffee shop next door to the hotel where we quickly/easily picked up coffee on the mornings we missed breakfast and needed some caffeine! Barcelona is a great city. You can not go wrong with this hotel. I will definitely stay again. Although I have stayed at their sister hotel Hotel B - also in Barcelona and that too was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Best Decision Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer E
Reviews.Content: From the moment you walk up to 1898, you will be satisfied with your choice of hotel. 1898 was recommended to us from some friends who stayed here a year before us and raved about it. The service is impeccable, Monika at the front desk spoke perfect English and spent time reviewing the map and giving us multiple sightseeing and restaurant recommendations. The hotel is beautifully decorated, the spa is luxurious, and the rooftop bar has great views of the city and a relaxed environment to unwind after a day of sightseeing. We were there in March, so I would advise you that the bar closed at 5:00pm because it was early in the season, unlike our friends who were there in the summer and had late evenings there before or after dinner. We received a tip from another patron before we left the hotel to purchase and print our sightseeing tickets for Sagrada Familia Bacilica in the business center of the hotel, this tip saved us a two hour wait in the line that we passed when we arrived to the tour!!!!! Breakfast at 1898 is like no other! Beautiful display or meats, cheeses, pastries, breads, yogurt, eggs, fruits, nuts, .....u name it!! And champagne to poor over orange juice for mimosa's. One more tip: there are few rooms that face the lively street of Las Ramblas, I would advise requesting one of those rooms, ours was 446 and had a little balcony to step out on and over look the hustle and bustle of the action. Enjoy!!!!! If we returned, we would stay again 100 times over!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Ninigivi
Reviews.Content: I adored this hotel, we stayed in June and the weather was glorious. We were right on Las Ramblas but when in the hotel felt like we could have been anywhere. The views from the rooftop bar were brilliant. The hotel felt traditional but with modern features, making it an all round experience. Staff were brilliant and the breakfast buffet, though expensive was really top notch. Have recommended this hotel to friends and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Helenbarton
Reviews.Content: This hotel really does deserve all the good reviews it recieves, its a great location situated on Las Ramblas, and a good base for seeing the sites of Barcelona. One piece of advice,we had a British airways flight into terminal one, and walked straight out of the terminal building and got the blue bus 5.50 euros each (you get your ticket at the bus stop), straight to the Plaza Cataluna about a 25 minute ride,from there its a two minute walk to las Ramblas and Hotel 1898, a taxi from the airport is about 25 euros ! The rooms have everything you need, we just had the standard room ,it was lovely and compact, the staff were helpful friendly at every level throughout the hotel and we recieved a bottle of bubbly in our room as a welcome. The roof top terrace pool and bar really dosen't disapoint, its fantastic, just what you need after a busy day site seeing. We also used the pool sauna and steam room in the spa and it was equally as good. We didnt use the hotel resturant and only ate snacks on the roof top terrace, they were good. There are so many tapas bars and resturants to choose from you wont be disapointed. We also visited "Boadas cocktail bar" which is a step back in time to the 1930, where the drinks are wonderful its small and compact and just up the Ramblas only a small distance from the hotel, you could easily miss it, it was well worth a visit. Thank you to all the staff who made our stay so wonderful,we will definately be back to Hotel 1898

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, excellent location. The hotel crew were very helpful and amicable. Located near a few meters from busy La Rambla, the room was quiet, clean and had an excellent illumination settings. We had only a minor problem with the room safe box, that was promptly solved. Breakfast was delicious and the SPA was a nice experience on winter.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel; Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: Richard M
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of their Colonial Suites for a city break recently. The service was absolutely outstanding, the suite excellent. The Nespresso machine was a nice touch but wasn't working like my own one does. This was the only fly in the ointment for an excellent stay and was such a minor irritation that I'm still giving the hotel 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, quiet hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jhugon
Reviews.Content: Our room at the 1898 hotel, right on the busy “La Rambla” avenue next to the harbor and old town (Barri Gotic) was tastefully appointed in dark colors and wood paneling, with a large flat-screen TV and free WiFi. Best of all, we found the rooms to be quiet and well soundproofed. The bathroom was clean and comfortable, though the location of the shower head at the far end of the bathtub made showering a bit treacherous. One of the best features of the hotel is the roof deck, with its pool and cozy chairs. We visited in March, so we could not use it much, but we noted that it would be a great feature of the hotel when visiting in the summer. We also enjoyed the complimentary 5 pm tea in the lobby of the hotel. The most confusing part of the hotel is the parking situation. It turns out that the hotel does offer parking at a cost of about 25 Euros per day, but we missed it at check-in, and ended up parking in a public garage for a few more Euros. In case it helps others, this is our understanding of what we should have done: when you arrive at the hotel, do *not* pull up in front of it – you will have driven too far, and will be forced to drive down and back up “La Rambla”, dodging pedestrians, scooters, taxis and buses just to get back to where you started from. Instead, turn right on the side street (Carrer del Pintor Fortuny) right after the Meridien hotel and just before the 1898, then pull over on the left-hand side of the street in front of the hotel’s side entrance. The staff will then direct you to their parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: sje
Reviews.Content: We've just arrived back from a lovely stay in this excellent hotel. Our experience of Barcelona did not start off well when we had our money stolen within an hour of arriving. This could have marred our whole experience of this city but the way in which the staff in this hotel immediately assisted us helped us put it into perspective and after dealing with the practicalities (Police, Insurance etc) we were able to continue with our break with limited disruption.......many thanks to Paula! This is a fabulous hotel in the heart of Barcelona; it has a nautical/colonial feel and rooms are perfect ....... fluffy towels, stylish bathrooms and even a pillow menu ..... oh yes! The spa and heated roof top pool were wonderful ...... lovely to be able to swim outside in March! The variety on offer at breakfast is impressive and served between 7 and 11 which means that it doesn't get too crowded as no need to rush! As mentioned the staff and the 'attention to detail' are simply perfect ....... if it makes us want to go back after our initial experience of Barcelona it has to be pretty special ...... go see for yourself ....... you won't be disappointed!!! We'll be back soon as we wouldn't want to stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here by all means!”
Reviews.Author: sstj
Reviews.Content: This is exactly the type of hotel I adore...beautiful interior spaces, lovely old building, excellent service, & perfect location. I would recommend this to anyone...pricey, but well worth it. We did not use the pools or spa, but they looked delightful. Ask for a room that is not facing La Rambla...quieter. There was a little city noise (guitars, laughing, singing, cafes) & we enjoyed hearing those sounds. Last visit to Barcelona stayed at the Hotel Neri in the Bari Gotic & loved it, but wanted to stay somewhere near La Rambla & chose Hotel 1898 on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay close to the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: chrissassen
Reviews.Content: Trip there with my wife for three nights, excellent and quite flawless for us at the time, have been at several other places in Barcelona before and after but nothing to compare.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Treat”
Reviews.Author: kitchenlady
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit and this time we took our family with us so occupied 3 rooms. I emailed ahead to ask for rooms as near to each other as possible and this was granted when we arrived. The weather was fabulous for our 4 days which enabled us to use the rooftop outdoor pool which was heated. Unfortunately the bar was not open yet but we were able to take some drinks up from the bar. A birthday cake was requested by my children and was delicious - the staff presented the cake beautifully decorated with fruits. Breakfast is probably one of the best I have experienced and I have travelled extensively !! Try to get a deal with breakfast included as its pretty expensive. Hotel and rooms are spotless, bedlinen and bed without fault. I like the central location of the hotel, some prefer not to be on La Rambla but for us it was great and the hotel is an oasis of calm away from the busy streets. I found the staff to be attentive, pleasant and helpful. Would I visit again ? most definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: dgerson76
Reviews.Content: Too many times us Americans are warned about how different European hotels can be. This was not the case with Hotel 1898, a boutique hotel in La Rambla. My father and I stayed her for 5 nights in February, and had an incredible time. The hotel itself is just 10 meters off La Rambla, putting you right into the action, without the noise. I had heard that this area was not very safe, but I have to totally disagree; it was completely fine and we had zero problems. The hotel bar is very cozy, with couches and warm colors. The overall decor of the hotel is very mellow, with warm striped wallpaper and large black/white nature photos. It exuded class and comfort, without being invasive. We ate at the restaurant in the hotel, as well as the bar. Both were fantastic!! I would recommend this restaurant even if you are not staying at the hotel, it was that good. The service and the quality of the food was outstanding. I am getting hungry just thinking about it! The rooms are very nice, with very high end amenities and lighting system. There is not much TV in english, but who really cared. The room was peaceful and allowed for a great rest after sightseeing. The downstairs pool and spa are really unique. Its like going to relax in an underground cave! I could have spent hours in here, it was really and excellent way to unwind after a long day. We didn't take advantage of the spa, but it looked very inviting. There is also a small gym for working out. All at no extra charge. Since it was winter, we did not visit the rooftop pool. I would like to come back again in summer, and I would absolutely stay here again. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “What fairytales are made of.....”
Reviews.Author: pille2
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Barcelona and landed in the middle of one of the great holyday weekends with feativals and the whole city on its feet - and discovering that there barely was a single bed left in town. The airport people then got us a room at 1898 and we arrived there sweaty and tired - what a revelation - just entering the reception area the size of a football field with the elegance of a english library of earlier times - wonderful! Cool and calm with professional people taking care of you and the room was the first I ever experienced with windows facing into a tract four stories high - a sight so beautiful that I had a pickture of it as a screen saver on my telephone for weeks :) The beds are wonderful and the rooms beautifully decorated. Wonderful roof terracce with bar serving finger food and pool area. The only thing bad was that the omelettes at the great breakfast spread were made with sugar! Shudder! The rest was all pickture perfect! Best in Barcelona to be sure. La Rambla - the great main street passes the hotel and on the other side is a asian restaurant with great food and terrible people. Everything warmly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Aimee M
Reviews.Content: Best hotel ever! Fantastic! such a great location for everything, fantastic. Great facilities, lovely pool on the roof (with great seating area and views of Barcelona) and lovely pool in the basement as well. Would thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Central, Colonial style”
Reviews.Author: bikies_tour
Reviews.Content: On a rare child-free few days away, we opted for the 1898 in Barcelona. Passed by it lots of times before, and liked the look of it, so booked for four nights. We were pleased with our choice. Its a gorgeous hotel. It's so good location-wise, that we couldn't go wrong.It's about five minute walk to Placa Catalunya. I loved the room, and it was surprisingly quiet, considering its location on La Rambla. Clean bathrooms and bedroom, with our own balcony, with plenty of toiletries. E25 taxi fare in from the airport. We didn't eat dinner, but had great breakfasts. We didn't use the spa or pool, not enough time this trip. Too busy eating Tapas and drinking Cerveza! Did have cocktails in the Lobby bar and could have stayed longer on all occasions. Life is tough!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Great hotel (Check out the roof!)”
Reviews.Author: Matti T
Reviews.Content: A beautifully designed hotel with a roof top view of the city (as well as a pool and dining area) all in the center of Barcelona’s La Rambla...account for a great hotel! We stayed at 1898 with our 1.5 year old baby girl in June 2011 and loved the hotel and service. Our room had a cute baby crib waiting upon our check in and the staff was more than happy to help out with any question we had and helped us locate some missing bags. The hotel is located in a prime location (a 5 min walk from la Boqueria market - a must visit) as well as many other major attractions such as shopping areas, the old city, the port etc, etc. All in all I would highly recommend this hotel, especially for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - but pricey”
Reviews.Author: nolatravel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights - it is well located and nice to walk from through the gothic area at all hours. We checked in here after staying our first 2 nights at Hotel Arts - everyone was professional but the Hotel lacked the warmth and service level we had just come from at the Club Leveles of Hotel Artes for the same nightly rates. we went through withdraw of our complementary drinks and food and conversational staff. It has a beautiful rooftop with heated pool but unfortunately no service at this time of year. We also did not take advantage of the spa and indoor pool in the basement area which looked very nice. The room was nice and comfortable - we stayed on the 5th level and had our own balcony - the parapet wall was high so it felt more like a courtyard - I could see this being much more worth it on a warm summers day. The bedding lacked down pillows and instead seemed like foam. The shower had a slow drain but was fixed promptly within 5 minutes of alerting the front desk. The wifi was complementary - as it should be - the lobby area was very nice with lots of room to lounge. We enjoyed being able to walk out the door into the older parts of the city and thought the hotel was beautiful - it just felt uneecessarily expensive when compared to our prior hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MartaRiga
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 nights in H1898. It was lovely. Our room was on the 2nd floor with windows facing internal terrace, nevertheless it was very quite and nice, despite the lack of view. Spacey and clean room, with daily service made it ideal place to rest. Big bathroom with nice shower also is what I liked. There is no ironing service there, but it won't be a trouble, if you know that already.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for visiting the city”
Reviews.Author: tomtripper
Reviews.Content: It's probably the best hotel in Barcelona. We stayed last weekend there for the second time and again we were convinced by the personal and cosy approach of this classic but totally refurbished hotel. Its situation on the Ramblas 100m form the Plaça de Catalunya is perfect for all visits. 2 pools, spa and lounge anmenities are original and nice. The top floor terrace with heated outdoor pool and lounge bar (closed during winter) gives a great view over the city. Personnel in the reception is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast ist very complete and of good quality. Tough the view is limited in the rooms and the noise reduction between rooms is just ok but very good to the outside. 2 beds on wheels is not so comfortable for couples. For family with kids I would prefer a hotel closer to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the centre of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Keith_and_Fiona
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in February for a trip for my 30th birthday. On arrival at the hotel, the hotel advised us that they had upgraded us from a standard room to a superior room which was a nice bonus! There was a slight issue with the room we were given but we mentioned this to reception and they moved us to another superior room no questions asked. We found the staff were all very helpful and friendly. The location is great, about a third of the way down La Rambla, about 5 mins walk from Placa Catalunya. There is a supermarket about 2 mins from the hotel as well which is handy. The room was very luxurious (the bed was huge!) and was well equipped with toiletries, slippers and robes. We also liked the different lighting settings the room had (there were 4 different settings). The leisure facilities were very good – there was a pool, steam room and sauna. We would have preferred the steam room to be a bit hotter but this wasn't a major issue. We went up to the rooftop pool area as well which looked great but unfortunately the weather was far too cold for us to try it out! The pool was heated and would be great retreat from this busy city in the summer. The hotel bar was a nice place to relax, although the drinks were very expensive! 6 euros for the cheapest beer, spirits varied from 7-10 euros and even soft drinks were 5 euros. It was nice though, we usually went back there for a drink after being out in the city. Overall, we had a great trip and if we return to Barcelona we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel in excellent location great for a weekend break in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: jk3278
Reviews.Content: Just back from two days in Barcelona and stayed in hotel 1898. What a central location just on la ramblas with great facilities including rooftop heated swimming pool. Fantastic modern rooms. Great location to base your self for a trip to Barcelona..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ayaarlos
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 days in the 1898 in the beginning of february. This hotel is perfectly located on La Rambla. 5 minutes walk from Placa Catalunya where the the airport shuttle is located. The hotel itself is beautiful, although a tad dark inside. It feels like evening all the time inside the hotel. The Room We had a superior room, decorated in black and white with a view to a side street. The room itself isn't large, but is big enough, with ample wardrobe space and a big bathroom. The bed is huge, super comfortable with huge fluffy pillows. The bathroom had a lovely full bath with waterfall shower, really nice ETRO bath products, bathrobes and slippers. In addition there's a coffee tea set equipped with a kettle. My favorite part of the room was the light settings, that can be changed from any part of the room and control all the lights. A small but really nice touch. The only problem we had was with the safe which malfunctioned a few times, but the reception were quick to assist. The Spa... This was my favorite part. A beautiful spa equipped with two saunas and an indoor swimming pool. The spa is open from 08:00 to 21:00 which is perfect to start the day with a relaxing swim or unwind after walking around all day. The Outdoor Pool I ventured to the outdoor pool only once because it was freezing outside. But the pool is heated, and it's a fun experience to take a warm swim outside in the winter The thing I could say about this hotel that isn't very good, and only because I have had a different experience in others was that the day of my arrival it was my birthday. Other hotels I have stayed at usually acknowledged this in some way. I have had far less expensive hotels send cake and wine to my room without having to even tell them it's my birthday. But that's all about hotel policy... The 1898 didn't acknowledge my birthday in any way, not even to say congratulations Other than that, it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, clean and comfortable - a refuge”
Reviews.Author: Brian_the_cat
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Right in the middle of town, easy to walk to the places you need to be. La Rambla was only yards away yet we found the hotel quiet and calm. We didn't eat in the hotel as we preferred to go out. Nor did we have breakfast - the €23 per head was too steep (even more than London!) but there were plenty of tapas places close by so we didn't miss out. One of the highlights as mentioned by others is La Boqueria. the covered market a few minutes away. Wow, what a place - never seen the like in the UK, more's the pity. Would we go back there - yes. Would we suggest our friends stayed there if they were in Barcelona - yes. Without question.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: aglang
Reviews.Content: We stayed here late December into January, for 5 days before our cruise. We had a family reunion with our son who has been living in Copenhagen. He was excited to come to Barcelona for the food. He is a chef. We all stayed at Hotel 1898. The location is perfect. We could walk everywhere, from restaurants to all Casa Mila and Casa Battlo and dont miss La Boqueria, a most amazing food market. It is so close to the hotel. We did take the hop on hop off bus for an overview of the city. Right outside our door was the Rambla and amazing sights, sounds and smells. The lobby of the hotel was lovely with a great bar area where we sat each night until they closed. There did not seem to be a concierge. The breakfast was really wonderful! We did not go to the spa as there is so much to do in the city, who had the time. Great hotel in a superb location! Just walk out the door and all of Barcelona is at your feet! We went to Cinc Sentis for New Year's Eve, a great experience (very expensive but it WAS New Year's Eve). Other restaurants were Moo (very trendy and expensive), Ciudad Condal for tapas and others I cant remember. We went to the Asian restaurant right next to the hotel 2 times. Very good.. It was our first trip to Barcelona and I am glad we chose this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price for a comfortable pre- and post-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: Christine S
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night before and after a Mediterranean Cruise. Short ride from Barcelona airport. Even shorter ride to cruise terminal. Right in the heart of La Ramblas, however you could never tell from the room unless you looked outside as the windows were sooo sound proof! Gorgeous decor, a dream bed, wonderful amenities, glorious bubble bath, delicious breakfast and very accomodating and nice staff. Room was not ready as we arrived early both times, but the lobby is plush and comfortable and not too noisy. NOTE: When walking outside on La Ramblas, be careful. Pick-pocketers do exist and are often young teenagers and swift. Keep all belongings in a cross body bag in front of you or a top inside coat pocket. We had an incident, but nothing was taken as we were prepared and our back pockets already empty.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: jules37
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at this beautiful hotel in fantastic central location we were treated wonderfully. We were allocated a gorgeous, clean and well equipped room overlooking La Rambla and all facilities at this hotel are superb. We went on a discount package which was fantastic but we were treated no less favourably than full price customers. The breakfast buffet was the best ever and the staff brilliant, we will go back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, BUT.....”
Reviews.Author: Don R
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel twice on the same trip - arrived in Barcelona on Christmas Eve and stayed one night in a small room, then off on to Girona to visit family for 3 days. Returned to Barcelona, knowing we had choices for many of the fine hotels, but decided to stay here again, spend the extra euros on a larger room overlooking Las Ramblas. Unfortunately for us, the room we were assisgned on the 4th floor literally shared an exterior wall with the church and BELL TOWER next door. Worse yet, the headboard of the bed was on this wall, and every 15 minutes and on the hour, LOUD BELL CLANGING went on, literally blasting and shaking us in the bed. It was awful. We decided early on it might just be a holiday thing and would end soon, but right through New Year's - BANG, BANG, BANG ALL NIGHT LONG! Since we had travelled from Denver, CO to Barcelona for a long stay, we had many suitcases and bags, most of which we were not interested in re-packing and going to the front desk to get into an argument about why they "could not move us, the hotel was full, etc". Upon check out, we mentioned this terrible inconvenience to the deskclerk in hopes he might swing a small amount of compensation our way for the awful noise. He said he would mention it to the manager, he was not empowered to do anything, but he made it VERY CLEAR TO US THAT HE HAS HAD MANY, MANY GUESTSCOMPLAIN ABOUT THIS VERY SAME ISSUE. It was obvious at this point that the hotel knew of the problem, gladly took our euros, then politely tried to downplay the very well-know problem. I decided to respond to the manager when the customary "how was your stay" email arrived about a week after our return to the US. I made it clear to the manager that I did not want a free night if we came back to Barcelona, that we should have been warned of the bell beforehand, and given the option of another room. I also made sure that the manager knew that we have travelled throughout the world, and when this sort of thing happens, and it has happened before, that advising us that" if you had just mentioned this to us, we would have moved you to an equivalent room" is the patented answer, it is easy to say after the traveller is long gone, and I didn't want to hear it. I simply asked for a small credit to my credit card, especially since we stayed twice during the same trip, and spent many euros with this nice place. The response I got from the manager ignored everything in my email request. He offered a free night if we return, he blamed the bell on the church in that he suggested it was malfunctioning (excuses), says he has NEVER heard about this issue before (odd that his entire staff knew explicitly that the clanging bell is and has been a major problem for those unfortunate enough to stay anywhere near that corner of the hotel), and advised he would have gladly switched us to another room had we said something while there (exactly what I asked him not to insult me with, as we all know this is code for covering mistakes and screwups), which I believe would have been impossible since the hotel for our room rate was booked (plus we didn't want to go to the immense trouble of packing everything up and schlepping off to another end of the hotel, which may not have fronted Las Ramblas). While the hotel was very nice, the breakfasts were high quality, I would not recommend this hotel just because of the poor, poor management response to my email. He didn't listen, didn't understand our issues, made excuses, blamed others, followed the universal code for poor service at a hotel and then basically insulted me with his email response to my complaint. We will not be back to this hotel, will not recommend it, will advise family and friends in the area to stay elsewhere and hope that by reading this review, hotel management learns and reacts more appropriately next time....and you know there will be a next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: TexasJewels
Reviews.Content: About €30 from the airport, Hotel 1898 is in the heart of Barcelona. Walking distance to everything. We booked a room with the spacious balcony... long table w/chairs and two lounging benches. Plush robes and Etro toiletries X2 everyday.... no one but the best gives you doubles of anything! European linens on comfy beds, very clean rooms. Two pools, one in the spa and one rooftop. Grocery store with wines just around the corner and Starbucks next door. Believe it or not... The best Lobster Paella made with couscous was at ShoKo. Book a 10:00p beach view table then stroll into the club and dance the night away.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, breakfast and location!”
Reviews.Author: Forrader
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the hotel. Breakfast spread was excellent, and service was prompt. The rustic room decor was impressive, and we loved the modern room features and amenities. The hotel location is good, the metro is nearby and there's a supermarket at the next building.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RandellT1
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at Hotel 1898 during the Christmas holidays with our two daughters, some friends and their son. This was our first trip to Barcelona and we decided to stay at Hotel 1898 based on the excellent reviews the hotel received on tripadvisor The hotel was simply outstanding. It is centrally located on La Rambla within walking distance of Placa Cataluna, the Gothic quarter and the beach at Barcelonetta. The hotel was beautifully decorated for the holidays, the rooms were large and comfortable, and the staff was most attentive and went out of their way to make sure we had a great stay. This is a great hotel that we highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Starting to just show it's age a little”
Reviews.Author: slumbermonkey
Reviews.Content: Been coming here for about 6 years and the stardard rooms and just starting to look a little tired. Radio didnt work. Speakers for bathroom were broken. Bath looked a bit old. That said pools are still amazing. Roof top pool overlooking the city is incredible - so are the prices of the cocktails - but their annoyingly worth every Euro. Basement pool, my favourite - must go down if you're staying. Breakfast - so much selection - give yourself enough time, you'll want it!

Reviews.Title: “Colonial splendour right on La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: treasureParis
Reviews.Content: The whole hotel is decorated in a modern colonial style, we loved it. My husband and I had a superior room and despite the hotel being on the busy la Rambla it was surprisingly quiet. The breakfast buffet had a huge range of choices and efficient service. We enjoyed drinks and tapas on the roof top and also in the lobby bar. The basement spa and pool were a favourite of ours after long days of sightseeing. For me, this hotel was the best thing about my stay in Barcelona. Monserrat is worth visiting and the national art gallery on Montjuic is a must. Be prepared for long queues at the gaudi church. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location and great brunch”
Reviews.Author: LPintheME
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on La Rambla Street in the middle of all the clubs, bars and restaurants and was surprisingly quiet to stay in. The rooms were very nicely appointed and the shower with 3 heads was great! The tapas restaurant downstairs was A+ and the Sunday brunch on the roof was outstanding! Overall, an amazing hotel in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Romance and Class..... Great Location....”
Reviews.Author: Jess81286
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for several days during my honeymoon in August. The rooms are gorgeous not to mention how relaxing the basement spa and pool was after walking all day in Barcelona. The roof top bar had an amazing view and pool.... the drinks were a little pricey but the wine selection was great. I know there are cheaper hotels in Barcelona but this was worth the splurge, it was a great experience and very romantic. Right off las ramblas was a great location for all the sights and it was closed the best market in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: lisa g
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the perfect location. Whether it be for sightseeing, shopping, public transport or restaurants, it is an oasis of calm right in the centre of everything. We had a junior suite which was beautiful, well equipped and very spacious. The rooftop terrace was a highlight. It is stylish with geat views and even though we were there mid Winter the pool was open and heated and I took advantage of that. Having said that if you are not keen on swimming outdoors in January then the pool in the Spa was also beautiful. The staff were all attentive, patient and helpful especially the front desk ladies. Would definitely choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff: friendly and professional. Perfect location to discover the city, close to subway, shops, restaurants. My room was excellent, with large bed and super pillows, bathroom with large shower. The spa area indoors is well worth a visit. Breakfast should be included in the room price. 23 EUR per person for breakfast is to expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: leahsue0602
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I have ever stayed in. It is right on the ramblas in the center of town. During my trip I visited Paris, Madrid and Barcelona. Barcelona was my favorite city. Beautiful palm trees, sea, and such a lively city. I was sick for a night during my visit and the hotel was wonderful in doing everything they could. Hotel is very modern, great breakfast buffet, comfortable bed and wonderful staff. I visited Lasagrada Familia and Palau de la musica, both were amazing must sees. Also did open air bus tour which takes you around the olympic facilities that was great as well.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: thirtythree
Reviews.Content: 1898 Hotel Barcelona was perfectly located for everything we wanted to do while in Barcelona for five days. Given its place between Liceu and Catalunya Metro stations, my wife and I moved easily to the amazing museums, Gaudi casas, church and park, opera and concert halls, and other important sights. We found excellent, reasonably priced restaurants within comfortable walking distances (15 minutes), with the assistance of computer websites and local maps. The Boqueria market was a short stroll away and we had delightfully tasty breakfasts in our room every morning after picking out fresh fruit, cheese and croissants at the stalls. The hotel itself was spotless, pretty, comfortable and quiet despite the outside noise from La Ramblas. The well equipped , complimentary business center allowed for emails back home and any research we needed to do, as well as printing out air tickets in advance. Also, with a short walk from hotel, take in a concert at the Palau Nacional and find one of the many small, superior restaurants to walk to afterwards. In summary, 1898 Hotel Barcelona is a terrific place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mini break in January 2012”
Reviews.Author: sheagaskin
Reviews.Content: Really great hotel if a little expensive. Location was perfect especially for a first time visitor. Spa facilities stunning and most relaxing. Most definetly will go back, something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: Traveller412
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay in this excellent hotel in March 2011. Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: traveler2and2
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas week in Barcelona at Hotel 1898. I cannot say enough great things about the hotel. The room was beautiful and the bathroom spacious and lovely. We enjoyed the lobby area, reading, and enjoying the bar for snacks and drinks. The staff was always helpful. The rooftop terrace was a very pleasant and well decorated. We would not hesitate to stay there again. I wish that all the hotels that we stay in were as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Right where you want to be!”
Reviews.Author: Wribasel
Reviews.Content: Spent three days with my family in Barcelona, the hotel was a great oasis and the location was perfect for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: BobHARRIS10
Reviews.Content: We had really looked forward to staying at this Hotel. Spent New year week here, and it did not meet our expectations. It is a expensive Hotel and I would expect a level of care and quality to match that price. Unfortunately the Hotel is not well maintained. Three bathroom leaks in two days. Hotel has no sound proffing, hence it is very difficult to sleep. Noise from street, nosie from nightclub in basement, noise from hallways. Very poor. Staff are young and friendly, but seem poorly led. Little interest in fixing problems or customer satisfaction. Cleaning and preparation of room was sporadic. Roof top pool is nice. But roof was closed for New years eve. No effort made by managment to organise anything for this special evening. Hotel faces a very "commom" part of Las Ramblas. We saw con artists evry day, along with drug sellers. I would not reccomend this Hotel or staying in this part of Barcelona if you have a family. Try the "Gracia" area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: coreyman97
Reviews.Content: Everything about 1898 was terrific. There are numerous reasons to stay here: Great location, rooftop pool and bar, spa with indoor pool, sauna and steam. The staff was very helpful, especially Monika. Our room was very comfortable, one of the best hotel beds I've stayed in. Got a great rate on Orbitz for our 8 night stay. Would stay here again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Foodfreza
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels i've stayed in my life, and i have stayed in quite a few :) no minuses to be found. Amazing breakfast, spa area is worth missing out on the city touring :) rooms are very well decorated. A bit pricey, but worth every penny and maybe even more.

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop terrace a nice respite from busy La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: henrylimsg
Reviews.Content: We dropped in to the Hotel's Rooftop Terrace for a cup of coffee and ordered some snacks for the evening after shopping in the madness of the activities down below on busy La Rambla. The coffee was very good, and we were especially impressed with a fried rice dish, which was very fragrant - the aroma of lemon-grass infused into the rice and prawn. This is a nice terrace if you have some time, to unwind, relax and watch the sun go down in the evening. The evening that we were there was cold, so the staff was very thoughtful to provide warm blankets for both of us, and even helped us take a couple photo. We would love to drop by again should we be visiting Barcelona and La Rambla again in the future. A beautiful place with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great lobby, pool & sauna, but . . .”
Reviews.Author: Eve R
Reviews.Content: The lobby area and the rooftop pool were great. The downstairs sauna was also nice. The internet, however, is truly atrociously slow. When it is working, you have to re-log in every 10 - 15 minutes and then at night when everyone was in their room, it sometimes wouldn't work at all. It was free but they should have a paid option for those that need a faster connection for work purposes. Even the 'business center' had four nice computers (including two new macs) but these were essentially useless as you had to connect via the incredibly slow wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed March 2010, would love to live in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beth G
Reviews.Content: I wasn't as won over by Barcelona as I expected to be, perhaps due to the time of year (early March) which meant we had the first snow Barcelona has had in years. the weather meant we spent more time in the hotel than I normally would on a holiday, but with a hotel like this that was a good thing. The room, though looking on to a central courtyard, was really lovely. dark wood, plush beds, really felt luxurious. Tea was served daily in the sumptuous lobby, the sofas in the bar made it very tempting to while away several hours. The downstairs spa and pool was calm and relaxing, and when we finally braved the rooftop pool on our final (warmest) day the view was superb and we were just disappointed not to have been able to stay more time there. my only criticism would be the breakfast, which was a vast buffet, but the service was slow and unattentive. a more simplistic but thoughtful approach might be better both in terms of customer satisfaction and reducing waste. I was also slightly put off by the location on la ramblas which meant walking passed caged birds and animals each day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, great location, but very expensive”
Reviews.Author: AndreaN2
Reviews.Content: No doubt that the location is hard to beat, however you also need to pay the price for it. I stayed in June and booked a superior room which is very spacious, nicely decorated although not my taste. Bathroom does not match the room decoration at all and would need some updating eventually. Service is average for a 5* property but I might be spoiled from travels in Asia. Rooftop terrace has a great view and is beautifully decorated but don't expect service! Not sure if I would come back unless for the location.

Reviews.Title: “A real treat!”
Reviews.Author: Sue A
Reviews.Content: Great location, spotlessly clean room. Just needed a bottle opener and wine glasses in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel- wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Cynd113
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel 1898 during the summer and really enjoyed our time there. The hotel is meticulously decorated, the staff is very helpful, and the both the roof deck and the spa in the basement make this a very special place to stay in Barcelona. The location is busy since it's located on one of Barcelona's busiest streets, but it's a great place to explore the shops and people watch. We also LOVED coming back to Hotel 1898 and spending time both on the roof deck, but also swimming in the pools and relaxing in the sauna at their spa. I would highly recommend this hotel because it offers the perfect complement to a busy city. Also, (and I admit this is a strange recommendation for someone visiting Spain) the Asian restaurant located in the same building/next door to Hotel 1898 is delicious. It’s was a nice break from tapas, and my husband and I agreed some of the best Asian food we’ve had.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ctenneen2
Reviews.Content: I've read many reviews about this hotel , the staff was better than rated, they turned out to be very helpful.As someone said the soap in the room was way to small to deal with, however the hotel is in the center of everything to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Designer interiors next to the Rambla.”
Reviews.Author: DenverD
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel for travelers that want superb designed interiors and a great location smack dab in the action of the Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “On La Rambla Sits A Very Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marcmarc
Reviews.Content: I spent last Thanksgiving with my son in Barcelona, who is there on his Semester Abroad. We traveled there in late Summer when he began his term. I returned for the holiday and chose a highly recommended hotel, 1898. A lovely lobby and congenial staff greeted me when checking in-I arrived early and they were able to satisfy my need to access my room, I believe it would depend on how busy they were- I have found this to be the rule with well run hotels. 1898 is indeed, a well run hotel. My room was comfortable and stylish, along with the very nice bathroom, free Wifi, inviting lobby and central locale,the result: I was very happy with my surroundings. Sometimes you find yourself in a great hotel and in a less then great city- with Barcelona and Hotel 1898 - you have it all.

Reviews.Title: “Class and style like no other! A Treat to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Suziestella
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive through the grand entry foyers and doors, past several classy sitting suites, you know you have chosen the right hotel. Beautifully presented, excellent staff, terrific facilities with roof top terrace pool and below ground spa pools and saunas, restaurant and business areas are excellent also. If you are lucky enough to get a room facing La Rambla, you can delight in watching the action. Rooms are luxuriously large with quality furniture. The photos on their website look interesting - but really don't do it justice. It is so much more than you can see. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great room great location.”
Reviews.Author: James P
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right on Las Ramblas and close to hop on / hop off buses. Taxi's are always available also. The rooms are spacious and nicely planned. The bathroom was 5 star and included extras that were unexpected including toothbrush, toothpaste and combs etc. The hotel felt safe and secure. You needed card access to enter the elevators. The staff also locked our luggage in a safe place after we checked out but before we left Barcelona. Friendly and professional staff. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.....horrible towels.”
Reviews.Author: lut5556
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. Let's say that right off the bat. There is nothing negative to say about the appearance of this place. Located right on the tourist trap of La Rambla it is in the middle of everything. The staff is very helpful and makes you feel good from the moment you walk into the property. HOWEVER.........I know this is a little picky but the towels were horrible. They felt like the ones you throw away at home. Hard and rough. It was just so odd considering the beauty of the place. Also, the showerheads are weird. They face stright down and seem to wet the tub ledge more than your body. The the needs to be about six inches longer. Once you go you'll understand what I'm saying. But, a nice place and a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but kind of small”
Reviews.Author: afintx
Reviews.Content: When we checked in to the hotel it was very late and they had only one room left in the hotel. We had requested a deluxe room and the room we received was very small. It was clean and modern and we liked the room itself but it was tiny. The hotel is nicely appointed. The scene at the bar was disappointing. The best part is location location location. It is right off of Los Ramblas. Far enough away so you don't hear too much noise ( ask for a room in the back, not facing the street). I would recommend this hotel but ask to see the room before you commit to it. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at hotel1898”
Reviews.Author: bdoo
Reviews.Content: Really no complaints. This was my husbands first visit to Barcelona and my first time back after many years. We have not travelled internationally for many years . The hotel was comfortable, a very good location just off Ramblas & staff were friendly and helpful. Though I attempted to use my mediocre Spanish , they all spoke English and did not make you feel foolish with your attempts. This was the case wherever we went in Spain, however. Food was good though we mostly ate outside hotel. Had one breakfast and one dinner of tapas. Would definitely stay there again or recommend. Not cheap but worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Millor a Barcelona (best in Barcelona)”
Reviews.Author: ilan-needham
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a 4 night stay at H1898. Overall H1898 was a superb choice. Great location on La Rambla, with 3 minute walk to Plaza Catalunya and the METRO stations (Plaza Catalunya or Liceu). 2 blocks away from La Boqueria and 5 minute walk to Passeig the Gracia. Despite being in the middle of Las Ramblas, as soon as you get inside, you are in an oasis away from the crowds and the noise. We stayed at a Superior room, the room was spacious and with state of the art music and lighting system, we had a small terrace and the bed was extremely comfortable. The rooftop pool has an amazing view las ramblas and the mediterranean sea. The Spa and the pool is a nice extra Staff were helpful and friendly. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: mgtravles
Reviews.Content: 3 nights in Barcelona at this great hotel. Loved the location, guest room and facilities. The bed was terrific, while the in-room lighting and complimentary wi-fi were pleasant surprises. The breakfast buffet was great (but I ate much more than I should have due to all the wonderful choices). Will definitely stay here the next time I am in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Tony G
Reviews.Content: Just returned after 3 night stay. Good location on La Rambla. Quality choice of decoration and finish. Constant hot water and very clean. Did not eat in Hotel but used gym, sauna and swimming pool which were up to standard. Staff generally very helpful and friendly. Don't cut costs stay here and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: ca-beau
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in the middle of the infamous "Las Ramblas" area of Barcelona, then stay here. It is so perfect! You can go out for a bit, come back and relax at the rooftop bar or lazily lounge around (read: take a break from all the great shopping or touristy stuff), or even lay by the pool. The view is spectacular! If it happens to not be so great outside or cold, go downstairs to the pool or get a massage in their luxurious spa. Either way, you can't lose! The staff is amazing and friendly. They can also speak English in case you don't have your Spanish down. The rooms are boutiquey and modern but yet remain cozy. The bed was comfy. A bit small (by American standards but not European) but still comfortable. I would have to say the overall atmosphere was upscale but comfortable. Not stuffy. In the evening the lobby area bar was happening. Lots of guests getting together to mingle. Fun time. You will not be disappointed by the great location and "feel" of this hotel. I/We will definitely be back here next year!

Reviews.Title: “Sexy Hotel 1898 - perfect vibe for a sultry city”
Reviews.Author: stephensonlo
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at Hotel 1898. Close to La Rambla and the Gothic district, it was a quick walk to all the shopping and sites of the area. We stayed out of season so I have a feeling we paid a lot less than some people that have reviewed this property... that said, away we go... We had the pool in the spa to ourselves one evening - we didn't get a chance to use the rooftop pool and bar because it was pretty chilly when we were there, but it seemed like it could be a pretty happening place in season. The staff had no problem providing us with a late check out or offering us answers to any questions we had. The room service was forgettable. We are from a big city ourselves and street noise doesn't bother us - but there will definitely be a bit of this due to it's location right on La Rambla (I think that is part of what makes it fun.) I would recommend this property for a couple seeking romance in an urban setting or to a 30-something group looking to shake things up in style. I thought the colors and decor of the hotel were the perfect compliment to the city - very sultry and sexy, but I can see how if it wasn't to your taste you could find it a bit dark with all the dark walls, floors, bathroom. In the states, I would compare this hotel to a Kimpton property (Chicago - Hotel Allegro or the like) - boutique and hip but large enough to offer good ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Style and comfort on La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: bristol407
Reviews.Content: This place really has style and quality. Excellent, friendly staff and a wonderfully appointed building. Exceptional breakfast, good rooms and big (slightly firm) beds. 200 metres to the Catalunya Place and about 800 metres down La Rambla to the Waterside. Excellent location if you want the City Centre surroundings and good transport links. A bit touristy but this is what most people will want. If you arrive after dark the place is hard to find, there are no lit signs. It is mid way between Catalunya and Liceu metro stations close to the Carrefour illuminated sign.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Barcelona Near Everything”
Reviews.Author: aztocalifornia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel 1898 for one night prior to our cruise to the Mediterranean in October 2011 after reading good reviews on Trip Advisor and cruisecritic.com message boards. We had been to Barcelona before and this time wanted to be right on the Ramblas in the best location. We flew in from JFK at 7:30 am and took the Aerobus right across from baggage direct to Placa Catalunya for about $12 American money. It took about 30 minutes and drops you off about a 5-7 minute walk from the hotel. It was easy to find right across from the birdcages. The staff was very welcoming and helped me with my iphone which would not work and sent me to a phone store to get the settings turned on. The hotel was a small boutiquey type with a restaurant and nice decor. We upgraded and had a beautiful room. It was not real large but had all the fancy marble and lighting and the most comfortable linens and amenities. We could walk right to the market, gothic quarter, touring bus and feel safe walking around the Ramblas at night. You can't go wrong if you want location. We would highy recommend it for cruising as it is a short drive by taxi to the cruise terminal. You don't need a taxi from the airport which is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Dorina S
Reviews.Content: You can't get a better location! Hotel is in a very good condition, with great service, very clean, professional staff, very rich breakfast. The pool is a plus after a long walking day out. Highly recommended! Will definatly go back!

Reviews.Title: “Style, comfort and terrific location”
Reviews.Author: smckToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: The common areas and rooms are stylish and lovely, as the photos suggest, but we were also really pleased with how comfortable our room was (great bed!) and the relaxed atmosphere in the lobby bar and lounge areas. The roof top pool was a treat, with a great panoramic view of the old areas of the city. We skipped the pricey room service breakfast, and instead picked up fruit and pastries from La Boqueria market, less than 5 min walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Monica B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great find, what you see on their website is what you get. The lobby is stunning, in fact the whole hotel has the WOW factor. The gym and spa were a great addition, my husband availed of the gym and pool twice daily. The rooftop terrace was a great place to look over the city and enjoy a glass of Cava. The staff were friendly and efficient, there is a Starbucks and a Chinese restaurant next door. The location is so central, everything is on your doorstep. I would recommend the Blue and Red Bus Tour round city early in your stay, then you can decide where you want to spend more time, book in advance and to redeem your tickets is about a 5min walk from hotel. Will certainly stay here on our next visit to this most beautiful of European cities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, especially for price range.”
Reviews.Author: S2boston
Reviews.Content: Helpful service. Got upgraded to superior room. Clean, comfortable, and bright. Good convenient location. Good value overall.

Reviews.Title: “Sumptuous!”
Reviews.Author: Chumpy123Yorkshire
Reviews.Content: 4 night stay in September 2011 and it was almost perfect. Staff were friendly and helpful and the room(superior) was immaculate, lavish and cleaned impeccably every day. Did nt use the pool(closed) and did nt have time for the spa but the Terrace lounge and pool provided amazing views of Barcelona. The pool was small and the bar prices very expensive but I was nice to relax there after a day of sight seeing. The hotel was situated just off Las Rambles so was an ideal base from which to explore Barcelona. This can be an expensive place to stay but ultimately well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Stop”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaPT
Reviews.Content: My aunt bought my husband and I a night at this hotel, as we had a 2 day/1 night, layover waiting to fly to Paris. I was absolutely in love with the hotel! No only is the design and style of the hotel absolutely beautiful. But the room was to die for. The rooftop pool that over looks the entire city was gorgeous, and you are located right in the heart of Barcelona, on one of the busiest streets, La Ramlas. It was absolutely amazing, and if you can afford it, it is a must stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely building and decor, location superb but a bit dodgy and a hefty price”
Reviews.Author: MashaLloyd
Reviews.Content: I love the location, the colonial style building, the decor (wood and stripes and glass) and the spa which is superb if very small. Breakfast is out of this world although it is not included in the price. When you walk in the lobby from the bustle of the Rambla which is getting seedier and seedier and if not a little dangerous, it is like walking into a luxurious oasis of a building from 18th century Spain in the colonies (the building was the Spanish Philippine tobacco company) with a big comfortable drawing room effect. The decor is very classical, the rooms are in stripes (either red and white, black and white or green and white) and I love it if at times I must admit it's a bit masculine and dark. There are no feminine touches in the rooms … I always return to this hotel but they never remember me. Not much to fault at the 1898 except for the slightly stuck up staff. The rooms are wonderful if you get a big one; some are very small. I usually go for what they call the Prestige rooms (supposedly bigger). They all cost the same but I know from experience that they are not the same size and some have balconies and some don’t. Everything is very modern and you need a science degree to work the bath and the shower but then that's the norm these days in hotels. Lovely teas made but nowhere to plug in the kettle, but that's just a minor complaint. The hotel is right on the Rambla and you can hear the rumbling of the metro underneath which bothered my husband but it didn’t bother me. Another silly little thing their hairdryers are extremely heavy, probably to avoid theft, and I found it very cumbersome to use, in fact I could hardly manage. The hotel is not cheap, the only affordable rooms being tiny and interior. I think they are called the classic ones. I took one look at one and asked for a bigger room as I found it claustrophobic.

Reviews.Title: “October Break”
Reviews.Author: dalucey
Reviews.Content: Lovely quaint hotel in the heart of Barcelona, on Las Ramblas. The smaller swimming pool, loungers, along with the bar(of course) on the rooftop are a great way to wind down after a hard days sightseeing/shopping. There is a fairly good choice for the buffet breakfast. Although the main areas of the hotel are decorated in a modern sophisticated style, some of the rooms have a colonial feel about them, although they do have the benefits of modern tv, ac etc.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel, vibrant City”
Reviews.Author: Jalyauba
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel 1898 on the 16th of October for 3 nights. I booked upon the recommendation of Tripadvisor and they were not wrong. From the reception staff, to the food, to the Hotel. My husband and I like to be in the centre of the activities which is what La Ramblas is. We had a classic room which does not look out onto La Ramblas therefore this provided an oasis away from the noise and vibrancy which is outside. Look out for the Market which just down the road from Hotel 1898 which serves lots of local dishes and even cocktails in some parts. Enjoy Barcelona and Hotel 1898 we certainly did

Reviews.Title: “Top shelf, sexy Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BWP60
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1898 is an extraordinary experience with high end stylish decor, sleek rooms, seductive underground groto pool-spa and high end well presented delicious breakfast. A great way to start (or end) a European vacation spoiling yourself right on the active and exciting La Rambla area close to many activities and having a wonderful swim and message.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic stay on La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: MizzouTraveler75
Reviews.Content: After deliberating whether to stay at Hotel 1898 or the Montecarlo we opted for H1898 and were very happy with our choice. Both hotels are on La Rambla but the main entrance for H1898 is actually on a side street which insulates it from a lot of the street activity. The hotel was exactly as billed and depicted on its web site, a 4+ star establishment with many amenities. We were given a free upgrade and provided great service. After arriving at 9am from our cruise ship they stored our luggage as requested and we were free to use the spa and lounge. After doing some sightseeing we returned around 2pm and our room was ready with our luggage waiting for us in it.
