The rooms were very nicely furnished and had high-tech interfaces for the TV, lighting and climate control systems. (the only distraction was the noisy corridors in which we heard foot traffic coming and going all night long – remember Barcelona is one of those cities that never sleeps) The rooftop Terrace bar was a very nice feature also. It’s pricey but provided a very romantic setting in which to view the night skyline with a loved one. Having said that, I’d definitely recommend H1898 for a romantic getaway to Barcelona. Not exactly a family-friendly place if you have children with you, but if you and your sweetheart desire an upscale establishment in the heart of vibrant Barcelona, then 1898 should be the choice for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarcieX
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on Las Ramblas so its great if you just want to be in the busiest part of Barcelona. A couple of days here is plenty as you can get a little tired of the crowds here. Our room was not ready at the time of arrival and we had to wait 40 mins extra to check in. We were on our honeymoon so it would have been nice to have been upgraded or something small as a token to welcome us. I work in the hotel industry and its very easy to comp a bottle of wine or a free breakfast. The hotel is good value for what you get and the roof top pool and bar is a nice getaway from the crowds below on Las Ramblas if the weather is good. Pricey drinks at the roof top bar but delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience!”
Reviews.Author: TonyBeachGuy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, interesting (its decor is very 1920s ish) and well located. Plus the staff was helpful (we dont always find that in Europe)! Id come back and stay here again! Breakfast wasn't the best, but we opted for eating at the Boqueria anyhow! (-:

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linda E
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel after a 12 day cruise in September, 2011. I was only staying one night and Hotel 1898 was in a perfect location, right in La Rambla area and a quick walk to metro and tour buses. Staff was profession, friendly and very helpful. We arrived early so dropped off our luggage before we went touring around the city. When we returned, our luggage had already been placed in our rooms. The rooms are spacious and beautiful. I've never seen such a beautiful bathroom, everything you needed and more. On the rooftop was a bar, pool and they served tapas overlooking the city. The drinks and food were delicious. Quite lovely. Below the lobby is their spa and indoor pool built in the old warehouse. We weren't able to try the food in the dining room since we had to leave at 5:00 am. About a 20-30 minute trip to the airport. They prearranged our airport transportation and they were there early. I wouldn't hestitate to stay again, only for a longer period.

Reviews.Title: “We love Hotel 1898!!”
Reviews.Author: Soraya S
Reviews.Content: Hi we just finished 4 nights in Barcelona at the Hotel 1898. It was fantastic. The photo's that you see on the Hotel's website are exactly what you get. The service was great at all times. The hotel is completely renovated (brand new). They have two swimming pools (tho the terrace one was a bit cold given it was November). My husband and I also also had massages in their day spa center - which were terrific. I read an earlier review that said whilst breakfast was a bit pricey it was worth trying - so we did. We ended up having the buffet breakfast for our final two days - it was one of our breakfast highlights of 2 week holiday. The location of the Hotel was great, only a short walk to the metro and many many tourist attractions. Having the free internet was a huge bonus. We would have no hesitation in even looking at other hotels... this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A standout jewel of a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: LouisaTheK
Reviews.Content: Excellent location right on Las Ramblas with quiet lush rooms and perfect service.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Bliss”
Reviews.Author: JacquiSouthampton
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five day stay in Barcelona and have to say that all the reviews about this hotel are true. It's in an excellent location right on Las Ramblas although the noise of this busy street do not filter into the hotel. All of the staff - whether on reception, in the bar area, the spa or those keeping all areas of the hotel exceptionally clean - were not only helpful but always pleasant. The Classic Rooms were well equipped and we'd definitely recommend trying one of the variety of teas available in the room. Do not miss the views from the Roof Top Terrace at sunset while you relax on one of the comfortable loungers and we'd recommend using the inside pool and sauna after a day's sightseeing - a really calm and pleasant ambience. If the price of the hotel breakfast is slightly higher than you would like to pay we would definitely recommend a restaurant just on the corner - Lobo. They provide an excellent choice of meals - breakfast, lunch and dinner - at a very reasonable price and the staff are again friendly and welcoming. Likewise the Chinese Restaurant right by the entrance to the hotel - excellent and freshly prepared food.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous on the rambla”
Reviews.Author: Viclugano
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a beautiful historic building on the rambla. We had a great room with a small balcony right on the rambla. Very well decorated, with nice furniture and beautiful lighting with a number of settings avaialble from the comfortable bed. The bathroom was very nice as well. Beautiful lobby and entrance, nice lobby bar, fabulous rooftop bar and pool vith views, stunning indoor pool. We loved our stay and did a lot of walking around taking advantage of the central position. The only negative was that the rambla is always very crowded and noisy, so at night it was rather loud inspite of the good windows.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: billyb52
Reviews.Content: All the reviews posted are true: Beautiful rooms (clean, quiet, comfortable and very good air-conditioning and heating), terrific location and the staff was very professional and helpful. The rooftop deck and pool are relaxing with a great view. The rooms are expensive but we feel it was worth it to make for a special stay in Barcelona. I would return here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and in Las Ramblas?”
Reviews.Author: travelswithRobie
Reviews.Content: We booked 5 nights in late October and because it was a longer stay, we requested one of the rooms with terraces. What a nice surprise! The room itself was small by american standards, nice be European, and the terrace effectively doubled the space. We had a table for 6, which we used for room service one day, and other days I would go to La Boqueria and buy us fruit and pastries, and we would make coffee and tea in our room. Part of the terrace was sunny in the morning, which allowed me to practice morning yoga outdoors, with a view of Montjuic. Service was FANTASTIC! we asked for ice most every day, and sometimes twice a day, and they were prompt, and most did not want to accept a tip. Rooftop terrace was calm and welcoming, although menu is ssomewhat limited. (they offered the restaurant menu on one occasion, to increase choices)/ Massage was great, although they only have 2 treatment roms. The indoor and outdoor pools were very nice to have (oct 17-23), and I was able to use both. Definetely a find, keep up the good work NN!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: ausbiz
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a business-/leisure trip in Barcelona. The hotel is located in the best location, close to "La Rambla", the market, all the restaurants, tapa bars, shops, museums and other attractions. Check in was fast and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I stayed in a "Classic Room" which is very quiet as the room is situated at the rear, viewing an interior patio away from the noise of "La Rambla". I liked the idea of the "Pillow Menu" and was very happy with the pillow I chose. I didn't have breakfast as I don't eat much early in the morning but ordered room service twice which was very good. I certainly will return to this hotel on my next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “You can't ask for better!”
Reviews.Author: ukdoctor
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night stay with friends based on locations and positive reviews. The hotel exceeded our expectations. Check in was simple and the staff incredibly welcoming. We were eshown to our rooms. They were wonderful. The beds were large and very comfortable indeed. The pillows were perfect. Our rooms were at the rear overlooking the small square and were very quiet. No problem with noise from The Ramblas. We did struggle a bit to get the air-conditioning set correctly as did our friends, but at this time of year it wasn't an issue and I'm sure the hotel could and would sort the situation if asked. Yes - the rooftop pool and bar! What a wonderful way to spend a relaxing hour or more. The Mojitos were fabulous. We will definitely use this hotel as our "default" from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Happyholidays81
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel that is perfect for your every need then this is the one for you! Everything from airport bus(which you can get from airport to pl cata and is 5 min walk and only cost 5.30euro) is very close by. Once your in its v fast to check in, v helpful staff. Once in our room we where meet with a lovely big bed, lots of space for hanging and draws for other bits. Free safe for all your valuables. Good sized bathroom with extra bits robes slippers ect. As for breakfast, yes its not cheap but I would have to say well worth the money, anything you want is there and much much more. I really could go on and on about this place but if your in barca in must stay here to understand, Thank you 1898 for a lovely stay we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine R
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel - the roof top terrace is a must. Would definately stay here again & recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: 4MGOBLUE
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1898 was a fantastic hotel that we selected purely based on tripadvisor reviews. It is so nice when the actual experience lives up to and exceeds the online reiews and pictures. From the panoramic roof deck to the elegant privilege room to the relaxing spa and the courteous service with a smile from Monika and Jaime in particular, I highly highly recommend this hotel. We have stayed in new expensive hotels in Rome and Paris and 1898 is better. Loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and a great location”
Reviews.Author: PeachtreeMom4
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat, on La Ramblas and next door to Starbucks! Actually, the huge market is also about a block away, and the Gothic quarter is an easy stroll, too. The rooms, while on the small side, are beautiful and unbelievably quiet. The bathroom is gorgeous and quite large for a European hotel. The beds are incredibly comfortable. The staff was friendly, but we didn't really need much except for dinner reservations one night. (They came through for us, at an excellent restaurant we have also reviewed on T/A.) One thing--PLEASE be careful in the lovely bathrooms! I took a slip in the bathtub and have some major elbow bruises. Ouch!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: thebibo
Reviews.Content: Perfect!!!!Just returned from a 5 night stay in Barcelona at this hotel. It was wonderful!!! Everything from the staff to the location was perfect. We stayed in one of the rooms that has a private outdoor area with a table and loungers. We did not find the noise to be a problem like other reviewers reported. Great places to eat and drink very close by, so we walked everywhere. The rooftop pool was a great way to end the day. We will never stay anywhere else in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sarin70
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1898 is a very nice hotel and a good value overall. Located in "La Ramblas" the hotel is in a great location to see the sites. About a 10-15 minute walk to the port and a 5 minute walk to Gothic town it is ideally situated. The metro is also 1 minute away. The hotel rooms are nice. They are not huge but typical for Europe. Beds are very comfortable (pillows are great) and the rooms are very clean. The housekeeping service is also very good. We stayed with our two teenage children in October , 2011 for 5 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I would avoid the breakfast at the hotel as it is very expensive and there are way better values and food elsewhere. Overall, a very nice hotel I would stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Just because it looks good doesn't mean it is good.”
Reviews.Author: HoneymoonHoney
Reviews.Content: Beautiful to look at, great location, fantastic rooftop terrace but they fail epically on service and the little things that matter. Breakfast in the room was horrendous, toast that could have been more toasted by my hairdryer. No refill on the free tea coffee in room, in fact no tea bags ever, just coffee, one little tiny uht pot of milk each day which is not enough for one cup let alone two. No iron and a refusal to borrow one. Tea and coffee served on the roof top terrace with breakfast if you pay over the odds for it but once this is over, they refuse to make any tea or coffee, they also refused to allow me a coffee from the downstairs bar and bring it up. Being a non drinker generally, I could not enjoy being there at night without resorting to a cold drink. Some of the rooms are tiny with horrible views, some are nicer. Exceptionally comfy beds though. To summarise, excellent location but way over priced, (10euro for a juice) - even if money was no issue I'd still expect service to be of a much higher standard. Mixed review as the hotel was nice but for the price, I'd have expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: kalepooki
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a great location. Beautiful and even though on a busy road, surprisingly quiet. The rooms aren't very large but tastefully decorated, in an old-fashioned kind of way. Tips: - Try the pool and spa. - Try the chinese restaurant just round the corner. It is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: familyontour
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay at this hotel. Staff very helpful - especially Monika. Rooms not large but extremely comfortable and quiet. Location fantastic - La Rambla on your doorstep but the hotel itself an oasis of calm. Rooftop terrace wonderful at any time - lunchtime tapas, afternoon beer, late night cocktails. Swimming pool at spa small but also lovely. What's not to love about this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Hockeybill
Reviews.Content: Great location, staff and rooms. The rooftop terrace is beautiful with amazing views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Nigel_1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the end of September/into October. I will start right off by saying I was a little disappointed with the reception we got when we checked in. The staff was nice enough, but they messed up our room reservation and didn't really handle it the right way in order to rectify the situation. Basically, we reserved a Superior Room, but they had us down for a Classic Room. They forced me to go to the business center and print out my confirmation to prove to them that we had, in fact, reserved a Superior Room. We were in our Classic Room at this point, and once I proved it to them, they then conceded that they had made a mistake and it took about an hour for them to move us to the correct room. An honest mistake, but could have been handled better - especially at $430/night!! That was the only negative experience of our hotel stay - the rest of the stay was amazing. The location does not get any better than this. Right off of Las Ramblas, which is the heart and soul of Barcelona, with the benefit of being on a quieter side-street, so you don't get any of the noise. The hotel, itself, was very cool. Nice lobby and bar/lounge area, cool spa/fitness center setup in the lower level, and the roofdeck lounge/pool was fantastic. The room was small, as most big-city hotel rooms are, but was extremely clean, and handsomely appointed. The lighting and music (yes, music was piped in to the room and bathroom) could be controlled by easy switches right next to the headboard - we loved this and was a nice touch. Bathroom was clean and fine - only one sink. Great experience and would definitely return to this hotel - if you're ok with paying these prices, I fully recommend it. I also recommend upgrading to the Superior room (or Deluxe room) because it provides an external view of the street/plaza and a small balcony (the Classic rooms face inwards towards the courtyard, I believe - and no balcony).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel for a weekend away or longer”
Reviews.Author: petet45
Reviews.Content: The 1898 is a great hotel with tasteful decor in a wonderful location right on La Rambla within easy walk of the old town, Born, the port etc but while you are there you won't know as the hotel is well soundproofed from the outside world and even the idyllic rooftop bar is very quiet with lovely views over the city. If you want to find a nice easy place to eat and drink, Bar Lobo next door (turn left down Carrer d'en Xucia) sits in a nice square and is cheap but with a good vibe. I would make a couple of mildly negative comments, the hotel is very dark especially if you are in a room overlooking the atrium in the middle. You move from bedroom to breakfast (massive selection, generally good quality) without seeing any daylight and I found that I struggled to wake up until I had been outside for a while. Secondly, there is a lot of internal noise from pipes and people in the corridors and as we are light sleepers, we needed to put in my trusty earplugs to sleep. All that said we would definitely come back again and would be more than happy to spend several days in the hotel due to the wide range of facilities available. Feel free to message me if you would like any other tips or information. By the way the city tour bus is as boring as hell and tends to take you to stops which are 10 to 20 minutes walk from the attraction itself. We also got stuck in the riots over the weekend and were dumped 30 minutes walk from the stop in Plaza de Catalunya even though the side roads looked pretty clear. I would personally use taxis which are cheap and plentiful. Oh and they don't do irons in the hotel which is a strangely Spanish thing!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel doesn't deliver on its promises and is overpriced”
Reviews.Author: AmayaD
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a 4-day stay in Barcelona because it advertised to have two heated swimming pools - one in the spa and one on the roof terrace. On arrival, they were indeed there, but the water was freezing cold in both swimming pools! It was so cold in the spa that those nice jacuzzi chairs they've got, were simply uncomfortable! Worst of all, when we complained, the staff said they knew about it, but there was nothing they could do, because the administration of the hotel doesn't want to act unless anough clients complain directly to them!! The room was nice, but if you're staying in the left part of the hotel, it's directly above the tube line, so you will hear quite loud vibration from it every 5 mins or so, which is annoying, especially late at night or early in the morning. We then moved to the other part of the hotel where there was no noise from the tube, but the noise from the street was quite loud even with the windows closed. The staff was not proactive at all, we had to repeat every signly request at least 2-3 times before they got it. Also, they don't provide irons, even the mini ones, so be prepared to pay 8 euros to get a shirt ironed for that nice dinner you booked in the city. I don't understand all the good reviews - we weren't able to use any of the swimming pools even though the weather was amazing, couldnt really enjoy the spa and the level of service is just not good enough. Other people seem to be raving about how their room got cleaned daily - I expect that as a minimum requirement in a hotel! If you're looking for something nice and special and for the price you pay, don't go to 1898!

Reviews.Title: “Pre-cruise and Post Cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: zapoyol
Reviews.Content: I had the oportunity to stay in this hotel for few days. Our family took a cruise to the mediterranean leaving from Barcelona. We stayed ( my wife and I ) for a few days. When we arrived the front desk were extremely helpful and nice to acomodate our needs. They even call to confirm our transport to the port and airport the day before. The rooms that we stay were clean and nice,modern and great free wi-fi. We had brreakfast and the food was great. Also dealing with our luggage was done by the young guys at the front dest, they were responsible and took good care of our luggage. Location: this hotel is located in front of las Ramblas, it was really convenient for us. We had a great time in Barcelona, we will be back and stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in centre of Barcelona - perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: peachypooch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at H1898 for 5 nights in October 2011. We loved this hotel!! We had a room on the 2nd floor witch looked out onto an internal terrace, despite it not having a view it was very quiet. The room itself was spacious and cleaned daily. It would appear that the bedding was changed daily too. The bathroom was big with a great shower. The roof top terrace is worth visiting as there is a lovely seating area, bar and pool. We would recommend and return to this hotel. For those who like ironing facilities be aware that these are not available at H1898.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maxinea42
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel stayed 3 nights in September our requests were catered for and we had a nice quiet room. The room was a little small for two cases but everything else made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel well worth the money, no deficiencies”
Reviews.Author: roseandribbons
Reviews.Content: This is truly a fabulous hotel: Great comfort, great service, great amenities, and a reasonable price. I liked the convenient location, close to the metro, Plaza de Catalunya, the Bari Gotic, and the Boqueria market. My room was a little on the small side by NAmerican standards, but wonderful decorating meant it wasn't the least bit claustrophobic. Very very comfortable bed and bedding. The hotel is generally decorated in a "colonial" fashion with dark wood and white and green marble, and the seating in the lobby and the roof deck is very comfortable. The rooftop lounge/bar is made up of both table/chair settings and chaise lounges/couches, for a variety of comfortable seating arrangements; I was traveling solo and would take my computer up every night and review my day's photos while enjoying a sangria. Also, the small pool in the basement was a great place to cool down and relax after a day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location, minor setbacks”
Reviews.Author: angiegrrl138
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel 1898 and loved the location. We also were very impressed with our room size, the private terrace we had (totally worth the money if you want to relax a bit), and the hotel features. We loved the view from the rooftop pool, however the dining and drinks on the rooftoop are quite expensive. The library had computers for us to use which were nice. The workout facility was adequate. The spa and sauna were nice as well. Very relaxing. The minor setbacks were our room smelled kind of bad, although it was clean. I am not sure if it had something to do with the plumbing... They also did not bring our newspaper we requested daily. I am sure they would have fixed the problem if we mentioned it, but we are not really the types to complain. Overall it was clean, beautiful, and had a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home..I wish”
Reviews.Author: TripNLuxe
Reviews.Content: I’m a starwood member and “should” stay at the Le Meridien (across the street), but there was something about H1898 that I couldn’t ignore. I must say this is one of the best designed hotels I’ve ever stayed in. The interiors have been created blending colonial touches and contemporary fabrics giving it this modern/masculine clubhouse feeling. We stayed in a junior suite on the 6th floor. The views were amazing, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was well appointed with towels and TONS of ETRO products, fabulous. The spa (underground pool, sauna, steam room, etc.) and fitness center are complimentary and provide a great break from the craziness outside. Do yourself a favor and spend a few hours down there!! I really have nothing bad to say about this hotel. The staff is professional and friendly, the property is well maintained, and they are generous with the amenities. I only wish the H1898 was a St Regis so I could collect on the points!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Holiday_EKIN
Reviews.Content: As with other reviews, this hotel is placed perfectly on La Rambla and so is within easy walking distance of the Port, Gothic area and all the restuarants and bars. The rooms are really well decorated, but just slightly on the small side - ours was a standard room. And for those that like TV there was only 1 English langauge channel - BBC World! The breakfast buffet was amazing - everything from cooked, to healthly, to continental - even Champagne. The roof top pool & lounge area is lovely, but I can imagine in summer that it would be quite busy. Although everything is fantastic, the prices are excessive - a small bottle of sparkling water and an OJ cost us 7 euros. And for lunch 1 mojito, 1 fruit cocktail, 1 water, 1 coffee and 4 peices of tapas cost 75 euros! There is a Starbucks nextdoor, so would recommend popping in there if you are trying to save a few monies.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't get any better”
Reviews.Author: KBSyd
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1898 is perfectly situated on La Rambla which makes it extremely easy for food and shops. The main sites are also walking distance from the hotel. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. The rooms were gorgeous...modern, clean, good size. There wasn't really any outlook but it didn't matter as the room was so lovely and comfortable. There was some sort of noise from the air conditioner or something but it wasn't an issue. Rooftop pool is great and a nice spot to relax and have a drink. Would recommend this place to anyone...you couldn't get any better than this place.

Reviews.Title: “a terrific find and worth the money”
Reviews.Author: AmberK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on Las Ramblas, about 2 blocks from the Catalunya subway stop. This means it is in the heart of everything. Perfect location. The hotel is absolutely beautiful. Rooms are a decent size and nicely appointed. The SPA is gorgeous and the rooftop bar and pool lovely, especially in the evening. Breakfast is a buffet and rather pricy but if included in your rate well worth a visit. There is a Starbucks next door and multiple restaurants so plenty to choose from nearby. WE had supper in the hotel restaurant and it was excellent. The staff are all very pleasant and most speak english. A couple of caveats: The bathroom tub faucets are a little tricky and one wrong turn results in scalding water. Watch if you have children. THe air-conditioning is located in the closet and took us two days to figure out. The windows are not soundproof so ask for a room away from Las Ramblas. THis hotel is in a perfect location, absolutely lovely and well worth the top rating on Trip Advisor. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & Beautiful Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SouthernCross99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel 1898 in March for a long weekend and loved it. The location is perfect for a short visit. The facilities are beautiful, clean and well taken care of with fashionable rooms. Furthermore, the service was outstanding. The front desk staff was especially helpful when I wasn't feeling well and directed me to a good pharmacist. The bartenders were friendly and sociable and the whole hotel accomplished a feel of relaxed intimacy and exclusivity, while still coming across as trendy and popular. I would definitely recommend this hotel and look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: WPSAG
Reviews.Content: We had a stay of 3 days and found everything matched our expectations. The position on La Rambla is perfect with Metro and buses 2 minutes away. The rooms are of average size with FREE wifi and large TV. Bathrooms are well fitted out and there is reasonable hanging and storage space. The best feature is the Spa Sauna and Steam room in the lower ground floor. It is complimentary and we used it every day. Additional pool on the roof top with a bar which we visited but did not use as we were out every day. Breakfast is expensive so we ate at one of the local places in La Rambla nearby. Staff are very helpful and rooms are very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: tkeucla
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a second time this year (Oct 2-4, 2011) and you could not ask for a better location. It is charming (small rooms) but the staff is very helpful and the place has an amazing roof top bar. I had a friend flying to meet me on my business trip and the hotel happlily put me in a room with two beds. Don't get me wrong, the rooms are small, but well equipt and the beds are very comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel as it is right in the heart of Las Ramblas, close to the metro, and a hop skip and a jump to the Gothic Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “1898 first class”
Reviews.Author: Timetraveller070
Reviews.Content: “Hotel 1898: First class hotel” This hotel ticked all the boxes for a relaxing 4 day break, as you walked into the reception, the deep colours and soft lighting as well as a friendly smile from the bell boy hinted of a qualty hotel, check in was easy and again with frendly staff. We chose a Superior room the 6th Floor (very quite) the room had luxurious wood finishes and Sheets of Egyptian cotton & large window, double glazed, King size bed and soft pillows, The room as well as the rest of the hotel was spotless. the bath room had and a fixed shower and lots of Toiletries. the big plus is the roof terrace La Isabela, with panoramic views over barcolona a swiming pool and bar,you can also order a good selection of tapas, furnishings are excellent to relax on, they also had plenty of staff to look after your needs, open until 2.00am. The meal in the Hotel Restaurant was also very good with a wide Choice of food, Breakfast also had a vast choice but..my only Criticism is, its so over priced at e23, just around the corner you can get a cooked breakfast for e10. This hotel is right on la ramables. in the center of Barcelona , next to Plaza Catalunya, including the Casa Batlló , the Pedrera , the Palau de la Música Catalana , the Gothic Quarter and El Born , the Gran Teatre del Liceu and the Picasso Museum all within walking distance A well run hotel with good staff, we will be back..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: merryth
Reviews.Content: This is a superb hotel. Rooms are classic, service exceptional. Be sure to take advantage of the roof terrace, loungers and pool. The breakfast is the best I experienced in Europe and a great way to start your day. Free PC and internet access. Fantastic location on Las Ramblas whilst still being quiet. Just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: tyreke
Reviews.Content: Pros: This place is very nice Spacious room, free wifi, nice bathroom, great beds Central location, great beds Great (if not particularly friendly service). Undeground pool is awesome. Minor criticisms: Rooftop pool is freezing (I didn't see anyone swim in it for more than 1 minute and it was a 32 degree celsius day. Rooftop bar food is a complete rip off (very small portions - dont eat there) Church bells go off late in the morning (9 oclock onwards) and may wake light sleepers

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel but area is very noisey and hectic!”
Reviews.Author: Missshopper
Reviews.Content: If this hotel had been in another area, we would have enjoyed it more as it was a very nice hotel. I was expecting it to be in a nicer area since I had read how the location was great. If you want to be in a central location, it is ideal for you. There are many cafes around as well as the usual tourist shops (no boutiques or such).. You can walk to take a sightseeing tour and find plenty of places to eat. We took an organized tour with Barcelona City tours which was good and we saw the main attractions. The traffic is horrendous as is the noise but you are right on Las Ramblas. However, after taking a tour and seeing the area by the ports, we would have much preferred to stay there. We did pass a few areas with nice shops in town that did seem what we would have preferred as we were on a ladies trip. Our room was not ready when we checked in early but they did arrange for just an hour's wait until we could have it. After flying all night, this was very welcome. The front desk service was good and there was free internet. The room was nice and we had no complaints. There is a root top bar which was quite expensive for drinks and snacks. The breakfast was expensive ($25 euros) and we chose to eat elsewhere as we knew we would have a large breakfast on our cruise. There is a Starbuck's next door also. We were happy to leave the area for the cruiseship as it was just too crowded for us and we did not like it. However, the hotel itself was not the issue!

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of all the action”
Reviews.Author: TerryWrist
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a perfect location, roughly halfway between the waterfront and the Placa de Catalunya. Friendly staff, nice and well equipped rooms (mine even had a balcony), and a fantastic (albeit expensive) buffet breakfast. Two swimming pools (one on the rooftop (heated) and one in the basement), a sauna, and a fitness center are there for all your sporting needs. All in all, this is a perfect hotel. I think it's quite expensive, but as I was on business I did not see the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “1898 we sure do appreciate”
Reviews.Author: azrenden
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 days at 1898. Our experience was wonderful. Upon check in our A/C was not working well. They were very quick to place is in another room. The room was clean and the bed was great. I would suggest as we did to have your room on the quiet side of the hotel as La Rambla is busy and noisy street. I read a review by someone else that the staff at the front desk were rude and unaccomodating. I disagree, they could not have been better. The hotel was in a great location if you want to be near dining, shopping and transporation. We recommend

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Barcelona Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Judy_Houston_Texas
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel 1898 in Barcelona on Trip Advisor. Arriving from 2 weeks on a cruise, we selected it because of location on the Rambalas and because it was highly rated. WELL, it was not only good BUT great! It is a gorgeous hotel of the world! It is newly redesigned and remodeled to perfection. Every space is sleek, stylist and fashionable. Stepping into the lobby is red carpet all the way, the rooftop bar is a sweeping view of all of Barcelona with great service and the rooms are perfect. Every detail is perfection. The staff before arrival was very helpful, informative and ready for our arrival. We asked for a guide for the day as we only had one day in Barcelona. That, also, was perfection. The guide spoke excellent English, was professional, on time and showed us Barcelona in 3 hours! Above all, we felt SAFE! We quickly learned that safety is of utmost importance in Barcelona. If you are not on your toes, your passport and everything in your pockets and hotel safe will be gone in a flash. Oh, did I mention the spa in this hotel? The prettiest I have ever seen. There lounge chairs IN the hot tub! I look forward to a return to this jewel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 1898 in Barcelona Spain”
Reviews.Author: bheaney
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night in August 2011. Everything was great, room, service, location. A little pricey but we enjoyed it. Didn't get a chance to use the roof top restaurant or pool but it looked nice.

Reviews.Title: “Top rating”
Reviews.Author: Ozone04
Reviews.Content: We have just spend 3 nights at this hotel and cannot say we were ever dissaponted once. The hotel is beautiful and the service and staff are first rate and belive me all the pictures u see on the net and elsewhere totally do it justice if fact the reality is even better. Drinks and meals in the hotel are a bit on the expensive side so be warned but the service and facilities more than make up for it - just check out the spa! I e-mailed the hotel in advance to seek a room upgrade as it was my partners birthday and whilst I didn't get a response on arrival it had all been taken care of so I need not have worried - completely gratis! The location is excellent for enjoying all aspects of the city and there is plenty to see within walking distance. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of going to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Humblerootswellness
Reviews.Content: Great place, great amenities. Decent price for what you get and the location. Service CANNOT be beat. Rooftop pool, spa etc etc... After weeks of crabby hostels and hotels in Spain, this was VERY refreshing. Quiet with a private patio. Great way to end a trip.

Reviews.Title: “Officious unwelcoming and unhelpful but good location clean and so-so value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Wishum
Reviews.Content: Arrived having prebooked a deluxe room for 4 nights. Shower badly leaked overnight which originally blamed on us but explained had not used it! Necessary therefore to change but no comparable room available. Given pleasant room on las ramblas well soundproofed but not told about constant noise and vibration from metro below. Would have thought in view of all trouble of having to repack and change rooms would have offered a late check out. Not at all!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Rooms”
Reviews.Author: LacrosseMD
Reviews.Content: A bit pricey, but some other places on tripadvisor had mixed reviews, so I went with 1898. They have an afternoon turn down service, which is nice, no complementary breakfast, very nice rooms and a spa. Only 5 min south of the Plaza Espanya and centrally located relative to the great restaurants on and off of Rambla Catalunya, Barrio Gotico, the Picasso Museum, and the waterside sights. Need a taxi to the Olympic Stadium and Miro Museum. Again, great location. Staff was very helpful with each of my inquiries.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Dallas David
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a dream! Excellent service, thoughtful amenities and an unbeatable location equal one great place to stay in the most beautiful city in the world. Pretty pricy but if you can afford it, choose 1898.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, don't expect to be treated differently for a special occasion”
Reviews.Author: dpa15
Reviews.Content: Stayed for our honeymoon early September. Lovely hotel, good location, clean, welcoming, we had a very pleasant stay. Rooms are clean, modern and turned down nightly. Roof top terrace is excellent. Very expensive food and drinks, but you kind of expect this. Spa is amazing and very dramatic. Located right on the Rambla so fantastic position for sight seeing. We stayed for our honeymoon and even though we told the hotel on e-mail before coming and again on check in we still did not receive any little extras what so ever. I don't expect free-bies, but on such a special occasion and choosing a top hotel, you do think after telling them they may do sometning of a gesture to make you feel special. Nothing what so ever. Quite disappointed that such a high calibre hotel took absoloutly no interest in a guests celebration.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent city-break hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NikCat
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, good spa, wonderful roof-terrace. Overpriced breakfast. Will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DudditsEngland
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fabulous location just seconds from La Rambla. It is beautifully decorated and feels lovely and luxurious. Our classic room was spotlessly clean, spacious, bright and came with our own small terrace at the back. It was also lovely and quiet! The staff were lovely and helpful and the free wi-fi was a great bonus. We also spent a lot of time on the gorgeous roof terrace which is lovely and peaceful. The canopied sunbeds were great and the staff were very attentive. We'd absolutely recommend this hotel and we'll certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “It has everything...”
Reviews.Author: ross086
Reviews.Content: H1898 is a historic building given a clean, classy update. From the public areas to the rooms the details are taken care of. My superior room was large, beautifully outfitted and well-equipped so I could do some desk work. Wifi was fine. The roof terrace and pool are open from breakfast to tapas to drinks while on -1 there's a nicely outfitted gym, a beautiful indoor pool and other spa facilities. I found the staff friendly and services like laundry better than most. After staying at the Arts and the Gran Hotel Florida, both fine hotels, I'll return to H1898 for its central location and vibes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the middle of the Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Steph_Leuven
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the holiday in this hotel during a weekend. The description of the room (Privilige Room) exceeded our expectations (spacious, clean, quiet ), can't really mention any 'bad' remarks... The staff was very helpful and friendly when we asked something. We also used the spa-facilities which were also very clean and served as relax-time during the afternoons... The hotel is very well placed in the middle of the ramblas to visit the landmarks of Barcelona. When we'll visiting Barcelona again, we'll sure get back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Iratravels
Reviews.Content: First class hotel with excellent service. Only one warning, make sure you are on the quiet side. The Ramblas is loud.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Location; But Noisy room”
Reviews.Author: gwillen100
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel and location. Friendly staff. Two issues from our trip: - Wireless was not as reliable; it kept going in and out - Our Room , 422, was above a narrow alley way with restaurants below; it acted as an echo-chamber; it was very noisy until about 2AM each night; I would not stay in this side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay - First Class Hotel - Check it out”
Reviews.Author: a3whd
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were delighted. Smiling and pleasant gent took our cases and showed us our room and everything in it..Reception were so helpful, booking restaurants etc. The Hotel is beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean.Business room with 4 computers to access the internet and printers. All free. Free Wi Fi for those who bring laptops. The top of the building (Floor 7) has a great pool area and fantastic areas for lounging on long sofas with great service from the staff. Drinks are not cheap 7e for San Miguel 7.5e for glass of wine. If you stay in a Relais and Chateau hotel you must expect this. Location is just off La Rambla and in the heart of the city. See my other reviews for restaurants we visited. All in all a wonderful 4 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: donnajs
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days based on TA reviews and we were not disappointed. On La Rambla which is a great base for sightseeing, the hotel rooms are small (standard rooms) but beautiful with all the amenities. The breakfast buffet was the best we'd ever seen--so many choices, it was mind-boggling--nothing like a Mimosa to start the day right! The people at the front desk helped us with so many questions--Monica, especially, made 1898 most memorable. Try Bar Lobo next door for the best tapas!

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTED AT THE 1898 !!!”
Reviews.Author: 2clb
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for a 2 night post cruise stay..Had no idea it would become a stressful end to a much anticipated vacation..Sorry I didn't upgrade to a room with a view as the courtyard classic room felt like it was in a dark tunnel and within in a couple of feet from the window could see into other's beds...Room was very dark..NO one at reception desk explained how the cardkey had to be used to activate the elevator or the room lights..Within in a few minutes of entering our room we were in total darkness...Or that the airconditioning control panel was in the "CLOSET"...and hard to see..Luckily we had a small flashlight..Hated the lighting controls/system (I prefer the easy on/off switch)..The beds/pillows were the worst I've ever had ...Bath soap bar a bit larger than a postage stamp and NO washcloths...Loud music "Amplified" due to courtyard, playing from their rooftop lounge every night until 1:00am...During my first few hours at this hotel I had to call the front desk no less than 5 times..with an extreme lack of understanding and disregard by those on duty to my issues...I was so glad I only did a 2 day post stay..When it happily came time to check out no one offered to call a taxi or ask us if we needed help out with our luggage...While we enjoyed being able to see Barcelona..I couldn't wait to leave this hotel !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “3rd visit and it gets better each time”
Reviews.Author: bongomoppet
Reviews.Content: Visited Barcelona for a two night stay at the Hotel 1898 for the third time. Each time I'm amazed at the wonderful location, hotel facilities (especially the downstairs pool, gym and spa), and the service. Also, try to book a stay that includes their breakfast, which is one of the best I've had anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect oasis from hustle and bustle of La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: minibreaker89
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - all key sites within easy distance. However, best thing is to be able to chill out at the hotel - particularly on the rooftop terrace (daytime and evening). The hotel is very well appointed and staff were friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel and can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: kate_robinson_55
Reviews.Content: The service was fantastic, the room was beautiful with a huge private courtyard which was great as the Markets were only about 100m away. The Hotel Foyer also has an Amazing scent to it (not sure what) it is but it smelt beautiful. This is one of my favorite hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Renovated Lodging Made For Almost Flawless Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCatLady
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Hotel 1898 for a few days in August 2011 and enjoyed it immensely. The hotel decor is beautiful in a preppy, classic way - striped upholstery and dark wood. The rooms echo the decor of the lobby. Our room had very high ceilings and although oddly configured (with a large foyer) it felt spacious. The real stars are the pool areas. The underground spa pool is dimly lit and feels like an underwater grotto. The rooftop pool, while small, has ample seating including lounge chairs, daybeds, and the like. The roof is beautifully landscaped and also includes a restaurant and bar. The only complaint about the hotel is actually the puzzling lax service at the rooftop. Although this issue is endemic to Spain (and Barcelona in particular, from my observation) it was almost like you had to beg someone to bring you a drink. Also, it should be noted that with the USD's lack of buying power, the drinks (when you could get them) were really expensive. But, another plus is the excellent breakfast buffet that was included in our rate. It was extensive with every imaginable pastry, fresh fruit, juice, coffee, charcuterie, cheese, and even a choice of hot dishes such as omelettes. The location was also excellent, right on Las Ramblas. Although it was quite a distance, we walked to both the beach and the Sagrada Familia. I highly recommend Hotel 1898.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good - but a few things to be aware of”
Reviews.Author: CA_DINK
Reviews.Content: Two female travelers from the US, mid 30's. Well traveled - have been to Italy, France, Greece and all throughout the US. Typically stay at 4-5 star hotels as rated by US standards. I have noticed that US traveler opinion can be different than other European travelers - just keep that in mind depending on where you are from, when reading this review. Pro's of this hotel; -Centrally located -Beautifully decorated -pool -plunge spa like pool, steam room, sauna, gym (free of charge) -Clean -Comfortable -HUGE room (207) Con's: -Breakfast outrageously expensive. You can have the same breakfast in the lobby, but they charge 10 euro more for eating outside, on the roof. -Issues with the bathroom, drain did not work properly - and it was never fixed -Front desk staff, less than helpful. Provided minimal information on directions, recommendations etc. -Steam room - either it wasn't working or is of poor quality. It wasn't steamy, or even warm. -According to the Frommer's travel book, they warn against lower level rooms - because you "may" hear the train. We heard the train every 10 mins. We couldn't change rooms because none were available. Thank goodness we were so tired to sleep through. However, at these prices the train should not be an issue. Be very aware of where your room is located in the building. Tip: there is an excellent cafe right around the corner where you can get virtually the same breakfast for 1/2 the price! If I were to go to Barcelona again, I don't think I would stay at this hotel. I would probably try MonteCarlo which is right across the street. I also went to Mallorca, and Seville - please feel free to contacxt me about those areas as well.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want in a hotel - a brilliant find.”
Reviews.Author: bonnielondon74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 1898 over August Bank Holiday 2011 with a friend, in a superior room. Our first impression was of the beautiful, colonial style reception and lounge area, which was a welcome relief from the hustle of the Ramblas - Hotel 1898 is amazingly well located! Our room was well-appointed and comfortable - no complaints there - and they gave us a twin room as requested. Hotel 1898's biggest selling point has surely got to be its roof terrace. I was expressly looking for a city centre hotel with a pool and a roof terrace, but I was staggered at how spacious the terrace was. There were dozens of chairs and tables, sun loungers, day beds, comfy seating, shade and umbrellas, and table services from the very helpful waitresses. It was the perfect place to spend lazy days and evenings and night-times, and I would definitely go back during the clement months just for that asset alone. The pool was modest, but definitely a decent size - I gather many rooftop hotel pools in Barcelona are little more than a plunge pool.. There is also a lovely pool in the spa, which was a welcome surprise, with sauna and steam room. If I had any 'complaints' they would be that: - the wifi is patchy and frustrating - the room service and bar menus are uninspiring and you can't have breakfast in your room But the 'complaints' wouldn't stop me HIGHLY recommending 1898, and giving it 5/5, and I will certainly be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: RossRozz
Reviews.Content: Just perfect for our exclusive meeting. Attentive service, perfect location right on the Ramblas, delicious food. The Filipinas room on the mezzanine floor are ideal for small meetings or tasteful receptions. The corner suite with the private terrace are just amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: MikeDa13
Reviews.Content: Located on La Rambla, in the heart of Barcelona, H1898 is a stunning hotel, with an elegant and stylish interior and friendly and helpful staff. The first-rate indoor spa has a pool with hydro jets, a sauna and a steam room. The fabulous roof terrace has a pool, a bar and comfy sofas, with great views over the city. Named (apparently) after the year in which the last two Spanish colonies (Cuba and the Philippines) gained independence, the hotel is one of the best places we’ve ever stayed. I strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, one of best hotels we have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Alan_Joanna
Reviews.Content: This hotel, although a little pricey is excellent in every way. Very modern furnishings very comfy beds, nice big bath, free spa and roof top are great. Location is very convenient as it is just off La Ramblas. Easy to get to from airport. You can get the Areobus which stops at Plaza Catalunya which is less than 5 mins from hotel. A cheaper way is to get the RENFE train from the Airport (Terminal 2 via overhead walkway between areas A & B. If you purchase a T10 ticket you can get to the hotel and back for 8.25. The T10 allows 10 rides on the train for this amount and you can share the ticket with others. The bus is arou d double the price. We heard a lot of stories about pickpockets operating on the metro and on La Ramblas but we made sure we didn't take any easily stealable things like handbags and only took a small amount of money with us each time we went out. However no-one ever tried to pickpocket us which proves if you are alert and don't do touristy things like spend a long time looking at a map in the street then you are perfectly safe. A must is to visit the famous Market a few streets down from the hotel ( same side) it's great for fresh food. We got fruit, smoothies and croissants, etc each day. There is also a fantastic crepe stall too. To sum up, the hotel is well worth it's position on TA. We had a superior room which means you are on the outside of the hotel. We liked opening our window and soaking up the atmos from the street below.

Reviews.Title: “chill out in the middle of the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: rumbag
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the 1898 and we had another memorable and relaxing stay. The rooms are quite small but classy and comfortable but the real reason to choose this hotel is the roof top pool and bar area. It has large bed style seating and they play chill-out music allowing you to totally relax with the hustle and bustle of the Ramblas just metres away, but be warned, anything purchased here is very expensive although the tapas are of very good quality. The staff are very attentive and polite. The spa is, like the rest of the hotel, well furnished and gives an air of pure relaxation. A location bang in the middle of things which allows you to totally relax....win win!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with friendly & helpful service & great breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: sim0np
Reviews.Content: We would thoroughly recommend this hotel as having a great location & friendly unfussy service throughout the hotel. We were a little worried we would find our room noisy given the location just off Las Ramblas & indeed this was the case on our first night. It was not too bad but noisier than we would have wished. Next morning we mentioned this & were moved to a similar rrom on the 4th floor facing internally & this was absolutely fine. The front desk staff were knowledgable & helpful. The room (a classic, which is the most basic category) was not large but quite comfortable & well furnished. We booked a bed & breakfast rate and recommend this heartily as the breakfast buffet was superb. The terrace on roof is nice but we only drank there once as the prices were too expensive. Overall though we would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, and if we go back we'ii stay at the same hotel”
Reviews.Author: judit_l15
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is superb, on La Rambla Street, close to Katalunia squer. It is not a cheap hotel, and without breakfast. They do serve breakfast, but it is expensive (23 eru per person). The service was exellent.The room was cleened twice a day and we got chocolade sweets every evening. The stuf was very polite and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller x
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days in August 2011. Great location centrally located right off the La Ramblas strip. La Boquaria fresh food market a half block away one direction and a supermarket a half block the other direction. Our room was updated and had all the modern amenities. Quite roomy and well air conditioned. I agree with all the other reviews regarding the rooftop terrace. It was wonderful. Great service and even though we were there at peak time, never overly busy. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The most incredible hotel I've ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: beautyspeaks
Reviews.Content: It was my honeymoon and my partner and I wanted a place to stay that was luxurious and special in the heart of Barcelona. We were blown away by how beautiful this hotel was and the incredible level of service. We were greeted when we first arrived by helpful desk staff who let us into the room early because it was free and we just landed in Spain. We were met in our room with yummy chocolates and champagne (we got a packaged deal from the hotel) and we lounged on the rooftop terrace on one of their "sky beds" to recover from our jet lag. We also had a room right on La Ramblas and the windows were 100% sound proof - we would never be able to tell that thousands of people were milling about just below us. The food is pricey, but delicious and worth the extra few Euros. The morning breakfast on the terrace was a little over the top (huge plates of fruit and pastries and generous breakfast plates...) and a little excessive, but also delicious. If the price is not an option, this hotel is worth indulging in. From the two pools, the incredible service, beautiful decor to the cloud like beds, this hotel was worth ever penny in our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “THE .......Oasis in Barcelona .”
Reviews.Author: mutley77
Reviews.Content: Where to begin! This is an amazing hotel. We were in room 636 which was a lovely corner room with a separate lounge and lovely big bathroom. The bed was huge and very comfortable and they have thought of everything to make your stay comfortable. Yes, you can hear Ramblas at night and the metro in the morning, but we still slept very well and you cannot expect to be in the heart of things and not hear anything. The car park was a real plus for us, very secure and worth every penny and the whole hotel was a pure oasis. From the minute you walk into the darkened hotel entrance your eyes are rested and you feel cool and calm immediately. The basement spa is a real haven from the heat and hustle and bustle but the real gem is the roof. The pool is great but the view is outstanding. There are lovely places to lay and relax and the cocktails are sublime. We ended every evening there watching the sun set listening to the city below us whilst sipping excellent drinks. We cannot recommend this hotel enough, it really made our stay in Barcelona so special. Tip - try to book direct and get the breakfast included, it is the best breakfast we have ever had. Also, if you want to make your first night special, book a tapas and wine tour through Spanish Trails, the best way to welcome you to the city.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Aaliyah84
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days and it was perfect regarding location, staff, and rooms! We had no complaints even though it was in a busy area when you walked in to the hotel it was a relaxed atmosphere. Our room was quiet - no noise we slept well. Staff were helpful and always smiling which was lovely! Would def recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: APJK
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect just off Las Ramblas. Roof area was superb as you could look out over the city & ly out & read all day or night or have superb tapas & drinks. Rooms were really nice too. Pool was a bit small though but we never even used it as we had so much to do & see eventhough this was our 3rd visit to Barcelona. It is a bit pricey but when you get there you will say its worth it. Will definitely be back to 1898.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: lhreye
Reviews.Content: This hotel is housed in a restored 19th century building and is a colonial delight. The rooms are large, spacious and stylish. We ate at the in house restaurant which served up excellent mediterranean cuisine and tapas. The cathedral is a 10 min walk away. Superb..

Reviews.Title: “Everything spot on!”
Reviews.Author: scott b
Reviews.Content: The great sevice started the moment we entered the foyer. Our room was well appointed and very spacious. The location makes it a great spot to explore BCN. The rooftop pool is a perfect place for a nightcap. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Tranquility”
Reviews.Author: ghurka307
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the 1898 for the last 2 nights of our trip to Spain, and it was fantastic! Perfect location, right in the heart of the action on La Rambla, so easy to get to from Placa Catalunya & easy to get to all the key points in Barcelona. Even though it was on La Rambla the hotel was an oasis of tranquility! Our room was beautiful & quiet, the bed was incredibly comfortable. The staff were excellent, helping us find places, suggesting restaurants & making reservations etc. The rooftop pool & bar was definitely the highlight for us. We arrived prior to check-in so went up there to relax for a couple of hours & it was awesome. Great view, nice pool, comfortable seating, and wonderful restaurant! A beautiful way to end our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Gamby30
Reviews.Content: We have booked this hotel after reading so many positive recommendations. We had a summer special promotion with breakfast included. The location is great, easy to get to from the bus station, very central. The hotel service was great, we were always helped with our questions and a few good recommendations. We have tried the spa and special massage offers, an excellent way to relax. The top roof bar is another great plus for the hotel. The selection of tapas is small, but great quality. The hotel room (delux) was a little bit small, but very clean and with nice luxury details. I have found the airco in the room too strong, but personally I don't like airco in my room. The breakfast had a diverse choice, excellent way to start the morning. And the breakfast was until 11.00, which was good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect end to a perfect trip!”
Reviews.Author: PamelaJ1963
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in Barcelona after disembarking from our Mediterranean cruise at the beautiful Hotel 1898. This gorgeous hotel has been beautifully restored and the sleek, modern design mixes well with the old architechture. The lobby is expansive and very comfortable. Because it's summer and because 6 huge cruise ships arrived in port that morning, and because it was a Sunday, we were unfortunately not given a room until about 4 pm. This was frustrating as we were very tired, but it also forced us to go out and explore a little along La Rambla, other than take a nap as we had planned before dinner. La Rambla is bustling and fun but do be careful - lots of pick pockets and scammers. Luckily we were warned. When we were finally shown to our room we were very pleased - it was big, with a huge bed and beautiful bathroom with every amenity, plus a nice coffee service. The pool deck on the roof was amazing - big, comfy loungers and bar service - unfortunately it was just too darn hot to really enjoy it. Despite a full hotel, the staff was attentive and did the best they could for us - free drinks while we waited for the room. This is a great hotel in the heart of the action!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Daniel M
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have stayed in a number of hotels in Barcelona and Hotel 1898 was easily the best. From the moment we walked into the hotel, the service was excellent. The room was huge and beautifully appointed. Roof top terrace and pool stylishly decorated. We had a number of friends come over for a cocktail on the terrace after a hot Barcelona day and all were amazed at the standards of the hotel and professionalism showed by staff. Overall, i could not find fault with the hotel at all and would highly recommend others to stay here. I will definitely be returning to Hotel 1898 on our next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to Detail Everywhere”
Reviews.Author: Practically-Speaking
Reviews.Content: Our 9 night stay was a complete pleasure from beginning to end; Perfect in everyway. Check in was flawless. Maintenance of the room by housekeeping was superb; changing bed linen and bath linen everyday with refills of bath hygiene supplies. The hotel is spotless; attention to cleanliness is scrupulous; throughout the entire property. The restaurant is high quality and evening dinner service is friendly and casual while maintaining the niceties of formal dining. Breakfast is awe inspiring; if there is anything they don't have on hand you don't need it; the breakfast hostess and serving staff are cheerful and pleasant a good start to the morning. The front desk is courteous, patient and helpful beyond belief. They are always available for directions, assistance or restaurant recommendations. The restaurant recommendations are fantastic; most within a 10 minute walking distance. Any and all requests were met with quick and efficient resolutions. There is nothing to find fault with at this property. I would suggest a five star rating for this hotel would be more appropriate.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great service, conveniently located to la Rambla”
Reviews.Author: Emmanuel396
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel from August 8 to August 13, we were nicely suprised on arrival with free upgrade to the room facing the street. (superior category) Concierge staff is very helpful and booked for us a few restaurants. roofterrace is great with very nice swimming pool and great views. great location, close to the 'la rambla' also greatly appreciated cleaning staff with excellent service: room nicely cleaned everyday. overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: ajnewjersey
Reviews.Content: I planned this trip for my birthday and had 8 people traveling with us. This hotel was highly rated and it lived up to its reputation. The rooms were beautiful and well appointed. This hotel was located right in the heart of Las Ramblas. the only problem we had was our safe wouldnt work and we had all of important documents in it. management was just a little slow to respond, it may have been a language barrier but it didnt spoil our trip. The hotel was very comfy and elegant, i would go back on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Eureka089
Reviews.Content: Great location, lovely room, comfy bed, stylish decor, fantastic views, friendly and helpful staff. All these add up to a wonderful stay. We were disappointed that the indoor pool was closed for refurbishment as the terrace pool is tiny and feels crowded with just a couple of guests. However, we had free breakfast as part of a special offer on booking, which more than compensated as it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Peace found in La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: Chafffamilytravels
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the beautiful Hotel 1898 just off La Rambla in the busiest part of Barcelona. The rooms were beautifully done and the best part was having a quiet place to go to relax away from La Rambla's excitement. We had a room with a beautiful terrace. The rooftop pool and bar were a great way to relax after touring and shopping all day.

Reviews.Title: “We loved every bit...”
Reviews.Author: cocas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in a very busy weekend in Barcelona: Construmat, Formula 1...and other events. The hotel is in an ancient building and has a wonderful reconstruction. Decoration is superb, colonial style, specially in public areas and has a great Terrace on top floor. We booked a superior room and I really advice at least this category as the standard rooms are pretty small ( as in most European city centres). Breakfast was not included but it is worth every euro!! THe staff is really amazing!!! Quite helpful,nice and friendly. I loved every bit of my stay. I just didn´t like so much the Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jnh56
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights to enjoy a short break in the city centre. The location is excellent for exploring on foot the old town and La Rambla and the great range of shops nearby. We picked a deluxe room which had a fantastic large private terrrace but all the rooms we saw looked great. The hotel is very clean and the staff are exceptionally helpful. There is a fabulous roof terrace with swimming pool and bar- ideal for chilling! We would fully recommend this hotel for anyone who appreciates quality. We have not scored the restaurant because we ate out. Also the indoor spa was undergoing a refurbishment and we cannot score this.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Esieens
Reviews.Content: Really nice room and worth the stay just for the terrace and the pool! Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Mantmc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 18 year old son and friend before and after our Mediterranean cruise. The staff were polite, helpful and professional. The location on La Ramblas was perfect and the sound proofed rooms were quiet. We did experience some noise from an outside bar and restaurant on the back side of the hotel, but it ended fairly early in the evening (a Saturday). The rooms are tastefully decorated and very comfortable. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Darryl1234
Reviews.Content: Right on the Rambla, beautifully restored and decorated, large airy rooms, great bathrooms. A great choice! Don't miss the rooftop lounge. It's the perfect way to end the day.

Reviews.Title: “Chilled out boutique luxury on La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: TurnersTips
Reviews.Content: It was actually over a year ago I stayed here so apologies that I have only just got to writing a review, however it would seem the hotel is still well rated so feel my review is relevant. Stayed here for 4 nights with a girlfriend on our annual long weekend away to catch up. Ideally situated smack in the middle of the tourist areas, only 10 mins walk to the beach one way, 3 mins walk to the St Joseph's market the other, and many plazas with restaurants and shops in all around. The hotel is large, with traditional architecture but modern amenities. The room we were in (one of the entry price ones) was quite compact but comfortable, and the bathroom was very nice. Its not the cheapest place around but I felt it was worth it and would definitely consider staying here again on my next visit to the city. The best thing we found about this place was the roof terrace which appeared to be open until about 2am and was never really the busy. There's a bit of greenery up there and chill out/jazz music playing which adds to the atmosphere and drowns out some of the street noise. There are lots of comfy sun lounges and king sized shaded cabanas, with a small pool (more for a refreshing dip than to swim in), a cocktail bar and al fresco dining (not particularly cheap). We would start off our day with a lay in and coffee in the hotel before a swim in the basement spa area and then heading up to the terrace to sunbath/read/snooze (it did get VERY hot in August, obviously!), then head to the market for a late lunch at the boqueria (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La_Boqueria) and a bit of a wander around the local lanes and shops to help digest, before either retiring back to the terrace for late afternoon cocktails or doing some sightseeing (beach, Gaudi buildings, etc) until it was time to get ready for the evening activities. Its doubtful you need to book anywhere if you're going to eat early - ie before 9pm - most Spaniards dine about 10pm. We went to a salsa club one evening and got there at 1am, and were the first to arrive. I wouldn't really bother with the hotel breakfast if I were to stay again, might as well pop down La Rambla and find a cafe for a much cheaper price with better views for people watching (ie. at the Cafe de l'Opera - http://www.tripadvisor.com/Restaurant_Review-g187497-d697457-Reviews-Cafe_de_L_Opera-Barcelona_Catalonia.html).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous position on Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Ruthy54
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great position, right on Las Ramblas and near to the market and Gothic Quarter. It was easy to beat the crowds from here, by getting out and about early. The room was very quiet and comfortable and the pool on the roof top at the end of the day was most enjoyable. The staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Must be one of the best in the city!”
Reviews.Author: meganpotter
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this hotel. It's location (on La Rambla) puts you right in the heart of everything but when the doors/windows are closed I couldn't hear any of the busy city life below. The decor is magnificent. Bold and edgy yet comfortable and lush. The swimming pool reminds me of the one in Hearst Castle - divine. Guest service was, as expected, fantastic. Oh, and the bathroom was quite a treat - granite and glass everywhere - and a great open shower design. Really, this is one of my all-time favorite hotels in the world. I cannot comment on the food because we ate elsewhere, but I don't doubt it is great. We also had an amazing time on the rooftop. There's a small pool and bar there (a bit crowded), but what's better are the cabanas and other seating areas that line the border of the rooftop. My husband and I had a surreal time just lying there at night being served by the waitstaff while watching fireworks and enjoying a tremendous view of the city. Two thumbs up for Hotel 1898!

Reviews.Title: “Honest and hospitable people here”
Reviews.Author: Dolly054
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of Barcelona, on Las Ramblas. The staff was very accommodating and helpful. We did however experience trouble with our room safe. After sending various people to fix it, without success, we asked for another room and got it. Two days later we received a message saying they had some of our belongings at the front desk. There was my driver's license and credit card, as it had been accidentally left in our old room due to the problems with the safe! (I had not yet realized it was missing) I was totally impressed that this had been returned to me. The room was clean, quiet, and the hotel is beautiful in a wood-and polished marble way. They front desk was very helpful with everything. It is not crowded or touristy in the least, even though you are right down in the center of the action (including the student protest marches).

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, modern, tasteful and generic”
Reviews.Author: SallyMalibu_CA
Reviews.Content: The decor of this sleek hotel is ultra modern, reminding you of a trendy spot in New York City. The staff is helpful and friendly, our deluxe room spotless and good-sized with a large, unique terrace which boasts built-in couches, a large dining table and chairs and complete privacy. These terrace rooms are located only on the fifth floor and therein lies one of the biggest problems. Because one can only see the top of a large building across the side street from the room or terrace, you have no sense of what city you might be visiting and you could be almost anywhere in the world. The noise from the air conditioning and other machines atop the building across the street precludes your leaving your terrace door open at night so you are forced to rely on the room air conditioning, further isolating yourself from the city itself. The beds are incredibly hard (wish they'd give more thought to the beds and eliminated the "pillow menu" ) and don't really allow for a good night's sleep. The location of the hotel is very good (right on La Rambla) but if you want to experience Barcelona with atmosphere, choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel”
Reviews.Author: lofty0
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a short city break before Christmas 2010 and had a lovely time. The communal areas are lovely, comfortable and relaxing. The room was a nice size and also extremely comfortable. The staff were highly attentive and on hand when required. The location, right on Las Ramblas is excellent, right in the heart of Barcelona, walking distance from the Marina. The best recomendation is would you go back. For Hotel 1898 the answer is YES.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant - the rooftop pool alone is worth it!”
Reviews.Author: alimarie1502
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved Hotel 1898 as we stayed for 2 nights in July - we were a mixed group (one couple, two young adults, and two older adults), and everyone agreed we would never stay anywhere else in Barcelona. I can echo previous reviewers - amazing location without the noise, like an oasis in the middle of Las Ramblas. Very comfy beds and a bathroom that was out of this world (rain shower, super comfy tub - we had classic rooms). But the highlight was definitely the pool on the roof and the roof terrace in general. Laying out in the sun with a margarita overlooking the gorgeous city may have been the best thing we did.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent combination of relaxing and exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: JannetenJuno
Reviews.Content: The location of Hotel 1898 is perfect. The Rambla itself is not very interesting but the districts Ravel and Barrier gotic are all within walking distance, and so is the Placa Catalunya with all buses/ metros.. It's clean, the staff is very polite and helpfull and the rooms are convenient. The roof terrace is a very welcome supplement. After many kilometers walking it's so nice to lay on the loungebeds with a cold drink, the pool and the easy-listening music. Be careful, the depth of the pool is only 1 meter.The (roof)breakfast is very good but expensive (€ 25 pp). Do it once or twice and take your breakfast for the other days on one of the nice little cafetaria in the neighbourhood. The cleaners are so honest that they picked up a 5 euro biljet that I unconsciously threw inside the bin and left it for me with a note! We (my daughter 15 years old and I) will surely come back!

Reviews.Title: “A Magical Birthday Treat at a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: littleboo
