Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for a big birthday celebration. The hotel is on a prime location, right in the centre of Les Ramblas. It is unremarkable from the facade but step through the revolving doors and it is imediately evident that this hotel is stylish and sophisticated. The decor is very modern, but with a touch of bygone class thrown in. Quiet dark furnishings and carpet (black mainly) in the main areas and corridors (I have noticed this trend in other Barcelona hotels), however the cocktail lounge area was very vibrant with big comfortable sofas and contemporary lighting giving it a nice atmosphere. The rooms are very attractive with wooden flooring and deep crimson or dark green walls, ofset with lots of white woodwork, Huge comfortable beds in white quality linen and again great attention to detail with fantastic mood lighting.The ensuite was large well lit and beautifully appointed. The room also has a safe and minibar, although we never used the latter, choosing to go to the carrefoure supermarket a couple odf doors away to buy our champaigne and snacks, and the famous fruit market for fruit salads and smoothies etc to eat in the room for breakfast and evening snacks before venturing out for dinner. We had a room with a huge balcony furnished with large sofa type built in seating and again nice mood type lighting, this became a suntrap in the day and was great to sit out in the sun high above the hustle and bustle it of the streets with a glass of wine and watch the sun set over the rooftops. The hotel also has a large rooftop terrace with cabanas and loungers around a swimming pool, but as it was February when we went this was not really utilised, The cellar also has a fabulous pool with different spa features and the usual Steam room and sauna, together with a well equipt Gym and treatment rooms. Everything about this hotel is elegant. The only downside to the hotel was the much aclaimed breakfast, which we decided to sample at E40 each. We went into the restaurant to have breakfast and were dissapointed with the lack of anything really decent to eat, just continental style pastries and cakes, some fruit etc ( I have stayed in Holiday Inns with a better breakfast) we went back to the cashier at the hotel entrance without eating anything and she immediately removed the breakfast from our room bill. I must say that the entire staff were very friendly and super efficient and that the hotel is most definately worth of it's star rating. I would stay at this hotel again and as I am a travel agent I have recommended it to several of my clients who have each been very happy with the hotel. We ate in some fantastic tapas restaurants, and also in a great "ala carte" restaurant called "Monroe's" in the Gothic Quatre, just across the road from our hotel. Also don't miss the Tour Bus trips from the Plaza de la Catalonia, we got the 2 day pass and this allowed us to do both routes and see all the main tourist sights. There are pickpockets in Barcelona in the main tourist areas, but if you keep your valuables out of sight and take care of your belongings at all times you will be fine, they are just as bad in all major cities, London has it's fair share. Also don't be lured into the street "find the lady " games, as whilst you are watching this diversion the organised pickpockets take your wallets and pass them to another so that nobody would be able to trace who has it. Barcelona is a beautiful city, it combines all the sights and culture of old Catalonia with a lovely beach and stylish Marina area, I have been back again with business in May this year but the hotel I stayed in did not compare to the H1898. A tip for the Ladies, leave your best heels at home unless travelling by taxi to a restaurant, the cobbled streets will wreck them.

Reviews.Title: “Great! wouldn't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: AA3000
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults, 1 2yr-old) stayed there for a week in July 2011. I only have great things to say about them, and although we're quite picky, had no complaints. Details: Location: right on las ramblas, but didn't get any of the noise! Right next to both a big supermarket and the famous Boqueria fresh fruit market. In the middle of all of the action--we walked EVERYWHERE. Room: we stayed in their cheapest room with a king-sized bed. the room was quite spacious (by European standards), and very new/clean/modern. We didn't have a view, but who needs a view when you only go to your room to sleep? Bed: LARGE, very comfortable, good pillows, blankets, etc. Great night sleep every night. Bathroom: modern, new, clean, great shower, lots of toiletries (including full-sized toothbrush). Yes, the soap is small and non-standard, but we always bring our own soap anyway. Roofdeck/pool: really new/modern/beautiful. the pool itself was of course small, but most people just went in to get a little wet before going back to lay in the sun in the luxurious chairs. Great view Elevator: modern/new, small (normal European size), but they had 3 of them, so we never had to wait long. Food: we never had any meals at the hotel. There were just too many places to eat outside. But we did bring some microwaveable mac'n'cheese for our daughter, which they quickly handled for us. Service: anything you need, with one call, they take care of it in minutes! We needed an electrical adapter and they were up with it in minutes. Everything was GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PamelaBelle
Reviews.Content: Because Hotel 1898 does not have 24 hour room service, they can not be a 5 star hotel. But being located directly on Las Ramblas, room service was never an issue! What a fantastic hotel! We arrived at the hotel around 11 am. Our rooms weren't ready, but they checked our luggage with no problems. We went out for a stroll on Las Ramblas and lunch, returning around 2 pm. Our room wasn't ready, but it was recommended we head to the roof. One of their pools is on the roof and was lovely, but so were the canopied seating arrangements. We relaxed with beautiful views of the city, and had a nap while listening to some Euro-Jazz music unobtrusively piped in amongst the landscaping. The service was excellent, the rooms and bathrooms were excellent. We stayed two nights prior to heading out for our cruise. We were charmed by Barcelona and look forward to returning - and staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: dan_cfm
Reviews.Content: We were booked for 2 days prior to our cruise. What a wonderful location. If you don't like the noise than don't have a room on the street, personally it was entertaining for me to watch the happenings out on Las Ramblas and I slept with ear plugs. From the moment we checked in we never felt as if we were in another country, almost everyone spoke english. The rooms are very clean and I owe this to the beautiful hard wood floors and top maid service. The roof top pool is wonderful but it is very small and has very few chairs in the pool area, get there early. All four districts are within walking distance. If your going to venture off from the hotel to eat just don't eat on the Blvd. Find the smaller little gems that surround the city. The spa was closed for remodeling, which I was told 1-1/2 months after my booking. We did get nice massages in one of the suites they had set-up. We also went downstairs to look at the spa and it was completely tore apart, but it looked like a wonderful place, I sure wish it would have been open. It would have made this the perfect place. One final note, all the talk of pick pockets is true. My friend being a big burly guy was walking the Blvd. with his daughters and just as a skinny little kid reached into his pocket my friend grabbed his wrist.. At this time his partner came to his rescue as well as the girl that was also involved in the set-up as the distraction or at least her barley covered breast. We later had learned from one of our guides that they are all part of a Spanish Mafia and are highly trained. Just be alert in crowds!

Reviews.Title: “all good , booked based on TA reviews”
Reviews.Author: jimmybyron
Reviews.Content: just had 3 nights in superior suite on mid summer package which includes breakfast and a dinner. couple of points : rooms very well set up great beds and the quality that is expected with the price. we had room 446 , 4th floor over looking las rambles, not sure i would book this room again as can be a little noisy at night , not sleepless night kind of noise but the typical barcelona late night walkers etc. It took us a little while to get used to the quite loud church bells from the church next door, but I'm in the room typing this (free wifi) and have come to like them after three days. as others have said you do get a rumble from the metro which is under ground, this stops around midnight so not really an issue. the breakfast is sensational, we did book to have it on the roof one day but i wouldn't bother it was really much better in the dinning room on the first floor. roof area is nice , of course the photographer has worked magic with the pool pics, ok for a dip but not laps. If u want to do laps get a cab up to the olympic pool on montduic. in summary would def stay here again , probably book an internal room with the courtyard or light well view, def get breakfast included we booked direct as we always do , check their specials. oh and the spa s getting work done this week. AND the location is fantastic close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further, just a fine hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: wilso1
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms for a night while in Barcelona, 2 of the room were packages & one that included a massages. We arrived at the hotel around midday to be told not all rooms were ready. This is not what you want to hear but, they just went out of their way to make you feel welcome and do whatever they could to look after you while the rooms were being made up. We got into our rooms around 2pm, one room with a small balcony over looking la Rambla, the rooms are quite a good size with a large bath & very comfortable bed & pillows. Soon after we decided to venture down to the Spa for our massage and take a dip in the Turkish bath, the Turkish bath is sensational only to be toped of by one of the best massages you could ever have, the young African women sure knows how to massage. After this we decided to visit the pool area on the roof for tapas & a few drinks, consider the location this is a great little pool with a nice bar with views over Barcelona. The breakfast the next morning was the best, you will not get a better breakfast anywhere in the world, everything you can think of & very fresh. Honestly this Hotel has everything you want and located smack bang in the middle of Barcelona. We went as a family and loved it, if you want a romantic night or weekend look no further, this hotel has it all. Quite simply 5 star hotel with 6 star service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: Preston71
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Barcelona, and decided to stay at this hotel for a couple of days after returning from our Cruise. The hotel rooms were much more spacious than I had expected after being in serveral other European cities. The turn down service in the evenings was very nice, towels were changed in the morning and evenings, front desk service was great. The hotel was immaculate and roof top bar and pool were very nice in the evenings to watch the sunset over Barcelona. The locaton on the La Rambla was excellent with the Subway just a couple of blocks away. I would deffinately recommend this hotel and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: traveling4me2
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews, and we are glad we did. What a great location! We were concerned about pick pokceting, but we just left our valuables in the hotel and enjoyed ourselves on Ramblas. I would suggest staying here and we would definatly stya here again. The only downpoint is that the service isn't so great. I was told in Europe it's not like the States, so it didn't really bother us. Overall, a very good hotel at a pretty good price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: bissetbay
Reviews.Content: The service was great, the room was just like on the photos, flat screen TVetc. The location was spot on in the middle of La Rambla The only negative comment was that the terrace bar was extremely expensive compared to the rest of restaurants and bars on La Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, in fabulous location.”
Reviews.Author: Losman21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel 1898 in Barcelona for two nights in July. A short bus ride from the airport drops you off within a 5 minute walk. We arrived at 8:30am and our room was available for check-in. Both the indoor and rooftop terrace pools are fantastic. We also highly recommend including breakfast. We traveled through Spain and Italy for two weeks and the breakfast at H 1898 was by far the best! We wouldn't hesitate recommending this hotel to anyone. We will surely be back on our next trip to Barcelona (just watch out for the pickpocketers on las ramblas, they are everywhere and very easy to spot if you are looking).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: appleacre
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in July 2011, we had 2 rooms. 1 a classic for 2 teenagers 1 a privilege for my husband and I. Both rooms were very good, the privilege had a lot more space and would easily accommodate clothes for a longer stay. Our room had 2 windows one overlooking La Ramblas we did not find it noisy at all. The hotel service was very good. The rooftop pool is lovely and is a welcome respite from the city, it really is a tranquil spot in the middle of a big city. Breakfast at Bar Lobo around the corner from the hotel is very good, just leave the hotel by the door that is not on La Ramblas, turn left and you are there. The hotel is ideally situated for sightseeing, the beach and fine dining restaurants. I would stay here again when visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Brillant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Salty7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a weekend in January & it was lovely. The room was of a great standard with a TV & choice of lighting to set the mood. Our room didnt have a great view but this was made up by the roof top terrace where you can look at over Barcelona whilst enjoying the pool & bar. I also tried the basement spa which was very quiet & intimate whilst I was there which I very much enjoyed. There is a pool with showers, bubbles etc & a sauna & steam room just to the side. There is also a gym & treatment rooms available. Both the room & spa were well stocked with all the neccessary lotions & potions for your stay & you are provided with robe, slippers & towels. The staff were polite & accomadating & did not hesitate to hold our luggage after check out for the rest of the day until we were ready to depart. Deinately 10/10!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel... Staff Great”
Reviews.Author: SusanJC53
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 9 - and just returned from a 7 night Royal Caribbean Cruise out of Barcelona. We stayed @ the Hotel 1898 the night before our cruise departed and the night after our cruise returned so we would be able to see Barcelona. I loved the Hotel 1898 - it is a very clean, well managed hotel. The rooms were spacious - nicely decorated and the staff was wonderful. The staff was very accomodating and hwith storing our luggage till our room was ready. It was nice having FREE - WiFi and also we enjoyed relaxing @ the roof top pool. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and would also return to this hotel if I was in Barcelona again. Also... highly recommend Fat Tire Bike Tours - great way to see Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel with a Magnificent Roof Garden”
Reviews.Author: jbh2red
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with this hotel. Our room was quiet and well-appointed. The roof deck and pool set-up was perfect; having a drink up there overlooking the whole city was wonderful. The hotel staff was unobtrusive. While La Rambla isn't for everyone, this hotel is close to a wonderful market and convenient to the old city. The hotel was not at all overpriced. Our only minor issues: When we finally found the thermostat (inside the armoire), it was difficult to adjust without a flashlight. And while there was free Internet, it didn't always work in the bedroom and kept requiring us to re-log in.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona family vacation.”
Reviews.Author: hampdenLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Generally I enjoyed our 8 night stay at 1898. My wife and I were traveling with 4 parents who had two small children. The check in staff were friendly and got us to our rooms very quickly after a plus 20 hour trip which was appreciated. We stayed in a standard room. The size of the room was very adequate. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was user friendly and everything was clean. We were very impressed with the breakfasts that we had every morning at the hotel. Actually one of the better hotel breakfasts we've had in quite some time. There are 3 elevators that serve the hotel. Only one of which will take you to the 7th floor which is the rooftop where there is a pool, bar , lounge type area. Very nice. There are pictures on the site. The elevator situation is a little confusing because only one elevator will take you to the 7th and often you would have to wait quite a while to hit the jackpot and have those particular elevator doors open. Often we would just ride up to the 6th floor which all the elevators did and then walk up the stairs to the 7th floor. The waiters were very hit or miss on the roof. Some were friendly while others made you feel like you were bothering them. The bartender downstairs in the lobby was very friendly and helpful. The biggest annoyance with the hotel for me was the very spotty wi fi internet connection. It was ok in our room but the other two families had problems with it and at best it would sign you out after a minute of non use. It was impossible to get wi fi at all on the roof which must be particularly annoying for business travelers. I did not use the indoor pool but it looked nice. The gym was small but adequate for a run on the treadmill. The weight stack was too light to be of any real use. The hotel is located in the "times square" of barcelona close to all the attractions. Also when people warn of pick pocketers, it's no joke. I saw quite a few roaming the crowds. We had some tapas and wine across the street from the hotel on our second night and the waiter asked us if we could change a 50 euro note. We thought it was a little odd but gave him change. We discovered the next night when we used that note to pay for part of our meal that it was counterfeit. We went back to the restaurant and of course they denied it but returned our money. Barcelona is a great city but keep aware. I do recommend Hotel 1898 for first time tourists. Great location, food and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, Great location, very smart”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeChap
Reviews.Content: The not so good bits,,,,like others booked double bed got twin, downstairs pool a bit jaded and be careful not to hurt yourself on the jagged edges under the water (told the area is to be revamped soon), bathrooms can be a bit smelly at times - european plumbing.. The good bits...Excellent size room, fantastic food quality, upstairs pool area superb, hotel was spotless, superb location, breakfast on the roof terrace, downstairs pool in terms of clean and excellent service, floor 1 about 4 computers with printers great for online booking of flight seats..3 minutes from the Aerobus pickup point (near Hard Rock Cafe) just over 5 Euro's and quick Neutral, not the cheapest place for extras but the quality is excellent and worth the treat. Would we stay again yes !! So if you want a super hotel in a super location give 1898 a try.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: NadineInPhoenix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel 1898 from May 8, 2011 to May 10, 2011. Rooms were beautiful and functional. Hardwood floors, comfortable beds, beautiful bathroom with plenty of room. Room was always kept spotless and although we were on Las Ramblas, our room was away from the street and quiet as a pin. Free internet in a quiet room on the second floor business center. Breakfast is a little pricey at the rooftop cafe, but excellent quality and the view cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique style hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Gloffy
Reviews.Content: When I come back to Barcelona I will be staying in hotel 1898 again. The best for everything just don't get a room on la rambla side, can get a little noisy late at night

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel though front desk not entirely genuinely helpful”
Reviews.Author: pickycritic05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of our cruise in Barcelona. We chose this hotel based on trip reviews of others and from a traveller TV program. We were not disappointed. The lobby decor is tastefully done. The hotel is very conveniently located (side entrance and the main address is on La Rambla, the busy street but the main entrance is on a side street, directly opposite of Le Meridien). Every staff member was polite and courteous and generally helpful. Our rooms were a tad small but tastefully decorated. All fixtures worked (though the shower takes some getting used to). Most importantly the rooms were clean and tidy. Housekeeping was excellent. The hotel is about 3min walk to the Metro and is in the shopping district (for tourists) and lots of reasonable priced restaurants and shops in the side streets. We were near MACBA and visited there (don't recommend it though). Negatives/annoyances: We had 2 rooms. One was fine but we had a problem with the other. When we entered the room, it didn't have the aircond turned on while the other one did. We found it strange but it wasn't a problem and the porter happily showed us how to control the aircond. The TV was also smaller than the other room but we weren't that bothered. HOwever after 15min of aircond, we noticed a very strange smell in the room. We suspected it was due to the aircond. We brought the problem to the front desk staff who suggested that we move to another room but wanted us to pay more because the room was a grade higher than what we booked. I politely refused and asked that he either finds me another room on the same floor at the same price or fix the aircond problem. After much discussion with his manager, they managed to move us to another room at the same price as we booked and on the same floor. This new room didn't have the funny smell, was clean, and had the same size TV as the other room (where my kids were staying). But there was a problem with this room too -- the card access wasn't working so they gave us keys to access our room and a card key for the elevators. This was not a big problem but was a hassle because housekeeping only had card key to access our rooms, not the normal keys. The offshoot was we had to stay to let housekeeping into the room so that she could clean it. Luckily most stores aren't open until 10am so was more of an annoyance. I highly suspected that the front desk knew of the problems with the rooms but didn't offer to upgrade us to compensate for our troubles. Also we asked several front desks of which Gaudi museums we should visit because we were only going to be in Barcelona for a day and half. We were surprised that they weren't able to offer any advice and instead asked us which ones we would like to visit! We were quite surprised that they weren't as helpful as we'd hope -- we got the feeling that, whilst they were polite, they weren't that interested in helping us. In other words, do your own research before going to Barcelona if you are poised to stay in this hotel. To be fair to the staff, they did provide us good directions to the tourist attractions, once we knew which ones we wanted to visit. They also helped us made reservations to a Tapas restaurant that they recommended. The food was ok. Other than those irritations, breakfast was very good, pool on the terrace was excellent though tad small (one cannot swim laps in it). There's also a small pool in the basement that is very nice and had a serene environment as it was in the Spa area. The gym seemed small but we never had a chance to use it. All in all, service was generally good and we were able to overlook the annoyances with our experience with the rooms (we also found out many of the rooms were under renovations, even though the front desk told us they were fully booked!). We would stay in this hotel again if we return Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: hellojenjen
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel is a great choice. Very friendly staff, central location, close to transportation, and right next to the hub of the Rambla. Although you might expect to have the noise of the Rambla keep you up at night, the rooms have good soundproof windows. Occasionally you might hear some hoots and hollers, but nothing that will wake you. I would definitely stay here again. The only thing I would say is that if you don't speak Spanish, you have very limited in-room entertainment options. The TV has only 30 or so channels, most are in Spanish, and only about 20 actually have programming. No movie rentals. While you may not think you will be spending any significant time in your room, occasionally we like to relax and watch a movie before bed, or have some tv on in the background while we get ready in the morning, well, unless you want the BBC news, or Spanish programming, you're mostly out of luck. Also, the in-room internet requires a login every day, sometimes twice a day. It's free though, but they should get a good IT guy to make it more friendly. But honestly, if these are the worst things I can think of about this hotel, then they are still top of the line. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: appl3star
Reviews.Content: Everything was very good. Friendly staff, nice hotel rooms, rooftop terrace, Spa in the basement. Hotel is situated in the very centre of Barcelona, still the rooms were quiet.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved our stay at Hotel 1898!”
Reviews.Author: MKBredeson
Reviews.Content: The rooms are fantastic, beautiful decor, clean, comfortable. The staff was incredibly helpful, friendly, and welcomed us with smiles! I loved the Starbucks just next door, and the excitement of being right there on La Rambla! Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with pleasant amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Steincat04
Reviews.Content: Located right off of Las Ramblas, the hotel is a great location and nice escape from the hustle and bustle outside. It's important to get an inside room, or one that doesn't face Las Ramblas if you want some peace and quiet. The amenities are nice and include a decent business center, library, and breakfast buffet. The rooftop pool is fantastic, but got soo crowded that we could hardly find a seat. This is probably a product of the busy summer season and warm weather in Barcelona in June. Be prepared to pay a lot for food and amenities at the hotel. Everything is very expensive at the restaurant, bar and room service.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale, Clean and Excellent Hotel in the Middle of Chaos”
Reviews.Author: Frohwein
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and had a wonderful experience. The staff of the hotel are incredibly nice and helpful. The hotel itself has a traditional, upscale appearance without being over the top. The rooms are nice sized and ours had a huge bed for Europe - at least a King and maybe even a bit larger. The hotel is immaculate - especially considering the absolutely nutty scene on the street just outside. Actually, make sure you put the do not disturb sign on the door if you come back for an afternoon rest because the cleaning staff is quite zealous and will walk into your room without knocking (happened twice, but no big deal). We purposely focused on getting a quiet room - actually the least expensive in the hotel - because we are not big partiers and didn't want to deal with the street noise after calling it a night. Our room was very quiet (401). The pool is largely a waste, in my opinion, because it's in the basement and you feel like you're swimming in a cave. The hotel is simply in the middle of everything on La Rambla - a couple of blocks to the fruit market, and easy access to the old city. We definitely recommend this hotel and we are picky folks.

Reviews.Title: “unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: 2006world_traveler!
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to Barcelona after a five-year absence and wanted to stay somewhere central and safe, and I wanted to treat myself to a more upscale place. This hotel was rated high on the Trip Advisor scale so I gave it a try. It was a lovely hotel, an oasis just steps off noisy La Ramba. My room was extremely elegant. I did not sample the hotel breakfast. The only negative was that the lobby smelled very odd and was not conducive to spending any time in. The rooftop bar is amazing. Great views, a fun place for a drink and appetizers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & clean hotel in the heart of La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: Renee045
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of the rave reviews & location. It was an excellent choice on the Rambla in Barcelona. The hotel was extremely clean & well maintained. The employees working there were helpful & professional. The spa area was a real treat too with the unique pool & sauna and again very clean. The best though was the dinner we had on the rooftop! The food was delicious & the atmosphere romantic along with wonderful waiters to serve you. You would not be disappointed in staying here if you are looking for this particular area & a clean peaceful hotel to come back to!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel so far”
Reviews.Author: gad38
Reviews.Content: Just checked in today and could not be happier with the hotel. The hotel has a warm and sumptuous feel to it. It is modern, but not cold. We have a superior room on the 4th floor that overlooks La Rambla. Noise has not been a problem. The staff is great and has been both friendly and helpful. I was nervous about these points as I read a few reviews that indicated otherwise. So far, we have had an excellent experience and would rate this hotel highly. About the only critical thing I can think to mention is the prices on the Tapas bar on the roof are a little high. Each items is roughly 10 Euros. My son and I each had 2 for around 46 Euros and were still quite hungry. That being said, the rooftop terrace is very nice and very relaxing. We sat and watched the city as the sun was waning in the early evening and the value of that far exceeded the somewhat pricey Tapas. FYI - there is a great Gelato place about a block off La Rambla (when you go out the side entrance) that is really good. We will be stopping there again during the trip. By the way, the 4 computers they have in the library are a wonderful feature. It saved me lugging my PC on the plane and has been available whenever I wanted it. In fact, I´m writing this review on the hotel´s pc using their internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place- wish I could go back!”
Reviews.Author: Thebic_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pure magic for us. In an excellent location close to Barri Gothic and its many charming little squares. We walked everywhere in this city, from the Gaudi landmarks to the beaches to bars and restaurants all over town. We ended every night on the hotel rooftop, lounging on a daybed, drinking an iced fruity cocktail and unwinding to the sounds of jazz - or of jazzy versions of pop songs. We LOVED the complimentary tea time every day at 5pm in the lobby. Fancy chocolates and cookies, sometimes a croissant, and all in a lovely setting. On our last day in Barcelona, we tried out the spa pool, sauna, and vapor room, all very fun and complimentary as well. We had the lowest priced room in the hotel, and still found it extremely luxurious, very large by European standards, and simply fantastic. I can't even fathom what the top drawer rooms look like.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoying the stay”
Reviews.Author: 3galsontour
Reviews.Content: It is a lovely alternative to the Meridian where we stayed for three days just before coming to H1898. I can see it is well adored but laugh a little at the family designation. Immediately was informed my 10 year old daughter could not use the spa. (it was not really in the plans anyways). Then when waiting for an elevator noticed a sign on the wall informing us that you cannot use the elevator if you are by yourself under 12. If that doesn't say trip advisor family hotel of the year then I don't know what does. Actually I jest. While the sign is completely ridiculous I imagine it is a response to some obnoxious kids. One small point is there is no conditioner. There is a plethora of kits - "dental kit, vanity kit and sewing kit" but no room left in the elegant display for conditioner. Rooms are compact but not overly challenged in the space department. Real difference between classic and a superior is the inner courtyard versus street. Enjoy the free water and free Internet in the room. Around the corner Bar Lobo does an excellent breakfast in a lovely feeling square.

Reviews.Title: “A great escape from Barcelona Hustle and bustle..”
Reviews.Author: yaronpeled
Reviews.Content: Graet hotel , excellent service , rooftop pool has great views on the city , great indoor pool and spa , altogether a great place to chill out from this buisy city , gain some energies and out again! an excellent location right in the center , but once you're inside it's a perfect retreet . enjoyed a lot , great buffet breakfast. will come again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,great staff”
Reviews.Author: texasinsc
Reviews.Content: We were with two other couples staying here before our cruise. this was a great hotel and the staff was friendly, helpfull, and took great care to make sure we were being helped. the hotel fronts the Ramblas several blocks down from Catalonia square. this was a great area with many good restaurants. the rooftop pool and bar area were really nice with great views of the city. the arrangement they made for the hotel to ship transfer was inexpensive and really good. He carried 6 people and all of our luggage for the cruise for $1oo euros plus tip and delivered us at the luggage drop off for the cruise. the hotel rooms were spacious and outstanding.If we ever go back to Barcelona this will be our pick for the hotel. plus there is a starbucks just next door and a duncan donuts a block down. A good place for breakfast or a quick lunch is the lobos which is just down the sidestreet.the cafe is open air and the small plaza has street musicians .

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, one of the best stays ever”
Reviews.Author: MvdK01
Reviews.Content: Really beautiful hotel and had a great room with large outdoor terrace with tabel and big daybed. Room well arranged. The only thing that needs improvement is the service at the check-in counter. Arriving at 13.30 our room was not ready yet .... regular check-in was at 15.00 ??? So we were not amused, but beside that it is the best hotel to stay in Barcelona !!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel close to the action on La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: TLMSLC
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the fine points detailed in previous reviews. Given the price it rates four stars, not five - very good but not a wow. Ask for a room away from the elevator as the noise level can be high when party goers return from the streets at 2:00 AM. Not a problem if you are one of them, I suppose. Ask for a room away from La Rambla if you are a light sleeper. The hotel would do well to employ a designated concierge given the large number of foreign guests. They are not overly helpful or knowledgable about events, sights, or restaurants. In the front office's defense they are quite occupied with the large number of guests checking in and out.. For the price they should offer the service. Drinks on the roof are a romantic way to kick off or close out an evening but pricey. Try one of the many "pubs" in the area. Starbucks right next door and many other expresso shops are a stone's throw from the hotel, so no need to order in house breakfast or coffee for big bucks. Note these establishments don't open until 8:00 AM or later If so inclined use one of the spin cycles or treadmills in the hotel gym. There is also an indoor pool, sauna and spa.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of luxurious calm right in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: FeeMcRae
Reviews.Content: The room was cool, spacious and immaculate - so was the bathroom. The roof pool, terrace and bar have the most amazing views over Barcelona, night and day. A lovely, classy hotel right on La Ramblas. We couldnt have asked for anything better - I would recommend to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: twehenry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here and really enjoyed it. Likes - really close to La Rambla but quiet and relaxing. Roof top patio rocked and was a great way to end the day. Can't say enough about the rooftop!!Staff was great and very helpful. Dislikes - Main Restaurant was very stuffy and not really somewhere we decided to try out. Would have been nice to have a good home base restaurant. Overall a good spot if you want to be near everything to walk and also close to a metro stop. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent hotel for a tired traveller or one that wants to enjoy the finer things in life”
Reviews.Author: HelenS2866
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Barcelona via overnight train from Paris - so a 9am arrival. Despite the very early arrival, and although our "superior" room was not yet available (nor did we expect it to be at that time), the hotel staff were very pleasant and tagged our numerous bags, advising us to check back with them around 1pm, to see if we could book in early. The foyer is magnificent - lots of dark woods, black leather Chesterfield couches, opulence personified. Situated right on the main pedestrian boulevard of La Rambla, we were right in the centre of things, yet we had no issue with any noise. The Mercat La Bouqueria (a most wonderful food market with freshly squeezed juices and fruit that looked and tasted as if it was picked that day), was within a 100 metro walk from the front door - off La Rambla. One could immerse oneself there for hours as there was tapas, fruit, and an assortment of food there to keep all intrigued. The hotel has a complementary business centre with two Apple and two Windows based computes available for guests to use in an opulent setting on the 1st floor. There is a magnificent terrace tapas bar which overlooks the city and is a wonderful setting to view the lights of the city on cushions and wooden decking. Our room had two very comfortable single beds pushed together in the European style, with a pillow selection we did not have to avail ourselves of. We used the spa and sauna which is on the basement level - a very relaxing experience complete with dry and steam sauna's, pool with inbuilt chairs in the spa and fountains in a similar atmosphere to a Arabian styled hamman. My friend had a very relaxing one hour foot and leg massage for 85 Euros, which compared to Paris, was reasonable, given the luxurious surrounds. The room had a fridge, deep bath, toilet, bidet, comfortable chair and large LED TV affixed to e wall. The Service staff are exemplary in their duties - nothing was too much trouble. The toiletries we high quality and refilled very quickly, there is a turn down service (complementary) which is a nice touch complete with foot mat on each sides of the beds and chocolates. We called for ice - brought up immediately. There is an in-room safe and great lighting. My only small fault in an otherwise unblemished record, is that there was no iron and board available for guests to use - security was cited as the reason, and although I understand the potential risk of fire, for a hotel of such quality to not offer this was surprising. Despite this, we would both stay here agin in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good, not great.”
Reviews.Author: NatalieZMD
Reviews.Content: Location in center of tourist hub - on the main blvd of old Barcelona; while this is great for exploring this part of the city on foot, it is also in the middle of a very hectic part of town. Our windows (superior room, #225) faced the back of the hotel - a small side street but one that had 3 cafes/tapas bars, and, as the nights are long in Barcelona, there were street musicians playing outside our windows past midnight. I imagine the rooms facing the inner courtyard are quiet - these are mostly standard double rooms. Overall, the comfort of the room was more than adequate, although not the best I've experienced (I travel abroad several times per year), especially at this price ($445/night). The room was normal size by european standards. The bathroom / shower good but not amazing. The decor of the hotel, the lobby setup, etc is the part I enjoyed most. Spacious, well appointed, well designed. The roof terrace - a very nice touch. Beautiful views of the city, very pleasant to relax and unwind, fantastic outdoor furniture - couches, chaises. However - the restraurant on the terrace - another story. We had tapas & drinks one early evening - ok, not great. On the last morning we had breakfast on the terrace - quite awful. The bread wasn't good, the fruits were tasteless, the fresh-squeezed orange juice wasn't good, and to top - the omelet was oily and cold!! A bad breakfast in any situation, but at the price of 25euro/person I think this is unforgivable. Of note, there is an alternate breakfast option at the hotel - on the 1st floor at 21euro/person; we did not try so I cannot comment. In general I rarely go out of the hotel for breakfast because I don't like looking for something in the morning, but in this case I felt that the prices for bfast were unreasonable. My experience with the front-dest staff was neurtal. They were neither exceptionally helpful, nor unprofessional. A restaurant recommended by the font desk (El Pintor, in the jewish quarter) was not good. A tapas place they suggested - a typical tourist hub with good but mediocre tapas. We also stayed at hotel Catalonia Catedral in Barcelona - in the Barri Gotic on a pedestrian street. This was substantially better priced, and while there is a difference in hotel class, in this case this difference did not justify the significant difference in price. Catalonia Catedral was very comfortable, quiet, with larger rooms and a significantly more modern/c

Reviews.Title: “Loved it & recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Virginia2002
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent 3 nights here before a cruise. I picked the hotel based on Trip Advisor's reviews. We were not disappointed. After checking the hotel website, I had a few questions before reserving a room and sent several emails. Each one was answered in less than 24 hrs. We arrived before noon via taxi & were greeted curbside. Even though we arrived before the normal check in time, Monika was able to see if our room was ready, it was & then checked us in. Also she was excellent providing us with hotel & Barcelona info as well as info concerning pickpockets & on how to be careful. Our room was on the 3rd floor on the side street. The pros: 1. Very clean with a wonderful bathroom 2. The pillow menu. I tried the Memorex pillow & liked it. 3. We enjoyed the steam room & sauna & loved the therapy pool on the lower floor. 4. Afternoon tea was relaxing. 5. Had a special rate that included breakfast buffet. The buffet had a large amount of choices with American & European items. Delicious fresh fruit. 6. Early check in 7. Great location 8. Front desk sells discount tickets for the hop on/ hop off bus. When we purchased our tickets we received a booklet with discounts to other sites. 9. Helpful staff who speak good English. The cons: 1. The tub is very slippery & we were not given a tub mat. I should have asked if one could be provided, but did not. 2. The fitness center did not open in the early hours of the morning. My husband likes to work out around 6-7am & it was closed then.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable !!!”
Reviews.Author: maximus217
Reviews.Content: We stayed 9 days in Hotel 1898, and we were pleased that we have selected not only the best hotel in Las Ramblas but also the most centralized hotel in Barcelona since the hotel is located in the upper Las Ramblas. We have selected Superior Room with the view of Las Ramblas. The room is magnificent, and they offer different types of pillows to choose from. The free wi-fi in the room is a major plus since most hotels in Barcelona will require a payment of 20 to 30 Euros per day for internet connection. We were able to have a good night sleep even though our room is located in the front of Las Ramblas. We highly recommend anyone to get the breakfast buffet with their room rate. The food is plentiful and have a wide range of variety. The business center can be used free of charge if you need to access your e-mails or print any document. One thing that stands the best about Hotel 1898 is the type of service their employees provides to their customers. They are all courteous and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: musti_SF
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1898 was excellent. We loved the location, check-in experience and the comfort of the room. It certainly felt luxurious. The bed was very comfortable. After walking all day in Barcelona a comfortable bed with silky sheets welcome you at night. I loved the bathroom and the toiletries. We had a small problem in the room where the AC stopped working. Within ten minutes they sent someone to fix it. The location was also great in terms of public transportation and fun. It is only 5-10minutes away from Plaza Catalunya where the airport bus drops you off. There are many restaurants and cafes on La Rambla. At night it seems like a place to be. This was an expensive hotel but I thought it was worth every penny!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel on Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: kitteecat74
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel for a conference and was lucky enough to spend 3 nights there. The food and the service were impeccable. The Spa was a dream come true and location can't be faulted. There is an entrance directly on Las Ramblas and the lobby is stunningly beautiful. There was a large choice at the Breakfast buffet including several local delicacies, like local ham and cheeses. There was a choice of hot and cold food and also the option (for a minimal charge) to have your breakfast on the beautiful rooftop terrace. The rooms were spacious and well laid out with beautiful bathrooms with great showers. The only minor down points would be the "double" bed which was two large singles puhed together and the "view" into the covered courtyard, so minimal sunlight and lights were needed at all times. The good point there, though is that there was no noise whatsoever from the busy Las Ramblas. As mentioned before there is a roof top terrace with views over all of Barcelona, a very small pool and a bar that is open until 9 or 10 o'clock. The lobby bar is only open until 11ish normally, but because there were so many of us they stayed open until 1 or 2 in the morning. There was free Wifi throughout the hotel and about 4 English speaking channels on the TV. The conference area is in the basement so that the business users not disturb the leisure guests. I went for a walk in my free time and (without the free map proffered at reception on check in) managed to find the cathedral,the market, the bridge of sighs, the port, the biblioteca and about a hundred Irish bars within a 15 minute walk of the hotel. There is also a supermarket 2mins away if you need to pick anything up. Can't recommend this hotel highly enough and will stay there again when I can afford it personally!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Finish a Spyns Pamplona Running of the Bulls Tour”
Reviews.Author: Spyns
Reviews.Content: A number of Spyns clients have stayed at this hotel after their trips with us to Pamplona's running of the bulls. Most raved about it so I jumped at the chance to stay here before a pre-trip to Pamplona in late May. Overall I really liked the hotel but clients should be aware of a few "quirks". The hotel has an excellent location right off of La Ramblas - Barcelona's equivalent of the Champs Elysees. The reception staff were among the best I've encountered in Spain: excellent English; professional; and fast. The hotel itself looks like it was renovated about 4-5 years ago and everything was impeccably clean. The rooftop bar and swimming pool were truly unique and I thought the spa (with pool, steam, exercise room and sauna) was also excellent. For those who are light sleepers, you shold be aware the hotel is right above the subway line so from 5:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. my 3rd floor room vibrated every time a train passed under the hotel. Also, if you have a room overlooking busy La Ramblas be prepared for latenight noise. If you are a light sleeper, go higher (there are 7 floors) and ask for a room on a side street rather than fronting on La Ramblas. Two other minor issues: first the internet connection was achingly slow; and the TV remote was an exercise in frustration. Other than the noise and technical issues, the hotel was excellent. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Top class designhotel”
Reviews.Author: ToolBergen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just top class. When arriving in the lobby it was pure class. The room was stylish an good size. The rooftop pool and bararea was just fantastic. In the evenings it was a really cosy atmosphere sitting there with nice music, great view and the best drinks. The only thing they can improve is the concierge service that was not to helpfull and some aircondition in the gym. The hotel is fantastic and stylish, go spoil yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Just few comments”
Reviews.Author: philippeenrique
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, well located, etc... just as everyone else said!! Worth going to. Now, few comments I make for the management just so it can become number one in Barcelona... 1. Gym? Nahhhh. There are 6 cardio machines but just one bench with a few weights. Pu-lease... When someone wants to do "real gym", try to do like other hotels in Barcelona, have a partnership with a real outside gym and if customers ask for a real work out, then direct them to the outside club 2. Your terrace is beautiful, but Gosh, the water is cold in the swimming pool. Such a shame. 3. Your male receptionists could be friendlier. I don't know if they feel threatened by gays or something but they are not as nice as your female receptionists and they have an attitude. 4. By default, don't provide super soft pillows in the room, especially if you hide that there is a pillow menu... That spoiled one night for both of us. I had to ask 4 times the reception to bring us other pillows the following day... Apart from that, a very very nice hotel, well located, better than other ones we've been to in Barcelona. The Terrace is fantastic, the rooms are spacious and nice, the service is great. I recommend the hotel to people that would read my comments.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at H1898!”
Reviews.Author: Joce01
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7 nights stay at H1898. This hotel is very centraly located, allowing to walk pretty much to all/most major attractions/sites. The staff is very friendly and eager to help. The rooms are not big(we had a classic room), but everything needed is available and still confortable. The roof top terrasse and pool is very nice and was well appreciated, since we got full sun and hot weather every days of our stay... ;-) The spa in basement is also very nice, but noisy when many people are using it (some don't understand that a spa is for relaxation and not for lound chats...) Furtunataly, we only got that once, every other days it was quiet and nice to use. The buffet breakfast was included in our stay and was better than expected (nice selection and good (variety of fruits, cereals, pastries, embutidos(charcuterie), bread, cheese, white wine, cava, variety of juice, yogourt and a diet section)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and pool... that's it.”
Reviews.Author: psafdieh
Reviews.Content: Easily accessible from the aerobus, perfect location by the food market (boqueria) on Rambla. Rooftop pool was awesome and staff was respectful at night, lowering the music so we could sleep. On the other hand, room description on the hotel's site said "overlooking inner courtyard" which was really "overlooking three potted plants on a concrete floor". No sunlight. Oh and no concierge... and the reception staff wasn't very warm. Room service menu needs a boost.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: LindaLarini
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Clean, chic rooms with wonderful beds and linen! Couldn't be better situated - right on the Ramblas - but not noisy in the rooms!! The pool is a fantastic plus after a hot day's sightseeing in this wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “Best Barca Option”
Reviews.Author: mrsbirdo
Reviews.Content: The location and roof terrace make this the perfect Barca hotel. Added to this beautiful style and decor and great staff - i wish I was there now.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother researching other hotels.”
Reviews.Author: Tuck033
Reviews.Content: We spent a lot of time reseraching hotels in Barcelona and picked Hotel 1898 primarily because of the TripAdvisor ratings and reviews. It couldn't have been better. Perfect location. Suites are a good size and the bathroom is user-friendly. Staff was very helpful. Buffet breakfast was comprehensive. One tip for the Hotel: What's with that bar soap? It would have been difficult to handle even with tweezers. One tip for travlers: Although the address is on La Rambla, that's actually a side door. Apparently some cabbies don't know that they need to drop you off on the side street to access the main entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Pashie33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at H1898 for a week as part of our honeymoon. We had an excellent experience and would definitely go back. Our room was very quiet on the 4th floor and I could always find a housekeeper in my hall who was very nice to give me items I needed. We LOVED the terrace and having breakfast there. They accommodated us without a reservation and it was SOOOO good we made a reservation for our last morning there. It is a must-do and it was the BEST breakfast we had ever had. The pools are wonderful and a great view from the rooftop. We also enjoyed the sauna, steam room and massages. Upon leaving we discussed coming back for an anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: drjeff
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days here and picked this hotel because of it's reviews on Trip Advisor and becaue it had an indoor pool. I like to swim daily. First the location is excellent figth off teh Rambla in the center of Barcelona. It is in the center of everything just a short walj=k form the Plaza Catalunya. You can walk everywhhere from here or if you wish the metro is just a few feet away. The public rooms are beautiful. There is compilimenatery tea in the lobby every afternoon. There is freee wifi and the business center is compilmentary as well. There is a great indoor lap pool in the basement with a full spa and execise rooom. There is a second heatetd roof top pool and terrace with a great view. We had a classic room which was large enough with a very large modern bathroom. This was one of the best big city European hotels that I have ever stayed at and have no problem reccomending it. The staff is also very helpful and warm' The only issue we had was with the taxi back to the airport. The hotel arranged this and it cost us double the price that the originating journey cost. Do not ask the hotel to get you a taxi back to the airport. This is the only thing that I can fault the htoel for.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cwyorks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights to celebrate a wedding anniversary. It was our first time in Barcelona and I don't think we could have picked a better hotel. We got the aerobus from the airport, buy a return ticket, and it's a very short walk from the bus stop to the hotel. It's a beautiful building and you will not be disappointed with the inside either. We booked a Privilege room as we were celebrating, and it was lovely, very spacious with high quality fixtures and fittings. It overlooked La Rambla but we were not bothered by any noise from the street, though as a light sleeper I was aware of the rumblings of the metro. This may lessen if you are on a higher floor (we were on 3rd floor). We didn't book breakfast in the room rate so didn't eat in the hotel but La Boqueria market is just a short stroll away with fresh fruit platters selling at just 1 euro, and a good selection of fruit juices and smoothies if you are feeling in healthy mood. There are also a few tapas bars there so plenty of choice. The stalls in this market are amazing. Check out the speciality fish displays, plenty of photo opportunities. There's a branch of Starbucks next to the hotel for a more traditional tea/coffee and muffin breakfast. The hotel is very central so ideal for walking/sightseeing but there is also a choice of 2 metro stops if you are feeling less energetic. If you leave the hotel through the side entrance and turn left there is a small square with a selection of tapas bars and restaurants. We didn't use any of these but they always looked busy. Our favourite spot for late afternoon was the roof terrace. Very nicely set up with lots of sofas and daybeds. It seemed to be popular with both guests and local business people. We had a drink there most days and even ordered a bottle of wine on our anniversary. Be warned though, the drinks are not cheap. There is also a food menu though this seemed to be mainly snack type meals, but you do get complimentary nibbles when you order a drink. All in all we were very pleased with our choice which was mainly based on Trip Advisor reviews, and would love to stay here again if we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pidner
Reviews.Content: It was a great stay. The gym, the terrace, the spa. Everything is really good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: trane12
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean, elegant in a contemporary way, quiet even though on La Rambla, good business center, lovely terrace / bar with great city views, has a fitness center, pretty spacious rooms well done. The staff was fabulous. Considerate, smart, efficient, very helpful and, as my wife said, all good looking. I am very picky especially as regards customer service and these guys are stars.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for city trip”
Reviews.Author: happy_camper_ww2010
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in perfect location with nice rooms and spectacular views from the rooftop terrace. Barcelona's main tourist attractions are in walking distance or a short Metro ride away. Wonderful breakfast service on sunny days on the rooftop terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city hotel”
Reviews.Author: SwissFreqTraveller
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong staying at this hotel. Nice rooms, good wellness, rooftop pool is a bonus (as are private pools for certain suites). Service was great - they even managed to get us an ATM custom programmed on Easter Sunday such that we could have our concert tickets printed! We felt a bit like James Bond... Breakfast buffet was out of this world. Barely see such a sumptuous and big selection of fresh fruit at hotels. Only caveat: our room was 622 (I assume it's all x22's), and we were next to the employee elevator. As you can imagine, this thing was worked day and night, and could be heard in the room. Same for the trolleys pushed past our room. But even if we had this room again, we would take this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “H1898 - Best in class!”
Reviews.Author: Alabang
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent only two nights at hotel 1898 Ramblas, but we can only hope to get back there soon. Perfect location, perfect service and such a SUPERB hotel! All what we had hoped for when we booked our stay. Nice pictures from Philippines (that we know quite well) on the walls on each floor are bringing the guests to their rooms. Classy wooden floors and wall pannels, adding to the charm of dark green and white striped colours. Huge beds and impeccable bathrooms. We only regret that we had no time to try the spa or the outdoor rooftop pool, where the view of the city is quite nice.Buffet breakfast was very nice too, with so many different choices (e.g. not too many hotels propose fresh papaya!). All in all delightful stay, to say the least!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great City. Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ryegate
Reviews.Content: The H1898 is a world class hotel with history, modern amenities, great service and a superb location in the heart of Barcelona. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to anyone wanting to see Barcelona at its exciting best while while having the ability to return to the H1898, an oasis of quiet and class.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel in a Wonderful City”
Reviews.Author: Sockrdad
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1898 occupies a wonderful building on a lively La Rambla streetcorner. The hotel management runs an operation that lives up to the very worthy location.

Reviews.Title: “super!!!!excellent!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: spyce
Reviews.Content: we just return from a wonderful trip. our first stayed in europe was at hotel 1898!!!we loved it!! I email in advance beacuase it was my husband bday, they had ballons at our arrival!! i loved the rooms and the bathroom were great!!!!!the breakfast is to dieeeeeeeeeeeee!!the best in all of our stayed in europe!!!! i really recommend this hotel!!!its rigth at the ramblas and there is NO noice in the rooms . I am a ligth sleeper and it was great sleeping in.restaurants: cerveceria catalana, botafumeiro, and the w bar its a great spot for a drink!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: oldwalkerSoutheast
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with excellent attentive staff in a prime position. It's only a 5 minute stroll from where the airport bus drops you in the Placa de Catalunya (6 euros - good value). I would suggest that you use the side door in to the hotel as we had to be rescued from the rotating door with cases! We arrived mid-morning but were welcomed and our cases taken off us. We were given a good map by the reception staff which we used the whole time we were there as it was easier to take in and out than a guide book. I have to admit that we were a little edgy about pick-pockets as everybody mentioned them, but we made good use of a 'bum bag' which meant that all valuables were kept close at hand. We made use of the safe in the room to leave anything valuable. It's a short stroll to the water-front, cathedral and Picasso museum and the metro is very easy to navigate. The trains and the fares put the London underground to shame. I would suggest walking to the cable car up Montjuic and catching it back to the port as the queues are much shorter that way.Also don't miss the Fonts Magica at dusk - they are brilliant but the views are even better. Going back to the hotel, the rooftop pool is warm and the whole terrace area is lovely. The spa pool is great too. The rooms were kept beautifully clean - no mean feat when the bathroom door is mirrored and promptly covered in fingerprints. Yes, we could hear the rumbling of the metro but it didn't bother us. (we were on the 4th floor). We'll be back. We loved the hotel and have got plenty more to see in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: kjwcanary
Reviews.Content: We simply loved this hotel. We've been lucky enough to stay in some great hotels, over the years, and we both agreed that it is the best we have stayed at. Rooms are very clean and well appointed, with incredibly comfortable beds and great bathrooms. Service was friendly and efficient, and the location really can't be beaten. Both pools are great, and the roof area with bar is a very pleasant place to hang out in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with central location”
Reviews.Author: Ajaxio
Reviews.Content: We were so please with Hotel 1898. This was our first time in Barcelona so we really had no idea what we were doing except that we trusted Trip Advisor reviews to find our hotel as we have had very good luck with TA in the past. We were not disappointed with 1898. We went for the nicer room which was really huge by European standards. In hindsight we probably would have been OK with the standard size room, but we got "a deal" with breakfast included in the fancier room so we felt it was worth it. The bed was the biggest king size bed that we have ever slept in and the lighting really is great and "green". The bathroom was luxurious with bidet, which many Europeon hotel of this price are eliminating in favor of more space. The service at the hotel was great. Rooftop bar and pool wonderful for cocktails in the early evening. Breakfasts were abundant and very good quality. We were not wild about La Rambla at first but had requested a queit room not on La Rambla. Ultimately the 1898 location was very central and La Rambla grew on us. Windows are double pained and we had no noise issue. Might be a problem if you are on the Rambla side of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property!”
Reviews.Author: cassil74
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1898 is a great property. I highly recommend it. The rooms were delightful and the rooftop is great as well. I would definitely suggest staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mvgp
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights here and It was perfect. Walking distance from major sights, the room was fine, quiet, even if it is on the ram la.. Just perfect

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel in a fab location!”
Reviews.Author: KatrinaStamp
Reviews.Content: rooms were lovely, location was perfect - right on Las Ramblas but you'd never no. Would def stay here again when I come back to Barcelona, and definitetly recommend it. Spa treatments restricted to massages only but still very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: BlasGlasgow
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights in a deluxe room with terrace. Superb location, room was on fifth floor so was very quiet and the terrace was a great size with sun from mid morning until sundown. Room itself was a good size, beautifully decorated and the bed was very comfortable. Buffet breakfast had a superb selection and service at the hotel was helpful and unobtrusive. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in central location”
Reviews.Author: ebennike
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as a part of a guys' trip to Barcelona. Check-in went smoothly and service at front desk was fine throughout the stay. Location is right on the Rambla for what it is. If you don't like the area, then don't stay here. I find it a great place to stay in Barcelona as you are close to virtually everything. What I liked most about the hotel was the heated pool on the rooftop terrace. Even though it was February (and the air a bit chilly), we had great fun sitting in the pool drinking cava for hours. Highly recommendable. :) For some reason the pool in the basement was terribly cold. Don't know if it had to do with the fact that they just finished maintenance the day before. Otherwise, they really should turn up the temperature. It is too small to swim in anyway. Overall, especially considering the price, I would recommend this hotel to anybody, and I almost certainly will use it again for my next stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect from A to Z, one of the best hotels we ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: swisspigs
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot. Really a lot. But this traditional stylish wonderful hotel really got us! We loved the room, a superior room with view to the Ramblas. The room was spacious, wonderfully decorated and everything was selected to represent best materials and luxury. The bathroom was gigantic, with green marble all over, big bath tub, separate shower, two sinks - what do you want more? The sleeping comfort was as good as it can get and the linen felt great and cuddly. We also enjoyed the swimming pool area. Buttons all over to put jets to various areas in the pool. All well maintained and a piece which completed the luxury feeling. And yes: The bar and the barmen were classy, the Japanese restaurant being part of the complex as well and the good thing is that you are 'in the middle of the cake' having the Ramblas at your doorstep. We will be back when we are in Barcelona again. Muchos graçias!

Reviews.Title: “Top location, good customer service, small room”
Reviews.Author: SwissAirTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in Mid-February and had a good stay while in Barcelona. Hotel location is very good and the building is really impressive. Some street noise at night so you could ear it. Customer service provided is good. Buisness center available as well as 2 pools (indoor and outdoor). Nice rooftop terrace with city view. Room booked was a superior one but was rather small. Good amenities for this hotel category. Breakfast in-room was good but not great. A good choice for your weekend stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable beds ever and a bathroom with a balcony!”
Reviews.Author: Nathalie_and_Nikolas
Reviews.Content: We're very glad for having chosen the 1898 hotel for our stay in Barcelona. The hotel is very decent and as a result - we really enjoyed our stay. It has two entrances - the smaller one from the side of La Rambla and the main one - from the quiet street. Before coming we worried a bit about the location - from our previous journey we knew that La Rambla is a noisy place that never sleeps but everything was just great as we got a room in the farther wing of the hotel with the window to the small calm street. The room was spacious enough (we booked a priviledge one), spotlessly clean, very elegant, decorated with taste and... it had a bathroom with a small terrace. I adore bathrooms with natural light so this was just terrific as was totally unexpected. There was a kettle and an assortment of tea in the room so you could have a cup of tea at any time. We also liked the "light menu" that allowed you to choose the combination of lights you prefer during the day - "welcome", "read", "relax" and "night" positions, very comfortable indeed. The bed we had in our room was just enormous and so comfortable that you wouldn't want to wake up in the morning. So we didn't miss an opportunity to order breakfast, which was great, to our room. Now let me explain why we do not give it "excellent". First, upon arrival we were given the minimum of the information concerning the hotel. Yes, we got a small booklet with all the amenities but it would be rather nice if not to show us around then just to explain where the restaurant is, what we need to use a spa or how to get to the rooftop terrace. Nothing. The only thing we got - "We have a spa. You can use it". And that's all. Now the swimming pool they advertise as suitable for swimming turned out to be ridiculously small taking into consideration the number of rooms in the hotel and dangerously hot. So forget about swimming, it will be rather lying in a hot bath with many other people. And the zone itself is not kept properly - there were enormous puddles of water that made the floors slippery. They should understand it's inevitable but very dangerous so there should be either some person constantly wiping the floor or they should put wooden or rubber carpets there. As for the rooftop pool, it is made for kids - too shallow and too small to swim though the idea is great. Next, I've already mentioned that the street under our windows was rather quiet but still if there was some noise outside - like a garbage truck every morning or a group of youngsters having a late night party - you would hear it so double windows would be much appreciated. And the last one. My husband bought me flowers. There was no vase to put them in so we put them into the sink so that the maid could see them and bring us a vase. It didn't happen. Neither on the first day nor on the second. The only thing she did - moved them into the bidet. So that's the 1898 hotel with pluses and minuses we experienced. Hope this review will be helpful to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Be Beat, Perfect Location, Lovely Rooms, Great Service.....”
Reviews.Author: TigerLoewi
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind the hustle and bustle of Las Rambla, the fabulous street entertainers, the incredible market, the walking distance location to so many of Barcelona's oldest and finest then you'll love this place. The rooms are lovely and decent size, the entire place is spotless, almost too clean, the pool in the spa is terrific as is the roof garden pool and lounge chairs. The beds are comfortable, the water warm, the staff uniformly helpful and cheerful, the decor quality everywhere. The bathroom fixtures can be a mystery. The sink drain is magical. Push the drain down to close and low and behold, push it again to open it. Why do we have to deal with those plunger thingy's back home? We checked in very early, exhausted and in need of sleep. They sent us straight to our room, with a free upgrade, possibly because we made an attempt to speak the language. We wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: terryfu
Reviews.Content: Location is good and very convenience. Service is friendly and very supportive. Good sight on the roof top swimming pool and relax. Basement in-door swimming pool and spa is pleasure, but little bit small. Cannot complain in Europe compare to Asia country.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Jmac10
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here for 3 nights last weekend and it was one of the most relaxing, best short breaks i have had. The hotel is ideally situated on the Ramblas- perfect location. We had a standard room which was very well decorated and well equiped - apart from the lack of an iron which was a bit frustrating (and surprising for a hotel of this rating) when you arrive with clothes crushed to the max by easyjet baghandlers!! The only way to get them ironed was to pay an extortionate amount to the hotel laundry service (6 euros a piece!). I opted to hang them in the bathroom while having a hot shower and steam the creases out! The room was clean and the shower was fab. It was a nice touch to come back in an evening to a few chocolates. I believe that all the standard rooms overlook over an inner courtyard, so are quiet. I imagine that rooms overlooking the Ramblas might get some local noise. However, i wasnt aware of any noise at any time in any of the other hotel areas so that might be unfair. Unfortunately there was torrential rain for a whole day that we were there and im not sure if it was from this or a leak in the room above, but there was definately a leak... into our bathroom. the staff responded well when it was raised, but i am not sure that it was actually fixed during our stay. Likewise we couldnt get our airconditioning to work at all which meant that the room was a little warm for my husbands liking (but perfect for mine!). There was a rooftop pool, which we unfortunately didnt get a chance to sample (reason to go back though!), but looked fab and warm and there were great views from the roof. We did however sample the indoor pool, gym, sauna and steamroom. Just perfect- cant say any more. The bar was pricey as you would expect from any city centre hotel, but we opted to drink out of the hotel and explore anyway. Breakfast was fantastic- there was absolutely everything available, from cereal and toast to smoked salmon and Cava. The staff were welcoming and friendly and very helpful. I would have no hesitation to recommend this hotel to anyone and look forward to a return visit myself. Tip: Venture off the Ramblas into the side streets to wat and drink there are some really nice and reasonably priced bars and restaurants, but those on the Ramblas are overpriced and not half as good

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and sumptuous”
Reviews.Author: popjoy
Reviews.Content: Fabulous place. One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. We only had a standard internal-well room and even that was fantastic (and quiet - internal rooms recomended if you want peace). Basement pool was like something out of Hadrian's villa (in a good way!). Breakfasts appeared to be on the pricey side (about 20 euros each), but actually represented fantastic value. Everything was top notch, from the decor to the service. It's on La Rambla, which some may find a little tacky/touristy - but it's Barcelona, a lot of the city is like that. If I was ever to return to Barcelona, I would definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A dream from check-in to check-out”
Reviews.Author: Vespadirk
Reviews.Content: Had a short weekend trip to Barcelona and the Hotel 1898. It was a great hotel with great service and great breakfast. Exceptionally clean and the Spa area and massage was very nice. -Be sure to enjoy the great breakfast buffet also. -Situated in the middle of La Rambla (the main street) it is a perfect location for a short trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico !”
Reviews.Author: CLARETSMAD1882
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a great stay in a wonderful city. This hotel was better than many 5 star hotels I ve stayed at. Good location if you want the hustle and bustle of La Ramblas ( Which we did !) with a lovely spa area to relax in afterwards. Rooftop pool was fun (and warm!) and the breakfast was great. All manner of fruits, pancakes, fry ups, omelettes etc. Soft drinks, wine, Cava etc etc. Shop around for prices - Prices I was quoted ranged from £140 - £290 for the same room on different sites. One slight quirk was that there are no irons available, only a laundry service. This is quite expensive if you need a few things sorting.

Reviews.Title: “style in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: cliveva
Reviews.Content: Our room is spacious and well appointed, better than some 5* s that I have stayed in. I notice that some of the rooms are smaller than mine. But all the comforts that one requires from a hotel are here, prices are as a 5*, but thats what I was expecting. the roof terrace is lovely, with the heated swimming pool open in Feb! We are in the heart of the city, Metro near-by, ,aero-bus link just 5 mins walk away, so getting here is a breeze. everything, including Wi-Fi, work. I have no complaints about this hotel. (stayed for 4 nights) would come back again, and recommend. Recommendation - check your room and ask for a change if it is too small.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, stylish rooms and property”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix491
