Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel 1898 for several nights during a business trip to Barcelona, and was quite impressed with the design of the rooms and common areas. It's an excellent re-use of an existing office building, with very high-quality (and high-tech) furnishings. The restaurant was excellent, and the staff was very accommodating. Plus, the location -- right in the middle of Las Ramblas, the pedestrian hub of the city -- couldn't have been better. (And, if you're a coffee lover, there's a Starbucks right next door, accessible through the lobby.)

Reviews.Title: “high class, high style,great service”
Reviews.Author: MAR16N
Reviews.Content: one note though - ask for room with NO view to the street - gets nosy in the evening with music from surrounding bars.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location on Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: steve50hawaii
Reviews.Content: Lovely old hotel in the heart of Las Ramblas. Central and easy to travel to. Food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mandjatx
Reviews.Content: We stayed over a weeked while on business and found the location and staff exceptional. It's just off La Rambla and is impressive in history and design. The lobby is beautiful, and the entrance onto La Rambla is subtle which makes it nice as a tourist to get ones barings. My room was in the back of the hotel and was extremely quiet. Huge bed and nice bathroom. As a business traveler laundry service is always dicey, but 1898 had my shirt and pants back to me in half a day. Would recommend for tourist or business travel. Also recommend the Red Tour busses you can catch just up the street from the hotel. While I usually chalked these up to the unadventurous, the South Route was amazing and would be almost impossible to walk on foot. The sites on the North Route are better seen on foot (IMHO) which we did.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the area, no doubt”
Reviews.Author: imflickring
Reviews.Content: Sure, the rooms located towards La Rambla can be noisy - and sure, you might hear the underground passing by. But if you want total quietness, this is not the area in Barcelona for you anyway. Got upgraded to superior which also ment "upgraded" to La Rambla view - and slept with windows open towards La Rambla on the 4th floor, no problem. And I'm sure there are better five star hotels. But If you want to stay (exceptionally) centrally situated and pleasure some luxury, this is the best option in Barcelona. I would definately go back and will recommend it to anyone going to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at H1898”
Reviews.Author: Sh5345
Reviews.Content: This is a marvelous hotel conveniently located on Las Ramblas. The staff was very courteous, helpful and attentive. The room was immaculate and comfortable. Our room was at the front of the building which overlooks the Ramblas and we were concerned it would be bit noisy. However, this was not a problem - we were amazed at how quite it was. My only regret is that we couldn't stay here longer. I can't wait to return to H1898. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Elisabet37
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel with fantastic service. After long days spent sightseeing, we would head to the fabulous rooftop for poolside sangrias and sunsets. We thoroughly enjoyed our experience at this charming historical hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent crisis management”
Reviews.Author: NickieParis
Reviews.Content: We are used to this Barcelona hotel, which is usually close to perfection (clean, calm, good taste, friendliness and professionalism of hotel attendants, fantastic downtown location). However this time, due to leak problem in the swimming pool, we could not enjoy the equipment. The hotel, though disturbed by these services no longer to be delivered, managed the situation with extreme professionalism, while also upgrading remaining customers (among which ourselves, we could discover a fabulous colonial suite) and offering other amenities. We will definitely come back and hope these operational items will be soon resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - You won't be Dissapointed!!”
Reviews.Author: mugwuffin
Reviews.Content: My Partner and i stayed at this hotel in at the end of Jan 2011. Booked it on expedia at a good rate and i added a note advising the hotel it was for a special occasion. - When we arrived our room had been upgraded to a superior room on the top floor. – The gorgeous rooftop pool and spa were open when we stayed, but check before you go as they were refurbishing later in the year. - Location is perfect, right on Las Rambla's with easy access to anywhere in the city using the excellent transport links. Barcelona is a beautiful city, and I would highly recommend doing the hop on hop off tour bus. – Avoid eating on the Rambla’s, expensive and food better in the restaurants outside the main tourist area’s. – Would defiantly return to this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and expensive place”
Reviews.Author: hip66po
Reviews.Content: Key points of this hotel are in the title, very noisy due to maintenance work. Breakfast area and restaurant are located in underground conference room ... no windows compared to advertised "Rambla view ...". Besides health amenities were 100% out of order, so forget about the superb swimming pool, SPA and sauna advertised on the WEB. Where the hell does this number 3 position in Barcelona comes from ....?

Reviews.Title: “Style AND substance - brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: RM_Hampshire
Reviews.Content: Spent a wonderful weekend in Barcelona at this amazing hotel. Courteous multi-lingual staff who understood good service, gorgeous rooms, excellent facilities and perfect location (for leisure use). We normally shy away from such stylish hotels as they tend to be more style than substance but this place passed the test. We had a room with a balcony at the back of the hotel, which was well appointed. Be aware that being a city centre hotel it is surrounded by cafes and bars and people will be out on the streets until the small hours. The rooms are pretty well soundproofed but we were glad we took earplugs. That said, one of the best hotels we have stayed in and it surpassed our 4 star expectations. Go and stay there before it turns into a 5 star and the prices go up!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel ... BUT avoid Rooms on "La Ramblas" ...”
Reviews.Author: maridomi
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel to spend a weekend/2 nights in Barcelona,for a special family event. The selection, based on trip advisors advices, was cross-checked with some others guidebooks. Just by entering the hotel lobby, we dive in a great atmosphere; the restauration of this old "philippine tobacco headoffice" a couple of year ago is simply great : choice of the materials, mix of wood/stone/modern lightning/lounge music contribute to build an excellent first impression. Reception staffs is multilingual, nice & friendly. We ask for a room with a specific color, and we got it. The rooms are simply wonderfull : same excellent selection of materials, wooden floor, very nice bed, very modern bathroom (and modern shower system), as well as all room services you would expect from a 5 stars hotle (this one has 4 1/2 stars). We got a room with a view on "la Ramblas", on the third floor. When the windows are closed, we could not hear the crowd walking on La Ramblas BUT .. what a bad surprise to feel the vibrations of the subway, every 2 minutes; this is the same feeling as experiencing a light earthquake ... heavy & repetive vibrations coming from the gound ... really a bad experience ... that prevent me to sleep during the subway service (hopefully, the subway stops from 0100 till 0600 during the week ... but doesn't stop on Saturday ...). We asked the next morning an other room, on the quiet side of the hotel, and we got it without any difficulties, and with some excuse of the staff ("yes, this is a well known problem, we are sorry for this, some customers are not noticing it (.. I can not believe this ...)etc etc). I then commented that giving these "Ramblas" rooms to customers without notifying them in advance, and without proposing a better price, will seriously impact the reputation of this wonderfull hotel in the future. I got a 10% reduction for the night, as a kind of a compensation, but only after asking for it. This was far less than what I expected for a night without sleep ... That being said, the others services of the hotel were simply perfect : - wonderfull breakfast, worth the price - amazing spa in the ground floor (charming & modern swimming pool in a very old voulted room) - very nice atmosphere at the bar, also attracting some "real" persons from Barcelona - excellent food (served at the bar during January11, as the main restaurant was under restauration). - wonderfull terrace on the top floow, with a 30°c swimming pool (what a feeling to swim in the morning, among the 'smoke' of the pool, with the view on Barcelona waking up ...) So again, one of the best hotel I have been so far ... if you don't get the rooms on "la Ramblas". I really advice the management of the hotel to act with more transparency for these rooms, and to propose a reduced prices for it only for the customers who accept this situation. The whole staff at the reception know the issue, but do not inform the customers when they arrive ... and probably hopes that nobody will complaints. If this doesn't change, H1898's reputatiion will for sure drop in the future.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KateLondon_9
Reviews.Content: I had an absolutely wonderful time in the 1898 in Barcelona. I think it may be the best hotel I've ever stayed in. When we arrived our room was upgraded to a superior for free. The room was large and had a balcony overlooking La Rambla. The room was well kitted out with a wide range of toiletries, hot drinks, towels and robes. The service in the hotel was great - helpful advice at the reception and friendly bar staff. The rooftop pool and bar area was just amazing. I can't begin to say how much I loved it up on the rooftop. And the spa in the basement was also great. Lovely pool and sauna. We had breakfast in the room once which was delicious. I definitely want to stay here again and I will try out the full breakfast in the restaurant which looked great. The location is superb for exploring all around Barcelona and I never once felt uncomfortable or worried about pickpockets on La Rambla as I had been warned about before coming. I really loved every minute of my stay here and can't wait to return. A perfect hotel in a fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with a smile”
Reviews.Author: steamyjim
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in some great hotels around the world but I think the 1898 is now our favourite. It strikes a perfect balance between fine service and friendliness. The breakfast was one of the best ever with its selection of foods (lovely pastries) washed down with Bucks Fizz if you required. To top it all, you walk out of the front door straight onto La Rambla; cannot fault it

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: VikTorry
Reviews.Content: + Perfect location VERY good breakfast (even in comparison with italian and swedish 5 stars hotels) good service warm swimming pool on the roof free tea time from 5 p.m. to 7 p.m. - standard rooms have windows to the patio, so they are very quite, but there is no fresh air superior rooms have windows to the street, so enough air, but they are noisy (you can even hear metro at night)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in heart of Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Robincain
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff, clean and comfortable room (bit on the small side), fabulous location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with great service in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MonRu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end part of our 3 weeks trip of spain. We stayed here for 3 nights. We didnt originally intended to stay there, but it was their good service that made us chose the hotel for the last leg of our trip. The thing is, we were in London for a week before we got to Barcelona to start our Spain trip. We actually stayed at the Le Meridien right accross the street for 5 nights. However, since we were still going to go around spain for 21/2 more weeks, we decided to leave one luggage with all the heavy jackets (from our london trip) as we were planning to go back and stay at the Le Meridien again. Unfortunately, they do not allow us to do so, which is why we decided to go accross the street to 1898. They are willing to store our luggage there as we will be staying there at the end of our trip. Neddless to say we didn't regret our decision to do so. the hotel is really nice with great amenities. The room is a bit on the small side (compare to the Le Meridien accross the street), but all and all no complains. The concierge service was excellent. They were willing to google me information and gave good recommendation of restaurants to go to, clubs, etc. The dorrmen & bellhop also gave us great service and help in finding taxis, lifting bagages, etc. They have a business center that is free to be used by guests, complete with access to printers (free as well). I find this really convenient especially since I didn't carry my laptop during the trip. We also met up with few friends during our Barcelona trip, and the hotel lobby is a great meeting place. it has several clusters of sofas, so we always met up with our friends at our hotel lobby before deciding where to go next. The hotel location is really great. It's main doos is on a side street of La Rambla, but the hotel is actually in the corner of that street and La Rambla with an entry door also on La Rambla. Overall, great stay & great service.

Reviews.Title: “This is a truly great hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Damian35
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at 1898 last July 2010.....we were recommended other hotels but booked 1898 after reading the review on TP. We had an "internal" room.....it was great !!...better than many "external" rooms we have stayed in. The breakfast buffet was one of the best we have experienced in the many, many hotels we have stayed in. We highly recommend this hotel !! (PS location is perfect for a quick 4 day visit and the roof top pool and bar rocks !!)

Reviews.Title: “Top Drawer Hotel.. you'd struggle to find better ANYWHERE”
Reviews.Author: glennlobo
Reviews.Content: we travel a fair bit and like to stay in nice hotels. 1898 has to rank as the best hotel we have stayed in. the staff were very accommodating, friends and welcoming; the service was efficient friendly and non-intrusive; the spa was an oasis of tranquility in a serene space. Barcelona is a lovely city, lots to do and see and 1898 is perfectly located for easy access to anywhere in the centre. i would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. the spa is supposed to be child free so if you have kids that would reduce the appeal.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further”
Reviews.Author: Yorkie1977
Reviews.Content: What everyone has written is true. A wonderful hotel and outstanding staff. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Connecticut_Couple
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel 1898 before boarding a cruise the next day. It is in a perfect location, on a side street right off the center of La Rambla. The hotel was elegant, clean, and the rooms were well appointed. The service was excellent, from the front desk staff to the bellmen. We had a LOT of luggage, and it didn't bother them at all getting it up and down from our 2 rooms, and storing it while we toured around Barcelona. They even made sure we had a taxi/van to get us to the port. Would highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “should be a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbb-global
Reviews.Content: I agree with a previous reviewer Miss Mesopotamia - this hotel is not a 5 star but trades off its location . We stayed here over New Year and found the rooms small, staff were average in terms of helpfulness and breakfast was an expensive. The location is excellent but a few examples of annoyance were - lights automatically cut out after around 10 secs when you closed the room door leaving you looking for a card to insert - in the dark; my partner asked about finding a local hair salon and didnt receive a helpful response, a G&T at the bar downstairs was €15; there were no room irons available and washroom facilities were cramped in the main lobby area. House keeping was efficient but the hotel didnt offer the additional services such as newspapers or a concierge facility that you would expect with room rates which varied between €181 and €236 per night from 29th Dec to 1st Jan. Barcelona is also wonderful city but it also becomes tiresome fending off theives whilst visting the wonderful Gaudi attractions or marina area. Perhaps the Hotel, like the City, has become immune to hospitality requirements due to tourist volumes but travellers also have choices in deciding where to spend their cash.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel in perfect location -- another Tripadvisor hit.”
Reviews.Author: LAinNY
Reviews.Content: It's a treat to keep writing reviews that essentially begin with thanks to this website, and to those of you who write the reviews that make it such a resource. We have never had a bad experience with a TripAdvisor recommendation, and Hotel 1898 in Barcelona is another absolute winner. Really excellent contemporary re-design of an older industrial building, our room was comfortable, plenty luxurious without being ostentatious, good pillows, mattresses, amenities, shower, and so on. One of the reasons we picked H1898 was the onsite exercise facility (these are not common by the way), which is pretty good -- a couple treadmills, one stairclimber, multiple exercise bikes; no weight machines, but a set of dumbells if that's your thing, and a beautiful pool (you can see it featured on the website). There're also full spa/massage facilities, which we didn't try, but which seemed quite in demand, and very well staffed. For that matter, the entire hotel staff are really great, friendly, helpful, multilingual. We changed cash everyday, borrowed an umbrella, got directions, called cabs, etc., and were always greeted with a smile, made to feel welcome in every respect. The bar off the lobby is spacious, quiet, w excellent drinks/bartenders, tho like everything else in Barcelona just now, expensive. Likewise the upstairs restaurant, where we stuck with the excellent and copious continental breakfast instead of the, like, 40 dollar breakfast! Again, this is not a cheap city, though the hotel itself is very reasonably priced for what it delivers. It's located directly on La Rambla, Barcelona's hugely popular 'promenade,' busy at all hours, lined w tourist traps of one sort or another (skip these and visit the shops/bars/restaurants off the main drag; don't miss the big produce market two blocks south), but great fun for all that. Our room gave on to a side street, and was perfectly quiet; rooms looking out onto La Rambla itself might prove a little noisy unless you're planning on late nights yourself. But from here you're walking distance to the waterfront, the must-see Picasso Museum, the Gaudi Basilica (a long walk, but do it anyway), shopping districts, pretty much everything -- and the immediate area around the hotel itself has lots of great restaurants, bars, music, whatever, within a ten minute or so walk. Barcelona is a fantastic, fun city, and Hotel 1898 is a wonderful place from which to enjoy it. We had a great time there, and recommend it most highly.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel- perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Travelottie
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel as a surprise for my 30th birthday and I have to say that I was very impressed with his choice. I work in travel, so am picky about hotels and I have to say I really enjoyed my stay. Hotel design was stunning and the location was perfect. Rooms were nice and the different light settings were a nice touch. Yes, there was a bit of noise from the street outside, but I expected that due to location. There is no noise from anything within the hotel. Staff were really helpful and did what they could when we were stranded in Barcelona due to Heathrow being closed. My favourite bit was the rooftop pool and the indoor pool with jets. It was so nice to relax and get away from all the chaos on the Ramblas. All in all fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Lives up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: Doogsta007
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic Hotel, certainly lives up to its reputation. I tayed here on te 17th Dec for 2 nights and upgraded my room, which I pre booked directly with the hotel to a deluxe. I was allocated rm 636 whch overlooked the Gothic Qaurter. The room was extremely spacious with a living area comprising of a two seater setee, chair an large flat screen tv. The room decor is exactly as you see it on the website. The attention to detail and all the mod cons you would want are in there, touch control lightning and audio for tv and radio, air conditioning, seafety depoist box. There is an excellent welcome pack and ample t and coffee making facilities. The bathroom was extremly large and very well equipped with soaps, shampoos, vanity kits, etc etc. New slippers are placed in your room each time you leave along with soft dressing gowns. The receptionist and concierge provided a first class, welcoming and friendly service and were extremely helpfull. The location of the hotel could not have been better with Catalanya metro just a two min walk away. We took the aerobus to the hotel from Barcelona airport, journey time of around 20 mins. 8 euro return. Fantastic service. I could go on on on about this fantastic hotel but to some it up in a few words i would say attention to detail is exemplery, extremely clean with all your needs met. Please use the spa and rooftop pool as these are just brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Liora293983
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the 1898 hotel for five days and were most satisfied with everything: the staff was always helpful, there was no problem with early arrival, the location of the hotel is just fantastic and we liked very much the decoration and the aesthetics everywhere in the hotel. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Oasis in Busy Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: DK1960
Reviews.Content: We ended an eleven day European trip with three days in Barcelona this past August. Our children are ages 15-21. The hotel was wonderful. The rooms were clean and quiet and reasonably priced for the location and quality. The rooftop pool was a great retreat after touring the city each day. We would highly recommend both the hotel and La Isabela which is the bar-restaurant located on the terrace by the pool overlooking the city. Great food and drink and a friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Bmorechick
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight at Hotel 1898 prior to embarking on a cruise. The location, pools and spa is what initially attracted me to this hotel. The location is EXCELLENT. You walk out of the hotel and are steps away from the hustle and bustle of La Rambla. There are many stores/restaurants within walking distance. The lobby is very elegant and the lobby bar was great. We went down for tea time and the selection of tea was fabulous. The staff was great and everyone that I encountered spoke English. I thought the rooms were very large for European standards. I've stayed in many hotels in America that were half its size so I was impressed. We weren't in the room/hotel too much because there is so much to do and say and we had such little time. Unfortunately, we did not experience the indoor pool/spa. The outdoor pool was quite warm and very pleasant although it was chilly outside. I wish we had more time to enjoy the hotel but I would definitely stay there again if I ever visit Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: DeliciousMarbella
Reviews.Content: Chose 1898 as was well supported by Trip Advisor reviewers. The hotel is in a perfect location to see all the sights of Barcelona,we managed to walk everywhere...including Parc Guell ,(which was quite a feat ) and the Sagrada Familia. Everything else is really close by.The hotel is located on La Rambla...and although this is a busy street there is no noise whatsoever. Hotel facilities are first class ....particularly enjoyed the lovely warm pool at the spa and the views from the roof terrace . No complaints and excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “You will not hesitate staying at the 1898.”
Reviews.Author: RM-UK
Reviews.Content: Classy, special, clean, great location - really nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Awosome hotel, with mediocre service. It could have became no 1, though.”
Reviews.Author: NGHC
Reviews.Content: So far, for us, the TripAdvisor is the best tool to know and to get the best hotel in any place in this world and it has never been wrong so far. If the hotel is catagorized as 'big 10' in the city, it must be worth staying, depending on our taste preference and budget. This hotel is ranked number 4 and the rank tells itself. I went to Fatima via Lisbon and Barcelona with my wife with an intention of pilgrimage. Because of this, we planned to stay the first 2 nights and then the last 2 nights at Barcelona. Originally, we chose another hotel, but due to the extraordinary experienced we felt, we booked this hotel again to stay for the last two night before going back home. When I chose this hotel, I was utterly confused because the number 1 hotel in the area is at the same location, but cheaper. However, I gave H 1898 a try due to the comment of "luxury" and location. The hotel has a good rate for Euro 235 a night, not including the breakfast though. We requested the double superior room facing La Rambla, with an upper floor and a balcony. They gave us exactly the room that we requested. It was a beautiful room, touched with Colonial style and adorned with luxurious wood and double-paned windows. Sophisticated as well as well-equipped plasma screen TV was attached to the cherry red wall. A beautiful radio proudly stands on the desk of our room. Not to forget the free WiFi provided and an enourmous private bathroom featuring elegant marble countertops, shower and a bathtub, and a selection of high quality personal care products. We also got a small balcony that enables us to observe the exciting activity happening in Barcelona's gothic streets. The selection of pillows also guarantee a better sleep, since we can customize our pillow by making a selection from our Pillow Menu. The hotel also has an impressively scented lobby, remarkable decor, luxurious finishing touches and unusual quality. Making this hotel the place for those who appreciate luxury and colonial style. It has an astounding warm water pool and a modern top roof pool. If you can enjoy it while you are here, this will truly amaze you. It is such a pity that we didn't have time to try the pools. The breakfast was beyond outstanding. The collection of fruits, bread, hot food, salad, juice, and buffet gourmet such as lacon, fole, jamon iberico, salmon is served on exquisite platters. The selection of Saint James tea was excepted with open hands by us, a tea lover. The breakfast room in this hotel is located in the first floor of the hotel. The restaurant is one of the places where the beauty of La Rambla Street is perfectly shown. However, after this stay, we now do understand why this hotel, such a magnificent modern hotel, well equipped, safe with a convenient location at La Rambla, is only placed no 4 instead of no 1. It is a hotel everyone would try for, sadly, it is run by people with "no passion", so to speak. Sometimes you can feel that Thai and Bali people are so passionate, until the hotel facilities itself becomes number 2 since the people working in it effects too. But certainly not this hotel. The receptionist was stiff and responded with a very standard manner. Here are some examples; when you requested the specific room by email they will respond with unappropriate manner, when you arrived back to the hotel, there wasn't any greeting " buenes noches", when you were checked back for the second stay within 3 nights interval, there wasn't greeting, even a simple "welcome back" or "welcome home" would be nice. It is a remarkable waste for such a comfortable and nice hotel to go to waste. Despite the service, everything was flawless. I still recommend you to stay in this wonderful and superb hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandman621
Reviews.Content: This is truly a great hotel. Tastefully re-created and decorated property right in La Rambla. The staff is courteous, very helpful and multi-lingual. A good sense of excitement in the public areas without seeming overwhelmed. Do not miss the roof top lounge and pool area - spent a marvelous afternoon sipping local cava and nibbling tapas by the pool looking out over this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: Derrickdixon
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed here on three seperate occasions and truly think that this is one of the best hotels i have ever stayed at. Every detail from the decor to the staff is perfect, and im always sad when its time to leave. I would not entertain staying at any other hotel in Barcelona! Great city, great hotel! I would recommend it to anyone and cannot wait til my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a few Days in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Denmark46
Reviews.Content: Just back from four wonderful days in vibrant Barcelona with a quiet and comfortable base in H1898. Large rooms with no street noise, an excellent bed and a well appointed bathroom, what more can one desire. The restaurant serves a wonderful (and expensive) buffet breakfast, but dinner a la carte is equally good and much more resonably priced with the best tapas we ever had anywhere in Spain. The service provided by everybody is smiling, attentive and very competent. Let me warn you of the price level in the lobby bar and the rooftop bar, but then again who needs them in a city so full of cheap and good bars.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for better location, typical european room size”
Reviews.Author: housmony
Reviews.Content: I went to Barcelona to board a cruise ship, I stayed at 1898 the day before the cruise left. I was happy with the hotel. 1. Great Location20 feet from Las Ramblas 2. Cool shiek look 3. great rooftop bar 4. typical small european room but comfortable and clean. I returned after the cruise and stayed 4 extra days. One of those days was at the W and I stayed in the penthouse. It was amazing but cost $3000 per night. I think the 1898 provides a luxery traveler with satisfaction for the highest expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Touch of class”
Reviews.Author: Wicks
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in November 2010. This hotel is situated halfway along Las Ramblas and is a genuinely lovely haven and I would thoroughly recommend the hotel for those considering a break in this beautiful city. Once inside the revolving door from the bustling street outside there is an immediate sense of relaxation. The staff were very accommodating and professional. The room was very modern and luxurious. Particularly enjoyed the 5 settings of lighting and the modern and well equipped bathroom. The rooftop terrace provides an excellent view of the city with a bar and swimming pool. The spa downstairs in the basement is excellent and well worth a visit to unwind after many an hour pounding the streets. The breakfast is excellent with a vast array of meats, cheeses, fruits, breads even iced cava which sets the day up nicely. For those that have never been to Barcelona before this really is a brilliantly located grand hotel equidistant between all the attractions of the city - close to the metro, place de la catalunya (for the open top bus, bars and restaurants) gothic quarter, beach, Gaudi attractions and Port Vell. My review would not be complete without mentioning the well documented problems regarding pickpockets in the area immediately surrounding the hotel. Namely Las Ramblas. Does it really happen or is the problem symptomatic of any big city? I have experience of visiting many big cities with supposed problems and I will say that Las Ramblas is up there. We witnessed so many pickpocketing events and my strong recommendation is to empty the contents of your wallets, purses and handbags in the hotel safe (all hotel 1898 rooms have them) and just take a minimal amount of cash and one credit card. Men -keep your hand on your wallet at all times, and women keep your handbag round your front with your hand on the opening at all times. Be particularly wary on Las Ramblas when watching the human statues and stopping at the gift shops. Also do not let down your guard when you are in a restaurant, keep your belongings with you at all times. My wife had her handbag lifted from La Fonda restaurant. These people do not look like pickpockets and they are VERY QUICK.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Naper2
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel after our cruise. We were able to check in at 9:00 am which was wonderful. The desk staff were very helpful and they spoke english. Our room was very comfortable and very modern. The spa area was beautiful. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, private and overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: McGunn
Reviews.Content: It is a wonderful hotel with great front desk service. The suite with the private balcony was romantic but the service in the dining room leaves a lot to be desired. There is very little english spoken, so if you are not fluent in spanish....good luck. The food is great but slow! A martini with olives was 20 minutes. They don't understand the olives go in the martini. I just think that for $500.00 dollars a night, an olive should be easier to get.LOL, they grow them there. The rooftop pool is wonderful but offers only snacks. Patience is the key, service takes a long, long time. No, I would not return. Friends of ours got their wallet stolen right in front of the hotel. Pickpockets are rampant and the police turn a blind eye. Go to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “vehicle security is everything”
Reviews.Author: simon1955
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in July breaking up a car journey across European countries . With the security issues that Barcelona has secure carparking is essential,and the best is on the premise . The Hotel has underground carparking for a few cars and needs booking in advance . On arrival go to reception first to ask for assistance to park ,(there is a passenger lift from Basement to reception for baggage ), however the entrance to the CP is through a Piazza where tables and chairs are set out ! This needs dedicated reception staff to clear the way and for you to gain entry. The ramp access for longer cars is not for the faint hearted either ,it is STEEP with a 90 degree bend halfway down ! On the way thru the City centre whilst stopped at lights ,and with the hood down we found some guy trying to pinch bags from the back seat ! BE WARNED . We felt a little vunerable on the streets and kept our excursions to a minimum (we are fearless 50- somethings ,and seasoned travelers ) just as well therefore that the roof garden/bar/pool/sundeck was a super safe haven .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JazzMomCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We selected Hotel 1898 because of its good reviews on Trip Advisor. We were delighted with the decision; the place is a gem. It is small, clean, comfortable, and beautifully decorated. Although I was concerned with its location right on busy La Rambla, the place is remarkably quiet -- about all you could hear at night was the occasional low rumble of the Metro train below the building. The room we had was a bit small by American standards, but we opted for economy over opulence. (The dollar is very weak against the Euro these days.) One of the best things going for Hotel 1898 is its staff, most of whom are young, nice, helpful, and multi-lingual. The rooftop lounge is fabulous, with views to die for. All-in-all, Hotel 1898 is an oasis of calm in the midst of the bustling city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: annaMunster
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home having spent a glorious three days in the Hotel 1898 in Barcelona. The location is terrific, just off Las Ramblas. However, we couldn't hear a thing from the street. The only noise was the rumble of the metro, which did not bother us. We were in room 347, which was gorgeous. Every detail in the hotel is attended to. It's spotlessly clean, quiet, the staff are very pleasant and obliging. We only had breakfast in the hotel. It was substantial and varied. For me, the hotel's best feature is the super rooftop terrace, which has a lovely pool and terrific lounging area and bar. I would return to Hotel 1898 in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona is beautiful and a wonderful city.”
Reviews.Author: danishk58
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1898 is centrally located within walking distance to restaurants, shopping and entertainment, as well as the bus system. The hotel staff was excellent, the room beautiful, the pool and rooftop bar fantastic. What a wonderful stay, we plan on returning as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: michael_d_brown
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Barcelona in many years. I wanted some where good to stay for our 2 day break. I read the reviews thought that Hotel 1898 was the place for us. It was - fantastic location, friendly staff and a spotlessly clean room. parking was easy - an underground car park just 200 yards away. 48 hours secure parking for just 50 euro - where could you do that in central London! Our room was located on the end of the building. On our first night there was a fair bit of noise from a group of people outside, but I suspect the Hotel moved them along as they went quiet very quickly! Other than that great facilities and a lovely place to stay. Our next trip is already under consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it for so many reasons”
Reviews.Author: dkrubes
Reviews.Content: Location is terrific. While right on la Rambla, it's quite enough. The pool and spa is terrific. The folks are helpful. There is no concierge so do your own restaurant research, but they are happy to book. Hike up to the castle fork great views It's an easy walk to the Gothic area, el borne should not be missed, dinner at con Gracia and Gelonch are a must. Walking and eating at the market are steps away,it's a must. Be careful on La Rambla. Don't eat anywhere on or near it. It's all crap n Take the Brightside Sidecar tour with Jaoa if you can. Walk to the Marina. Be sure to sit for lunch before 3PM or your screwed. Any decent place will close. Go to the Champagneria for fun and crazy times. Be sure to see all of Guidis works. The houses of disagreement. Park Guel. Shopping is great for Americans at Zara and Massimo Dutti, terrific quality, remarkably cheap. Get a VAT receipt when you shop. Unless youmaskmthey won't give it. At the airport find the VAT exchange. You'll get back over 10 percent in cash. Would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best ever in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: nicurn1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at H1898 in October - what a great hotel! It is right on Las Ramblas, in the middle of where you want to be. The hotel itself is beautiful, modern, and luxurious. We were on the third floor and the room was nice size for European standards. Bathroom was excellent, nice marble counter, great rain shower heads. We had a demi-balcony overlooking Las Ramblas. Noise was not an issue for us. The bed was ok, not the best, but not the worst. There is always someone cleaning something. The hotel by far was the cleanest we have stayed in across Europe. I am a bit of a neat freak so that was a huge plus for me. The staff was very helpful and always courteous. The rooftop pool was such a nice place to just relax, order a drink, lounge on one of the cabanas. It was a perfect get away in the middle of a bustling city. Prices were a bit steep on the roof but so worth it. The spa and underground pool/saunas were a nice treat. The hotel really is a great resort to just relax in. Even the hotel lobby and bar were comfortable. My only complaint was that during "siesta time" I was always woken up by the housekeeping staff vacuuming the hallway carpets. But it didn't bother me too much because I like things clean. And if I had another thing to comment on, not a big deal, the hair dryer was very heavy and you have to continuously hold the button down. But it was all worth it to stay in such a nice hotel. We will definitely stay here when we return. The location is great too. Easy walk to anywhere you want to go. We only used the metro to go to the Sagrada Familia.

Reviews.Title: “An Elegant Oasis”
Reviews.Author: CANADIANTEXPLORERS
Reviews.Content: We had less than 24 hours in Barcelona. The hotel booking was a bit of a splurge but it was the end of a 2 week trip in Spain and we wanted our last day/night to be very special. And it was at Hotel 1898. Our room was quiet, luxurious, well appointed, spacious and an oasis to return to after a whirlwind tour of the city. Reception gave us a warm welcome on arrival and attentively helped us plan our walking tour of the city. We ate in the main dining room , H1898, overlooking La Rambla and had a marvelous and memorable meal. Again with excellent service. The roof top terrace and bar was a great spot for a late night drink and toast to an amazing city. Although we didn't have time to try out the pools, they looked most inviting. We will definitely be back. This is an elegant, first class hotel and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A sheer delight”
Reviews.Author: lwilson1313
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews on TripAdvisor and decided to book for five days. We travel a lot and while not particularly demanding, we know what makes for a great hotel. 1898 fits the bill. The staff, the rooms the public areas and the location were top notch. Wonderful attention to detail too. The Boqueria market is two blocks away, the Gothic Quarter across Las Ramblas where the hotel is located. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “A magnificent boutique hotel right in the bustle of Las Ramblas...”
Reviews.Author: devm635csi
Reviews.Content: What can I say - we love this hotel. This was our second trip to Barcelona and second stay at 1898. The location is excellent - right off the energy of Las Ramblas but the minute you step inside the hotel it's a quiet sanctuary. 2 min walk to the subway, 5 min to El Cortes Ingles dept store, easy access to the Barri Gotic and easy to shoot down to the port. Two blocks from the Boqueria as well. And a Carrefour grocery store 2 blocks up the street. Rooms are somewhat small (we've booked Superior both times) for the money but we find the decor perfect and very soothing/comfortable. The 'scenes' lighting system with the need to insert a card key to keep the lights on (energy saving feature) is cool the first time and then annoying the rest of the stay. Some rooms have larger floor-to-ceiling windows that open out to street views (cheaper rooms have courtyard views) - some rooms look right over Las Ramblas but the noise might be an issue at night. We didn't eat at the restaurant for dinner this time but ate dinner twice our last trip and it was pricey but solid fare and excellent service. We had the breakfast buffet included in our rate this time and it is quite a spread served in the restaurant. With the open market down the street a cheap terrific breakfast isn't far but if tablecloths and a substantial buffet is what you're looking for, consider the hotel. The spa is unique with its dark 'Turkish Bath' style pool - dramatic mood lighting and arched tiled ceilings make for an interesting swim you won't find at a Marriott or Hilton. Steam spa, dry sauna, showers and a fitness room with treadmills and TVs are also available. Never tried the spa but the menu seems extensive. Service is unobtrusive and the front desk is attentive. Housekeeping is efficient and ever-present with daily service and turn-down at night. The hotel itself is well decorated and the public spaces invite lounging with comfy sofas. Don't miss the silent movies constantly playing off the side of the reception - or the massive bar for a glass of wine. No complaints here - we can't wait for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnLee63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel 1898 for three days before we departed for a cruise. This hotel was perfect for us. Its location on the La Rambla allowed us to walk to all the places we wanted to see. The hotel is clean, modern, comfortable and has a friendly and helpful staff. The staff was always ready to help out when we were the bewildered tourists. We will definitely go back if we ever go to Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Just "okay"”
Reviews.Author: Carolin L
Reviews.Content: Although there are aspects of this hotel that are lovely, it falls short in so many areas.I spent an hour checking in (they could not find the booking, done through an on-line booking company). We paid for the upgraded 'superior' room, which was to provide views of Las Ramblas. Not only was our window small and elevated, the only view that was provided was of the 28 windows of the hotel directly across the street off of Las Ramblas - providing NO privacy whatsoever. When I asked for a better room, offering to pay for another 'upgrade', I was told that the hotel was full - despite a couple who walked in off of the steet and were given a room as I stood at the desk (Did they get the last room in the house???).We did have the benefit, however, of the noise from Las Ramblas, late into the night - every night and early in the morning. Our sleep was further disrupted by the cleaning staff who began there task at 0800, banging and crashing in the hallways, dragging chairs on the hardwood floors etc. Robes were provided, along with cheap and very small slippers (which did not fit my husband's size 10 feet), and 2 of the smallest bars of soap I have ever seen. After one use, and the soap was merely a sliver. There were water / soap splashes behind the bidet on the tiled walls from a previous occupant who had washed their private's. These remained during the entire 4 night stay. The egyptian cotton sheets appeared to be part of the 'historical' aspect of the hotel, in that they had numerous small bleach / moth holes. The downstairs hydro-therapy pool was a welcome addition, however, the steam room was not functioning along one of the large jets in the pool. The roof-top patio was also lovely. Considering the cost of alcohol through-out Spain, it was a bit of a GOUGE to charge guests 7 Euros for 1 glass of wine on a patio where signs prohibit the consumption of food / beverages NOT purchased there. The same glass of wine could be purchased anywhere on the touristy Las Ramblas for 3 - 4 Euros. On our last day, we left the room at 1030 to go shopping and have brunch. As I write this review, it now almost 1400, we have returned to a dirty room, with no sign of housekeeping. Value? For 250 Euros per night, I don't think so. The room is small, with only a bed and one comfortable chair jammed in the corner, making room service a challenge. In a city which should be known as a 'den of thieves' due to the high incidence of pick-pocketting and other crimes focussed on tourists, none of the above is hardly surprising.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: stinkykitty
Reviews.Content: If you want comfort, security and convenience, choose Hotel 1898. Although the room was on the small size, it was clean and modern and extremely well appointed. Bed was extremely comfortable. Front desk was polite and extremely accommodating. We ended up with an interior room which was quiet during the nightlife hustle and bustle outside on Las Ramblas. Tapas at the rooftop lounge was decadent while lounging on a day bed watching the skyline come alive.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: denise4480
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my cousin for 4 Nights and cannot fault the Hotel, fantastic location for La Ramblas, Metro and buses, outstanding rooftop terrace, pool and bar serving tapas, snacks and meals in the day and night with beautiful comfy seating and shade if required with a panaromic view of Barcelona. Lobby and Bar area downstairs so spacious again with comfy seating, Excellent spa and inside pool which was so relaxing after the hectic days site seeing, the staff were superb and very friendly and helpful, would not hesistate staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel and location.”
Reviews.Author: nareshojha
Reviews.Content: Up Side---Excellent hotel, location is absolutely great, right in the middle of La rambla, I think the best a traveller can look forward to , everything is close by. Rooms are spacious, clean and upkeep is excellent. Spa is real nice, after a days travel u can really unwind. Down side--- slightly overpriced. Some of the staff were reluctunt towards asians. ( I think management should do a training to educate them that all asian does not fall in the same category.)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Fabulous location, can't wait to return!!”
Reviews.Author: LiveToTravel040
Reviews.Content: My husband and i had a 2 night stay in this hotel in Aug10, after hours of looking at hotels on the internet we chose hotel 1898 as it had great reviews and we were not disapointed. We had a superior room on the 6th floor it was Beautifully decorated room with a lovely clean bathroom with expensive granite finishes. Being on the 6th floor was great because this hotel is bang on the la rambla so we was not bothered by any noise at all. there was a lovely pool on the roof with sun beds but unfortunatly i didn't go in the pool as although it was the height of summer the pool was freezing and i hardly saw anyone in there even though the pool area was packed out. This was our second trip to Barcelona so we didn't do all the tourist things again such as the hop on/off bus tour but i would recommend it if you havn't been to Barcelona before, it's a great wayto see the city over a couple of days. There are so many fantastic places to eat breakfast, lunch and dinner in this city and we didn't have one bad meal anywhere. The tapas is to die for!! if you like walking then this is the place for you, from this hotel you can walk to the beach, Olympic port and there are some great places to shop but no real bargings to be had with the Euro being so poor at the moment. the only down side to Barcelona is the CRIME it's absolutly rife in this city, although we were not efected this time we were on edge as on our last visit here my husband had his mobile phone stolen and my sister last month had her purse stolen from her bag without even knowing it!! they are good!! it's such a shame as it really lets this amazing city down. Just be very aware of you valuables at all times and watch what you have in your pockets.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: SunburyTraveller
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. The staff were really great. We stayed three nights in a Privilege room May 2010. The hotel was clean, and very peaceful given the location right in the middle of the action. The location is an excellent base for exploring the city and being right on La Rambla there were plenty of options for restaurants but also a supermarket and the fresh food market right near by. The rooftop pool is a great treat. Hotel 1898 - Le encantó!!! (we loved it!) We have booked three nights again for August 2011!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: CTRavel1204
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a very nice room with our own terrace. Due to the fact that the pool area on the top floor is second to none you actually don't need the terrace - so save the money!

Reviews.Title: “World class”
Reviews.Author: Robertmfreeman
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Location is perfect. Service is world class. The whole hotel is excellent - the design used throughout is modern but very tasteful. Prices are reasonable for the quality. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bwanthar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 1898 from August 29th-Sept 4th. I was given an interior room which was just fine (no view from the bedroom window but I wasn't spending any time in the room except to sleep.) The hotel is beautiful and the 7th Floor terrace, pool and bar are some of the highlights of this place. After exploring the sights all day, it was great to come back and lounge by the pool from about 4-6 pm. As others have noted, it's not a huge pool and often times the chairs would be occupied but I'd just grab a towel and sit on the edge of the pool with my book (or chat with other guests.) And in the evenings, after going out for dinner and more exploring, I'd come back to the hotel and head up to lounge to one of the comfy couches or beds for a glass of cava! I'd hang out and read or write and just enjoy the lights over Barcelona. It felt decadent. Another great feature of the hotel is the spa in the basement of this hotel. Make sure you take advantage of the pool, steamroom and sauna down there. It's all included in the hotel price and it's a luxurious treat. And last but not least, was the great breakfast!! (Make sure when you book your room that you get the breakfast included.) Of all the hotels I stayed at while traveling, this was my favorite breakfast. They had everything: a huge variety of sweet and savory pastries, eggs, bacon, sausages, sliced meats, smoked salmon, cheeses, all kinds of breads, cereal, fruit, yogurt, a variety of juices, champagne, wine... everything! And if that wasn't enough, they would make you omelets or eggs from the kitchen. (I think I read that other reviewers thought the food was cold but understandable given it's a buffet and as noted above, the servers could bring you something hot from the kitchen in addition to your own pot of coffee for the table.) My favorites were the tiny quiches and the cream puffs drizzled with chocolate. So tasty!! I will definitely stay at the Hotel 1898 again. And I hope it's soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Haven in the midlle of Rambla's fever”
Reviews.Author: RachelIsrael
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel from the moment I entered it. The lobby is beutifully decorated. Though I arrived early before noon my room was ready. The rooms are not very big but are spavious enough. Sparkling clean bathroom that seems recently renovated. The free internet is also a benefit. Breakfast superb and the food in the hotel is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable !”
Reviews.Author: JP5380_Nam
Reviews.Content: Absolutely first-rate. Excellent in every aspect. First of all, this is a truly remarkable place: the building that used to house a tobacco company has been restored to grace and is an architectural jewel. Interior design is impressive and very tasteful: wood everywhere, warm tones, and delicate deco. Service is excellent. The staff are very helpful. We were there on a B&B basis. Breakfast was perfect, with all the classics plus smoked salmon, Spanish ham, duck liver, cava, Nespresso, you name it. One major attraction here is the roof terrace: like a large yacht deck with astounding bed-like sofas and meridiennes, it offers a 360° panorama of Barcelona. True Luxury. At the other end of the building, the basement houses a swimming pool with a waterfall and immersed massage couches. Negative points? Our room gave out on the narrow inner patio, with other rooms not too far on the opposite side. Granted, the other solution in the center of Barcelona would be a - noisier - view of the Rambla. Anything else? I am trying hard. Yeah, the outside pool is chilly. That’s about it :-)

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Carbib
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay in this hotel. Stayed in a superior room where everything had been thought of in creating a comfortable room with all the addtional touches you expect in a 4 star establishment. The location could not be better and the roof top terrace makes this hotel stand out from others in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Would clearly stay here again and recommend it to friends”
Reviews.Author: cider24
Reviews.Content: The quality and cleanliness of the hotel was excellent in every respect. The staff were courteous and helpful. We especially enjoyed the spa and swimming pool plus the rooftop terrace both during the day time and at night. The location was perfect for us to explore Barcelona and to sample the great foods and wines of the city. The hotel gave you that feel good factor when you walked through the doors.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: XLBNX
Reviews.Content: A week of work made me book this hotel. Friendly helpful staff. The pool made my week.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: mrcool76
Reviews.Content: This is a fantasic hotel, right on La Rambla, Its Elegant, Charming and Quality, Staff are great and very attentive. Rooms are very well decorated, the bathrooms are spacious and clean. The Hotel also has a very nice pool and bar area on the rooftop which looks out toward the central areas of the city. Highly Recommened.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels i have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: lover2travel78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I LOVED this hotel. We stayed here after staying at Hotel Montecarlo for 3 days, which we liked as well. This hotel is gorgeous from the outside, has a beautifully decorated large lobby. there is a spa like scent that welcomes you every time you set foot into the hotel. i couldn't stop taking pictures of the interior! service was good. the rooms were well decorated. we took advantage of getting the personalized pillows they offer you. the roof top lounge/bar was beautiful and trendy. the spa was amazing, my husband loved the pool and the gym. there is a starbucks and a great chinese restaurant adjacent to the hotel (in case you need a break from tapas) . we took advantage of their beautiful library, they have 4 computers with free internet, 1 with a printer. they also have complimentary tea time from 5-7pm, with 2 types of tea and sweets. this hotel was definitely a memorable experience for us during our trip and would come back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Just awesome”
Reviews.Author: vickizig
Reviews.Content: Totally loved our stay here. Location is incomparable....right on the Ramblas (we did not hear a sound from the street in our room)....walking distance into the Barri Gotic and the Born area. Rooms are fantastic. The rooftop pool and bar is a wonderful place to decompress after a day of sightseeing. Loved Barcelona, and would stay at the 1898 again in a heartbeat. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Génial”
Reviews.Author: Eli10troyes
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, excellente locatiion sur la Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, if you want to be on Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: juliefromSF
Reviews.Content: This is a great-looking and very comfortable hotel. We had a good-sized room, very clean, and the decor was very stylish. The rooftop pool and bar are great, and there's a decent hotel gym. We loved the location, too.

Reviews.Title: “Missing Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: flippywebsurfer
Reviews.Content: I would have titled this review "Missing Hotel 1898" but I wanted to keep it a well kept secret! The hotel is in the center of it all, easily accessible to your main thoroughfares. Nothing quite going back to the hotel with 2 pools waiting for you to relax your tired body from exploring Barcelona, I prefer the underground pool as it has a spa quality to it. Drinks over sunset at the rooftop and you're ready to explore the city's nightlife. We have friends in Barcelona and were forewarned of pickpockets in Las Ramblas, I'd say just use common sense as a tourist. Overall, never felt threatened in any way, I suppose being a New Yorker helps. Really great vibe, and our stay at the hotel added to a great first time visit to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Bexandvern
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for everything. Beautiful hotel with attentive staff. Very clean and excellently maintained. Worth every penny for the stay and the rooftop breakfast a must!

Reviews.Title: “lovely barcelona”
Reviews.Author: fairmax
Reviews.Content: what a great hotel in a great location with great service. my only advice is to make sure your room is toward Las Ramblas - the back rooms are over a large and loud bar

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Hildegunn95
Reviews.Content: 4 adults from Bergen, Norway visited Barcelona from Sept 3 - 6. We were all very pleased with this hotel, and will for sure recommend it to our familily, friends and colleagues :-) Great location, nice staff - we ate breakfast here every morning. Roof terrace was also great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Texasstarr
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply wonderful! Beautiful lobby, rooms and terrace top swimming pool with bar. You could look out and see all of Barcelona. The hotel was right in the middle of La Ramba with plenty of action. Hotel staff was very, very nice. I experienced a lot of rude people in Europe and this was our last stop. They really made up for it and I went home happy and content.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leonalovesluxury
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect hotel in almost every way. The rooftop pool is a lovely place to relax and cool off. When the hotel is busy it can be difficult to find a lounger. The drinks are expensive but no more so than any other hotel of this quality. Our room faced a small courtyard, not onto the busy road so was very quiet. The spa is lovely and free to use, on the first visit I took my bathing costume with me and expected to change in the spa. There is one changing room but only one, and no hair dryer. It seems easier to come down in ones bathrobe and return to ones room to get dressed etc. This is what most people did. We had breakfast included and on one day we paid extra to have it on the terrace. This was the most magnificent breakfast I have ever had, but you will need to be very hungry indeed. The other days we had breakfast in the main dining room, this too was lovely but we had been spoilt by the terrace. I would return to this hotel in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “chic hotel on la ramblas”
Reviews.Author: sheringtons
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1898 was everything we thought it would be and more...Excellent room ,service and locality. Just having a two day break it was central for every sight seeing trip...We used the hotel for breakfast and evening meal which we thoroughly enjoyed. After a long day cramming in all the sightsit was bliss to eat in the hotel and then go onto the roof terrace for a night cap...

Reviews.Title: “Meets all expectations...and more!”
Reviews.Author: lovemypup
Reviews.Content: I had booked a room at the Le Meridien since I am a Starwood Gold member. However, the reviews on this website scared me away, and led me to Hotel 1898. As usual, tripadvisor members steered me well! And, after walking into the lobby of the neighboring Le Meridien, I am SO GLAD I stayed at 1898. The people who work at the front desk could not be nicer or more eager to assist with any and all requests...they speak perfect English, and the lobby (an anomaly in today's travel) is actually comfortable and useful as a place to sit if you are just looking for a place to relax and wind down after a busy day. The rooms are comfortable--the furniture is nice, the colors soothing, and the beds comfortable. The free internet is much appreciated, and the amenities go beyond the usual and are very nice (we LOVE the embossed slippers). The showers are great--always hot water with good pressure...this, too, was much appreciated! The rooftop pool is wonderful, with great views, and the basement pool is even nicer--soothing, and dark, and quiet. Very romantic. The workout area is minimal, but they try, which is appreciated. I agree with everyone's comments about the hotel's restaurant--it's the only drawback to an otherwise wonderful hotel. The people who work there are indifferent and a little rude, (the place was completely empty at 8:30 on a Tuesday night...which pretty much tells you everything you need to know about it), and the prices are ridiculous for a very average meal. Also, since they are right above the subway, the floor and tables in the front of the restaurant actually shake every 7-8 minutes as the trains go by. If they could get a decent restaurant into this hotel, with prices to match, they would have a goldmine. The location of this hotel is the best we could have imagined...literally only a few steps from Las Ramblas. Great restaurants and shopping are all within walking distance, and the front desk will sell you a discounted coupon booklet for the hop on-hop off bus tour. It's a great way to see the city, and to save a couple of Euro. There are literally dozens of restaurants in walking distance---if you go out to Las Ramblas and walk to the right, there is a great market selling fresh fish (including lobsters and crabs that are still alive), fruit, snacks, and drinks. They also have a couple of stands selling sangria that are fun. If you go out to Las Ramblas and walk to the left, there is a pizza place that is good, and a little middle eastern place called Pita Inn that sells gyros--delicious food for less than 10 euro. (In Pita Inn, sit upstairs---it's about 20 degree cooler up there!) The shopping in the middle of the street is "ok," but there is a grocery store (also to the left once you hit the main street) that sells wine, chocolates, souvenirs, etc. It's usually crowded, but they have a lot of registers open, and most people are only buying a couple of things so they move quickly. It's a great place to buy some fruit, pastries, etc for the mornings. All in all...Hotel 1898 hit the spot...and I will gladly return upon my first opportunity to do so!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended go to Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Alan_Peck
Reviews.Content: The most impressive part of this hotel is the rooftop expericence, easy listening music under the shade of rooftop umbrellas and soft inviting seating and couches. Worth paying that little extra. The food was good althogh a little on the high price as were the drinks. The reception were also very helpful and knowlegeable. The rroms are very clean and finished to a high standard. The negatives were so small and hardly woth mentioning. Howver, the front rooms on the Ramblas side are noisy and you will experience a small rumble no and again from the underground tubes. Nothing too problematical. Recommendations... hire a bike for the day and go to Cerveceria Catalana for Tapas best i have ever had and go late afternoon to miss the waiting times. Stay here and enjoy. Regards

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, unbeatable comfort and best Barcelona location”
Reviews.Author: AineKav
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in August. We booked directly with the hotel's website which seemed to offer the best rate. We couldnt say enough about the quality of this hotel. The location is perfect for exploring Barcelona at leisure. The standard rooms are good sized, air conditioned and very comfortable. In the heat of August, the two pools were a welcome refreshment! I don't know how this hotel is not a 5*. Staff were more helpful than we could have expected. The hotel was the highlight of our trip which says a lot since Barcelona is such an amazing city wherever you stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful.....”
Reviews.Author: holidaygirlKentUK
Reviews.Content: Fantastic city break! The hotel is really clean, modern with a twist and in an excellent location. The rooftop pool and bar was a great place to relax and unwind with a view of the sun setting over city. The indoor spa is luxury. The staff were really helpful and friendly. Worth paying that little bit more to stay here... We fell in love with Barcelona and can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but decent -- great location”
Reviews.Author: RachelinKabul
Reviews.Content: If you've got money to spare, then the Hotel 1898 is a decent choice for a Barcelona visit. Its two main good points are its excellent location and the comfortable rooms. Service is okay -- not bad, not great. The biggest downfall is the high pricetag (we paid 200Euro/night b/c we got a major discount, and it still felt a bit too high). We had the smallest room type -- it had a king bed, a desk with chair and an armoire with a few hangers and no shelves for our clothes -- the room did not have enough space for a comfy chair or any other furniture. Our window looked out into an interior courtyard that was decorated nicely with plants and stones. Our bathroom was pretty large, with an extra deep tub, which was a nice touch. We spent several afternoons at the pool on the roof, which is nice. There are some areas to sit with shade and some in the sun. The food on the roof is also very expensive. On the first day we ordered a chicken and shrimp dish for 8.5Euro and it was one kabob with 3 small pieces of chicken and 2 small shrimp. The next day we brought sandwiches up with us, but were told that we weren't allowed to bring our own food. They later recanted, saying it was okay to eat our sandwiches on that day only, but not in the future -- it simply didn't seem very friendly. Another odd service issue happened one day when we got back to the room midafternoon and the housekeeping staff was in it cleaning -- she didn't offer to leave and come back later, or say that she'd be done in just a minute. She didn't actually say anything. We thought that was a bit strange -- we understand basic Spanish and could have understood her -- we were tired and wanted to rest, but didn't feel like we really could b/c we weren't sure how long she'd be there or what her plan was. Other service situations went perfectly well -- while our room wasn't available when we first arrived from the airport (around 10am) -- there was one available after we returned from breakfast an hour later. And the desk was happy to arrange for a taxi to the airport for us, help us with our bags, etc. So, while the stay was generally nice and the location right on La Rambla excellent, we just felt like it was a bit pricey for the service. We chose not to eat at the hotel restaurant for dinner b/c there are a myriad of good food options within a short walk, including for breakfast. Coming from a country where there's no good coffee -- we were delighted to find a coffee shop right next door to the hotel. I would recommend the Hotel 1898 to friends with the caveat that price be no object, and that the location be more important than the service.

Reviews.Title: “So nearly Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Booozo
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell, we've stayed before and I can't wait to go back! But that said there were a few annoyances. 1) I specifically booked (via an internet agent) a DOUBLE room and got a twin, apparently it must say KING to get a double kingsize bed 2) Generally people use their bathrobes to go to the pools, but they only come in one size which for a 4* hotel I thought was rather poor 3) The toilet wasn't fixed to the wall. 4) When using the shower the bath leaked on the floor. But thats it! The rooms are so elegant and luxurious and I really like the snappy decor, the breakfast is the best I've ever had, more choice than any other and I've travelled around alot. The best thing of all is the roof terrace, with it's pool, bar and really comfy cushy sofas and beds, great at any time of the day, particularly after dinner, a midnight cocktail under the stars can't be beaten. Your search is over, stay you know you deserve it!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT !”
Reviews.Author: BJK15
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights 18th - 21st August - thought the hotel was fantastic - the rooms were very very small even though this had been mentioned on trip advisor previously i feel the room we had could have been classed as a single rather than a double with very little storage space for luggage. Having said that the room was beautifully furnished and spotlessly clean and we didnt spend a lot of time in it. The basement spa and pool were lovely but the rooftop pool and terrace were superb and what a lovely place to spend time either during the day or into the evening. As has been said previously drinks were extortionate on the terrace but we were on holiday so we just went for it! The food we ate in the hotel was first class and the breakfast was 21 euros which was also very good with an excellent choice. The hotel staff were very helpful and pleasant. The situation of the hotel was so central we would definitely stay there again when we visit this fantastic vibrant city.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: 4vents
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel in the best possible location. The decor is fantastic, very contemporary but quirky. The staff were helpfulp, bilingual and go the extra distance. Room was beautifully decorated, bathroom ideal. Window to courtyard so not all rooms have views, just to be aware. Communal areas stunning. Cannot comment on food, eating out in Barcelona should be on everyone's agenda, so we did that, breakfast lunch and dinner. Hotel prices for meals typical, quite expensive, and you can walk around the corner for amazing breakfast, tapas etc to Bar Lobo (exit hotel turn left and left again). Rooftop superb pool, bar, sunloungers with shade. It's a must, so don't go anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LizVandy
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week long trip to Barcelona. We stayed at B Hotel (Hotel 1898's sister hotel) for three nights and at Hotel 1898 for four nights. B Hotel was nice but Hotel 1898 was much better all around. Better location, nicer rooms, better pool, etc. We loved the pool in the spa as well as the pool on the roof. The rooftop is lovely and we had drinks before dinner every night up there. They were expensive but worth it. The staff at Hotel 1898 is great; they all speak english and are willing to help with whatever you need. The only negatives were that the beds were a little hard and the walls between the rooms and the hallways are very thin. You can hear everything the cleaning staff is doing in the hallway and it seems like they are always cleaning. Also, we stayed in a classic room which was quite small but suited our needs just fine. The location is great; right on La Rambla but I never heard any of the noise from the street in our room (our room overlooked an inside courtyard). We didn't eat at the hotel so I can't speak to the food. However, in Plaza Reial (a 5 minute walk away) there was a fantastic little restaurant called La Crema Canela that we loved. Also, the Born district is a short walk away and has a ton of great restaurants. We loved going to the market just a couple of blocks down La Rambla and getting snacks for the room and eating at the counters there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Best bet in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: CKWCaledonia
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights post cruise after doing a lot of research. Wanted a special place as we were celebrating my wife's 40th birthday and we were not disappointed! The lobby was clean and modern, but not sterile. The overall temperature of the hotel and our room was perfect! We had a Superior room with a king bed on the 6th floor with a "balcony", but you couldn't sit out. We ordered ice each day and room service was fast and friendly. We loved the shower and my wife enjoyed a bubble bath one night. The staff was accomodating and very nice. They let us check out a couple of hours after the scheduled time of noon as we had a later flight. We loved the use of the fabulous robes and slippers which we also wore to the beautiful rooftop pool. Mind you, the pool is very small and just meant for a quick refreshing dip. The lounge chairs and pillows and atmosphere was fabulous. We also loved the indoor pool next to the Spa area. It truly was an oasis and very lovely. You felt like you were in a beautiful cave......The only criticism we had was the restaurant. We ordered 5 tapas, one glass of wine and one bottle of water which set us back 60 euros plus tip. We wouldn't have minded as much if the food had been good, but it really wasn't. My wife and I are real foodies and this meal was overpriced and underwhelming. Overall, we had a fabulous stay and would most definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “a place to chill in this busy city”
Reviews.Author: joxmac
Reviews.Content: We spent a lot of time researching a hotel as it was our 10th anniversary and wanted somthing special! The hotel was perfect. Just off the busy Ramblas it was perfectly central but as it was down a side street we were not bothered by noise from the street. We chose not to eat at the hotel as we did think the prices for breakfast and meals were expensive. However there were lots of places to choose from and the hotel staff were very helpful in helping us find somewhere to eat at night and recommended 2 lovely restaurants. The rooms were very modern. We stayed in a classic room. It wasn't huge but had everything we needed as we we weren't in the room long. The bed was big and very comfortable and the air conditioning kept the room cool. My hubby thought the rain shower was great! For us the highlight of this hotel was the rooftop pool and terrace. This was a prefect haven at the end of a busy day. We would come back to the hotel all hot and bothered after sightseeing and go up to the roof in our robes (provided by hotel!) there were loungers, tables and these wonderful sofas and proper beds with canopies. we could lie there looking over the rooftops with a chilled glass of wine! Heaven!! The bar prices were higher than the oubs etc but that is to be expected. They made fresh juice smoothies and fnatastic cocktails. We would go back to the terrace after our evening walk as it was open until 2am and was lit by candlelight! This probably isn't the most cost effective hotel in barcelona but if you are looking for luxury, romance and a bit of relaxation - then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location - would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: need_to_travel_m0re
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night pre-cruise 7/20/10vand then 2 nights 12 days later post-cruise 8/1-8/3/10, For the one night stay, room was on second floor with king that was 2 twin beds pushed together, but room itself was beautiful with balcony and faced side street and La Meridien Hotel. Extremely quite and lovely accommodation. Second room for the 2 night stay was on 6th floor, king bed was actually one bed not 2 twins, room faced same side street but no balcony. Same lovely accommodations in room. No noise from Ramblas heard, but did hear fair amount of noise through our ceiling since floor above was outdoor pool/patio terrace.
