Business Center has pcs with free internet access to check-in with airline and print boarding tickets. Lovely indoor pool and spa on lower level. Carrefours supermarket is on Ramblas right across from hotel, Starbucks is next to hotel, and good restaurants are also close by, so extremely convenient location. Only few blocks away is Plaza de Catalanya and the hop on hop off doubledecker bus that we used as our main transportation around the city. Hotel is also walkable from Columbus statue at end of Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: Seattlecruzgirl
Reviews.Content: Even though this hotel is located right on the Ramblas, do not be concerned about that. The minute you step inside, you are instantly tranported into cool, calm, surroundings and a total oasis. This hotel was elegant, chic, unique ( infused with a history all it's own) and exactly the experience we wanted. We loved the room we had with private terrace-- totally recommend that if you are there for more than one night. The rooftop terrace was totally amazing with views and a chic elegance, bar, pool and super cool vibe. The front desk staff was totally accomodating this hotel was worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great Service and Central Location”
Reviews.Author: LiveWellTravel
Reviews.Content: H1898 Was the PERFECT hotel for me. I am a solo female traveler so having a safe, well located hotel near all the major transportation and restaurants makes a big difference. The roof top pool and bar have a great view of the entire city - good food, clean pool and an elegant environment without all the crowds. This was the best hotel of my entire trip...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central location - recommended for city trip”
Reviews.Author: PascalAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. This was our 4th visit to Barcelona so we knew that a location at or near Las Ramblas is normally not a recommendation (noise 24/7). We were very pleasantly surprised that our stylish room facing the inner courtyard was really quiet (even with the windows open) guaranteeing a good night sleep. The hotel is not inexpensive but we feel that the room, the rooftop terrace and especially the breakfast buffet justify the price tag. The breakfast buffet is really impressive. It might not be the biggest buffet, but you are sure spoiled for choice (different kinds of yoghurt, cereals, fruits, bread, pastry, cheese as well as sparkling wine). We went to see the W hotel and the Mandarin hotel and were happy to stay at Hotel 1898. The W is a buzzing and trendy place with great views from its sky bar but you need a taxi to go anywhere. The Mandarin is so design conscious it almost hurts. Beautiful hotel, but we preferred the relaxed atmosphere (and price tag) of Hotel 1898. The people at the reception desk were really helpful by switching our room when the first room had twin beds rather than a double bed. The service at the rooftop terrace was ok (but we are used to Amsterdam so our expectations are low) and the drinks great. All in all we cannot fault this hotel and would definitely recommend staying here when visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with few complaints”
Reviews.Author: Ange588
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is great. It is new, rooms are chic and clean and have a modern feel, it has a spa and a gym that all guests can use. The gym it a bit small, but the rest of the hotel makes up for it. The hotel has an indoor pool (spa) and an outdoor pool on the roof. The rooftop restaurant is not a big deal, but it is made to be so online. The reception acts as concierges too, but it is not the same when I compare it to other hotels with equal quality and stars. Although their bed is one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in. The hotel is right on Las Ramblas, a street with a lot going on all the time, which can be a good or bad thing. Driving there on your own with a gps can be hard, it took me and my family a while but we found it. It's located in a good area in order to leave to explore the city. For a 5 star spa hotel, this hotel will not disappoint you, but it will not blow you away either.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here, scammers”
Reviews.Author: Ilovebostons
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room, then when we tried to cancel they refused to cancel and claimed they never got our emails and charged us full price. Suspicious hotel behavior, they only accept email cancellations and they claim they don't get the e-mail when it is successfully sent. Not good business practice. Suspcious and difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel..bad service at rooftop bar”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter1235
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and historic. The rooms are quite nice and the location cannot be beat. The problems with the hotel are related to some of the service. There is a rooftop bar that is really nice (albeit expensive), but the service tends to be pushy, trying to get people to leave as soon as possible. We felt that we had to insist that we would not be pushed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CBGL2008
Reviews.Content: Ideally suited for the hustle and bustle of La Rambla but yet we had an extremely quiet room that was very clean, a decent size and with an excellent bathroom complete with quality toileteries. With all the superb restaurants close by we only ate breakfast at the hotel but that was of a very high standard especially the ham carved straight off the bone. Many of the major attractions were walkable or a short taxi/bus ride away - we only stayed 5 days but could have easily stayed a lot longer. The roof top pool was a very pleasant addition to the hotel with interesting views around the city and very pleasant to have breakfast on the roof as well. Poolside drinks were very good. We would definitely stay there again but I have to mention the activities of pickpockets which were all too apparent - if you keep your wits about then it is easy to prevent anything happening. I stopped a guy who flashed a business card in my face muttering something about a restaurant while at the same time he tried to go in my pocket which I easily stopped as I had been forewarned by other Tripadvisors. With a shrug of his shoulders he just looked for another victim and was there doing the same an hour later. Barcelona is a fantastic city, definitely now one of my favourites, just don't let the bad guys spoil it!!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury amongst the chaos”
Reviews.Author: SPBLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights right on world cup final weekend - about as hectic as La Ramblas could be, and yet not too much of a disturbance in our room. The room itself is very smart, not as lush as the pics make out but I should think this is one of the nicest hotels in the area. Although 2 single beds pushed together (on wheels!) not ideal. Beautiful roof top terrace over looking the city, amazing and romantic for a night time drink, and an excellent place to unwind with a swim after exploring. I would not recommend the terrace for dinning; the food is lovely but luke warm by the time it gets upstairs, and there are better priced options nearby (Cafe Lobo downstairs is great). Breakfast was fine but nothing amazing - it was all there but I missed the wow factor I have experienced in hotels like Grechotel Eva Palace Corfu. I do like a good holiday breakfast, and this was just luke warm and standard. Amazing service - the hotel should be proud of it's staff from arrival to departure. this was 5*

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of everywhere - with rooftop pool and terrace”
Reviews.Author: kremm
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in the hotel 1898, located on the La Rambla, only 200 meters from the Plaza Cataluyna. The biggest pros were the great location and the magnificent rooftop terrace and pool. For €250 a night we got a nice room with a king-size bed, a clean, bathroom with a mirror on nearly every wall, a tub and a sexy shower (although the mounted shower head was too close to the wall, and it annoyed a shower aficionado like myself). The staff were as expected; polite and helpful, nothing more, nothing less. Rated it 4 out of 5 because I ordered a bottle of chilled cava to be in our room at our arrival. The chilled bottle arrived 1-2 hours after our arrival, so therefore I had to surprise my wife with a Frappucino on the in-house Starbucks instead. All in all, a great hotel. But as we spent most of the time outside of the hotel, next time I'll spend less money on accommodation and more on shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Daffy01
Reviews.Content: This month my daughter and me went to Barcelona in this wonderful hotel. It was absolutely fabulous, no complains about anything! We had everything, sea, culture, shopping, sun... I can also highly recommend Trip Advisor they were nice and everything was well arranged. We had a bad experience before with another agency, but Trip Advisor gave us a lot of confidence and we went in a relaxed way on holiday this time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JM_Bushwick
Reviews.Content: I have to say this hotel was great. It was really nice well kept, the rooms were clean and spacious. I found the service really good and the Chinese resturant in the hotel was very good. The hotel's location is perfect, located off La Rambla and just a couple of blocks from the Placa Cataluna (think I spelled that correctly) it is perfect starting point to explore the city. I Also discovered the my last night there was if you walk to the other end of La Rambla, you get to port and you could walk to the beach from there. I thought it was a great hotel to stay in, in one of the most amazing cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in tourist area - rooms with terrace and roof-top pool”
Reviews.Author: Kostiantyn
Reviews.Content: A great location on La Ramba. Easily accessible by metro, busy tourist area with a lot of restaurants. Roof-top pool is great. The rooms are new, very clean and fully equipped. Get a room with terrace if within a budget - enjoying a relaxing champagne&strawberry evening on terrace couch right above the bustling street was a lovely experience. The staff ranges from very helpful to arrogant (e.g. helping out with recovering a forgotten photo camera in a taxi vs refusing to bring iron board). Anyway, a returning client and eager to come back to Barcelona (a wonderful city) and to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room a little bit too small”
Reviews.Author: digitalfun
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, loved the deco. Superb location. The room I had was a one of the smaller ones, but still, superb deco and bedding. This hotel is nearly impossible to get during GSM, but I was lucky to get a last minute cancellation from EAS, a local agency that specialize in accommodation during the Mobile World Congress.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: BeenThereDoneThat01
Reviews.Content: Deluxe, Modern, Fantastic. There is a heavenly 40 ft. relaxtion pool in the basement by the spa to cool off at the end of a hot day of site seeing, you feel like you are in a cave, with soft lights, music and massaging jets of water. Beautifual modern, spacious rooms. Hotel staff go out of their way to help you. Fabulous location in the heart of Las Ramblas. Free internet access (although keyboard is different for North American travellers).

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amandapot
Reviews.Content: nice hotel with good facilities. Clean and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Very good room”
Reviews.Author: Waleed_Essam
Reviews.Content: Simply the best location possible in Barcelona. The hotel is super clean. They offered us a Champagne bottle when they knew it's our honeymoon. The staff tries to help as much as they can, although they are not very knowledgeable about many details in the city. The price is good for the location. Being near a metro station makes things easy to go round the city, and you're still in walking distance from many cool places.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location- Amazing Rooms”
Reviews.Author: PJL30
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are absolutely beautiful all hardwood floors with very comfortable beds. If you go, be sure to ask for a room that doesn't face Las Ramblas as it can get quite noisy. 1898 is in a perfect location right close to everything. I miss it already.

Reviews.Title: “Smashing hotel”
Reviews.Author: dglambeth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights just recently, celebrating partner's 40th birthday. I can't find any fault. We had a marvellous time and both loved the hotel. It's expensive, yes, but it delivers what you pay for. Particularly loved the central location, the free wifi, the pool on the roof, the roof terrace bar for drinks and tapas at night, and the view out over the Betlem church from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: T0ny1948
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent although expensive hotel. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep Quality, Pillow Selection, Plus, Plus,Plus”
Reviews.Author: John E
Reviews.Content: My allergy to feather pillows was addressed within 10 minutes on a Sunday night at 8:00PM. Not only were the pillows changed, but the mattress cover also, because it was feather filled as well. Quality Customer Service at this fine hotel is impeccable. The hotel has been fabulously fitted out and certainly in my opinion earns a brilliant 5 star status. The design & decor gives one a visit back to1898 Colonial Spain.....BRAVO.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Building in the middle of Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: MMMeehan
Reviews.Content: The minute you walk into the lobby, you know you have made the right choice in Hotel 1898. The decor is beautiful and varied with plush leather couches and low tables spreading from the bar all the way across to the fireplace and TV playing silent black and white comedies. The staff are knowledgeable, efficient and excellent in any language it appears. The hallways have classy wooden trim with blown up black and white images dotted here and there. Our room was on the 4th floor with doors opening onto a small balcony overlooking La Rambla and, though slightly noisy late on a Saturday night, still made for a plush and comfortable sleep. There is a nice pool and terrace on the roof with plenty of cabana style lounge couches with food and drink service. After a week of overeating in Morocco I was excited for the gym, pool and spa area and was not disappointed. The brick archways and wonderful lighting really did impress me. The location does not need any extra praise, slap bang in the middle of La Rambla it is simply perfect. Great place. A+

Reviews.Title: “Solid All-Around”
Reviews.Author: AMWHouston
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in early June. Booked via hotels.com because the rate was a little lower than the hotel's website. Room amenities were all brand new and spiffy. Bar and pool were excellent. My husband kept getitng mojitos, which were expensive at 14 Euros, but they were pretty big, and the cava was quite reasonable at 6 Euros. Real treat to sit by the pool each night. Not a lot of seating by the pool itself but tons of space to stretch out in little lounge areas all around the roof. Pool at the fitness center was amazing! Breakfast was pricey; we ate at the market and local cafes instead. Worst pricing issue --- they charge 22 or 23 Euros for parking, and it does not include valet; it's just to park the car yourself underground. For that price, parking usually includes valet.

Reviews.Title: “Superb amenities, mixed review”
Reviews.Author: myra405
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this hotel but let me say that its all relative to what you want in a vacation... First, I will say that I wasn't paying attention when booking the location on this hotel--right in the middle of the tourist trap circus of Las Ramblas. We typically stay in a quieter location off of the beaten path and are much happier to visit touristy places and then venture back to peace and quiet. So, be prepared to be confronted with crowds, hasselers, prostitutes, etc, etc. when you exit this hotel. That being said, it was easy for us to stay in the hotel instead of to enjoy the sights of Barcelona (which is what we typically do). Really there's no amenity the hotel does not offer. The lobby is amazing and the archetecture impressive. The rooms are beautiful and the bathrooms are posh. The bed was comfortable and we slept well. The hotel's rooftop is amazing...cushioned benches/chairs/lounges all around with a nice pool, bar and amazing views. We ate breakfast up here both mornings and the breakfast was amazing. The basement of the hotel houses a spa and a beautiful spa pool, sauna and steam room. Its beautiful. So, if you go to Hotel 1898, go for the amenities and be prepared for not wanting to leave...also be prepared for staff to not go out of their way to welcome you. Staff was not AT ALL rude, but unfriendly, curt and, at times, slightly condescending. But coming from the South of Spain to Barcelona, I found this attitude common among most in the city (aka the taxi driver who attempted to swindle us). You will find the complete opposite in the South of Spain and I would return there, I will never return to Barcelona. Definitely eat the breakfast on the rooftop terrace. It may seem overpriced at just under 30 euro, but so worth it. You are served a huge amount of really good food and the women who serve it are much nicer, warmer and friendlier than any other staff I encountered at the hotel. Eating breakfast on the rooftop and strolling over to the pool was a great way to start 2 mornings. DO NOT eat at the restaurant on floor 1. The portions and the prices are laughable and the service is horrible. Instead go around the corner to Bar Lobo for AMAZING tapas and good service and value. I would not return to Barcelona but if this hotel was located in another city (perhaps in Seville, Cordoba, etc.) I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Primabijoux
Reviews.Content: From the rooms, to the service and location, this hotel was incredible. Located right on Las Ramblas and next to the Boqueria, what more could you ask?? I would definitely recommend this hotel for lovers..

Reviews.Title: “Deserves Its TripAdvisor Ranking”
Reviews.Author: Andlovingit
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, nicely appointed, well staffed. The entirely family was pleased. Good restaurants nearby. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We had an amazing time, but maybe we just got lucky!”
Reviews.Author: DoctorMitch
Reviews.Content: We had a unique experience, making this our finest hotel stay in, well, perhaps forever ! It is a beautiful, new, and modern hotel. We had reserved a junior suite, but when we arrived at 10 AM having just flown in from NYC, they upgraded us to one of the full suites with a private pool and large terrace outside overlooking the Ramblas so that we wouldn't be duisturbed by a private party on the roof terrace one flight above the jr suites. The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. Included was a bottle of champagne each night. We were able to check in immediately and nap on the terrace before taking off into the city. For breakfast we brought back goodies from the Boqueria one block away and ate on our deck. We couldn't even use all our furniture! And each day we came back to our own private pool. We even slept outside on the deck because the weather was so beautiful. Sleeping outside under the stars in Barcelona, after eating and drinking until late in the night, was a magical experience. We didn't want to leave and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, very well run and good value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: John12375
Reviews.Content: Everything was consistent with the reviews we read for this hotel. We had a superior room overlooking the Ramblas on the third floor. We had some concerns about street noise but were not bothered in the least since the sound insulation of the windows was fantastic. The room was very comfortable, spacious and clean. The only minor annoyances were related to the weak wifi signal and the hard to understand air conditioning controls (hidden in a poorly lit closet). The breakfast buffet was on the pricey side but was very well done (the staff will willingly prepare special requests like omelets if asked). All in all a very good choice for our stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “The fabulous Hotel 1898”
Reviews.Author: ebganey
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel 1898 during our trip to Barcelona. We were looking for a Hotel that was centrally located, had nice accommodations, and would be a good home base for our family trip. We were extremely pleased with the Hotel 1898. We were able to check-in early upon arrival and the hotel stored our bags on our check-out day as we took a day trip to Montserrat. The rooms were clean and newly remodeled, staff was very helpful, and we loved watching the sunset and drinking cocktails from the rooftop terrace. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: jorisby
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very good and has many advantages. But a big big disadvantage is that the nice terrace with pool and bar was closed when we arrived from 6 pm. during the rest of the the evening and night because of a private party !!?!! So this made my stay at this hotel a bad experience, also because I stayed only 1 day , if I knew it before I could have choosen an other day , so my party at this hotel was very bad . I thought a hotel like this has several meeting rooms to organize private partys. And using mails and websites they can at least make an anounce of this fact. Another bad technical thing : the Wifi signal was too low, but it is a very good advantage everybody can use PC and printer(with bad color) in the business center. I would recommend this hotel to other people who like also the free spa with pool, fitness, sauna, but look first at the prices for therapies, also a 'pack' may be a good option

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the midst of the hubbub of La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: rsemprun
Reviews.Content: When i entered the hotel, i was overtaken by the beautiful, cool, but warm environment - and the aromatherapeutic touches. We checked in, got an outstanding 'deluxe'? room with a terrace. small hiccup with some non-functioning a/c, but technicians came to address thee situation regularly. ultimately, we ended up in an even better room with a bigger private terrace. the entire staff is committed to helping you in any way possiblle. phone requests are usually addressed within 5 minutes. most incredible rooftop terrace, great, but pricey, brunch, but worth it for the view.. ambient music playing. loved the electronic lighting system and the room with the sepatate shower and bath. and the PILLOW MENU! i should've gone out to see more of barcelona, but was so comfortable in the room. got great restaurant recommendations from the bartender. all in all, there was not one stone left unturned during our stay to ensure our hapiness. i sort of cried when i had to leave, it was impressive. and i've stayed in some great hotels all over the world.. good job 1898. i will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great total package: location, amenities, overall style”
Reviews.Author: AGPace
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Barcelona for two nights and stayed at Hotel 1898 after ten days in Greece. While tired from traveling and not sure we were ready to do another quick city, we could not have been more pleased with Hotel 1898. It's in a great location, right off Las Ramblas toward the north end, so great for walking, people watching, and visiting some of the fabulous historic sites of Barcelona such as the Gothic area. The hotel is very dark in decor but in a hip and cool style. It's actually a very soothing place to hang out after the hustle and bustle on the streets. Friendly, helpful staff; the room was on the smaller side but it had everything we needed: great linens, very quiet, nice bath, flat screen TV; high tech room control lighting. I was concerned about being so close to the craziness on Las Ramblas but Hotel 1898 was very quiet. The hotel also had free internet service available for guests in their Library which is huge if you're not traveling with a laptop. There is a rooftop pool and bar which offers great city views; and, a Spa and workout area located on the lower floor. We had a drink in the bar one evening and that was fine. If I had to pick something negative, it would be the breakfast. While they put out a fabulous buffet priced around $25 Euros per person, I wish they offered an a la carte choice. I don't want to eat $25E worth of food in the morning. So if you wanted something simple, you either had to do Room Service or go elsewhere. Also, be careful with the cabs. We had a cab ride from the airport to the hotel in the middle of the day - $24E total and the ride took about 35 minutes because of traffic. No problem there. Then we had the front desk arrange for a cab to take us back to the airport, at 6:15 a.m. on our departure morning. We were in the lobby checking out at 6am; the bellman took our bags out to the cab. We were in the cab and on the road by 6:15 a.m. When we arrived at the airport which only took 15 minutes because of the early morning and no traffic, the fare read $28 E and then he charged us an additional $10 E because he said he had to wait for us to come out of the hotel. We felt stuck; tried to discuss the matter but he put up the "I don't speak English" wall. So we paid the money and he left. It was the only time in our 13 day trip where we felt we got ripped off. So, the bottom line is - ask what the fare is going to be before you get into the cab. They can give you an approximate amount. And in fairness, the hotel told me that the cab driver would charge us an additional $10E if we were not ready and on the road by the scheduled time. So, we left Hotel 1898 on a negative. But stay at Hotel 1898. It's a fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, neat and convenient”
Reviews.Author: jimbasic
Reviews.Content: This is an extremely clean hotel, especially given its location on Las Ramblas. With a room on the interior court and a secure elevator once you are inside you would never know that just outside your door you would be on the busiest street in Spain and blocks from the Gothic City. The room was small, but probably normal by European standards. Do look at the carefully written and clear instructions written in multiple languages (including English) on how to operate the shower before you attempt to use it. We found it a great way to transition from the US to Spanish culture was spending an hour in the evening enjoying the complimentary tea (when we got back to the hotel on time) and then another hour resting our tired feet and bodies in the pool and sauna and getting ready for a late (9-10 pm) dinner. The hotel's best feature was perhaps the SPA where the pool, sauna and steam room are available to guests. We did not have the time or budget for SPA services on this trip, but based on the set up and complimentary services available, we wished we had had an opportunity to try them. There was also a roof-top pool which has a great view and looked inviting but it was a little too cool during our visit to use it. The buffet breakfast was complete and you could ask for eggs done as you like them, which is a feature that we as vegetarians appreciated in meat-crazy and ham-crazy Spain. We knew at every breakfast that we could eat according to our dietary preference plus enjoy whatever extra goodies the hotel offered. The fruit offered in May was ripe, sweet and plentiful. Don't overlook the macadamia nuts. (In booking our room we mistakenly booked for one person instead of two but the hotel graciously provided us a second breakfast at the same unit price that we could have secured had we booked properly.) We had no problem in communicating with the front desk, even though we have no Spanish or Catalan language skills. There always was someone at the desk who spoke English and there was at least one native English speaker (from London). But, there is no separate concierge. The folks at the front desk do it all themselves. Though this may make for a more interesting job, it may not be the best way to help travelers. As with other hotels and tourist offices in Spain, we found it difficult to get a solid recommendation from the advisors at the front desk. The options available for tour guides, etc. were quite costly. There seemed to be few group tours of any kind available except standard, touristy bus tours. So, be sure to plan well in advance and don't rely on obtaining advice upon arrival. One notable small tapas place nearby (at Fortnouy and Lluna) is Mam i Teca. Eat there and you'll know you are in Catalonia.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdjn9
Reviews.Content: From the staff at the front desk, bar staff and housekeeping everyone was beyond helpful, friendly and gracious. We spent 8 nights and found it to be a home away from home. Afternoon tea and snacks in the bar area was a daily event. The hotel is in a perfect area for touring, within walking distance to almost everything. We faced the interior by choice and never heard a bit of noise from Las Ramblas. We did not eat at the hotel so can't speak to the restaurants but would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “all you need!”
Reviews.Author: adridann
Reviews.Content: Not the cheapest one but worth the money. Nice spa in the basement and the swimming pool and bar on the roof were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: nycfashionlover
Reviews.Content: H1898 is a very unique hotel. love the historical building, on a very nice location. nice rooftop pool very clean and modern on the inside. the room is not as big but very cozy. i would definitely go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience in years!”
Reviews.Author: shiningrose
Reviews.Content: My wife and I LOVED this hotel. We were there for 5 days and could not think of one negative thing about it! The roof top pool and terrace is stunning!

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: THEKENT
Reviews.Content: I was delighted with my stay at Hotel 1898. The rooms were exquisite, very clean, comfortable, and quiet. Most of all I loved the pool on the roof and being able to see 360 degrees of the city. The hotel is located in the heart of things so no matter which area you want to visit, you can actually walk there if you wish. I would stay there again. I told countless people about the hotel and how beautiful it is.

Reviews.Title: “1898 is Terrific”
Reviews.Author: stephbos
Reviews.Content: 1898 was a real treat. Friends recommended it so we had positive expectations, which were met and exceeded. Terrific location, great amenities (we used the indoor and the outdoor pools extensively after our days of touring), very responsive staff. We took a room in the back to be away from potential Lla Rambla noise, so it may have been smaller than we otherwise would have had, but it was quite comfortable - bed and pillows were great for sleeping comfortably. And free internet service was a major plus! The hotel definitely enhanced our visit to a fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book the "classic" rooms!”
Reviews.Author: FrenchLIT
Reviews.Content: Booked a "classic" room (the only kind of room left) at this hotel for a week-end. Was hugely disappointed : these rooms open onto a very narrow inside courtyard with a glass roof, which makes the atmosphere in the rooms really stuffy and hot, and dark 24/7 like in a windowless conference room... One cannot tell the weather outside or the temperature when waking up in the morning. Noisy corridors with cleaning staff waking you up every morning no later than 8am. And the Worst reception staff of a luxury hotel ever. Therefore, we did not try any other service at this hotel and had breakfast at the next door Starbucks!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with a capital L”
Reviews.Author: KatrinaVM
Reviews.Content: Took a while to book in as the first two rooms they showed us were at the back and side and rather small. Managed finally to get one on Las Ramblas - well worth it. We went for our 20th Wedding Anniversary and enjoyed the romantic swimming pool, the beautiful bathroom and very big comfortable bed. The toiletries in the bathroom were good but the television was hopeless - but we did need it!!!!! Yes the bar was expensive and the breakfast very overpriced. We tried the breakfast on the last day and the room was almost empty. You could have anything including champayne and the best spanish ham. Unless you have a huge appitite or lots of money to spend it was not worth it! For supper we went round the corner to rear of hotel and ate in the tappas resturant at night - just heavenly food! Tried having lunch in the market - very much a local custom and worth it. The goudi parc was worth going to but full of tourist (like us) and locals enjoying the parc. Local buses cheap and easy to use. Watch your handbags at all times But back to the hotel - the roof top pool looked lovely with decadent sun lounges. Stunning views from every direction. The bar and lounge area was kept beautifully and smelt devine. Staff were very friendly and were helpful every time we needed their help with resturant reservations. All in all you felt like royalty from the time you stepped over the threshold to the time you left - well done Hotel 1898!

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel in an interesting part of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: BetsyNYC
Reviews.Content: I took my 17 year old daughter and her friend with me to visit my son who is spending a college semester in Barcelona. We chose the hotel because of the spa and the lovely decor. The staff was happy to situate my room close to my daughter's room on the 3rd floor. At first glance I thought the room was small. My room faced a small interior courtyard, so no view, but the design of the room was so nice, and although the bed felt hard, it actually ended up being super comfortable. The spa and small pool was such a great treat at the end of the day. The girls had massages and loved them. We had tapas the first afternoon in the restaurant, which was not so memorable. The really remarkable thing about the hotel's location is how close it is to The Bocaria...huge covered market, not even a block away. Take a seat at one of the counters at the little market restaurant stalls ( my favorite was in the back ) and you will have the most delicious, fresh, Catalonian lunch!! Fish, razor clams, mussels, sausages, beef, rice...unbelievable! I also stopped there in the morning for fresh juice, and fruit sold wrapped up with a tiny fork. The coconut juice was my son's favorite! Staying on the Ramblas is a mixed bag. There are some shady pick-pocket types around and the touristy souvenir stands make you think you're cluelessly staying in Barcelona's version of Times Square, but I think the benefits out-weighed the negatives. Barcelona is very easily walkable and the hotel in a short few steps to the beautiful Gothic area and a reasonable walk to many of the Gaudi sites. The subway system is a few blocks up the street from the hotel, as is the big department store. The subway is clean and safe, and easy to understand. Take it to the Miro museum. It was worth the trip and had a lovely view of the city! Then go back to the hotel and splash in the pool. I wish the weather had been warmer because the rooftop deck and pool looked wonderful! I think we were lucky to find this hotel and would be happy to go back and stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best on La Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: headfortheborder
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay on La Ramblas and cost is not a big issue, then this is a great choice. We had a room with a decked balcony, nice sunbeds, table and chairs for outdoor dining and plants (though our room was overlooked by the hotel next door which seemed to have a busy top floor, so it was not exactly private!); very comfortable room in a plush 'clubby' feel, spacious, well-lit (hurrah!), well-equpped bathroom. The breakfast choice was the best of the hotels we stayed in last year in Barca (we stayed in 5). It's not cheap, so if it's not important to you eat a big b'fast, then have a pastry and a coffee for a few euros at a cafe nearby. Super bar, though sometimes you can wait a while to be served. Private parking is useful if you are driving, as we were. Many people like La Ramblas as a central place to stay, but we think there are more pleasant locations a short walk away - it depends what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Beatuiful”
Reviews.Author: saz1982
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutley great and is a little slice of luxury in Barecelona, we stayed here for four nights and loved it. The rooms and bathroom have everything you could need and more and the location is fantastic. I found the staff to be courteous and friendly and would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complaint about!”
Reviews.Author: bala77
Reviews.Content: I decided to get away for 4 days in Barcelona and everyone was recommending me that hotel! I was very pleased to see that they were right! it was perfect! the room, the service, the spa (except that some people didn't really follow the rules of not being naked in the shared sauna! but after talking to the staff it stopped happening!), the roof is beautiful and the location the best!I highly recommended it. And it's a good rate for that quality of hotel. I recommend also the restaurant next door to the hotel, perfect for bkfast and lunch Bar Lobo.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: lindatony2001
Reviews.Content: The hotel exceeded all our expectations. We reserved two rooms, one with two twin beds and one with a king size bed each on either side of the hotel. The rooms were beautiful and the beds were extremely comfortable. Each bathroom (even the one shared by two woman) were more than adequate and beautifully decorated. Other reviews have stated that if your room is street side that it is very noisy, we disagree...close the french doors and drapes and you cannot hear anything. The staff is not like any staff that we hav experienced, they treated us like royalty. Our every need was met quickly and most of all with the upmost professionalism. My family and I only stayed for 6 nights as we were off to Paris...London. We all agreed that we would have preferred to stay at the hotel for our 15 day trip instead. The hotel and staff deserve this amazing review, but with any great hotel we are concerned that it will be so popular we won't be able to get reservations in the future...but we will try!

Reviews.Title: “A top quality hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: KeithExeter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from Barcelona, having spent 5 nights at Hotel 1898. We found it to be perfect in every way. The staff were professional and extremely friendly; the hotel was clean and stylish; our room was very comfortable - particularly the pillows. It's in a great location on La Rambla, ideal for visiting different parts of the city and the numerous bars and restaurants on and just off it. By booking early and getting a discount, we got what we considered to be a very good deal. We definitely recommend it! Keith, Exeter

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and VERY Central!”
Reviews.Author: anarpo
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from Barcelona and have nothing but great things to say about Hotel 1898. I did quite a bit of research and figured that eventually I would have to make a decision so I just kind of went with 1898. I am now convinced that if anyone had a problem with this hotel it is because they are problematic themselves. Checking in & out was a breeze. We had requested a double bed ("matrimonial") but were a little concerned that they couldn't guarantee it. Just make sure to call in advance and have them make a note of it - email them as well to follow up with your request. The room was ample and the design very beautiful. I'm sure that there are other hotels that are a bit under this price range (we paid an average of EUR225 per night) that would have been great as well but my boyfriend has already said that this is where we will stay when we return to BCN for another vacation. It is very central on La Rambla. We stayed in Rm 444, which has a small balcony and looks directly out over La Rambla. I didn't have the same issue with noise on that side of the hotel. The windows are double-paned which helps reduce the sound. Aside from that we were usually so exhausted from sight-seeing and running all over the place for an entire day that by the time we settled in for the night it would have been difficult to disturb us. The hotel restaurant is fine - certainly pricey, but the food was wonderful. Less than a block away to the right of the hotel (if you are facing the main entrance) is a great grocery store called Carrefour Express. Definitely stock up on basics like water, snacks, milk or cream for coffee. There is a very small refrigerator in the room and an electric kettle to heat water for the instant coffee they provide in the room. They don't provide enough creamer for my taste, so I got a small amount of milk to hold me over for the week. The walk to Barceloneta is about 10 minutes, and if you go in the opposite direction, you're at Plaza Catalunya in under 5 minutes. There is tons of shopping close-by and metro stations all around - about 4 within a 5-8 minute walk. Barri Gotic basically starts on the other side of La Rambla from 1898. Just walk through one of the smaller side streets. If you take Carrer de la Portaferrissa and just keep walking straight, you'll get to see lots of small stores and then you'll come up onto the absolutely gorgeous Cathedral of Barcelona. Be sure to go to the hotel's terrace which has excellent views of the cathedral and other wonderful landmarks. This trip was fantastic. Our stay at Hotel 1898 set a wonderful foundation for a great weeklong adventure and we'll definitely be staying here again and suggesting it to anyone else that will be going to BCN. One other point that was very interesting...if you are facing La Rambla from the hotel (with your back to the hotel), look to the left and you will see a building with a large blue sign that says Citadines - it is bldg #122. There is a breezeway/alley on the ground floor you can walk through to see the Roman Necropolis - a small bit of land that has been preserved with ancient Roman tombs that were uncovered (in the 1950s, I believe) while the block was undergoing construction. There are lots of areas close to the hotel with very interesting history. Oh - and there is Free WIFI which made a huge difference to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: HanneH70
Reviews.Content: The hotell staff gave good service: recommendations of place to visit, with directions and booking of restaurant were done fast and always with a smile. Nice and clean room with nice accessories as robes, toothbrush ++ smaller than espected when paying for superior room but all included the rooms were good. The Spa department were nice, woth pool and training area for those who need that. I will definitely recommend a massage "Stopping time" - it was heaven :). The location was great at La Rambla within walking distance to all sites worth seeing. Will use this hotel again if visiting Barcelona. If a next time I hope to have the weather to use the roof top pool area - splendid area with a heated pool.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel (with some rumbling on La Rambla)”
Reviews.Author: BuonaNotteRoma
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Hotel 1898 during our second stint in Barcelona and couldn't have been more pleased. Every employee encountered was friendly and helpful, the hotel was spotless and the junior suite was large, contemporary, spotless and had a very comfortable king size bed. All this for a few Euros LESS than a supposed 5-star neighbor's standard room. The location on La Rambla was a great launching point for our daily walking-tours through Barcelona. The Metro was nearby as were the sidestreets to the gothic area and even a Citibank ATM. When booking a room, however - be sure to ask for a room not affected by subway rumbling (I think we were on the fifth floor and heard it). Granted, the rumbling ceases at about midnight but it can be a nuisance if you're a light/early sleeper. I would also advise that staying on La Rambla is a little bit 'touristy' since it attracts people the same way Times Square does in New York. If that's your thing, you will love 1898...if not I'd look for a hotel more off the beaten path. All things considered, Hotel 1898 would be my first choice for a return stay to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: aberkeley1
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Barcelona and I truly enjoyed my stay. Modern design, classy and chic!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Con03
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this hotel. We arrived early to the hotel, and they gladly held our bags for us while we had breakfast and toured the city. The breakfast at the hotel was very good and worth the money. The hotel is located right off of Las Rambla, which is extremely convenient. The room was beautiful and I wish I had been able to stay for longer than 1 night. The hotel is also located next door to the market, which is an awesome market. We were able to pick fresh fruit to eat for breakfast the following morning. Awesome, Awesome, Awesome hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and stylish hotel in a great location on La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: Christine_Audrey
Reviews.Content: This is a historic building beautifully and tastefully refurbished with 21st century comforts. Excellent location on La Rambla, handy for shopping around Catalonia Square but also good walking distance from the Cathedral and from the sea. Friendly staff, comfortable rooms, lovely marble bathrooms, comfortable beds. Buffet breakfast lovely but expensive, we ate at cafes nearby most days. Only surprise was lack of any kind of concierge service: we asked for restaurant recommendations but not that much help; and the most inconvenient thing was that the hotel would not change euro travellers cheques into euros for us, pointing us in the direction of a nearby bureau de change that wanted to charge us 10%.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best”
Reviews.Author: ClintBolton
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for xmas 2007 and got a really cheap deal compared to the rates i have seen recently. However, if i ever went back to this city i would pay the current prices . This is a fantastic hotel and one of the very best i have ever stayed in. Our room was one of the less expensive ones but was beautiful in design and comfort. The shower was absolutely amazing with several shower heads coming from different angles. I could have stayed in there for the whole trip. The hotel is in a great location- just a step out and you are on La Ramblas. The breakfast was good and the pool was nice. The gym, however, was inadequate and only contained a very limited amount of cardio equipment. I can't remenber seeing any weights. One tip- if you are visiting the city over xmas, be prepared for a lot of the bars and restaurants to be closed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: noworries10
Reviews.Content: Decided on this hotel becuase of Trip Advisor reviews and glad I did. My sister and I stayed here for a couple of days before getting on a cruise ship and what a delight. The room was small but very nice (remember to leave your room key in the slot to keep the light on) and the rooftop bar was the BEST!!!! Great tapas and drinks. I did get pickpocketed so be careful on the streets - I let my guard down for 15 minutes and that was 15 minutes too long and it was an expensive lesson. I still love Barcelona and would always return to this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, modern and right on the Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: r88my
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel shortly after it opened and got a special rate. Location is fantastic right on the Ramblas and we didn't have any noise issues. The room although stylish and modern, was quite small and it was a struggle moving around especially with the suitcase on the floor. Reception was always helpful and polite. Bathroom was spotless. I'm not sure I'd stay here again not because it wasn't nice, but for the cost compared to the size of the room. Thoroughly recommended otherwise if you know you want.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but make sure you have a lot of money”
Reviews.Author: coventryuk
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the heart of Barcelona very expensive, small bottle of Coca-Cola €15, vodka and Coke €25. The restaurant is very expensive, we were the only two people in there, food was okay and would not recommend. We had the room with the private swimming pool which was great for the kids but was overlooked by other bedrooms (€1,500 per night). Maximum two people in each room which was a problem because we had two children and no interconnecting rooms. The room service is very poor.... in fact there is no room service!! I phone down to reception for some drinks to be brought up only to be told that we had to go down and collect!! I had problems with exchanging money at the reception, one day they gave me exchange £ to Euro, next day they said, we do not do exchange at this hotel!! after speaking to the manager and explaining to him that they exchanged it yesterday he agreed to exchange more, but he was not happy!! The hotel swimming pools and spa are excellent and would recommend them. In fact this hotel is a beautiful hotel and I cannot wait to return to it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holidaycouple_10
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. Lovely staff, great rooms, fantastic location and the heated swimming pool was great fun in the winter fun and winter rain! We didn't get breakfast included in our booking but did have it one day and loved it. If and when we go back to Barcelona we will be booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel on Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Annie88Sydney
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel for location to the sights, the ramblas, shopping, and to the water. The roof top bar and pool is superb in the day and the view in the evening superb. Our room was ready early and the front desk staff let us check in early they were very pleasant and helpful. The room was lovely, beautiful bathroom. The room had tea and coffee making facilities. The only negative is they dont tell you that only one lift will take you to the pool deck, I had to help a lady in a wheelchair get out of one lift into the other, so she could find her family waiting for her. I would suggest this instructions are given at time of check in, othewise lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Philippine Themed Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mhel63
Reviews.Content: Cozy, clean and contemporary. Every floor has pictures of the Philippines. Very convenient and right in the heart of La Ramblas. Starbucks is just right down the lobby which is very crucial to us. Very nice lobby and security staff are everywhere. There's free Wi-Fi too...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service and loved having the terrace”
Reviews.Author: DondeNJ
Reviews.Content: We took a group of 15 close friends to Barcelona to celebrate New Year's. We ended up selecting Hotel 1898 over The Meridien based on the decor and traveler reviews (they are across the street from each other and right on Las Ramblas). The proximity to The Boqueria was the clincher over Hotel Omm (a trendier option if thats what you are looking for). We had two of our best meals in the Boqueria (one breakfast and one lunch) and were psyched to be only 2 blocks from it. Contrary to many of the reviews on this site, I did not hear ANY noise from our room at night and we slept soundly. The rooms were clean (housekeeping does a great job maintaining the property), roomy and the bathroom was nice (granite, towl heater, badet, etc). We highly recommend upgrading to a deluxe room for the 100+ sq ft terrace. We also found the concierge to be very helpful in assisting us with our New Year's plans before we arrived and we also asked them to make a dinner reccomendation for us that turned out to be surprisingly good (El Pintor) though a little pricey for what it was (to be expected in a touristy area). The hotel is a few blocks from notable sightseeing including the Gothic Quarter, Picasso musuem and stops for both the red and blue line buses (see below). The only negatives were the lack of irons in the rooms (though we never really needed them) and our king bed which was actually two twins put togther but not connected (if you toss and turn they will move apart since the floors are hardwood). We didnt have time to test out the Spa or the restaurant on premisis. For context, this is a good 4 star property. Some other things to note: - Use the red and blue line buses to see the city. You can hop on and off at any of the stops and they go everywhere for just 21 euros a person. -Eat breakfast at the Boqueria. The tapas counter right at the entrance has amazing omelets, chick peas and churros. -Get to the Sagrada Familia early or you will end up in a 3hr+ line to get inside. -A number of the highly rated restaurants we wanted to try were closed for the holiday through Jan 4th. -Take taxis late night... we had a couple in our group get mugged on their way to the Metro a few blocks outside of Club Shoko. This can happen in any city but given the 20% unemployment, pickpocketing is prob on the rise.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best!!”
Reviews.Author: sionkw
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for 2 nights in a delux room (private balcony) and can't really fault it. There have been a few negative comments about the service in reception, I can only comment on what I saw and they were unbelievably helpful and helped orgainse flowers and champagne as a surprise for our anniversary. Rooms were maybe a bit small but it is a city centre hotel and more often than not the rooms are a bit smaller than you would expect. The balcony was fantastic and nearly as big as the bedroom but unfortunately due to the cold weather we were unable to use it to its full potential. We did eat in the restaurant one night and the food and service was good and not overly expensive, we also eat at The Attic which is directly opposite the hotel on the other side of the road, the food and service was also good here but on the whole you need to go away from La Ramblas to experience true local cuisine. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Pity About Someone Breaking My Luggage Lock In My Room”
Reviews.Author: billthoo
Reviews.Content: Conferencing in November 2009 in Barcelona, and I wanted to stay somewhere central, somewhere nice. Loved the reviews, and loved the look of the hotel. Check-in and desk service was wonderful. The room was great. Breakfast was good. The location was superb (there wasn't a view from the room, but this didn't worry me). Then, two nights before I was leaving, my luggage had a lock removed and the zip damaged on a side pocket. The lock was fine in the morning, and the damage was noticed on my return that evening. The lock was nowhere to be found in the room. I reported this the next morning. Apparently according to the security video and door log the only person to enter the room was the maid... I was told it was not possible that the maid was responsible... I was asked if I had broken my luggage during my flight and had perhaps forgotten about it...!!! Point to note - even when there is a "Don't disturb" sign on the door, staff (at least I think they are staff) still enter the room. They left on my luggage in the room on one occasion whilst I was at breakfast, but the "Don't disturb" sign was still on the door. The management did respond after one week, and offered to pay the expense of repairing my luggage, but this was only after I sent a pointed reply to the "I hope you had a nice stay" email. It is a fantastic location, with great rooms, but I just wouldn't feel safe staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay and OMG the little night candies!!”
Reviews.Author: thg07
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of the reviews. I was travelling for work and decided to stay a week in Barcelona. I splurged on the room with the patio - SKIP IT! You can't see anything because the patio walls are so high. That is my only complaint. The room was adorable and the pillow menu was a crack up. I ordered room service and had the Caresse sandwich - the key is to have them toast it. The staff was very attentive and even the maid noticed i was preparing a dry cleaning bag and took care of it for me with out me saying a word. The location is perfect. You can walk up the street to the tour bus stops and down the street to the open air market. You are right on the Ramblas so you can watch people all day long if you like. There is a Starbucks right downstairs (I know that is so American, but sometimes you just want your Latte!). I walked to the Palau de la Música Catalana and all over. If you go down the little street next to the hotel a few blocks to Dr. Dou street and make a right there is an amazing bakery. There are lots of great places to explore on the side streets around the hotel. The bathroom was beautiful - loved the tub! They give you robe and slippers which is a huge plus. I went to the spa for a massage and that was very nice. Don't think it is a great big spa, it is two rooms in the health club but very nice (about $200 USD for 90 minutes). They have a roof top pool and there are great views of the city from up there. There is an amazing grotto type pool in the gym area and a few cardio machines. The sauna and steam room are nice, but the sauna was not hot enough for me. It is all co-ed so you need to bring a swim suit. The bar stays open late and there are plenty of place to sit and hang out there without feeling like you are in a bar. The decorating is beautiful. I used the business center to print my tickets. A sign of a good hotel- they had a mega magnifying mirror in the bathroom. They also had a towel warmer which I love because of hot towels but you can also dry clothes on it. Ok, so I really liked it and I would go back. My fav little thing...every night with the turn down service they leave a little dish with a few gilded candies - just the perfect thing after a long day or night on the town.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed review...”
Reviews.Author: DSB25
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that this is a beautiful, high quality hotel. Service was efficient, the communal areas (lobby, pools etc) were top class and it's location on La Rambla was convenient. However, when you consider value for money, I think there may be better on offer. The room was tiny (superior room) and although there was a view (unlike the classic interior rooms), it was of an adjacent hotel. You couldn't leave the curtains open as people looked directly into the room. Also, the location of the room, next to the lifts meant that we heard the constant 'ding dong' of people coming and going. We decided to put up with it as we were only visiting for 2 days, however, for me, when you are paying over £150 a night for a room, you want to feel like staying in! A couple more negatives...(sorry!) The walls were paper thin, we couldn't check in until after 2:30pm, yet the desk staff would not accommodate a late check out (even though we understood that the room was available). All in all, it is a 4* hotel in a prime location but in terms of value for money and room quality, it was a let down.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice...Very Good Hotel and Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: ZBoriaPR
Reviews.Content: I was here for pre-cruise with my husband. We stay 2 day and the experience was so good. The hotel staff are so friendly and helpful. The room are little bit small, but are very clean and the hotel have very good location. Also, have a excellent facilities. Finally, the hotel have Christmas decoration was so nice and look so beautiful, definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “1898 Great Location, Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: pjfarr1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel 1898 prior to our Mediterranean cruise. Its proximity to Las Ramblas is a major plus for sightseeing. Staff was accommodating and very friendly. The pools are beautiful especially the grotto pool in the basement. Starbucks is right next door. Room was very large, great shower and tub. Would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: emmartin1
Reviews.Content: gorgeous, safe, clean. View of Barcelona from the heated pool on the roof absolutely stunning in the evening. Had 3 rooms (only down side is can't have more than 2 people in a room) with balconies. Really perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, very poor service”
Reviews.Author: cassiope
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the pool and we were not disappointed: it is absolutely fantastic with amazing views. The pool is heated and not deep which was perfect for the children. The location is also great. The big disappointment was the service: staff just does not seem to care. We ordered food in the terrasse and it took them more than one hour to bring us the food. The manager came to apologise and offered us some wine to make up. Some people were served very quickly and some (like us) seemed to be less lucky, not sure why. In the evening we ordered some chocolate ice cream and after waiting for more than 30mn we gave up and cancelled... in the bathroom there is no conditioner, I called concierge to ask where I could find some and I was told "the hotel has many things but not conditioner" in a very condescending tone.... so be warned the service is not good, but the pool is well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, staff unaccommodating”
Reviews.Author: 5Beantown5
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel 1898 in a travel guide and it looked to be the perfect combination of location, value and amenities - including the beautiful spa and fitness center in the basement. All of these were true. We were very disappointed by the attitude of the front desk staff when we arrived with our young child and were told that she could not stay in our room - we would have needed to get an extra room. This is not a hotel for families!! We shortened our stay to one night at the 1898 and went elsewhere where they were more than accommodating and customer-centered and the overall atmosphere was much less pretentious.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant - stay at this hotel if you can”
Reviews.Author: Sydney2000Australia
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel - and we got it really cheap going through trip advisors search engines. It is right on the Ramblas but whisper quiet. Fantastic roof bar and pool, amazing basement spa and pool. Really good restaurant just behind the hotel too. Great central position - close to train line and tons of restaurants etc

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: BridieBrady
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a very convenient location. It is very stylish and well finished. The highlight though for us was being able to enjoy the lovely rooftop pool due to the lovely sunny weather - 24 degrees in November. The underground spa pool would have been lovely in the evening as it is very relaxing, but we liked to swim in the mornings outdoors to wake up. Barcelona is a great city, very interesting, and wonderful to wander around in and definitely worth a visit. I should mention that we found the staff extremely helpful and they were very friendly to us. The front desk were great, printed out maps for us with directions and booking restaurants etc, so we had absolutely no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel option in a great Barcelona location”
Reviews.Author: dseesel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel 1898 at the beginning of a trip through Spain. Agree with some of the comments that the front-desk staff is a bit "chilly" at times, especially compared to our experience in Madrid at the Gran Melia Fenix. Rooms are compact but chic and well-equipped (although could have used a dresser and stronger water pressure in the shower). Location near the top of the Ramblas can't be topped. Don't fail to check out the spa and pool in the lower level!

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: katb82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel 1898 for four nights in October/November 2009, in a Superior room. The location is excellent, very accessible to the main tourist strip, without being a ''tourist trap''. Although the reception / front desk staff were quite distant (I felt looked down on for offering a cash deposit rather than a credit card), we always felt comfortable and welcome. The bar was perfect for breaks in the day, and also spending a nice, quiet and relaxing evening. The staff behind the bar were very attentive of the guests, even when my boyfriend ordered the wrong drink, they offered to take it away and not charge for the mistake. My main disappointment was the roof terrace being closed for maintenance, but that did certainly not take away from my enjoyment of the hotel. We found it very quiet in the room, so much so we slept until 11am one morning undisturbed. The only thing I found to be disruptive was having the maids storeroom being right across from our door....clinking and banging in the morning woke me up on at least two nights...but I couldn't hear their voices so I'm certain they were trying to be as quiet as possible. The room service breakfast we ordered was slightly disappointing...only because it was colder than I would expect...but understandable. Overall, a very enjoyable experience. I would very happily recommend this hotel to friends and would definitely considering staying here again if in Barcelona - compared to other hotels in the area in the same price range, it definitely had a LOT more charm!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, security questionable, cold staff, rooms ok”
Reviews.Author: 021810a
Reviews.Content: Paid over 300 euros for a "privilege" room for our honeymoon which was ok, not gorgeous. Certainly the quality of the hotel is not 4 star and our room was not luxurious. Security at the hotel seemed poor. The staff were like expressionless robot, no warmth at all; you're lucky if they speak to you at all. Location off Las Ramblas is good but agree with other reviews, Barcelona consists of much more than Las Ramblas. After one day Las Ramblas is more an annoying than anything else. Next time will chose a hotel that is less of a tourist trap with hopefully nicer staff.

Reviews.Title: “A different, well thought hotel”
Reviews.Author: Polna_44
Reviews.Content: Just a different hotel expirience. Great design, location and service. Expensive but you do not feel you overpay.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: lovesfishingmm
Reviews.Content: First time at 1898 and we were very impressed. The staff were exceptionally helpfull and friendly. Our room was spotless with a very pleasant garden balcony .the postion of the hotel was of course tops and the breakfast very good. In all a "will return hotel" Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but I expected better”
Reviews.Author: madehiggins
Reviews.Content: It's a fine hotel. They take care of all the stuff you would expect, but for $400-600/night, it's not up to par. The staff doesn't provide a very high level of service and the internal rooms are a real bummer. The deluxe rooms with views of The Rambla are nice, that's where I stayed. But if I wouldn't pay over 150/night for an indoor room overlooking the alley. I was with my wife on our honeymoon and we checked out and went to Hotel International which is across the street and were happier there - it's a better value. For first timers, I'd say go anywhere within a 10 block radius of this hotel and you'll be happy. You don't need to be on "The Ramblas" they're not the be all and end all of Barcelona, they're more like a center of tourism but not a center of Barcelona. If I went again, I'd just get an apartment anywhere near here, go to the Boqueria market in the morning, and cook for myself. It would be a perfect way to see the city. Also, the breakfast is way overpriced in a country where you usually get it included. If you stay here, go out the main door, take a left and another left and you'll find two great diners that have amazing breakfasts for about 1/10th of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: Elata
Reviews.Content: Whatever you could wish from a hotel: location, service, facilities, food

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KevinnLynn
Reviews.Content: Perfectly combines being in the heart of la Rambla action with stepping into a calm,classy,friendly boutique style hotel. Our room was quiet, the breakfast was great, good spa area and, like other reviewers, we thought the roof terrace was fab.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Ask For Anything More!”
Reviews.Author: Proud_Daddy
Reviews.Content: After researching for weeks on the best Barcelona hotel for us, we finally decided on Hotel 1898 and we were not disappointed! In fact, the hotel exceeded our expectations by miles. The hotel is housed in a beautiful old building, but the decor is absolutely new. The style, however, is very, very classic. It felt like walking into another time. If there was one word to describe the hotel's decor, it would be "classy". Our room was not huge, which we expected in Europe, but had a beautiful terrace with a table and chairs. The room had very high ceilings, and all the amenities you expect from a top hotel. We loved that the Internet was fee too, something that's not offered so many hotels in Europe. The facilities are all world-class. There is a beautiful lobby with plenty of sofas that you will always find a place to relax. Besides the lobby is another lounge area with more sitting areas. There is also a wonderful bar and restaurant on the ground level that is perfect for late evening drinks. The hotel also has an amazing roof-top terrace that serves beautiful tapas and from which you can view practically the whole city. There is also a pool on the roof as well as in the basement, both not huge, but very nice and unique. The pool in the basement has a lovely cavernous feel. In fact, this whole hotel was very romantic. The location of Hotel 1898 cannot be beat. It is right on La Rambla, a very beautiful street full of life, shops, cafes, and street entertainers. It is also right in the Gothic Quarter, within walking distance to the Gothic Cathedral. In fact, we took a stroll down those beautiful narrow old Barcelona streets and stumbled onto the cathedral and a little further down, the Picasso Museum. It's definitely ideally situated if you're the type that likes to walk around a new city and see things as you go. There is also a very high-class Chinese restaurant attached to the hotel that seemed very popular with the locals. We didn't eat there, but it looked very nice. Behind the hotel, however, is a wonderful tapas cafe that we did eat at, and it was great. Again, very popular with the locals. There is also a business center with PCs and Internet access for free, as well as free printing, which was very handy when we planned our days and also printing our e-tickets for our flight after Barcelona. Overall, this was a fantastic hotel which wasn't too expensive, and better than all the other hotels that we walked past on La Rambla, including Hotel Montecarlo, Hotel Murmuri, and the Le Meridien, which was just across the street from Hotel 1898 and completely dead. I think if you're a first-time traveler to Barcelona or even a Barcelona veteran, Hotel 1898 would be perfect for you!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: siouxknox
Reviews.Content: It's hard to imagine staying at any better place in Barcelona. Right on La Rambla, it's a perfect location to see the many sights of this beautiful city. The hotel has a very cool, jazzy style, and is first class all the way. Modern decor, friendly staff, great amenities (including free Wifi). Based on other reviews we requested a room away from La Rambla, which no doubt was a good idea since the street is literally a river of people from dawn to dusk. Although our room was a tad small, it was beautifully furnished, completely clean and very comfortable. Perhaps the highlight of the hotel was its roof-top terrace. It has a small outdoor poool with lounge chairs, but the rest of the roof has large couch-like seating areas that invite you to while away the hours. There's an open bar and the wait staff is happy to serve you, but at the same time there is absolutely no pressure to buy anything and you are free to soak up the 360 degree views of the city, read a book, or take a snooze on the exceedingly comfortable furniture. It's a great place to unwind after a busy day of sightseeing or take in a nighcap (the bar is open until 12 weekdays and at leat 1:00 on weekends). In addition, there is a great spa/fitness facility in the basement. There's a good sized pool, steam and sauna rooms, massage parlor and an exercise room.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: RightRoute
Reviews.Content: Probably the best hotel and service experience of 2009. Everything from the frot desk staff to the housekeepers was fabulous. The only staff member on the rude side was a woman who manned the lobby bar during the day. The rooftop terrace is fantastic though pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: bruhlmeier
Reviews.Content: Right in the hottest spot at Las Ramblas, but with comfort and calm for a good night sleep. Find everything we need around there and easy to get on all kind of public transportation. One thing we appreciated the most was: After checking out we still can use the swimming pool and take a shower before catching a flight.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and facilities, elegant, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: dublintraveller100
Reviews.Content: On the N end of La Rambla, the Hotel 1898 is well located for tourists who are not deterred by the bustle outside and is close to much of what a visitor will want to see in Barcelona. The hotel is an elegant 21c conversion of a late 19c townhouse, later used as the HQ of the Philippines Tobacco Company (hence the name). The decor in the public areas is designer black with wood accents and some imaginative photographs. The excellent leisure facilities include two pools, one on the roof terrace with great views over low rise Barcelona - and with a bar offering tapas - and the other in the basement, beside a small gym, sauna and steam room. Internet access is free from an elegant 'library'. Room size varies. We stayed three nights in a well sized 'superior' room which had a view over a quiet side street and was candy striped and elegantly equipped. We used the restaurant only for its excellent continental breakfast (full buffet also available). All the staff we met were efficient and pleasant. Barcelona is not short of good hotels but we won't look further on our next visit. Highly recommended. Tips: (i) the excellent Onze Cent in the adjacent Le Meridien is one of the few fine dining restuarants open in the early evening and its window tables offer superb people watching opportunties. (ii) we also enjoyed an excellent meal in the (relatively) nearby and Gaudi designed Casa Calvet.

Reviews.Title: “Swimming on the roof or underground... Take your pick!”
Reviews.Author: lafreaj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I only had one night in Barcelona, but Hotel 1898 helped us make the most of it. The location could not have been better... right on Las Ramblas and near where the hop-on / hop-off busses pick up. Also within easy walking distance of the Cathedral and tons of restaurants. The front desk staff was very helpful and got us tickets for the hop-on / hop-off, for a flamenco show, and recommended a nice place for dinner. The rooftop area was a very nice addition. Be warned, though... we had to wait in very long lines at all the major attractions. We didn't even get to go inside La Sagrada Familia.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, good location, shame about the stand-offish staff.”
Reviews.Author: 57Varieties
Reviews.Content: In short: this hotel was located perfectly for us in what we thought to be the most interesting Barcelona district. We would agree with what most other users have said about the hotel, i.e. the location, rooftop bar and pool is the biggest draw, whilst the mix of colonial and contemporary design gives the hotel a unique look and feel. Very comfortable beds, rooms were kept spotless and we loved the pillow menu on offer. On the minus side, we had problems with the amount of storage space available in our 'classic' room (and we only had one hand-luggage sized suitcase each!) and the main 'minus' for us was the attitude of the hotel staff (apart from the cleaners, who were lovely). On the one hand, they were very helpful when approached, very professional and efficient. But no-one we spoke to in the bars or at reception was anything above civil. We were hard presed to get a smile from anyone, attempts to engage in conversation with the bar staff were rebuffed and generally we felt that their approach to guests was quite clinical. Of course this is not the worst thing that one could say about a hotel ever, but nonetheless it detracted somewhat from our stay. And was probably the reason that whilst the open rooftop area is lovely, we couldn't wait to get out of the lobby bar the one night we went there for a drink - the place felt like a mausoleum. As far as cost is concerned, I'm not entirely convinced that there aren't better value for money 4-star hotels in Barcelona, but nor did we feel 'ripped off' for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel298
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on the LaRambla! Great service, the rooms are nicely equipped and comfortable. I could always find someone who spoke English. Very nice, when we return to Barcelona, we will most definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Truly the most decadent place in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: LanSan
Reviews.Content: Barcelona has a lot of great hotels, but H1898 far exceeded our expectations. It sits right on Las Ramblas (not for everyone) so you're near everything. The rooms were nice, clean, and average sized. The staff was courteous and the front desk helped out tourists as there was no true "concierge". The real draw of this hotel though is the roofdeck. WOW! An amazing 360-degree view of Barcelona. The pool itself is underwhelming but the chaises to lay out in the sun are comfortable and the staff brings you water. We ate at the rooftop restaurant our last night in Barcelona and there isn't a better place to see sunset. The food was excellent, unique take on tapas, and I loved the lounge chairs and big comfy couches. Not the cheapest place to stay in Barcelona, but if you plan on spending any time at the hotel itself, the H1898 roofdeck is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: oliveerpent
