Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because it seemed to be one of the most lovely hotel of Barcelona. The unique situation on the Rambla but despite the noise outside, a peacefull room on the backside of the hotel. A mix of colonial and design atmosphere give this hotel a strange sensation. Try the bar and the swiming pool on the roof and enjoy the view on the city listening lounge music. (the mojito is full of taste but expensive : 14eur..-:) The spa is very nice and after a busy day, you will surely enjoy it. Last but not least, the chinese restaurant beside the lobby (but independant of the hotel) is amazing and very "in" (don't forget to book your table) For our next stay in Barcelona, we will be back in this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Great”
Reviews.Author: NIMURA
Reviews.Content: Location: convenient Room: Jr. Suite, nice and comfortable, ceiling is high and very large, nice decor, Bed: very comfortable Bath room: clean and nice Reception: nice and friendly Concierge desk: nice and helpful Breakfast: fresh and nice, variety Door man: Cheerful, very nice and helpful. Bath room: very large and comfortable, almost perfect. chauffeur: O.K. I would stay this hotel again, more than I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Location, a tripadvisor gem....”
Reviews.Author: mightyredbarney
Reviews.Content: Choosing this superb hotel (just off Las Ramblas) for a short break was an excellent choice. My wife is 25 weeks pregnant, H1898 offered calm, extremely comfortable and helpful hospitality to her needs. Our 'superior' 4th floor room overlooked Barcelona back streets, and was more peaceful than those overlooking Las Ramblas directly. The spacious room is equipped with all the mod cons one would expect from a quality hotel, including excellent air conditioning during an unseasonably hot snap, temperatures hitting 30 degrees in early October! Where the hotel excelled for us was in being able to use the splendid spa pool, a small Oasis of calm which we had all to ourselves during one afternoon. Bringing a bathing costume is certainly to be recommended - the 7th floor heated outdoor pool, adjacent to the wonderful outdoor cocktail bar, was another surprising and delightful facility!! The breakfasts should also receive high praise - they are served from 7-11am allowing a lie-in for the weary traveller!! The selection is incredible, and needs to be seen to believed. As well as what might be described as the Spanish version of a 'full English', there were exceptional cheese and cold meat platters, a full salads bar, huge piles of fresh fruit, numerous types of bread and toppings, 6 choices of freshly squeezed fruit juice, cereals, every pastry imaginable, gateaux and cakes and for those really wanting to spoil themselves, champagne and white wine...! Thankfully the Spanish eat their evening meals much later than we do in UK - it wasn't until much later that evening I felt like eating again.... A hugely recommended hotel - certainly one of the best I will ever stay in, and I would definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, can't go wrong here”
Reviews.Author: FromRotterdam
Reviews.Content: Easy to find: take the Aerobus (EUR 4,25) from the airport to Place de la Catalunya (last stop, takes about 30-40 minutes tops), walk to the Ramblas and after about 500m down the Ramblas it's to your left (before Starbucks). Its location makes it an ideal spot to start your Barcelona adventures. Beautiful, classy rooms and public areas: We booked one of the smallest rooms (because the hotel rates are not really cheap and you really don't need all that much space, but more important, they are facing the patio, and as a result you don't hear the noise from the streets). Halls, stairwell and other areas are very nicely styled in the same manner as the rest of the hotel. Great breakfast buffet: all you need and all you can eat and/or drink Ideal roof top terrace: very nice to relax after sightseeing. Lie in the sun, take a dip in the pool, or just hang out on the lounge type furniture Nothing negative to report? Well, it's pricey (but I guess not much different from other 4/5-star hotels in other places and centrally located). We arrived in the evening and ordered some tapas and drinks on the rooftop terrace, and it cost us EUR 70. A glass of wine will cost you EUR 7,50, soft drinks EUR 5 or 6 per glass, a Mojito EUR 14 and you are not allowed to take food or beverages with you to the rooftop terrace. A nice alternative if you're lazy (or just tired after walking around the city) is a small tapas bar on the corner 50m down the street of the main entrance of the hotel (not the entrance on the Ramblas). Other nice to knows: there's a Carrefour Express (small supermarket) on the Ramblas, located 100m from the hotel, a Starbuck's next to the Ramblas entry and a Market somewhat further down the Ramblas, ideal material for photographers). General warning: do watch out for pickpockets and bagthieves. In our last 24 hours we actually witnessed one robbery taking place at a traffic light, saw the aftermath of one and were told by another hotel guest she and her husband were robbed the day before. Do not get distracted (it usually always starts with an innocent looking distraction) , leave your passport and one credit card in the hotel safe, don't carry all of your money in your wallet/bag (and definitly not your home adress), put money in various places, and always keep your bag in front of you or tight between your arm and upper body!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay - great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: 2007bride
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. The rooms are really nice eventhough they are sort of small. Wi-fi was free. The rooftop pool and restaurant is great for day or night. The gym and spa looked great. The hotel lounge had a good vibe. The location is great because you are right off of the Ramblas and good shopping but close to Bar Gotti and Lexample neighborhoods.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel and Its Location”
Reviews.Author: lpang
Reviews.Content: My wife and daughter enjoyed staying at this very luxurious hotel. It is located right next to the LaRambla and a half block to a well-stocked grocery store. It is a former tobacco company building with rich wood trim. The breakfast was outstanding with a wide variety of food ranging from ham to cereal to fruits. The hotel was very clean and elegant. The front desk was very helpful when it came to getting information about local sightseeing and tours. They helped arrange tours to Salvador Dali's museum and other rural towns. The only problem was that it took a while for the rooms to be cleaned. It is also located a couple blocks from the Plaza de Catatunya where all of the tourist buses originate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent La Rambla Location with great rooftop pool”
Reviews.Author: pranzieri
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel based upon previous trip advisor reccomendations and we weren't disappointed. The rooms were a bit small, but had nice amenities including free WIFI. The staff was very hepful and courteous. The spa was very nice and the treatments were reasonably priced. I would allow at least 4-5 hours to fully enjoy the spa. We were especially impressed with the rooftop pool. It had a very chic vibe. The pool staff was a bit slow in delivering food, but was worth the wait. You could easily spend an entire day on the rooftop. We were on the thrid floor and did not hear any noise from La Rambla with is very busy 24/7.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel 1898 for two nights following a cruise. We selected the hotel based off of TripAdvisor reviews and could not have been more pleased with our decision. The location is absolutely PERFECT!!!!! We spend several occasions on the rooftop deck/bar - loved the views and the lounge music..... We had a bit of a challenge figuring out the shower in the room but overall the rooms were great too. Barcelona is an incredible city - we will be returning and we will most definitely stay again at the 1898!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice hotel !”
Reviews.Author: abc001085
Reviews.Content: In the the Rambla! Stayed for a 5 days. Very nice rooms. The breakfast is very good. Their is also a very nice but small indoor and outdoor pools (on the roof) . Their are also computer terminals with internet connection and printer for free. Very friendly staff. Perfect 4 stars hotel. wj

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with one or two very small issues”
Reviews.Author: MarleyIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location as you are bang in the center of everything. It is very nicely decorated and is clean and modern and if i was going back to Barcelona I would stay here again. Most of the staff are very nice and friendly with a small few exceptions. We didn't include breakfast in our package however we did have some room service and the food was quite good. Likes: rooftop terrace (very nice to relax), spa area, rooms, bathrooms, bar lobo next door to hotel (tapas here fantastic) Dislikes: no iron and the ironing service is very expensive, no movies on TV, late checkout rarely available as they are so busy (however they are very accommodating in looking after your luggage, allowing you to use spa area etc.)

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel with the best location of Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Maxiiie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in the 1898 hotel in Barcelona is two non connected rooms. The rooms are not that big. They have a nice bathroom with separate bath and shower. All the rooms have a very beautiful decor. The breakfast is also very good ! When you have breakfast you have a view of the Ramblas ! Their is also a very nice indoor pool ( not many hotels in Barcelona have one ) and fitness! Their are also 4 computer terminals with internet connection and printer for free. Their is also a very nice Pool on the roof with a bar.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: BritishCat
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Barcelona, and we now can say with confidence it’s not the last time! Hotel 1898 is perfectly placed to explore Barcelona – it’s located in the very heart of the town, at never-sleeping La Rambla. The hotel itself is brilliant – very good service (although sometimes a bit slow for a spoiled English taste). Spotless clean and spacious rooms are designed to reflect hotel’s history and an old colonial style, and at the same time use the latest technology – in our room lights could be deemed to a welcome mode, reading mode, TV watching mode and some more! Food was fine as well, especially breakfast on the rooftop terrace – fresh and filling, with a good variety of choices. We had dinner on the terrace as well when arrived – there is a tapas bar there with a wonderful view of Barcelona. It’s worth asking for an advice from a waiter – they are good at recommending tasty local food. We especially liked langoustine with truffles in a light pastry and cayenne pepper potatoes. They also make delicious non-alcoholic cocktails. Apart from terrace bar, the hotel has another restaurant and a bar on the ground floor, a spa and a small swimming pool. It’s worth to stay in for a long weekend, and we definitely going to do just that for the next visit to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: oregon64
Reviews.Content: The 1898 is situated on the busy and noisy Ramblas. It's simply an elegant and wonderful hotel. You have choices of rooms that abut the Ramblas, loomover a church or side streets. We initially had one over the Ramblas but decided that it was a bit noisy. The staff quickly accommodated our request for a more quiet room. If we return to Barcelona, we'd love to stay in the 1898 again. The staff were extremely helpful and responsive to any request. The rooftop dining provides breathtaking views of the city. The menu is fashionable...a bit pricy. There's a very nice rooftop pool and we found it a very relaxing and romantic way to spend the late evening. The 1898 is located near the main cathedral and within easy walking distance of transportation and shopping. There are many small, inexpensive restaurants along the Ramblas and at the rear street there are two tapa bars we'd recommend. During a dinner at one of them, we enjoyed impromptu street performers of flamenco and tango dance. There are also small art galleries on side streets near the cathedral and they are surprisingly inexpensive for some quality art work. We very highly recommend the 1898 for a quality stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect complement to the Barcelona experience”
Reviews.Author: nelliew47
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the TripAdvisor reviews and as usual, were not disappointed! Amazing rooftop pool, fabulous spa, and a delicious breakfast. Our room wasn't ready quite on time so they treated us to a class of Cava and some snacks. The only strange thing about the hotel was the elevator situation. The hotel has three elevators, but only one goes to the rooftop level (where the pool is located) and the lower level (where you can find the spa). The rest only stop on the floors with guest rooms. However all elevators are on the same system, meaning that it was sometimes next to impossible to actually get to the pool/spa. This explanation probably sounds as confusing as it was! However, 1898 is highly recommended - will return here and hopefully next time for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel - just don't buy your kids an ice cream!”
Reviews.Author: JML64
Reviews.Content: Everything positive I read about this hotel was true - it's in a great location (check out the market down the street towards the harbour; an amazing sight) it's quiet, sophisticated and the pool areas, especially the indoor wellness centre (note, only open to 14+) are amazing. However, I do have one complaint and that is the prices at the roof terrace bar. I was prepared to pay over the top prices for drinks in such a location - obviously not something that pleases me but you kind of expect it in a hotel such as this. However, what I do object to is paying a whopping 4 euros for a SHOT GLASS of icecream - that's just taking the mickey!! And the look on my 14 year ols son's face was a picture!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for Barcelona visit”
Reviews.Author: magoo2b
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel 1898 from August 5-9 and loved it! We took the bus from the airport then walked from Place Catalunya to the hotel. While our plane was delayed, the hotel had our request for an early check-in and a king sized bed (one mattress) and had accommodated both. We spend the extra for the deluxe room with a huge balcony. We didn't really have a view but the room was totally quiet - we never heard street noise or neighboring rooms. The room was kept immaculate during our stay. Also, the Internet access was in our room and free. While the room was lovely, the hotel deck and pool were the best part of the hotel. We went up every night for drinks after wandering around town. Yes, the mojitos were expensive, but we figured we were investing in the recipe when the bartenders showed us how to make the amazing Hotel 1898 chili mojito. The downstairs areas were also beautiful and comfortable. We just peeked at the basement pool - it was too hot down there after a hot summer day. The hotel's location was perfect. We had sweated whether we should stay close to Las Ramblas or in the Example district on our first trip to Barcelona. I am VERY glad we chose the hotel for its location. We like to stroll around a lot and the Example was too spread out for that. We never felt threatened or nervous in Las Ramblas and the medieval streets were walker friendly. We walked almost everywhere except up to Park Guell and Montjuic, where we took the very efficient Barcelona subway. We were very happy with our choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: GosforthNewcastle
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four nights at this lovely hotel with my husband and two teenage children. We chose the hotel on the strength of previous reviews and were delighted with quality of this hotel. The decor, staff and facilities were exceptional, we especially appreciated the sumptuous pool area after a hot days sightseeing. Its not a cheap hotel, drinks and food did add up, but the exchange rate didn't help this and it is a four star hotel after all. If you fancy an elegant get away, right on La Rambla, this is absolutely the place for you. KA Newcastle upon Tyne

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, extremely well located, perfect retreat!”
Reviews.Author: cabernetsue
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at Hotel 1898 for my husband's birthday, and I booked a Superior room. The room was extemely well fitted, but a little smaller than I had expected. The bathroom was lovely. We looked out over a side road off Las Ramblas, so it was beautifully quiet too. The pool area is fabulous and has a funky bar with day beds you can chill out on. The staff are extremely pleasant and willing to help. We had breakfast on the roof terrace; it was amazing - there was so much food of great quality, and the Cava was flowing! The bar in the lobby is also very good. A very chilled place to relax after walking miles around Barcelona! A perfect peaceful sanctuary after you've had enough of the craziness of Las Ramblas! Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great hotel, scrimps on finishing touches”
Reviews.Author: jivedriver
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with parents and disabled sister. Outstanding hotel, clean, modern, good location on the Ramblas with restaurants close by. Pool and sun terrace excellent with unbeatable city views. Hotel quite pricey E199 for classic room, although we got a deal which made breakfast only E15 pp. The breakfast is extensive and excellent there is nothing missing. The only criticism we have is that for the price of the hotel it lacks fine details, compared with other similar hotels in other main spanish cities, for example each room is issued with one bottle of water at the beginning of the stay only, there are no ironing facilities in the room and none to borrow, only an ironing service charging per item. The classic rooms look onto a small poorly lit courtyard, however there was no noise during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel could not have been any better...”
Reviews.Author: roberthelen_9
Reviews.Content: Lived UP TO ALL Expectations Many Previous Reveiws WereTotally Correct 2 Fantastic Pool Areas.Yea 21 Euros For Breakfast But Open 7 Till 11 EatAS Much As U Like Including Champagne On ice Salmon ,Fresh Strawberries Egs Bacon Hams Etc Etc Just Look On Thier Website For Photos.We Had Our Teenage Girls With Us They Loved The Wifi For Laptops Had Two Classic Rooms On 4th Floor No Problems.The Hotel Is Spotless From Top To Bottom And Has Fresh Fragrence's Everywhere.Staff Ever So Helpful .We Had To Be Out By 12 But Did Not Fly Till Evening Asked If We Could Keep A Room On Longer Unfortunatley They Had Full Occupacey That Day But Head Guy On Desk Organised Holding Our Luggage Told Us Showers Toilets Etc Available And Full Use Of All Facilities Still Available WHAT .Air Conditioning Fantastic In Rooms And Rest Of Hotel.Yea You can Find Cheaper Hotels But This Is What it Says On The Tin Loation etc Mint.I booked direct with hotel on web no probs card details left and pay when u check out.if you want any more info i would be more than happy to help..

Reviews.Title: “Hotel perfection- an oasis of calm on the Rambla”
Reviews.Author: tshirtsuntan
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel. It lived up to all our expectations, which after reading all the reviews on tripadvisor were pretty high! Can't recommend staying here enough...as soon as we stepped into the immaculate, ice cool reception from the hectic Ramblas we knew we were going to love the place. The location is really central and easy to find, the hotel fronts onto the Rambla about a 3 minute walk from Placa Catalunya where the aerobus drops off from the airport. We had a Deluxe room with terrace for our stay. The terrace was worth the small extra cost and perfect for relaxing, sunbathing and eating breakfast outdoors before a hard days sightseeing. The room interior is of a very high standard, bed massive and very comfortable. From the terrace you can hear a little noise from the Ramblas (the rooms with terraces are at the back and side of the building) but as soon as you close the door there is complete quiet in the room. The rooftop pool is nice, a little small, but the panoramic views of the city from the top floor are great. The bar area is good too but very quiet and low key, perhaps because it is so expensive?? Approx 13 euros for a cocktail. The single best thing about this hotel as far as we were concerned is the spa area in the basement. The pool is housed in the dimly lit old brick cellar and has therapy jets, water beds, a jacuzzi area, sauna and steam room, surrounded by comfy seats. Its pure luxury and relaxation and much less busy than the pool on the roof- we went down twice at approx 4pm and had the whole place to ourselves. Will definitely be staying here next time we are in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Simply superb”
Reviews.Author: Nolnoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for four nights at the beginning of August. Everything was perfect - be it location, the hotel itself and the staff. In fact I have never come across staff at a hotel as helpful. Rooms are spotless, are cleaned daily, with the bed also prepared at night time. Views from the roof top terrace were a highlight and it's location in central Barcelona made all sights readily accessible. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: jimalbe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel based on reviews on this site. It was a very nice hotel. The one complaint we had was that the hotel made alot of crackling noises at night. We think it was the wood floors expanding. It was loud enough for us to really notice. Other than that, everything was beautiful. The rooftop pool was the best part. Not sure the price matched the hotel, but it didn't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: dc1114
Reviews.Content: As far as European hotels go, this hotel was high class and worth the money. The rooftop lounge bar was absolutely amazing. The staff was attentive and accomodating. The internet was easily accessible (and free). The rooms and lobby decor were so classic and tastefully done. The hotel is perfectly located...all the major sites/areas were within reach, especially since it was close to the transporation hub, Placa de Catalunya. If I came back to Barcelona, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location Integrity and Comfortabe Elegance - H1898 is stellar !”
Reviews.Author: ckhonolulu
Reviews.Content: I am a world traveller - my standards are high . H1898 exceeded our expectations. Althought this is a first rate and elegant property, the atmosphere is a casual, welcoming elegance Often times European Hotel rooms are closet size...not here. The upgrade to Superior room is well worth it - although after peeking into an interior room, they are roomy however nothing like the superior rooms - for just a bit more Euro. All staff at the front desk are top rate professionals. We were able to check in early - but do not expect this to be the case for you, as this hotel is highly sought out by savvy travellers and maintains a very high occupancy. I mention this as I witnessed a rather crass American ( of course) making an utter fool of himself with insisting being given a room at 9 am. The staff was un-flappable and handled it with class. The catacomb spa and pool is refreshing after a long day out - wrap yourself in the plush robes provided then make your way up to the 7th floor pool and terrace bar to enjoy a sangria, sunset and the skyline views. The LeMeridien across the street does not have a pool and friends of ours were not only disappointed with this but also the size of rooms and they paid almost E100 more. Take the Aero Bus for an easy trip into BCN - Get 4 day Metro Card and enjoy - after a second day in BCN both my partner and I realized that we would not try to see everything in our 7 days as we would be returning to this enchanting city and to H1898.

Reviews.Title: “1898 was pretty much perfect”
Reviews.Author: awayweekender
Reviews.Content: We decided to move here after spending our first night in Barcelona in another highly rated (according to tripadvisor) hotel. The 1898 was miles better. It's 160+ rooms are recently (2005) refurbished, it commands a good location, and offers most creature comforts. Here are a few minor areas which could be improved: (1) many rooms are quite small, and despite the hotel's claims that rooms were specially soundproofed (100% wooden floors certainly do not help here), noise levels from adjacent rooms and corridors can be substantial, (2) shower water temperature can take a while to regulate. (3) aircon controls were inside an inadequately-lit cupboard, though still easy to operate. (4) lights are operated by a chip in the room key, so at noon on your checkout day the lights can go out as you're packing. This is a problem if, like us, you have one of the standard rooms facing into one of two tight courtyards. Whilst these are quieter (no street noise), they lack sufficient natural light. Here's a longer list of what's really, really good: (1) Rooms are very well lit (spotlights/lamps with four "mood settings") (2) Built in safes (not standard in all 4star hotels in Barcelona) (3) Electric kettles and tea/coffee provided in rooms (4) A leaflet encourages guests to choose from a pillow menu (see photo) (5) Mattresses are firm, cotton sheets have hi quality feel, towels/robes seem new (6) Decent selection of programmes on sharp flatscreen LCD TVs (7) Aircon works efficiently (digital thermostat plus Hi/Lo sessing), and is silent and odorless (8) Convenient to have both overhead 'rain shower head' and a hand shower (but no bidet) (9) Basement spa area (sauna,steam,pool), whilst small, is clean and rarely busy (10) Reception staff are well trained, responsive and speak good english (11) Rooftop terrace spans the entire footprint of the building... very large chillout/tanning area, and mostly overlooked by .. nobody. (12) Whilst shallow, rooftop pool is large enough for a few strokes each way (13) Views from rooftop are virtually uninterrupted (only Sagrada Familia is not visible) (14) Four PCs/internet available 24h for guest use in common area, one with printer (15) Free wireless broadband in all rooms (16) Breakfast buffet better than most hotels of similar standard in BCN, choice of filter coffee or self-service Nespresso machine at breakfast, and made-to-order eggs (ours were perfect) (17) Unusually high ceilings on all floors add feel of sophistication (18) Lobby area is a well-cooled haven from the summer heat (19) Location is exceptional ... directly on the Ramblas, one block from fruit market, big Carrefour next door, Plaza Catalunya just 250 paces away, old town & Cathedral very close, two metro stations (Liceu,PC) visible when you step outside the hotel ... this is probably the optimal spot to be as a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, so-so standard rooms”
Reviews.Author: john_matrix
Reviews.Content: The good: -Great location (although la rambla is not a very enjoyable place) -Wonderful roof terrace with pool where many hours were spent just relaxing and enjoying the wonderful view -Great spa section -Nice decor and botique feel -Great breakfast - we found out that the epress breakfast at the hotel (~10eur) was much better than Lobo's breakfast. The bad was unfortunately our room (standard room): - It was way too dark - almost no daylight flowing in (the room was on the 2nd floor facing the other parts of the hotel building), and with only spotlights designed to keep the room fancy but dark. So it was not really enjoyable hanging out in the room and there was no way to tell the outside weather. Felt a bit like a basement room.. -The bed consisted of two cheap-feeling small beds with wheels which where pushed together to form a twin-bed, but which came apart as soon as one moved due to the wheels. I.e. no way to sleep next to one another.. I guess we just had bad luck and that they don't have the same beds in every room given that no one else seems to complain about the beds.. -Although the room was soundproofed so you did not hear other rooms, you did hear every little thing coming from outside your door, which included all the noise the cleaners made when they started their work early in the morning. On our floor there was also some sort of conference room which meant that a lot of people who did not stay at the hotel were passing our door and making noise in the evening.. -Small room which basically only had rooms for the beds and a table and our luggage.. But not a big problem.. If we would have stayed at the hotel during a colder period and would have liked to spend more time in the room I would not stay at this hotel (at least not in the standard rooms) and would probably give it a lower rating. But since it was summer and we spent most of our hotel-time at the incredible roof terrace, I have to give it a 4. If the room had been better I'd give it a 5. I think the price was rather good for the overall experience and the location. Oh and P.S, I left behind a sweater at the roof terrace one day and when I went back to retrieve it a couple of hours later it was mysterously gone and never again found. It's so strange, because I'm 100% positive I left it there and all the other guests seemed like nice & honest people, so I cannot figure out who could have taken it... Anyway my tip is not to leave things unattended for too long at the terrace...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelTidge
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! We were staying for 6 days in Barcelona and were looking for a hight quality hotel that was a great place to chill out but also was central and had great places to eat out etc nearby. This is perfect for that. The quality of the decor and rooms is very high. Our standard room was on the small side (especially the bathroom) but was as advertised. We had zero external noise (from outside the hotel) but we were on the back. Internal noise was a slight problem, perhaps the door could have been better soundproofed? A very monor moan though because we didn't spend a lot of time in the room. Why? Well the roof terrace and pool was amazing, we spent a lot of time there. Drinks weren't cheap (14e for a cocktail) but that is the best Mojito I've had in a long time, perfect for a sunny day. The cellar spa although not massive is really great too and brill for de-stressing. Knowing that we had these to come back to after a day in the sun sightseeing etc was bliss. In summary this place is excellent. A little pricey but if you fancy a splurge it's worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location and Elegance - Fantastic stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: jvachon
Reviews.Content: We stayed a few nights recently at the Hotel 1898 and had an amazing time. First, the location simply can't be beat. You are right on La Rambla, just about a block from Placa Catalunya, but the rooms are nicely soundproofed so when you head to bed at night you really can't hear a thing. Second, the decor and design really blew us away - the late 19th century tobacco plantation theme is carried through every single detail. I've read a few of the negative reviews and really can't believe we stayed at the same hotel. Get this - I posted on Twitter that I was having trouble uploading photos for family back home because wireless (free) was spotty in our room. I got a tweet back in 30 mins from reception offering to loan me an ethernet cable so I could get on their wired network. Amazing. Lastly, nothing beats hopping into a refreshing pool with amazing views after a long, hot day seeing the city. And if you'd prefer to relax there's also a basement pool that's equally as enjoyable. We didn't visit the attached restaurant but then again, when you're in Barcelona why wouldn't you walk the 100 metres behind the hotel and get some authentic, well priced Catalan fare?

Reviews.Title: “One of Europe's best hotels”
Reviews.Author: Louai_AZ
Reviews.Content: It's a luxury hotel and I have no idea why this is not a 5 stars hotel; it could be because the Hotel lacks an outdoor swimming pool. My recommendation for those who plan to stay at the Hotel is to avoid staying in rooms overlooking the La Rambla; not only because of the noise of the busy strip but most importantly because of the underground metro, which passes under the La Rambla every 2 minutes and mildly shakes everything on top of it. This all boils down to the fact that the sound isolation in the Hotel may need some improvement. However, again this is one of the most luxury hotels I have ever been to in Europe, and far much better than five stars hotels in Spain itself. Rooms are spacious and the location of the Hotel is the best in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: tabithaEngland
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1898 is an oasis of calm in a lively,vibrant and colourful city . The location is in the heart of tourist Barcelona and as with any such a location you will get to see all walks of life (an open mind is necessary for the Ramblas, particularly late at night) and is great for people watching. We had no problems with the petty crime that Barcelona seems to be associated with and the location provides plenty of choice for eating, drinking and sight seeing. It was the perfect location for us. The hotel itself was peaceful and relaxing and the lounge area by the bar was a great place to enjoy the complementary afternoon tea and biscuits after a hectic day of sightseeing. The spa area and indoor pool with it's multi jet massagers was also ideal for unwinding before going out again later in the evening ( many restaurants don't seem to get going much before about 9 pm) and was never busy. Staff in all areas of the hotel were always friendly,professional and polite. We had a superior room with a small Juliette balcony overlooking a square to the rear of the hotel. This is a lively square with good bars and restaurants frequented by many locals as well as tourists and we could certainly feel the buzz of the city by being able to stand and watch all that went on there. However, come night time, good double glazing made sure that we heard nothing from it and come the morning we were down there having our breakfast in Bar Lobo which offered a great choice in a great location for a great price. Definitely better value than the hotel breakfast at 20 euros per person. We used the rooftop for evening drinks and daytime sunbathing and felt like we were a million miles from the hubbub outside of the hotel and the views of Barcelona and it's surroundings are stunning. If we are ever in Barcelona again we wouldn't even consider looking for somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Corie10
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and our room was ready. Very accomodating and extremely helpful desk staff. Loved the 7th floor pool - could have stayed longer. Beautifully decorated with couches and umbrellas for shade. Room was typical European and the bath was very modern. Free computer and internet access helped too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: mayla
Reviews.Content: First, why would you name a hotel after the year you lost a war? The decor is all about that time period, and is very dark. The views from the roof were good, but the pool is slightly larger than a bathtub. The best feature of this hotel is the underground pool connected to the spa. If I had it to do again, I would not stay anywhere near La Rambla. After spending a few days in quiet dignified Madrid, Barcelona seemed like Coney Island by the sea. However, to its credit, inside the Hotel 1898 was cool and quiet. If you like noise and a crush of tourists, La Rambla is for you. If not, find another neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Ouch -- Mean Staff”
Reviews.Author: ajatravel
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed four nights in June. The location is good and the price seemed right. For the first two nights my daughter and I stayed together in one room. My husband was to join us for the third and fourth nights. When I checked-in I informed the hotel staff that my husband would be joining us. Gosh, I feel that I am such a nice and easy going person and we would pay a little extra and everything would be fine. That was a wrong assumption. The person at the desk was extremely insistent that we would have to pay for an additional room at a very high rate. There was no give, and they were not pleasant about the situation in anyway. They told us that we were "breaking the law" and they turned-off the power to our room to force us to pay! Wow, now that is tough! I really think that they don't want families with children -- so that maybe a plus for some. So lots of bad karma here and it is hard to separate this experience from the other aspects of the hotel. Generally speaking I do feel that there is a very uptight and perhaps some bias toward Americans. I would avoid this hotel. There are plenty other options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel with few flaws”
Reviews.Author: pandpCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit and the hotel was great. All the staff were helpful and friendly and spoke English well. We arrived from the airport around 10 a.m., and one of our rooms were immediately made available to us while the other took a couple hours to be ready, we had both our rooms well before the normal check in. The location on La Rambla is great for exploring this area of the city and the rooms were spotless and the entire hotel very clean. Yes, some street noise can be heard from our rooms that front on La Rambla, but that is life in this part of Barcelona. Can't say enough about this classy and very cool hotel; its great.

Reviews.Title: “We want to stay forever!”
Reviews.Author: the_ashley_wanderers
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in an excellent location. Beautiful decor, gorgeous rooms, a superb spa hidden in the basement, and best of all - floor 7, a magnificent roof terrace with chic bar, glorious pool and fantastic views. If you can ever tear yourself away from the roof, you are central enough to walk to most of the key sites. We'd been to Barcelona before, and having an oasis like the roof terrace to retreat to after hours walking the streets or painting the tiles red is invaluable. A bit more pricey than many others, but based on the amount of time that we spent enjoying the hotel, worth every penny. Just don't order too many cocktails unless you've won the lottery.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: UKJA
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona for 4 nights as an extended city break. The hotel is located on La Rambla (which is semi-pedastrianised at this point) - an ideal central location for seeing the city. We asked for quiet rooms and we got them - virtually no noise from outside, despite being at the heart of the action. The rooms we so quiet that we all managed to sleep in after a late night out. The rooms were very well appointed, with lots of nice finishing touches: kettle - unusual for the continent-, slippers, dressing gowns, nice toiletries, clean towels & turn down service in the evening, free wireless internet, pillow menu, large comforatable bed, clever lighting system, marble bathroom, safe, frridge (which you can put your own stuff in) etc, etc Our highlight was the roof-terrace. Great for some unhassled sunbathing during the day (no fighting for sun-beds here), we particularly enjoyed early evening drinks and nibbles at the bar. Whilst the bar prices are very expensive, this did keep the numbers down and made for quite an exclusive experience. In our view it was worth every cent! All in all, a great stay and a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Nice with a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: leblanc666
Reviews.Content: We booked a privilege room in this hotel. When we booked we asked for a room, not with a red interiour and not at the ramblas. When we arrived we got a room on the 6th floor just beside the elevator. The first thing we noticed was how small it was in comparance with the photo's on the internet. So we didn't believe this was a privilege room. We went downstairs to get some explanation about this. The lady at the desk told us it was a privilege room but after asking for another room we were provided with 3 choices. One with the red interiour, one on the 4th floor at the ramblas and one one the 3th floor at the ramblas. We looked at all three rooms. First the one with the red interiour, It was much bigger than the room on the 6th floor, but it was red. So we dropped that option. The one on the fourth floor was very nice and looked like the one on the internet. We thought... perfect. But although it is a smoke-free hotel some idiot guest smoked in this room. So we decided to take the one on the third floor wich was exactly the same. They were very helpfull with that. We thought it was a perfect room but after about 10 minutes in the room another flaw came up.... the metro under the ramblas. You can hear/feel the metro passing underneath the hotel. The hotel can't do nothing about it. But the could have warned us about it. We got used to it but it wasn't nice the first day. Cleaning was good, service was ok. Room was perfect. Cons. Don't take a room at the ramblas on the third and fourth floor. You can hear the metro and the church clock banging every 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice Before Booking”
Reviews.Author: jk9999
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel based on the number of good recommendations found at this site. Unfortunately, our experience was not so good. Our room on the fourth floor was very small and cramped. Pipes from the upper floors ran through a square pillar in one of the walls. Each time someone above flushed it sounded like our room was going to flood. We found a large degree of variance in the helpfulness of the staff -- management and front desk staff seemed simply uninterested at at times. While the pool looks nice (and it is) it is a very quiet and subdued and the staff is particularly vigilant about uphold hotel "laws" related to the spa area. While this may be a recommendation for some -- this hotel is not for families or young adults. Bring your book and finest dress clothes and be prepared to socialize like a monk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: scottca075
Reviews.Content: I couldn't get into the Palace, because they are doing a renovation and have limited rooms, but a friend from Universal recommended this place. What a gem! They have everything I look for in a business hotel, a nice workout facility, a pool, restaurant on site and all were more than acceptable. it was also within walking distance to a lot of great little bars and restaurants that one of the bellman steered me to. I couldn't have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets???”
Reviews.Author: mrblain
Reviews.Content: As good as it gets...Im affraid not. we stayed at this hotel and found it to be just average. the spar is nice after a day of walking, and the roof top breakfast was very good. the room was ok but not 5 star. Breakfast served in the resturant was cold, yes cold eggs, along with poor service and any additional food or drink taken on the roof is very expensive. their web site is not a good representation of how your stay will be. Clean and in a good location that all it has to offer, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: getarounds
Reviews.Content: Just completed a 3 day stay at the 1898. Fantastic location for all of Barcelona's main sites. We walked everywhere and it was never more than a nice 30 minute stroll. The hotel itself is very nice. The rooftop pool and deck area is a fantastic place to unwind but be warned the drink prices are high! We had a very good breakfast one morning on the rooftop and it was also pricey. The views however make you forget the cost. Our room was always clean and the bed was very comfortable. We faced to the side street and had no problems with noise from the Ramblas at all. Bathroom was spacious and the room was a decent size as well. Only complaint was a foul ordor in the bathroom that came and went. Others have commented on it as well. Couple of hints...Have breakfast at Cafe Lobo behind the hotel. Very good and not expensive. We also scored at a great outdoor cafe at Placa Real named Les Quinzenites. Marvelous food especially the chicken croquettes and a wonderful atmosphere. It's about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. All in all an excellent value for the cost and a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The greatest hotel I have ever been to!!!”
Reviews.Author: Squirrel2009
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I am very surprised that this hotel only has 4 stars as it is more luxurious than many 5-star hotels! The standart room is reasonable in its size, has a great spacious bathroom. You can be dissapointed if you book superior room as it is just the same as standart one. The breakfast is a little bit expensive but very good. The Rambla is not very noisy - we were staying in standart room and we could not hear any noise from the street. The location of the hotel is really excellent!!! I was really amazed by colonial style of this hotel. I have stayed there only for 3 nights but I would like to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fair price for centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: New Canaan Mom
Reviews.Content: A great place to relax while still being in the heart of La Rambla and walking distance to many attractions/restaurants. Large room for Europe. Nice amenities. Basic pool/exercise room/spa. Parking garage incredible steep and windy. Staff adequate. Great rooftop bar. Computer and printer available free of charge. Don't waste money on breakfast or breakfast included or any packages.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: SLS1978
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful. They spoke English and was very social. The staff provided assistance regarding directions to various places, great sites; and recommendations to the best eateries, clubs, and shopping areas. I must say they were very accommodating. The rooftop bar was the highlight of the hotel, during our down time. The drinks were a little pricey. However, the view from the Roof Top was beautiful. The hotel was in the perfect location. My only issue with the hotel is that the rooms were pretty small. However, this appears to be the norm with European hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: LadyJulie
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at Hotel 1898, having chose it based on its location and great reviews on this site, and had a lovely stay. We were very fortunate to have a room ready for us upon our early arrival at 11:00am. The hotel staff was very friendly and provided good service overall. The location is right on La Rambla, which is bustling at all hours (be aware of this when choosing a room facing the street). We were just a short walk to Plaza Catalunya, another busy area where you can find a number of shops, restaurants, tourist buses, and a metro station. We also found a number of restaurants along the side streets near our hotel. You can walk to the Barri Gotic area, which also offers great restaurants and sights. A bonus was having a supermarket a block from the hotel, but be aware it and many shops are closed on Sunday! We always felt safe, despite all of the reports of crime in the area. The "classic" room itself was a bit small, but the bathroom was quite roomy and provided a nice variety of complimentary amenities. The maid service was excellent and the room was very clean. We had a really nice surprise and found a small terrace off our room (room 205- and all along our hall had them), so we were able to enjoy a bottle of wine night outside, enjoying the night air. The only downside was that our room backed up to a building with a restaurant, and we could hear the clanging sound of dishes and some voices on and off through the day and up until around midnight. We live in a small city, so these noises were not too disturbing. We only had a few criticisms about the room involving its lack of a clock, no ironing board or iron, and minimal TV channels. We really enjoyed the hotel rooftop terrace/bar, although the service was a bit slow and distant. We didn't use the restaurant or spa, so I can't comment on them. The free wi-fi worked well. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a great stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Central Location”
Reviews.Author: qaz123
Reviews.Content: This is well designed hotel in a central and convenient location. Located on the Ramblas and a short walk from the Raval and Barri Gotic, this hotel served as a convenient base for exploring Barcelona. We were booked in a "Classic" room, which was small but thoughtfully laid out and attractively furnished. The room had a small flat screen television that got a couple English language channels, a writing desk, a closet and a small bathroom with one vanity and a tub/shower combination with glass enclosure. The water pressure in the shower was quite weak, but other than that, there wasn't much to complain about. Those who like larger hotel rooms should definitely look into a higher room category. The best feature of the hotel was certainly the rooftop lounge and pool area and basement pool and spa area (including steam and sauna). These recreation areas offered different experiences--lots of sun on the roof and a sort of quiet zone in the basement--that we greatly appreciated after spending the day touring the city. There is a small but completely serviceable gym that looks onto the indoor pool in the basement. I would come here again solely because of the rooftop and basement recreation areas. I think few hotels in the city offer such a wide range of options for swimming and relaxing as this hotel does, particularly at this price point and in this central location. Service was good--they made reservations at restaurants when we asked them to and aslo answered other questions that we had. Housekeeping was also seamless--they made a morning and evening visit to the rooms. Everything was spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault the hotel”
Reviews.Author: IntotheblueUK
Reviews.Content: Ok i booked this hotel as a treat for my girlfriends birthday, and i thought it was excellent throughout. Stayed in 5* hotels around the world and have to say this up there with the best. I believe its the small things that make a hotel great. Arrived at 10am, room wasnt ready however they took my number and phoned me an hour later on my mobile to tell me room was ready for me. Fantastic room that overlooked the ramblas. Very spacious and all rooms have their own style. Had knock on the door in the afternoon to ask if we required any fresh towels even though we still had fresh ones from the morning. Staff very helpful throughout. Was given free cocktails on the wonderful roof terrace as bar staff were busy and apologised for delay in serving my drinks. Although its a fairly big hotel you are made to feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but disappointing in several ways”
Reviews.Author: Lulumary123
Reviews.Content: I booked us at Hotel 1898 mostly on the strength of the reviews here. We were looking for comfort, style and a convenient location in Barcelona. I had phoned the hotel about a month in advance to let them know that our Delta flight would be arriving at 8am, well before check-in, and asked them to accommodate us. The second person I spoke with assured me it would be no problem. When we arrived we were told there was no way we could check in early and were basically told to amuse ourselves for three hours. We were not offered breakfast or even coffee - nothing. We sat in the lobby then moved to the rooftop when it opened, where we were simply ignored. You can't get just coffee up there, they make you order a very expensive full meal or nothing. Our first day, the room was cleaned TWICE, which is great in a hotel of this caliber - I mean, we paid about $300 a night. The second day, the room was not even cleaned once, we arrived back at 7pm to no towels or clean sheets. We were not given an apology, just a lame excuse and not a very polite one at that. This time I said, "so, can you maybe buy us a drink or something so we have something to do while you clean our room?" We were given a voucher for the rooftop, which is indeed a nice place to hang out. But I would definitely characterize the staff as less than pleasant, especially when compared to most people in Barcelona, who are generally very kind and friendly to foreigners who are cool to them. Our room itself was comfortable, but yes, the Rambla is EXTREMELY noisy. Please don't delude yourselves folks, even if the bars close at 3am the noise continues until dawn EVERY NIGHT (we were on the 4th floor and it actually kept us up even with the windows closed). If you are the partying kind it may be just the thing you want but we didn't dig it at all. Very popular hangout for football hooligan-types of every nationality. Also, the street is sprinkled with shady types and street kids, BE AWARE. The market is lovely, get your breakfast there instead of paying 22 euros (as of this writing, about 30 dollars) for a relatively decent breakfast. Loved the electric kettles in the rooms and the complementary tea and coffee. We are an adventurous, but not ultra-partying couple in our 40s who came for the art, food and beautiful architecture. Next time we'll stay somewhere in the Born and I would recommend that if you have similar interests.

Reviews.Title: “Research Paid Off”
Reviews.Author: bob_96
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Tripadvisor, I decided to book the night before our Mediterranean cruise at this hotel. It did not disappoint - this is a top shelf hotel! We arrived on a red-eye from JFK at 7:30 AM and took a taxi to the hotel just to drop off our bags. Imagine our reaction when they said our rooms were ready! The staff couldn't have been more helpful and everyone spoke English. The only blemish during our stay was trying to get service up on the rooftop terrace. We waited 20 minutes just for a waiter to take our order then waited another 30 minutes for a drink. It would have been longer but I got up to complain. This was around 11 PM and there were only two other couples there. The lobby bar was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Tessari
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a must if you are visiting barcelona. The staff was thoughtful and courteous--it was my fiance's 30th birthday and the director sent a fruit bowl and bottle of cava to our room on arrival. There were a couple of glitches and the staff fixed them right away. We booked the deluxe room with a terrace--room 533--had one of the larger terraces--and it was so nice to sit out there and relax. The room itself was huge, even by American standards. Lots of amenities, even a toothbrush and toothpaste if you forgot yours! We also took advantage of the rooftop pool and the ground floor spa area--both were clean, water was heated and very relaxing. The hotel lobby is beautiful--really nice decor and the perfect place to relax while waiting for someone. The location is incredible...we were so close to museums, restaurants, and shopping. I also highly recommend the rooftop brunch if you are visiting during the summer. We truly enjoyed every moment of our stay and the hotel really helped us make my fiance's 30th birthday special.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: holsrus24
Reviews.Content: Arrived after midnight after a really traumatic journey. On checking in we were told that we had been given a complimentary upgrade to de-luxe room. This room was wonderful with a terrace with table and chairs and 2 beds to sunbathe. The hotel is in a fantastic location and we did not feel threatened at any time during our stay. All the staff were friendly from the moment we checked in until the moment we departed. The hotel oozes quality and whilst some people commented on the cost all I would say is you only get what you pay for. So a big thank you to everyone at the hotel for making our fist visit to Barcelona so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a first class location”
Reviews.Author: JRLP
Reviews.Content: It isn't "world class" or like a Four Seasons, but H1898 is a great hotel in a fantastic location (if you're a tourist, as we were). Formerly an old warehouse, it's been beautifully converted into a very comfortable and (for want of a better word) "trendy" designer-style hotel. But is also has good facilities; e.g. 2 swimming pools, a gym, free wifi, etc. We had a Classic room, which was comfortable and attractive, with all the facilities we needed -- but wasn't large! It didn't matter, since we spent little time in the room (except when asleep!). The location is terrific: near the top end of Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “the best, wonderful, relaxing, spotless, expensive”
Reviews.Author: D0nnaM
Reviews.Content: Our 3rd stay at 1898, we will return again and again, we have reccomended 1898 to all our family and friends, best for location, style. 1898 is right on "La Ramblas" perfect for all the restaurants and nightlife. The roof top terrace and pool area is a superb advantage point for viewing the whole of the city, Both the cellar pool and roof pool are superb. All staff are polite friendly and extremely proffesional. Having said all that the cost of our stay was way above our budget (very expensive hotel) however worth saving up for. Well done Hotel 1898 xx

Reviews.Title: “Service could have been better!”
Reviews.Author: bainso
Reviews.Content: We asked for early check-in, but when we arrived there was only a twin room available. I asked for one of their larger Classic (Standard) rooms & was told that there was one on the 3rd floor, but we would have to come back at 3 pm. They stored our luggage & told us that we could relax on the roof which had plenty of comfortable places to rest with a bar, pool & a nice view of the city. Drinks are expensive. We decided to check out La Ramblas which is right out the door of the hotel. La Boqueria is a short walk down the street. Lots to see & do as soon as you leave the hotel. Perfect location! When we got back we were a little disappointed because if this was one of their larger rooms, I would hate to be stuck in their smaller rooms. The bed was 2 beds pushed together, but it was perfectly fine & comfortable. There was a desk/chair, bench to put our luggage on, a small stuffed chair with glass table, a flat screen TV & a closet with a kettle/cups & instant coffee & tea. There was a mini bar & an in-room safe. For 3 days we had trouble with that safe. The first time we could not get it open & we had to wait for the front desk to send someone up to open it so we could get our cash/camera. We were told that it was the battery & they replaced it & we were finally able to get our cash/camera to go sightseeing. Unfortunately, the same thing happened the next morning when we were ready to go out for the day. Again, they sent someone up & they had trouble opening it & told us we could leave & they would get it open...huh, leave without our money/camera!!! They again got it open & said maintenance would be up, but suggested we put our stuff in the lock box in back of the front desk. I told them one of the reasons we picked Hotel 1898 was that we had a safe in the room. Again, they said it was fixed, but again the same thing happened. I put some of our cash/valuables in the lock box, but after the 3rd time was afraid to lock things in the in-room safe since we wasted so much of our time trying to get someone to either open or close it. No one from management suggested they replace the in-room safe or find us another room...frustrating! Also, the night before we were to leave we asked for a wake-up call for 6 am....no call & luckily one of us was up by 6:20 am. When we told them we did not get the call, they said it was automatic. I saw the girl write it in a book. I did not think that they should question us..why would we say we did not get the call??? There was no clock in the room. The bathroom was beautiful..all green marble & plenty of hot water. The towels were very large & thick & robes & slippers are provided. Also, the toiletries were about the best we have gotten in Europe, shampoo, body wash, body lotion, small bar of soap, comb, razor/cream, toothbrushes/small toothpaste, shoe shine sponge & cotton balls & Q-tips....nice! The spa area is lovely with a nice pool. Even if you don't use their spa services check out the grotto-like pool area. They have turn down service with chocolates with nuts. The bar area is nice & comfortable. I liked the fact that we had to use our key in the elevator to go upstairs to our room. The TV had very little programs in English. There was only 1 small drawer & that drawer did not open completely. All & all this is a lovely hotel in a great location for sightseeing. Close to the subway & within walking distance of a lot of the top sights. We spent a lot of time in the restaurants in Placa Reial.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant choice - the best on La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: ebennstl
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1898 was a splurge for the first part of our honeymoon to Spain, and it was worth every penny. As noted here, it's just a wonderfully luxurious retreat from the craziness of La Rambla. Steps from the Boqueria market, it's an elegant hotel that's quiet, plush and stylish. Our deluxe room was big, the bed was incredibly comfortable and our outdoor terrace was the perfect place to relax at the end of the day before dinner. We also loved the rooftop terrace and pool (seriously, don't miss the mojitos), and the spa/fitness center, which doesn't get much press, is gorgeous, with a steam room, sauna, pool and workout room. Don't listen to the reviews that call the staff a bit chilly -- we found them to be warm and kind. They even surprised us with a free bottle of cava waiting for us in our room -- a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: mtjtkd
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this hotel. It's in a good location and has nice amenities, but I've never had worse service anywhere. It's also expensive. Save your money and stay somewhere that wants your business. This place obviously doesn't.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant location and suberb facilities, highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: sjl115
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the end of May for 3 nights. We paid for a superior room and we were not disapointed. All the facialites were excellant. We have breakfast in the hotel 2 mornings, it was expensive at 20 euros but there was plenty of choice. The prices for thr restuarant and bar etc were high but it is a 4* hotel. All the staff were polite and very helpful. Would definatley go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lots of good attributes, some concerns”
Reviews.Author: huldawoman
Reviews.Content: My husband and a friend and I stayed in the Hotel 1898 for 4 nights in May. We had two rooms, one in the front and one in the back over a small tapas restaurant in the street below. It is an excellent location, right on the Ramblas. The hotel windows are tight enough that the street noises were not a problem. The mattress and pillows and sheets were top notch. The staff was friendly and professional. there were a few concerns or peculiarities that are worth mentioning. First, when I asked for an iron and board the staff told me "this isn't allowed in hotels in Spain" - that was a bogus excuse - we easily got irons and boards in other hotels we stayed and hotels that were a great deal older than the 1898. Second, they accepted 3 reservations for spa services and just before we arrived they announced that the pool and spa area was going to go under some maintenance. We arrived for the services, thinking that the maintenance would be over, but even in the early evening it was impossible to have relaxing services. Fortunately the spa person suggested we not try to go ahead with the service. The hotel should have had the courtesy to cancel us and offer another session time or at least a complimentary hotel service in exchange for not being able to meet our reservation and our expectation after a long trans-atlantic flight. AND we were not able to use these services that were part of the hotel amenities and there was no discount or compiimentary service in exchange. Finally, when we departed the front desk screwed up on a mini-bar charge that was their screw-up. We had already checked out with a sizable bill for 2 rooms on a credit card and the front desk wanted us to cough up $10 cash to settle their mistake. The front desk should have had enough discretion to drop the issue and take the less than $10 "hit" that was of their own making. The poor front desk guy was absolutely in fear of the manager not accepting his mistake and that I should be sure and take care of it. Again, the hotel should have just said "sorry for even this inconvenience and here is a bottle of Spanish olive oil or wine for your time". Those negatives were just unprofessional for a hotel that should be top notch. Final note - don't be tricked by the beautiful photo of the rooftop pool. It was a soaking area - probably not more than 4' deep and not more than 12' x 24' or smaller. Anyway, there is no way you do anything but cool down from a break in the sun and the water is warm. We were under the impression from the photos that we could at least stretch our bodies in the pool and that was impossible. The lower pool was under maintenance so we have no idea whether that could be used for exercise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: drrogi
Reviews.Content: Well appointed, central, helpful staff and beautiful spaces. A great and relaxing place to come home to after exploring of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Our first trip to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: emfeAthens_Georgia
Reviews.Content: This recently renovated hotel had a wonderful location on the Rambla, with an easy walk to the metro and bus stops, and a central location for beginning a day of sight-seeing. The rooms were spacious, well appointed, clean and had an a/c that kept the room very cool. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The buffet breakfast was spectacular and the hotel terrace bar on the roof offered lovely views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: Louisvilletravelers
Reviews.Content: we arrived in Barcelona at 6:30 am after an overnight flight. we were given a room immediately. the staff was helpful and friendly. the rooms were lovely. we booked a package that included reflexology. spa area is beautiful. highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel..just a few glitches!”
Reviews.Author: tuxedo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from May bank holiday weekend at Hotel 1898.Like all the reviewers before me have said, excellent location on the crazy La Ramblas,clean, smart, stylish etc etc The good bits: Stunning "Ralph Lauren" style hotel, very clean and well appointed. Daniel ( David Walliams look a like from Little Britain!!)at the front desk was very helpful with tips on good tapas resturants to great shopping locations, I wanted to pop him in my pocket and take him away as my personal guide!! Roof terrace was very chilled and we spent a lot of time with a lot of Mojitos, which were excellent! The moans and groan..... Our room was very DARK, we were in 410, with a tiny door/window looking into another bedroom, not good enough for the money we paid No over head shower, yet there were instructions in the bathroom telling you how to use "the overhead shower" and what looked like a fixed shower ceiling head, which was infact a vent! Very difficult to wash your hair whilst holding the shower in the other hand and something I would expect to find in a hostal ( not that i have been to one) and not the 3rd best hotel in Barcelona! Not eco friendly - there should be an option to recycle your towels and linens for a the few days we were there. I dont have clean towels every day at home and dont expect it here, they should have spent the money they would save on washing on.....my biggest complaint of all....A COFFEE MACHINE ON THE ROOF TERRACE. I was astounded that it was not possible to get a coffee and a croissant at 10.30am one morning, I was told that they were closing in 30 minutes and the coffee machine had gone! I was told this was a cocktail bar more over than a coffee bar. I find this most strange in all the establishments I have stayed in I have often had afternoon tea or a coffee in the afternoons,let alone a coffee with breakfast yet this is something they could not offer. Not good enough. Then in the afternoon I heard the waitress tell of a Dutch lady who had brought in a Starbucks coffee,"well you dont serve coffee here" was her retort. No olives available with drinks ( in Spain??, with one of the best markets next door??!!) on our last night, only plain and rather boring potato chips. Last time we were in Barcelona we stayed at the Claris, great hotel the area just not as happening.Put the service of the Claris ( and all pool amenties) at Hotel 1898 and it would be perfect! I probably sound a real old moaning minnie, but it is the little things that make a GREAT hotel! Hotel 1898 is great and we really enjoyed ourselves.Just a few little things that pull it down.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location but ROOMS TOO SMALL FOR $400/NT!!!”
Reviews.Author: ellimizani
Reviews.Content: I'm very picky about hotels so please keep this in mind while reading. I chose this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and was somewhat disappointed. For the price, I wasn't incredibly impressed. Yes, the decor overall is beautiful, staff are friendly and helpful and the location is really the best you can get in all of Barcelona, but I was really surprised to see how small the rooms were. I was upset for quite some time after check-in. We had booked a standard room (all that was availalbe online a month in advance) and the staff said a larger room was not avaiable for upgrade when I asked after seeing our room. The lighting/window is situated in such a way that the room can feel a teeny tiny bit like a jail cell. The bathrooms are cute, contemporary and adequate in size. No US electrical outlet in bathroom like other european hotels I've stayed in but they'll bring you an adaptor for free. Spa is great, could compete with any US high end spa. They have both an outdoor and indoor pool, both or which are beautiful. If the room was $250 or $300/nt it would have been totally worth it, but for $400/nt, I think anyone would expect the pretty much the best, and it just wasn't. I don't think this hotel should be as highly rated as it is on Tripadvisor, top 20 or 30, but not #3 or 4 or whatever it is.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel that is centrally located”
Reviews.Author: JJD21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights at the hotel and had a great experience. The location could not be better if you want to be near all the action in Barcelona/Las Ramblas. We could not hear the street noise from our room (which was very clean), found all the facilities to be great and enjoyed a day on the roof enjoying the views and the pool. No complaints at all about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “4-Star Staff, Great Room, Supurb Location”
Reviews.Author: Stargazerm31
Reviews.Content: We flew into to Barcelona two days early for our cruise. We chose H1898 based on Frommer’s and other reviews on this site. We got a great rate due to the booking early and the economy. We chose a Superior room. Our flight from the States arrived early and we took a taxi from the airport to the Hotel. Upon arriving at the hotel around 10 a.m. we where greeted at the door by a friendly staff member who took our luggage. Check-in was a breeze. There where three ladies at the counter. All where very friendly, helpful, and spoke very good English and where happy to tolerate my poor Spanish which I used more than my English. The great thing was our room was ready at 10:00 am. I am sure this is not normal but we where happy to get in our room. We where in room 605. It was a very nice room. It overlooked the courtyard in the church next door. It was quite there and we really didn’t get any of the noise from La Rambla. The rooms are very nice but small for the price. Still there is plenty of room and we found the bed to be very comfortable. The AC is a little tricky so when the offer to turn on the AC unit, let them do it. The bathroom was nice. The shower pressure was excellent and the towels where big and soft. The location is fabulous. You are right in the heart of La Rambla and there are several Metro stations close by. The roof top bar and pool are nice but we didn’t have the time to really use it. We did not use the restaurant. We found the prices to high. Breakfast was pastries at the Market. There are several good restaurants close by. A Italian restaurant that is a hole in the wall was fabulous and we ate at “The Attic” restaurant. We enjoyed them all. When we needed help or ask directions, we found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. Very 4 star. My wife and I would definitely stay here again and it is really great for extended stay which is needed to really see Barcelona and the surrounding areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit - booked return trip already!”
Reviews.Author: judyandnick
Reviews.Content: We visited the Hotel based on the reviews of Trip Advisor so went with trepidation hoping it would be ok. As it turned out it was better than we expected. Definately more 5 star than 4 star for us and we have travelled the world staying in top places i.e. Raffles Singapore, Sandy Lane Barbados, Dorchester, Berkely Hotel London. The trip was a last minute thing as we live in Spain and were going to see a group (The Killers) in Barcelona so could drive to see the show. It would take about an hour and a half each way so as it was also my birthday over the weekend we decided to stay a few days and are really glad we did. We arrived, checked in (reception very good and all speak English if your Spanish isnt too good) and then we were shown where to park. A strange feeling being walked by a porter infront of the car down the road through some cafes in a side street and down to the underground parking. Definately worth it. Secure, really clean and only about 20 euros a day with direct lift access from the lobby. The room was great. A superior room overlooking the Ramblas. Great until nightfall when the noise did permiate the room, carried on all night and left us knackered for the day. But the reception moved us to a (smaller) side room and we slept like babies the whole stay. Interesting that noise from the metro on the Rambla side also disappeared with the side street room. The hotel restaurant is good but a little lacking in atmosphere. Ok for breakfast though. The breakfasts are good but expensive so on our next visit we are going to go out for breakfast as due to the fantastic location of the Hotel there are many good places to eat. Cafe Lobo at the rear of the hotel is good for food and coffees. Whilst there we had lunch at the Hotel Arts as it was a hotel we were considering but it is not a patch on the Hotel 1898. It looks tired and shabby. We went on the tour bus and would throughly recommend it. Very interesting, clean, good sound on the headphones and value for money. The Chinese restaurant next door is a must. We went there twice as it was the best chinese food we had eaten. A restaurant recommended by another Trip Advisor - a fish restaurant , one of the oldest and most popular in Barcelona, was a major disappointment. The food was good but over the top price wise and also we had the most arrogant waiter I have ever come across. Everything was too much trouble for him, he confused our order and some other diners and also had a habit of slurping out of a bottle under the serving counter when he thought noone was looking. We were sat up in the gallery so if you do go dont sit in that area in case that is his permanent patch. A taxi to the restaurant was double the price of the one coming back so we think we were ripped off so the tip is always get the price of the trip when you get in or from the hotel reception if you go direct from the hotel. Also the spa and roof top area is just the most relaxing place to be after walking round the town. We always seemed to go when noone else was in the pool so were spoilt. On the safety angle for Barcelona we had read reports of 'watch out' but honestly we felt very safe. Obviously it is good to take care and not flash your wallet or probably even take a handbag purely because it is a large city and you can get distracted. We used the hotel safe religiously whenever we left the room as recommended by other Trip Advisors but felt very comfortable walking around at all times of the day and evening. All in all a fantastic trip and a fantastic city, so much so we are going back for more of the same in June!

Reviews.Title: “4* hotel, 5* prices, 2* service.”
Reviews.Author: NeilandAnn
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Barcelona. Having spent over 1400 Euros on 5 nights in the H 1898 hotel. This averages out to 280 Euros or approx £255 per night (room only, breakfast is an additional 20 Euros each). First the good news: the position of this hotel, slap bang in the middle of La Ramblas is perfect, the decor of the hotel is also quite superb. Sadly, things go downhill once you get to your room. Beware: we paid extra for a 'superior' room, the difference between a 'classic' room and a 'superior' room is the view ("of Barcelona's bustling streets" - according to the website). Our view was of a wall. A wall. We paid extra for a view of a wall. When we queried this we were told that we could upgrade to another room, they'd just check the additional cost that we would have to pay..................... The decor (and also the lighting) of the room is excellent, sadly the services were not. The quality of the TV & Wi-Fi reception was poor. The room (for this amount of money - after having stayed in 4 and 5* hotels all over the world) was small, as was the bathroom. We had to remind them at 17.00 hrs, on our return one evening that we would like the room cleaned; the soap in the bathroom wasn't replaced for three days; and the towels weren't replaced. The roof-top swimming pool area is a wonderful chill-out spot after a hard day shopping / sight seeing, but why are there are no changing / toilet facilities? Guest have to get changed in their rooms and then take the lift (only 1 in 3 goes to the roof) in their 'cossies'. Barcelona is a fabulous city. This is our first visit, and we will go back - but not to this hotel. Just because it's expensive don't think it's good, because it isn't.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Ashby de la Zouch, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: BigCez
