Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located for exploring Barcelona, on the stretch of La Rambla. The hotel is 5 star quality immediately from walking through the door. The decor is glamourous and tasteful. Our room looked out over La Rambla, which was an amazing view. It wasnt very big but was all good quality! The bed was comfortable,and I was impressed the suround sound and mood lighting. The most breathtaking thing was the roof terrace with 4 posters beds and a pool, and the cellar pool and spa-out of this world, and such a contrast from the busy city! As this was our honeymoon, it was a place that would otherwise been out of our price range, hence why we didn't eat or dink there much, as the prices were quite steep. When visiting Barcelona, have a drink in the wax museum bar-it will surprise you! Also Park Gaull is a must see!

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: knitter06
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights post cruise. I loved the look of the lobby area and the room- both were quite comfortable. Our room was clean and well supplied- nice toiletries, robes, slippers, and foot towels at bedside on turn down. Coffee maker and mini bar in the room. There is a bar/restaurant on the roof (great for tapas while waiting for the room to be ready) along with a pool. There is also an indoor pool and spa which we did not check out- the pictures of the pool are beautiful. They have an afternoon tea in the lobby bar. The location was great- near the end of La Rambla. It was an easy walk to L'eixample the Bari Gothic. The Plaza Catalunya, where the main TI and HOHO bus stops are, is a block away, and the market a block in the other direction. I think it makes a great base from which to discover Barcelona, and a comfortable retreat for your siesta! I thought it was fairly priced and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very oh-la-la...”
Reviews.Author: Bambule
Reviews.Content: Excellent place, really enjoyed our stay in hotel H1898, definitely made our stay in Barcelona fab experience. The only thing I found rather odd was that I could not find a place to buy some stamps for my 5 postcards and even though I asked at the reception they simply said "at the tobacconist " and didn't even offer to post it for me. which I though would be a nice gesture, definitely a spot on customer service and especially in comparison for the price of the rooms and price of one stamp I though it would be a nice touch. Good job I found the tobacconist in the end!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: zurich67
Reviews.Content: Beautifully decorated from the bottom to top. Generously spaced. Great, friendly service. Safe, clean and ideally located directly on the Ramblas. There are very quiet rooms to be had, so ask for your room not to be facing the streets if you prefer quiet nights. We found the rates very fair and the hotel and its services excellent value (we booked early online and got a very good deal).

Reviews.Title: “just returned”
Reviews.Author: EdScul
Reviews.Content: Hi, We returned last Wednesday after spending 3 nights in Barcelona. We stayed in H1898 off Las Ramblas. I must say we really enjoyed our stay both in H1898 and in Barcelona. What a city - the sights are incredible and we found the people lovely. The street entertainers on Las Ramblas during the day are a sight to behold. Make sure you visit the market. Like all big cities Las Ramblas at night can seem a bit seedy especially the lower end however we encountered no trouble whatsoever. One thing we would really recommend is to get the two day pass for the tourist bus = €27 for the two days. A great way to explore a great city. Eddie

Reviews.Title: “Just about Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Korniotis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the H1898 for 5 nights over Easter week, I was in awe the moment we arrived with the magnificent building and the gorgeous reception area, it was classy! Initially put us in a twin bedded superior room, but I'd requested a double bed, they transferred us without hassle! The room was comfortable, classy and with a small balcony, I guess a bit on the small side, when you consider the price, but space not helped by the massive luxury bed!!! The rooftop pool and bar area is an amazing place to enjoy the sun, drink a few mojitos, have some snacks and look over the rooftops of Barcelona, you'd forget you were in the city centre. The spa in the basement is a cool place to hang out after miles and miles of walking too! Its smack bang on La Ramblas, with the Market place 2 min walk away where we went for Breakfast every morning, fresh fruit, tapas, pastries etc etc My only 'little' complaint was that there was a really strange smell in the reception area, nortsure if anyone else has noteiced it but it was a bit offensive sometimes! Def. reccomend and we will stay there again on return trips, watch the wallet though, not for the pick pockets but those mojitos etc are quite pricey at €14 a go!

Reviews.Title: “4* hotel at 3* price”
Reviews.Author: SwissAirTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the H1898 and had a great time. Location is really excellent as it's on the Ramblas. Few minutes away from Plaça Catalunya, Barri Gotic, Merquat de la Boqueria... Starbucks is next door. Room itself was not really big as we'd a Standard room, with view in the interior Patio, but was ok. Large and comfy bed, marble bathroom, fridge, Tea/Coffe facilities, in-room safe, small LCD TV... Staff was helpful and really nice. Hotel has 2 pools, 1 on the Rooftop with a nice bar and 1 on the basement with a small Spa and Sauna and fitness room. Would highly recommend to anyone like smart 4* at the price of 3* when available with special offers. Building is impressive.

Reviews.Title: “As Good as Other Reviews Indicate”
Reviews.Author: Sooner in UK
Reviews.Content: Nice room with adequate space in room and bath; reasonably quiet if you get a room that does not face La Rambla. Front desk staff were excellent at all times and gave us great restaurant recommendations. Location is ideal for Barcelona sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: apbxresource
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel 1898 for 6 days. The location is excellent (this hotel is on Las Ramblas but the main entrance is on Pintor Fortuny). It is a 2 minute walk to La Boqueria, and an easy stroll to Barri Gotic and El born. It is also very close to Placa Catalunya and one other metro stop. The staff were very helpful, the rooms are clean and the beds are very comfortable (they also have a wide array of pillows to choose from the menu). The roof top bar and pool, as well as the spa pool are added pluses.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great decor- highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Ihearttravel79
Reviews.Content: I was taken here by my husband for a surprise birthday weekend away. Couldn't have been more pleased!! The location is excellent - right on Las Ramblas, very near the main square and the food market. The first thing you notice is the lovely decor, low lit and beautiful!! Exposed brick floors and lots of black and white. For those of you who know what Abercrombie & Fitch stores look like, it was very much like this, The room was lovely, although not a great view - it looked onto the 'inner courtyard / atrium', which basically meant that the rooms all overlooke each other - I could see directly into the room on the opposite side of the courtyard, this just meant keeping the curtains closed whilst in the room (the reason for a 4 and not a 5 out of 5 on the room score). We did use the poola nd spa, which has been clearly designed in the 'cellar'. Breakfast was expensive, but very nice with lots of choice. There was even sparkling wine to help yourself to for Bucks Fizz, which we had the morning of my birthday!! All in all a lovely hotel, that I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike0912
Reviews.Content: We had a Superior Room on the third floor with a view overlooking LaRambla which was great in the mornings with a cup of coffee from Starbucks next door. The staff was friendly and helpful,the room clean with a mattress I wish I could have taken home. You simply cannot imagine the different people from all over the world walking and being entertained below. Tips: Be sure to bring walking shoes and jeans. We found restaurants off LaRambla had better/less expensive food.(don't trust the people who try to hustle you to eat at their restaurant) Grocery fifty yards up the street. No violence at all ..but be wary of pickpockets. (safe located in room) Do take the bus tour ...27 euro for two days. Taxis excellent..not necessary but sometimes it is worth 10 eros not to have to walk back. Oh yes ..try the pool/sauna when you get back to the hotel with those tired feet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: blonaygirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to my expectations having previously checked it out on tripadvisor. The location is outstanding as it is so close to the tourist buses on Place Catalunya but also an easy stroll down the Rambla to the port and all that has to offer.The service was professional but friendly and the rooms were extremely clean and well appointed.We had a 6th floor Superior room overlooking the rooftops towards Montjuic. The higher rooms are lighter as you are above the line of the other neighbouring buildings. The rooftop terrace with a bar and swimming pool was a magic place to be during the setting sun.Next time I visit Barcelona I will definitely be booking again at 1898.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: jandlinlondon
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about our stay at 1898! The rooms were perfect from the electronic mood lighting, the modern marble bathroom, the wooden flooring and all the amenities you would expect of a five star hotel but not the price. A funky yet contemporary hotel. The best part was the amazing pool in the spa and the rooftop pool, bar and loads of private lounge space to enjoy views of the city. Perfect to look forward to after a long day of walking. Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoneTravelin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely hotel for one night before a cruise. The room had every amenity that you could desire and was very well designed. The hotel is in an excellent location, and the service was friendly. We requested and received a room in a "quiet location", and were not at all bothered by noise from the Ramblas. We saw the pool on the roof - lovely setting, but it was too cold to swim. The pool in the basement was absolutely beautiful also.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: WorldwideLive
Reviews.Content: Lovely building in the centre of Barcelona, Rooms were stylish and clean. Staff were attentive and helpful. Hotel was very warm. Great location to explore Barelona from

Reviews.Title: “So GOOD!”
Reviews.Author: XpandMyHorizons
Reviews.Content: It's everything that you've read! The location is amazing. Other hotels may tell you that they are 'Ramblas' but 1898 is literally literally on the street itself! My brother was right impressed when he found out I stayed here as he had walked past enviously every day of his backpacking trip 2 months earlier. Ha!! The decor is great. None of that modern bright minimalist stuff -> it was atmospheric and trendy. Room (I had a double) was S P A C I O U S with a great toilet. Free internet as well. Breakfasts were good. You can't go wrong with this one. If you can afford it...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - Already planning our next trip back!!”
Reviews.Author: Cavendish2
Reviews.Content: An amazing hotel in a great location just off La Ramblas. I booked it after seeing the reviews on trip advisor for a surprise for my partners birthday and neither of us were disappointed. The hotel itself is a very calm space - the bar downstairs is a great place to sit and unwind after a long day although a beer in the roof top pool is highly recommended!! We stayed for 2 nights last weekend and found the rooms to be very clean and comfortable, and the staff to be very attentive. The facilities are fantastic and we used both the spa and the roof top pool quite a few times. You can order Breakfast to be delivered to your room at no extra cost which we was a good start to both days. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to go to Barcelona and would probably pitch it closer to 5 stars than 4! We are already planning our next trip back in the summer!! We were warned about pickpockets in Barcelona before we went so we made sure that we had money is zipped pockets in our bags, that we kept on bags on us at all times and never put them down when we were out and about. There were a few times when people got a little close to us but if you keep your wits about you, you will have no problems.

Reviews.Title: “A classic hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: CamilleGB
Reviews.Content: Quiet and elegant athmosphere in the heart of La Rambla. Very attentive staff. Head for the terrace pool and sample the cocktails. A birthday surprise for my husband and well worth it ! Would definitely revisit. Continental breakfast included in the price would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location just loved everything”
Reviews.Author: Livvster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 1898 for three nights. I'd previously asked the hotel if there was any chance we could access our room early as we'd be arriving at 10am (their rooms are normally available from 3pm). Sure enough when we got there, our room was ready and we'd been upgraded to a better room. The rooms are small but beautifully decorated. We didn't hear anything going on inside the hotel but from time to time we heard some noise from Las Ramblas but it's what we expected from a prime city centre location. We both used the spa which was lovely at the end of the day. Everything was immaculate. The staff throughout the hotel were very welcoming and really friendly. Our room was cleaned to perfection and nice to get clean towels at turndown - something I'd expect from a 5 star but not a 4 star. The only disadvantage would be the breakfast service was slow each day . It's a buffet breakfast with lots of choice but if you want an omelette or hot drink it wasn't fast. That said, it's only a minor point and we'd definitely go back to this hotel. It's also great to have free wifi which we made use of each time we were in the lobby or our room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!! I was worried...”
Reviews.Author: kaconway
Reviews.Content: I planned a whirlwind trip to Europe for my parents, my sister and her husband and my husband and I. We used a holiday rental in the South of France as our base of operations and one of the side trips I planned was to Barcelona. I use trip advisor religiously and have yet to be disappointed in a recommendation. I was a bit worried about booking at 1898 because there were some negative reviews about unfriendly/unhelpful staff. I was won over by the pictures of the place...I'm a sucker for great decor. I booked 2 superior rooms and 1 lux room. I requested the the rooms be off the ramblas and that the lux room have feather pillows instead of synthetic. We arrived early on check in day and our taxis were met by a very helpful bellman who ran to get a cart and whisked our luggage away. The front desk staff were very pleasant and confirmed that the lux room did, indeed, have feather pillows. The lobby was stunning! All black and white and leather! Just beautiful! We all went to our respective rooms and were very pleased. They have a red scheme and a black scheme and both are very nice. The lux room had a huge balcony (though the view of surrounding rundown bldgs was not exactly picturesque). We had had a long train ride from France and were very hungry. The front desk recommended a tapas place within walking distance. It was excellent. I wish I could remember the name...We returned to the hotel and a few of the party tried the pool facilities while the rest of us headed to the bar to relax and play cards. The bar was fantastic! Even though we were stuffed from our tapas lunch, they had a free offering of sandwiches and sweets. The drinks were lovely and potato chips and peanuts appeared with the most adorable little black cocktail napkins. The bartender was not intrusive but still attentive. The feedback of the pool facilities were also very good. We retired to our rooms and indulged in room service for the night. The food was fine, not great. We breakfasted at the hotel the next morning...excellent spread! It was so nice to return to the calmness of the hotel after a busy day of sightseeing. All in all our 2 night stay was very nice. A few minor areas that could be improved, and I'm being picky...1) We had massages and, as I was 7.5 months pregnant at the time, I wanted to make sure that they could do a prenatal massage. They said not a problem, but the massage therapist obviously had not done prenatal massage before..it was fine, but I wish they would have let me know that they were making it up as they went along beforehand 2) during our massage, a group of children decided to make use of the pool. I don't think they had adult supervision (or not adequate if so) and make quite a bit of noise. As the massage therapists also do double duty as the spa receptionist, there was no one to tell them to quiet down 3) My father reported back that one of his encounters with the front desk staff was less than satisfactory. Apparently, he asked her a question and she couldn't be bothered. She waved him off, left and he had to wait for the next staff person to surface. Otherwise, a great experience at 1898 and I would absolutely recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Fiance's Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: lg2353
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after reviewing tripadvisor and were not disappointed. The hotel is very central and is an excellent base for exploring Barcelona. The hotel itself is definitely one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in and I would not hesitate in returning on my next city break in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great 1898 !”
Reviews.Author: TripTraveller2007
Reviews.Content: I recently took my wife to Barcelona for her 40th birthday, staying at the Hotel 1898. The hotel is conveniently located on the main street of La Rambla, which ensures that the main sites of Barcelona are nearby. Everything at the hotel was excellent, from the staff (very friendly) to the hotel amenities (Rooms, Spa, rooftop pool & bar etc) When we return to Barcelona we will certainly be staying at the hotel 1898 again !

Reviews.Title: “La Rambla Location!”
Reviews.Author: EUEx-pat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel 1898 for 2 nights in January 2009. We (my boyfriend and I) were there for a weekend holiday. Transportation We took a taxi from the Barcelona airport (arriving Friday evening at 20:00) to the hotel. We grabbed a taxi from the taxi stand outside the arrivals gate area. The trip cost us around 30 euros. We also took a taxi back to the airport when leaving and the price was the same. On our first trip to Barcelona we arrived in Girona with Ryan Air so had used their bus service to get to the city. For transportation for the rest of the trip we walked mostly. Neighborhood The hotel is on La Rambla and is in a very active area although from our room we couldn’t here any street noise. There is plenty of shopping around the hotel so it made it easy to get water, drinks, cash, etc. We found La Rambla to be busy during the day and really busy during the night. There are people there trying to sell you stuff and approaching you – some are there to sell you drugs. While my boyfriend was having a cigarette on La Rambla outside the hotel – a prostitute did approach him. There is another entrance to the hotel on a side street where you can stand and avoid the crowd of La Rambla. Overall, the location was good and convenient. Room (photos included) We had a Classic room and our rate was €180 each night (not including breakfast). We booked the hotel through the hotel website. The room was a good size which had a huge comfortable bed, a desk, 2 chairs, a wardrobe (a safe inside) and a mini bar fridge. There was a bench to put your luggage on and a huge flat screen TV in front of the bed. There were quite a few English channels but the reception was poor. The view from the window was nothing special but enough for some natural light in the morning. A unique feature was that it had different light settings where you could press a button for the mood you wanted to set in the room (for example: reading, watching tv, night, welcome). We found it easier than adjusting all the lamps. Bathroom (photos included) The bathroom was very spacious. There was a window in the bathroom to let in some natural light. There was a separate shower stall in addition to the tub/shower combination. However, the shower stall had no light inside. It was dark inside the stall even with the bathroom lights on. We looked at the ceiling of the shower stall and there was no light fixture and because of the dark marble it made it impossible to see what you were doing. We opted to use the shower in the tub (which we were happy that this was an option). The shower in the tub had a rain showerhead. The toiletries included the brand, Etro. Bar soap, bath gel, shampoo and lotion were included. The bathroom also included a hair dryer, 2 robes, and 2 slippers. Amenities/Service We didn’t use any of the hotel services. There is a spa service which we would have like to have tried. Everyone at the hotel was polite and courteous. The ground floor of the hotel is well decorated and there is plenty of sitting space. We came back for an afternoon break and found it relaxing to sit in the lounge area before we headed out again. Our stay here was pleasant and found it a good rate for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: stocky2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night at the end of our cruise in this hotel. What a fantastic hotel, situated on the Ramblas close to the metro and easy walking ditance of all the main areas of Central Barcelona. The hotel and rooms are of modern contempary design, staff are friendly and helpful. The roof area has a pool and bar and is great after a a long day exploring Barcelona and gives top quality views over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wery nice romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: love2travel2
Reviews.Content: We loved loved loved this hotel Ohh my where do I start? We loved the hotel, we loved the rooms, we loved the spa and pool area. Me and my husband spend 3 glorious days here on a romatic getaway without children. We had a very nice room facing the patio, with an enormous bed and we loved the deco.

Reviews.Title: “Ladies preference & hire a personal guide”
Reviews.Author: RogerAkron
Reviews.Content: Two couples, mid 60's, 10 days in Spain in late Oct. and staying in the Barri Gotic because the L'Exiample reminds us of the Miracle Mile in Chicago. Stayed 3 nights at Hotel 1898 and 3 nights at Le Meridien. $400 for each, first upgrade room, breakfast for 2 included only at Le Meridien($100 value). The ladies preferred the Hotel 1898 over Le Meridien. They liked the room size, decorating warmth, spacious balcony and comfortable lobby for a drink. They did not like the glass bathroom door, slate floors and small lobby of Le Meridien although it had the better view of La Ramblas and therefore the flavor of the city. Loved the sights like Boqueria and tour bus and for the first time we hired a personal guide. Great idea! We saw shops and sights we would have never found, especially so efficently. He set a leisurely pace, stopped for chocolate or pick-me-ups at great places that we had missed on our own. Jordan Susselman, +34 679 689 630, jordan@HiThisIsBarcelona.com Despite many, many warnings and heightened awareness, my wife's purse was picked during a rainstorm by two fellows selling umbrellas on La Ramblas in front of StarBucks. $300 lost, they're good! Most memorable were side trips to Montserrat, the seaside at Cadaques with Dali's home, Figuria and the Dali museum and Girona. (Maybe better than Barcelona) 5 days of sun and mid 70's and 5 days cold rain. We should have gone one month earlier. Roger Ramsey rhramsey@neo.rr.com

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: xTravellerx
Reviews.Content: Hotel has wonderful location at La Ramblas, right in the heart of the city. Rooms are quite small, but on European standard very good. The hotel is stylish and has a nice pool area on the roof deck, as well as saunas and a pool inside. The only negative thing was that at times the service at the bar was very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: wjbnyc
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at Hotel 1898 with my wife for three days in December. The location on Las Ramblas was perfect for getting around the city. To start with the airport shuttle (4 euros) drops you only two blocks from the hotel. It is centrally located with easy access to metro (150 feet) and being on Las Ramblas is where you want to be. I was there in the winter so I could imagine it is even a better spot in the warmer weather months. La Bocqueria is only two clocks away - a must for any seasoned traveler. Also, we enjoyed wine and cheese in the lobby one evening. The roof deck seems like a great place to relax after a day of sighseeing but wasn't as useful in the cold weather. The hotel was very clean and the staff was helpful with advice. Also, free internet in the business center. FYI... I stayed two more nights at the Hotel Arts/Ritz Carlton and wish I had stayed two more at Hotel 1898. Ritz was not centrally located and very noisy from the clubs outside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horror Show”
Reviews.Author: calilregit
Reviews.Content: I am an experienced traveler. I travel for business and pleasure. We take two vacations a year as a family. Those vacations are for a period of seven to 20 days each. My wife and I have used Tripadvisor for years. She has posted in the past but I have only used the site for my edification and am writing today for the first time. Our current travel experience has prompted me to write. I almost always look askance at postings of a terrible experience at a hotel that has a high Tripadvisor rating assuming it was an aberration. Alas, we are in the throws of such an experience at the Hotel 1898 in Barcelona, Spain. We love Barcelona. This is our second trip to the city. On our first trip, we had a wonderful experience. Great sites. Great people. I purchased one of my favorite pieces of original art from an artist in Barcelona which hangs in the entrance to our home. Our second trip to Barcelona has been a horror show. We came to the city for two days prior to a cruise. Our flight from Boston was delayed 10 hours but we slept on the flight to Paris before our connection to Barcelona. We looked forward to the Hotel 1898 as an oasis from the downside of travel. Alas, Hotel 1898 was anything but an oasis. My wife lost her passport. We assumed she lost it in the Barcelona airport but her recollection is that she had it in the hotel room. We take responsponsibility for not putting our cash and passports in the safe in our room. The passport is missing along with 300 Euros. It is a curious amount to be missing because it was three 100 euro bills that were taken from a larger sum of money and not all of the money was taken. We have taken the position that we lost the passport and have not complained to the hotel. We did ask them for their recommendation on what to do and they recommended we report the lost passport at the police station. They also told us the police would give us a report that would allow us to travel. I tipped the gentleman behind the desk 20 euro for his assistance. We did as advised and the police were very accommodating. We were told it will be up to the cruise line as to whether they let us board. We chalked the downside of our trip up to the adage: "---- happens" and were ready to put the incident behind us for the rest of the evening. Alas, that's when we ran into a Barcelona we had not seen before. In the lobby of the hotel is an oriental restaurant, La Xina. We looked forward to a relaxing dinner in the hotel. It was 10pm and we were told by the restaurant to return at 11pm for seating. Upon our return we were told a table was not ready and that we should go up to the bar and they would let us know when a table was ready. The bar consists of an oak runner around an open kitchen. Four bottles of Moet and some wine were stacked in a plastic crate filled with ice. There were no more than eight bottles of alcohol on the counter. It looked more like a bar you would see at a house party. I waited patiently while the young man made three frozen margaritas. Just before he was done another man that worked at the restaraunt came up from downstairs with five young women in tow. He stepped front of me and spoke to the bartender who nodded in return. Upon finishing the margaritas and passing them to a waiter the bartender looked past me to the young women to take their order. I politely said, "Excuse me". Without missing a beat, he told me he knew I was waiting but that he was told to wait on the women next. I asked the maître d if the restaurant was affiliated with the hotel or unaffiliated (I did not bother to complain). He told me it was unaffiliated. One can not give one's business to an establishment that could be so outwardly rude. Our family went for pizza down the street. When I travel I maintain low expectations and normally appreciate the courtesies extended to me and my family as guest saway from home. The Hotel 1898, and its "unaffiliated" restaurant, failed at meeting even the minimum standards.

Reviews.Title: “A negative part of our trip”
Reviews.Author: summertimes11
Reviews.Content: I just looked up this hotel, suprised to still see it is #3 in Barcelona. I have been meaning to write a review on this hotel because of the fact that staying here made me dislike Barcelona (hotels really can affect your overall view of a place, unfortunately). I usually trust trip advisor, and I did when I booked this hotel. The hotel rooms are nice, the roof deck/pool is great, and the hotel is beautiful. It is also in a great location. The problem with the hotel is the staff. The staff on our initial 2 days there were horrible, unhelpful, and never smiled (particularly the front desk staff). On our final day there, after much complaining, we managed to find some helpful staff and wished they had been that nice the entire time. A great hotel should never have mean, unfriendly, and unhelpful staff. The best part of our trip was when we actually left the hotel and stayed elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay anywhere else!!”
Reviews.Author: travellingsquacks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at H1898 for eight nights, from 21 to 30 Nov 2008. Given the length of stay, we had initially thought of trying two different hotels (the other hotel we considered was the Meridien next door), but we are now glad that we stayed the entire period at H1898. We had a privilege room on the third floor overlooking the Ramblas. There were two windows, a large one opening out onto the Ramblas, and a smaller side window looking at the Meridien. The choice was made after we had inspected a superior room and a deluxe room (with a terrace) for comparison. The privilege room appealed because of its large size, high ceiling, separate sitting area with full length sofa, and above all else, its fantastic bathroom. The bath room was not only large and luxurious (in a classy green marble), but really clever in design, because it had twin vanities (facing each other) OUTSIDE of the main bath room, which housed a bath tub, WC, bidet and a generous glass enclosed shower stall with a rain shower. This room was definitely a five star rather than four, on account of this bath room and the size. The window facing the Ramblas brought life and light into the room, the sounds of pedestrians, street vendors, entertainers, and even clinking of cutlery in near by restaurants, wafted in along with the cool autumn air every evening. We felt pretty much part of the street scene even as we sat in the comfort of the sofa sipping sangria. Its location on the Ramblas is simply superb. Although there are a multitude of hotels all along the strip, this particular corner is literally a few steps from the Plaza Catalunya (transport hub for the airport bus, tourist bus, metro, tourist information), and also the location of Carrefour right next door means grocery shopping is a cinch. A daily trip there for fresh fruits and bottled water became a routine for us. Via the Ramblas, almost all the major sights are walking distance including the GOthic quarter, the Palau Musica, the Palau Guell, the Columbus monument, the Gaudi masterpierces of Casa Batllo and Casa Milla, and the main shopping street on Paseig de Gracia. The hotel is also a few steps from the La Boqueria Market, which means you can eat the freshest produce and sea food the city has to offer every day. The excellent Bar Boqueria in the market itself is great value for money. After we found it, we ate brunch and dinner there almost every day. Forget about the tourist trap restaurants touting tapas sets along the main street. Finally two features make H1898 truly magical, instead of merely excellent. The roof terrace with its really classy outdoor furniture, which offer a panoramic view in three directions (the fourth being blocked by the Meridien), best enjoyed in the early morning and late evening. Many other reviews have raved about the terrace so no further elaboration is needed. However, it is the indoor pool which captured my imagination and which I really want to draw attention to. It is in the basement, and while not big (about 9m x 4m), the cavernous design with serial roof arches and gothic stone claddings on the wall, together with special lighting effects, and haunting music make swimming here a surreal experience. On one end, there is a large back-lit black and white picture of padi fields carved into a cliff which makes one think of Bali. An early morning swim will definitely invigorate and give a great start to the day. The adjoining changing rooms come complete with towels and toiletries so you don't need to bring anything from your room. Strangely, it was always empty on each of the occasions I used it. Perhaps it should remain a well kept secret. Overall, despite going with already very high expectations from reading all the past reviews, the reality managed to surpass our imagination. The staff are helpful and responsive when approached, but are otherwise discreet rather than proactive, The only one gripe I have is the hotel could not provide an umbrella on a rainy day. Given the room rates, I think it is fair to expect this provision in every room since it is not a standard item in most travellers' luggage.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: mershall
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Hotel 1898 last weekend for a luxury break from the kids, and was not disappointed! Barcelona has many stylish hotels to choose from, but this was the one that had everything we were after. The hotel is right on Las Ramblas near Plaza Catalunya. So it's ideal for wandering around the Gothic Quarter and Old Town area. The Marina is only about 15 minutes gentle stroll away through the wonderful streets. We booked a Superior Room which had a small balcony overlooking a couple of chilled bars to the rear of the hotel. If you can, book one of these rooms. There was never any intrusive noise from the street below, and it was nice lying in bed on the Saturday morning hearing the world go by! The room was a very good size, with a beautiful bathroom. I don't go away to watch TV, so I can't comment on the choice of channels on the large flat screen! There's also a digital radio which you can plug your MP3 player into. We didn't eat in the hotel (except Breakfast in Bed on our last day as a treat) as there are so many restaurants near by. Ask at reception for their recommendations. The pool and spa areas are beautiful, and if time permitted we would have had one of the many treatments on offer. There's also a roof top pool, which is closed now for the winter season. The large roof terrace (with day beds) is still in use over the winter so pop up there with a Cerveza Damm and watch the sunset over Montjuic. Our initial and lasting impression of Hotel 1898 was WOW. We didn't have time to do everything we wanted to, so we're definitely going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: T3TCA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel on November 11th this year. It is in a prime position on Las Rambus, Barcelona which really is the place to be. The hotel really is more like a 5* rather than a 4*. We did not eat in the hotel although it did have a restaurant, (which did look a little pricey) there are so many places to eat around the hotel. The room was very comfortable and roomy. The staff were really friendly and could not do enough for us. Although we did not use the spa it looked lovely. The parking facility was very good and there was a lift from the carpark into the hotel, Overall I would definatley recomend this hotel and I am extremely fussy!

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: travelsny
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel prior to our tour of Spain based on the reviews it had received on multiple web sites and travel magazines. The building is the former headquarters of a import/export (tobacco?) corporation and actually looks like a former bank that's been extensively renovated into a chic boutique hotel. It's location on the Ramblas is very convenient and is across the street from the Meridien. You can actually see the Meridien from the lobby which is decorated much like a gentlemen's private/yacht club i.e., dark wood, model sailboats, black and white photos, and club furniture. Service is quite professional and efficient since many business persons use this place. The rooms are quite spacious, especially the corner units, and decorated with Pottery Barn/Crate and Barrel type furniture. The bathrooms are very comfortable with granite/stone tiles, large tubs and showers, and good quality soaps/shampoo. Although we didn't have a chance to use it there is a spa and pool which appears to be quite nice on the web site of the hotel. If you want something light the tapas restaurant in the hotel is great--much less olive oily than the traditional fare found in many restaurants. And, for those who can't do without Starbucks, there is a branch in the hotel itself where you can get a reasonably priced coffee and baked goods for breakfast. This place is actually much nicer, larger, and cheaper than the Meridien where we also stayed during the trip--don't bother with the bigger name hotel, this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: james76manchester
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for my girlfriend's 30th birthday in september despite other hotels being rated more highly on trip-advisor at the time as we liked the look of the decor and the fact it had a rooftop pool and garden. we had a deluxe room which looked away from las ramblas and are located on the higher floors, making it quiet. it also had a terace which was great to relax on. the room was on the small side but the terrace gave you extra space. it was beautifully decorated and very stylish. the same can be said of the lobby and the rooftop bar and pool area, which was brilliant for relaxing in after the bustle of barcelona. the prices for food at the rooftop bar were not cheap as people have commented, but it was fairly quiet when we stayed and we were able to ask the barman to see if we could order food from the room service menu instead and have it brought up to the rooftop. he asked for us and it was no problem, so that made it much more reaonable. the pool was too cold for swimming in but the chance to lie in the sun more than made up for that. they also let us hang out there on the day we checked out as we didn't leave barcelona until the evening but we were able to keep using the facilites all day. the indoor pool was excellent as well. also the staff were helpful when we were trying to book restaurants and in general they were very polite. as noted previously they didn't carry our bags up to the room for us upon arrival, but personally i don't mind that. i certainly didn't have any problem with them as previous reviwers have commented. overall this is one of the nicest hotels i have stayed in and i would definitely stay there again. it is expensive but if you can afford it the extra cash for the deluxe room is worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: CapeMay97
Reviews.Content: All these great reviews - believe them. My wife and I (from the New York City area) read the reviews of 1898 on trip advisor and decided that this would be the starting point for our European Honeymoon. We are very glad we did. Barcelona was a fantastic city with so much to offer and we were in the heart of it all thanks to the location of Hotel 1898. Located on La Rambla, the main thoroughfare, we had everything in walking distance. La Boqueria (the largest market in Barcelona), Picasso Museum, Cathedral, Placa Real, Plaza Catayluna, Columbus Circle, A great Flamenco Theatre, great tapas bars and of course La Rambla itself and all of its street performers. Tip - If you are there for a few days, buy a bus tour ticket for two days and keep it on you, even though it's very touristy it gives you a great overview of the city and if you decide to walk around during the trip and find yourself a little far away, you'll always be near a stop instead of taking a cab back for another 10 euros. As far as the hotel itself - Extremely clean, modern, stylish, accommodating staff (all spoke english). Looks like it catered to the businessman a little more than the casual traveler, but it didn't make difference. Loved the buffet breakfast with Cava, cured meats, cheeses, caviar, pastries and all the other necessary foods and beverages at your fingertips. (well worth the 20 Euros per person if you like to eat). A very decent Chinese restaurant attached to the hotel. Great bar for a nightcap, with friendly bartenders & good peanuts. Fantastic Spa set to a balmy temperature, very relaxing with unisex sauna and steam rooms. We didn't get any spa treatments though. The pool had some nice features added to it, but it's not huge. We had no noise at night in our room despite what some of the reviews said. Room service was swift, though the burger was kind of weird tasting but I figured the beef is a lot different there - tasted more like baloney or a hotdog. The flat screen tv is all you need for the room, and there are unique dimming switches that are fun to play with. Can't say enough about this place, it really enhanced our time in Barcelona. Nothing to complain about. Highly recommended. Check out the photos if you have time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at 1898”
Reviews.Author: SORCEL
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 3-day stay at the 1898 Hotel in Barcelona. We drove over from France and had no difficulty in finding the hotel. We arrived with a flat tire and the staff were extremely helpful in getting it fixed. The staff were ever so friendly and spoke excellent English. The hotel is well located. In the same building there is a Starbucks and there are lots of small restuarants (not too pricely and with a good selection) to be found in and around the street Carrer de les Sitges which is just a block further up (but be warned they don't start eating dinner before 20:30 in Barcelona). Our room was small - but pleasant (classic). It was kept very clean and tidy, twice a day by housekeeping staff. The beds were comfortabel and you get to choose between a large choice of pillows. We were also very pleased with the large flat screen TV which was easy to view from bed. The bathroom was also small - but clean and covered in beautiful green marble. The hotel has an historical feel but all the facilities are modern. The entrance from La Rambla is amazing. We will not hesitate on choosing this hotel on our next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: trafalgarman
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 3 night stay at the end of October. Our superior room looked out over La Rambla and was beautifully appointed in an understated way. The room and hotel generally were as clean as anywhere we have previously stayed and the toiletries, robes, slippers etc were replenished frequently. We made full use of the spa facilities which were of the highest standard. Best to use them first thing in the morning though, as they were a little oversubscribed in the early evening. The reception staff were very helpful in giving information, directions etc. and arranged a taxi for us to the airport. We didn't eat in the hotel at all as there was a great deal of choice in the immediate vicinity. A great visit to Barcelona, made all the better by a truly excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern and well run”
Reviews.Author: FussySleepers
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a last minute substitution for another hotel because it could guarantee us a no smoking room. it was much more that that that. We booked a superior room and it certainly was with a great bathroom, closet space, reading light and every everything else needed including very comfortable king size bed. The guest services including handling our luggage and hailing a cab was first class. The air conditioning worked great also. Also, they readily accomodated our request for a late checkout on the day we left so we would not be at the cruise ship too early. The location on Las Ramblas was great and it was right in the center of many activities. (We were too busy visiting the sites of Barcelona prior to our cruise, so we had no opportunity to try their restaurant, bar, and other facilities.) Our only complaint was we could hear some of the noise of the restaurants below our back window even though we were on the next to the top floor. The noise was not terrible but a light sleeper might want to stay away from any hotel this close to the main streets with so many late night restaurants open.

Reviews.Title: “superb service”
Reviews.Author: pipstrip
Reviews.Content: My wife & 2 teenage boys stayed for 2 nights/3 days. We've been to Barcelona for short breaks previously, but this was our first time at this hotel. Perfect central location, immaculate hotel, beautiful rooms, & great spa which welcomed the children, not always the case. Very good value for the quality of the accomodation. But most impressive was the service, from the moment I 'phoned with pre-booking enquiries to the time we left in a shower of rain with one of their umbrellas, they could not do enough to make us welcome, without being obsequious. We all look forward to returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jwhitehouse
Reviews.Content: We found our stay, 5 nights, to be extremely well supported by a fabulous staff. When we had an issue, the response was as good as it could be. The decor is beautiful. Our room (636) was extremely well appointed. The location of the hotel couldn't have been better. The restaurant was well run with good food. This is the only hotel we have found that PRINTS the paper of your choice. If we were to return to Barcelona we would definitely stay again at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel In A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rockhopper17
Reviews.Content: We had booked a five night stay at The Hotel Jazz but due to technical problems in the rooms we were offered alternative accomodation at another Núñez i Navarro hotel, the H1898. We were not disappointed as this was a four star hotel instead of the three star hotel we had booked, a taxi was ordered to take us to H1898 which was paid for by the hotel. We had a superior room overlooking Las Ramblas, it definetely had the wow factor. The whole hotel had lovely furnishings, very clean, with a feeling of class about it. Breakfast was buffet style and was well stocked with fresh fruit, pastries, cereals, breads and juices. The staff were all very helpful and provided tea/coffee as requested. The roof terrace is a real asset, very relaxing place to enjoy a drink taking in the view of Barcelona. All in all a brillant hotel and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: mullet_rock
Reviews.Content: If there's one thing I regret about my stay in Hotel 1898, it's the fact that I only stayed for a night here. I loved this hotel -- from its facilities, the room, the service and the location. Location -- It's along Las Ramblas, so there is a lot of activity going on right when you step outside the hotel. It is a touristy area, so for some it may not be your cup of tea, but it is conveniently located beside MANY shops, cafes and most of all, the La Boqueria (a large public market quite famous in Barcelona. Make sure to go here if you're a foodie). You'll never get bored (shopping and lot of street performers) or hungry here. There's a McDonalds and KFC a few minutes walk away from the hotel, so if you're starting to miss the fast food, you can always go there. Room -- Immaculately clean. The design was very nice. My room was navy blue and white, very classy. Quite spacious for one person, really. They were quite generous with the amenities as well. There's a cool room feature that sort of sets the overall lighting of your room depending on your mood / activity -- for watching TV, for entertaining visitors, sleeping, etc. :) Staff / Service -- Professional and accommodating. Although I really didn't get to interact with them that much except for check in/out and when I asked for an electrical adaptor. But all in all, they were alright. Price -- Got this hotel because of an error made by the travel agent in my booking, so this was a pleasant mistake. But I would say it is still good value for the money. Facilities -- I haven't had the chance to use the facilities, but from what I have seen of the spa and the pool, I would like to go back and try them sometime. Food - Nothing remarkable. Don't expect an eye-popping spread, but it's alright. Overall - I love the hotel for the location, primarily. The fact that the other factors such as the room and staff were great is just icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Classy comfortable hotel but a couple of niggles. Breakfast a disaster.”
Reviews.Author: robfeltham
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard room which was small but well equipped and well designed with an extremely modern 'classy' feel. In the room there were tea/ coffee making facilities and a lovely large flat screen TV though limited choice of channels. Good internet access included in the price. Lovely comfortable lobby area and nice bar. Spa was a disappointment. It looked 'the works', had spout/fountain type things, but the water was luke warm only, not encouraging us to stay in there. Steam room was adequate. Breakfast area was very nice, and food reasonably good, but the breakfast service on the two weekend days we stayed was APALLING. They checked your name when you went in to the restaurant but then you had to fight for any kind of service. Two staff were doing their best, but were totally unable to cope with the number of guests. No-one to show you to your table. No unused place settings, and no-one offering to prepare to a place -- unless you work very hard to get someone's attention. Cold coffee. Lovely roof top terrace area, great place to relax after touring round the city. All in all not a bad hotel, excellent location, but not cheap and by no means perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and terrace”
Reviews.Author: Daveinatl
Reviews.Content: Overall loved this hotel... when our driver picked us up at the airport, he said "that's a fantastic hotel!" We agreed, starting in the lobbing, then seeing our room and then going out to the rooftop terrace for some sun and drinks. Our basic room was spacious, clean and chic... bathroom was very modern & the toiletries (including toothbrush/toothpaste & shaver) were high-quality. The mattress and pillows were very comfortable (you can select different pillows, etc., but the standard ones were fine for us) & the radio had excellent sound. We picked up a cruise after a few days in Barcelona & two couples we met onboard had stayed at the Hotel 1898--all of us raved about every aspect of the hotel (perhaps with the minor exception of some "cool" staff). The location is great, too... across from the Méridien adjacent to La Rambla & close to all major attractions. I cannot wait to go back... I tend to shop around for a good deal, but I might pay a little extra to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Edward95
Reviews.Content: This hotel in Barcelona gets high praise on Trip Advisor but having just stayed there for 3 nights I now know that the reports are all true!! My wife and I have stayed in some great hotels but we will have very good memories of Hotel 1898. Friendly, helpful staff, wonderful facilities and exceptionally clean and well maintained. We had a room with a private balcony - which included an outside bed!! The location is on La Ramba which is a very busy and lively main street - very touristy. The noise didn't disturb our sleep on the 5th floor. The location is excellent for walking to all the key sites. Breakfast is expensive but the choice on offer is excellent so we eat enough to get us through to mid afternoon tapas.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clarelittle100
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days for my birthday. Lovely Hotel Right in the centre of Las Ramblas. The moment of arriving our luggage was taken off us from outside the hotel and brought to reception for us by the porter. We checked in no problem. We booked a double room but had 2 single beds pushed together - Room 216. This was fine because I like my own space anyway. I have to be honest and say that the beds were very hard. They were Firm because I looked at the label on the matress. Not great if you are used to the Memory Foam type beds like we are. I found myself on the 2nd night with 6 pillows laid on top of the mattress with a blanket and sheet over the top, just to get some comfort. House Keeping will give you as many pillows, blankets etc as you want. This kind of ruined my stay in a way, because you pay for an expensive hotel and you don't expect to create your own bed. My partners brother and wife also stayed for 2 nights whilst we were there. Their room was 509 and the beds were softer than ours even though they were the same make. Maybe ours were newer than theirs. Not sure. The Room itself was lovely. I like a quiet and dark room anyway so it was great for us. We had a room in the inside of the hotel so we heard no noise from the main strip. This was great. The view from our room was not great, you could only see other peoples room windows, but enough light for us so that was fine. A view is not something that bothers me. The bathroom was lovely, great size with powerful taps etc and shower. Hair dryer, toothbrushes, toothpaste, shampoo, bathrobes, soap, 2 pairs of slippers, bath foam, hand cream, the usual extras. No flannel. Excellent. Fresh towels and sheets every day ,which was great. House keeping were excellent. The spa and pool etc was lovely. It was never busy and we often had it to ourselves which was nice. Steam room and sauna, again great! They also have a gym but I did not use this. You are given a white towel robe in your room when you arrive for spa use so you won't need to bring one. Roof Terrace was great, such a nice relaxing place to sit. Pool looked nice too. Great service. You get a bowl of crisps with each drink order too. Reception bar was great, again a nice relaxing place and a lovely Italian Bar Man called Luca. He was very charming. Business Centre has 4 internet PC's. 2 of which didn't connect to internet. These 2 had the printers connected to them. If you want to print anything you will need to bring a memory stick with you and save onto it from the internet PC's that do connect and then insert into the other PC's (the one with printers connected) and print on them. We did this when checking in on line and printing our boarding passes off. We did not use the hotel for food so we can't comment on that, but i'm sure it was lovely. I would stay here again, despite the bed situation because the rest of the hotel was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Fred20
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our three night stay at this hotel. Situated on La Ramblas it was a fab location for visiting the attractions of this wonderful city. Our room overlooked La Ramblas with a tiny balcony (wide enough to stand on!). Yes it was quite noisy, but not bad enough to keep us awake, even on the Friday night when the fiesta began! The room was a reasonable size. The bed was comfortable. Tea & coffee making facilities available. The staff were courteous. Marti on reception (seemed to be on duty the whole time we were there) was extremely helpful recommending fabulous restaurants. The Patagonia is definitely worth a visit - beef to die for! The roof terrace gave us great views over the city. The pool is tiny and was very cold at the time of our visit. But plenty of places to sit and relax. The only downside was the bar prices.....be aware! We loved Barcelona and will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FoodDoc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superb. I cannot say enough good things about it; Location perfect at top of Los Ramblas; Staff incredibly friendly; was upgraded to a deluxe room, with our own private patio garden area on the 5th floor! Room was great; was given complimentary champagne on arrval. Roof top pool and bar was fantastic. Will retrun many times. Just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: tippy2010
Reviews.Content: beautiful and well equipped and spacious accomodations. clean modern bathroom, excellent roof deck suitable for cool evening drinks. only downside was no real concierge knowledgeable about restaurants. use a guidebook for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great for special occasion!”
Reviews.Author: shortieLeics
Reviews.Content: I took my husband there for a special birthday, along with our son and daughter-in-law. We arrived very late on a Aug 22nd -Friday night after a BMiBaby flight delay of 2 hours. The staff were very friendly and helpful and we were soon checked in. Location of the hotel was fantastic and our room overlooked Rambla. I had booked PRIVILEGE rooms which certainly surpassed my expectations, large, airy, comfy bed and pillows, bathroom large and very well appointed. There was no noise from the street below. The roof top terrace provided a brilliant view of Barcelona. Terrace staff very polite and efficient, the cocktails and sangria were to die for (yes we sampled many). Having read some of the reviews and knowing the rating I anticipated that drinks, breakfast etc would be fairly expensive, but the luxurious Mackintosh style decor, the atmosphere and the quality of the food made it worth it. We had a really enjoyable stay there and would certainly go back again for a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: BabalouSomerset
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1898 exceeded our expectations and we cannot wait to go back next year. Superb decor, very clean and comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Even though it is situated so close to La Rambla you could not hear any noise from the street. The 5 course breakfast served on the roof top terrace took a bit of getting through but was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Arrived on the evening spain won the Cup!”
Reviews.Author: GMan2478
Reviews.Content: We arrived into Spain on 29th June 08, the evening that Spain won the football and had to clamber through the crowd and the fireworks to walk down Las Rambla. Very hot work but a wonderful atmosphere. When we arrived we were impressed. H1898 is in summary a fantastic hotel. Why? Excellent Service, both front of house and room service. Spacious room with excellent bathroom facilities. Well located. Best roof bar in town. Nice sun terrace and the pool - well it's more like a plunge pool, but refreshing none the less. Good concierge Nice Spa (so my girlfriend told me). It was hard to fault the H1898...my only foible would be that the amazing shower/bath system takes a few minutes to get used to but apart from that we had a fantastic stay and would definitely go back. We had friends that stayed in Le Meridien around the corner and thought that H1898 put their hotel in the shade in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Loved hotel 1898”
Reviews.Author: Bouzounyc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a lovely experience at the 1898 hotel. It was convenient, the service was excellent, the amenities great and the roof pool (although very small) not crowded and with delightful views of the city. The staff was very helpful with suggestions for restaurants and making reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel nice........front desk manager NOT NICE.”
Reviews.Author: clifthouse
Reviews.Content: We walked into H1898 and made a reservation with the desk clerk named Martine. We asked for a cot for our children. Martine moved us from a regular room to a superior room at no extra charge. The next day we check ed out of the hotel that we had been staying in and walked 2 blocks to H1898 in a light rain. Upon arriving at the desk a gentleman named Mr. S informed us that there was a baby bed in our room and that the superior room that we had reserved could not be used for my family. He said we would have to move up to a larger and much more expensive room. Mr. S refused to give us a discount on the larger room. I got the feeling that Mr. S realized the position we were in....we had checked out of our hotel and it was raining. We were in no position to walk and look for a more reasonably priced room. Mr. S took advantage of us. That said, the hotel was very nice. Mr. S............not so nice.

Reviews.Title: “So so experience”
Reviews.Author: hal9341
Reviews.Content: I really struggle to understand why this hotel has been given so many rave reviews. I booked this hotel for a two night pre-cruise stay. Having read so many great reviews I honestly thought we were going to be in for a treat. I couldn't have been more wrong. We were issued a twin room, despite having requested a double. When I put this to the receptionist I was bluntly informed that they were fully booked, and no changes could be made. Unhappily we accepted this fact and went up to our room (510) . When I opened the door my heart sank. A dark room with a tiny corner window. Worse still when I pulled back the curtain it faced out onto a small ventilation atrium. Even worse still there was a scaffold erected all the way up the air shaft. So, for any privacy the curtain would have to remain closed. The two beds were at opposite sides of the room, so it felt more like sleeping in a dormitory. We didn't have big plush beds. Instead you get small single beds that are on wheels. They were not comfortable at all. The so called turn down service is a total waste of time. All they do is pop a totally pointless piece of cloth (think teatowel) on the floor by your bed. They do not tidy your room at all at this point. When they did finally decide to tidy our room, the maid neglected to replace our bath towels. The breakfast is 21 euros! We didn't even bother to try it - far too expensive. When we went down to check out I had a few things I wanted to get off my chest, but as I should have expected the receptionist never actually bothered to ask if we had enjoyed our stay. I have stayed in so many hotels over the years (including in Barcelona) and I think this has to be one of the worst. Especially when you consider it's not all that cheap. Please check out my pics, so you can see what the rooms look like. If you want to stay here make sure you pay the extra supplements for the "good" rooms. Or better yet, stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MattDrewry
Reviews.Content: H1898 is a truly amazing hotel. From the moment you walk in, to the moment you leave, this hotel will empress you. The decor is fantastic, and the staff are wonderful, you are treated as if you are the most important person in the hotel at all times, nothing is too much trouble. We arrived at a busy time on a Friday, however we were quickly whisked through the check in process and up to our fantastic room on the 3rd floor, complete with its luxury bathroom. We then chose to wander up to the amazing roof terrace, where an stunning view of the city awaits you. As the sun set, we sat drinking a nice chilled glass of wine in the cool late summer breeze. The next day, after sightseeing, we tried out the spa area, again we were not disappointed. A well equipped and decent sized gym, excellent indoor pool and spa, and a decent sauna and steam room. In all respects a great way to unwind after a days sightseeing. If there were any negative comments, whilst the rooms are comfortable and beautifully decorated, they are a little on the small size. Food is also not available from room service 24 hours a day. H1898 just exudes style. It is a place to see and be seen. You feel that in simply being there you will bump in to a celebrity every time you round a corner. But saying this, H1898 is neither stuffy, nor pretentious. This is a chilled and relaxed stunning place to say in Barcelona. Worth every single penny of the +€250 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Mandys 40th treat”
Reviews.Author: reesriv
Reviews.Content: After doing the usual research we stayed at the hotel in August 2008 as a treat for my wifes 40th birthday. From the time we walked through the door we could not fail to be impressed by the wow factor. I can only echoe previous comments- staff brilliant, they actually want to help and are all professional in the way they go about their business. Rooms reflect the thought that has gone into the rest of the hotel, class and quality with many nice touches that make you feel that little bit special. The roof top terrace is indeed an oasis within a very busy city, a place to relax and be pampered but at a price when you order from the cocktail bar! The spa was immaculate and was quiet most of the time. The location is spot on for exploring the city and transfer via taxi from the airport 25 euros. We will return to this hotel having always said we would experience a different hotel everytime we do a city break, it was that good!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it all”
Reviews.Author: SusyLincoln
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived right up to the moment we had to leave we loved everything about Hotel 1898. Location of the hotel was fantastic, the interior cool, clean and staff very welcoming. We booked a PRIVILEGE room which certainly surpassed our expectations, large, airy, comfy bed and pillows, bathroom large and very well appointed. The roof top terrace provided a brilliant view of Barcelona and the area was kept clean and tidy (we saw maids tidying, mopping and re arranging cushions on the loungers every couple of hours - their attention to detail was brilliant). Terrace staff very polite and efficient, the cocktails and sangria were to die for (yes we sampled many) unlike some of the reviews we had read before our stay we didn't think they were over priced at all. We loved the whole experience and will certainly return to Barcelona and Hotel 1898

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Spa hotel City break”
Reviews.Author: Tiggette
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights from 22nd August based on the reviews on Trip Advisor and we loved this hotel. We paid the extra to book a Priviledge room and it was worth every penny, keep an eye on the hotel's website for some good deals that are updated regularly. Highlights were the large bedroom and bathroom, lovely products, quiet room (even though it was on the corner of La Rambla, we heard little noise), roof top pool and terrace but more than anything the basement spa area. We used the pool, steam room and sauna every day and it was so relaxing and peaceful. The pool has lots of water jets for you to find. We went for a city break and ended up having a relaxing Spa one! The other thing we norticed about the hotel it that there are always staff cleaning it, whether in the lifts, the lobby, the rooftop or the spa and so it is spotless. The staff are all really proud of this hotel and rightly so. As mentioned in other reviews, there is a Starbucks next to the hotel which was a bonus for us caffeine addicts. There was also a lovely seating area away from the bar where they played silent movies which were fun to watch over a drink. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: freqtraveller29
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the hotel 1898 on the first night of our honeymoon before a going on a cruise the next day, when we arrived we where tired from the wedding stress and where hoping the hotel lived up to expectation! It did, the hotel was beautiful and my wife and I really enjoyed our night there! I wanted to stay in 5 star hotels and really enjoy a luxurious honeymoon and when we arrived at H1898 we where greeted with friendly staff and a very nice lobby. The staff where friendly and when I told them it was our honeymoon the man who checked us in gave us a king-size double bed as I had accidentally booked two separate beds! The rooms are very tastefully decorated, well finished and the bathrooms are very spacious and clean. The H1898 also has a very nice pool and bar area on the rooftop with sun beds and comfortable seats which looks out toward the gothic and central areas of the city. All in all a very nice hotel and we where sad we only had a night there!

Reviews.Title: “rooftop oasis on the busy las ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Christieloves2travel
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at 1898 July 2008. Wonderful hotel, great moden decor in a charming historic building. Excellent location on Las Ramblas. Beds and pillow are super comfy and the bathroom had an excellent grohe rainshower and sleek black granite. Very clean, but not terribly large (at least our std room was not). The would definately be a case of quality over quantity-room quality was superb for a european hotel but not the largest in size. The most outstanding feature of this hotel is its rooftop. It boasts amazing panoramic views of the city, a decent size pool, loungy beds and chairs all around. The vibe at the pool bar is very chill and the drinks are great-especially the forzen mojitos and sangria! The food was also good. You almost forget your staying on Las Ramblas when your up there. Amazing hotel for the price. Would stay again and not hesitate to suggest to my fellow travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, Classy and Well Located”
Reviews.Author: RugglesScotland
Reviews.Content: Smart, central and a very good standard of 4 star hotel. I stayed with my daughter (24) on a shopping/sightseeing trip and it was ideal. We stayed weds, thurs and frid during august and found the rooms excellent, all the staff were helpful, everything is very well kept and the location is really superb. We booked direct with the hotel on a package that included reflexology for tired feet, breakfast and the option of a late check-out (the only disappointing part was that the late check-out didn't materialise, but not a great problem). Flights were with flyglobespan and we booked our airport taxi's through the flyg. site too - all without any hitches. We didn't have any problems with noise as some reviewers have said (we slept well) but I think you have to accept if staying in a busy hotel in a busy street in a busy city - there will be noise! The bar service was friendly - drinks are a bit pricey, but again you are in the centre of the city. Breakfast selection was fine - but probably not enough if you like a big fry-up type of breakfast. Great hotel

Reviews.Title: “cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: mimramtrout
Reviews.Content: Beautiful stylish hotel.We were cheapskates and skipped the €16 per head breakfast ..ate instead at the chocolate shop just down from the hotel which was great.Basement spa,swimming pool ,gym,sauna and steam-room all fantastic.Top floor terrace and bar great but pool just for lounging in..too small or shallow for a swim.Rooms were all deep cherry wood floors ,marble bathrooms and candy striped decor.WIFi great as was internet facility in the library on the first floor(4 computers with attached printers).Rooms and public areas were spotlessly clean.The staff were all friendly and helpul.Hotel definitely has the "wow" factor in terms of style and decor..

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth!”
Reviews.Author: TaylorPeat
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at this hotel and it was even better than the first time. Everything about this hotel is first class. It is located right on Las Rambla. It is very tastefully decorated and from the minute you enter the hotel the staff make you feel welcome and at ease. Great facilities with an indoor pool and spa in the basement and an outdoor pool on the most amazing roof top terrace. I really can't recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: MARCO1959
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is really beautifully decorated, cozy rooms and excellent location. Breakfast buffet is not to be missed. I will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels ever”
Reviews.Author: cheeseburger23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a stay at Hotel 1898. We couldn't have been happier with this hotel, and often had difficulty prying ourselves away from its confines to experience Barcelona. Some of the other reviews I read complained of poor service. We didn't experience anything like this. Everybody we met was extremely friendly and helpful. It wasn't like Four Seasons service where everybody is asking you every thirty seconds if you're okay, but if you express a need, it's seen to immediately. We booked a terrace room which will go down as one of my favorite hotel rooms of all time. We had an enormous private terrace, almost as large as the room, with beautiful plants, two spacious loungers, and a large table. We ate several meals out here and spent a lot of time relaxing. It faced a side street so noise from La Rambla was minimal. The room itself was decorated in black and white with rich wood floors. A/C was extremely powerful and worked brilliantly. TV was great with many more English channels than most European hotels. Enormous closet with plenty of storage space to unpack completely. Free Wi-Fi. The only complaint we had about the room is that our King bed was quite literally two LARGE single beds. Not bound together in the traditional manner, but actually on rollers and easily separated. This is fairly common in Europe and didn't really bother us. Bathroom was nicely appointed and spotlessly clean. Fresh robes and slippers every day. Nice toiletries and included shaving and dental kits automatically. Mini-bar was a bit sparse, but we stored things that we bought in the Starbucks downstairs in there and they didn't seem to mind. Location-wise, it can't be beat. It's right on Las Ramblas, and a two minute walk to the nearest Metro stop. Restaurants, shops, and conveniences abound. The shopping district is pretty much across the street. La Bocaqueria, the most amazing food market in Europe, is three minutes walk. For a quick fix, there is a Starbucks in the same building as the hotel. Food in the hotel was very good. Definitely above average. Room service was delivered within 20 minutes every time and always hot and delicious. We tried the buffet breakfast and were very pleased with it. Lots of little luxuries like champagne were made available. We ate in the main restaurant one night and LOVED our food. Service was also good, and they let us take our time. We ate on the rooftop restaurant another night and besides the shockingly high price of drinks we had an immensely beautiful dinner. How can you beat the view from the rooftop cafe as the sun sets over all of Barcelona? It was a memorable experience. Pools were fantastic. The rooftop pool was small, but refreshing, and the lounge areas on the rooftop are just too much fun to relax on. We went for a rooftop swim as the sun was going down our last evening in Barcelona, and it was simultaneously fun and romantic. The pool down by the Spa is really fun-looking. The gym was small, but we weren't there to work-out. We didn't try any of the spa services, unfortunately. Overall, we found this hotel to be a really good fit for us. We are relaxed people who don't like to make a fuss, but we also like our luxuries when we're on vacation. This hotel epitomized that relaxed luxury, and combined it with jaw-dropping views and location. If we're lucky enough to go back to Barcelona, we won't dream of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Looks nice but has a big problem”
Reviews.Author: bax52
Reviews.Content: First impressions were great. Sexy cool lobby and understated but classy looks from the street. Up to the rooms with the cases and it still looked very nice and cool. However thats the first for two big problems. We had two massive cases with us and hand luggage, and the front desk was manned by two staff members and a porter. No other guests and no offer of any help with the bags. Amazing in a hotel of this class and price range. So being typically english we did it ourselves but not a good opening impression. By the way this was repeated on checkout. No help whatsoever and 4 members of the lobby team watched us struggle past to the taxi. The rooms are good. Well furnished with a super cool lighting system and very nice bathroom. However here comes big problem number 2. The rooms are REALLY noisy. You here everything from the corridor. Its like the door isnt even on. So if your looking for sleep or relaxation. Forget it. This is a party city and we were constantly woken throughout the entire night by drunken guests returning to their rooms. Not good enough for a Hotel charging these prices. You expect to sleep surely ? The rooftop terrace is fantastic ! Very trendy, cool and amazing views. The pool is very small though, but loads of places to sit / lie and catch the sun. So this is a Hotel for party people we think. Cool bar scene, and if your coming in late from clubs, you'll love it. However if your looking to relax and get a decent sleep, be careful as we didnt !

Reviews.Title: “Loved the 1898”
Reviews.Author: DLM-F
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the 1898 for a week for our wedding anniversary and loved it. We had a 'superior' room in the red and white colour scheme (331) which was immaculately clean and had plenty of room. Nice touches included the robes and slippers and the fact they always replaced the soap - maybe petty but I've stayed in some '5 star' places that expect you to use one tiny piece of soap for your whole stay.
