Plus toothbrush and shaving kits as standard in bathrooms - no having to ask reception if you'd forgotten something. The location is ideal for exploring Barcelona - I don't know how someone can describe the location as 'awful' - umm if you don't want to stay on La Rambla - then don't, but it's on a major tourist central road - I'm not sure what they expected . The room was lovely and quiet considering where it was located. We didn't eat in the hotel as it did seem a little expensive for what was on offer and there are plenty of cafes nearby - there's a Starbucks next door for those craving a caffeine fix and a number of small supermercados nearby for picking up water/drinks for cheaper than the mini bar. I will definitely stay at the 1898 for our next Barcelona trip - in fact I can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience”
Reviews.Author: deegee17
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed at this hotel. The hotel is exquisite. The rooms have all the little toys such as the lighting system for reading, relaxing etc. The Hotel is immaculate and the staff is friendly and very responsive. The location is wonderful. You are right on Ramblas between Plaza Cataluna and the Harbor in the middle of everything. One thing I would recommend though which has nothing to do with the hotel. If you are a single person on a business trip in Barcelona, be careful of the pick pockets at night on the very busy Ramblas. There are many groups of African women who are very aggressive in their attempts to pick your pockets. They kind of swarm you, while one grabs your arm to try to distract you while their partners go for your back pockets or any bag you may be carrying. I live in Amsterdam which has its share of Pick Pockets, but they are nothing like the crews in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “great spa”
Reviews.Author: kandjIreland
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a mini honeymoon. I e-mailed the hotel and told them it was our honeymoon and they gave us twin beds! They eventually gave us a double on the third night of our stay. The hotel in itself was beautiful, the spa and rooftop pool were both excellent as was the buffet style breakfast in the morning, definitely worth the money. The location was also first class. The rooms were a little small but overall a great hotel but the price would ony be justified if you amde full use of spa facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: sticklebacker
Reviews.Content: I had originally booked the Hotel Arts for our 3 night stay in Barcelona for our wedding anniversary. Upon reading the reviews and seeing the location of Arts, I cancelled this booking to stay at 1898. What a mistake. The cost was about the same, (370 Euros a night for a bedroom with terrace at 1898). Paying this sort of money, I expected, rightly or wrongly so, to have some sort of standard of service. How wrong we were. We arrived to be told that there were no irons and ironing boards allowed in the rooms, that they were a 'risk', so if you wanted anything to be ironed, you had to pay for laundry (I am surprised no one else noted this?). The luggage we brought along would have cost well over 100 Euros to be ironed. How ridiculous. So we nipped to Carrefour next door and got a travel iron!!!! Not exactly what I had in mind for our special break!!!!! The room (532 I think it was) was smaller than I imagined it would be, spotlessly clean I hasten to add, with a nice private terrace to lounge around in, which I appreciated. It was nicely decorated, but not at all spacious in size for the price we paid. The service is what lets this hotel down. We had problems getting a taxi one night and there were 4 people behind the reception desk doing nothing, whilst the concierge over the road at the Meridien, were hailing every available taxi for their clients. Very irritating. Also, the service on the roof top terrace was spectacularly awful. I shouldnt have to send my husband to find a waiter to get us drinks, or have to look at remanants of breakfast left by other guests for half an hour. The location, la rambla, is awful. Coming from Amsterdam, this was the worst place for us to be situated. What a nasty, smelly, crowded tourist hellhole. We went to Hotel Arts for a drink one lunchtime and I severely regret cancelling that booking. There were staff everywhere. Service was efficient and polite and professional. This was truly a 5 star experience. I shall be booking there on our next trip for sure. I cannot recommend this hotel to anyone, because I felt it was majorly overpriced for what you get. Majorly disappointed and not sure why this hotel is number 1 in Barcelona????!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel, a little let down by precise and unemotional service”
Reviews.Author: Shliben
Reviews.Content: We came to the 1898 for our 25th Wedding Anniversary and made the choice based on the position of the hotel and the roof pool and bar (and the generally positive reviews). Overall not disappointed,but there are few minor issues that mark the hotel down a little. First the positives: Great position, really easy to get to from the airport - the bus stops around 500 metres away - and central for everything, right next to La Rambla. The roof pool (for dipping) and the bar are really great; they made a great Negroni - very strong. The drinks are expensive but you are paying for the fact you are on a roof with really comfortable seats and a good view. Food is also pricey and not hugely original. One evening we ordered a selection of meats for €23 and received a plate of one type of ham! Staff on the roof are very willing but service is a bit slow if there are a lot of people. Bedroom was large (Privilege Room) with a fantastically comfortable bed; room was well sound proofed with efficient A/C. Huge choice of pillows if important to you. Free newspaper (laser printed) every day. We didn't use the spa in the basement but it looked good if a little small. Now the minor niggles, which did not detract from our stay but should be ironed out based on the prices they charge: Free tea is offered every day in the lobby between 5 and 7 pm. The lobby and bar lack atmosphere (everyone is on the roof!). There was no one around to serve the tea and when the barman eventually was found we were not offered a choice of tea (there were 2 types) but the tea was poured and it was pretty awful! One of the bathroom taps kept falling off and we were only supplied 1 small piece of soap (both these issues were rectified the day the hotel was notified) The A/C control is inside the main cupboard: It's very hard to read the control and if any staff member needs to get at it they have to go into your cupboard where all your stuff is stored - not a great piece of planning. No biscuits in the room with the coffee - a bit penny pinching. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel (v. pricey) but there are loads of places outside - even a Starbucks in the hotel building if you like their coffee! The staff at the main desk are polite and efficient but as has been mentioned by other reviewers they do what is necessary and no more. That little extra touch is missing Overall we would stay again in one of their standard rooms and spend all moments at the hotel on the roof, which is the highlight. One other thing; Eat at Alkimia restaurant, Industria 79 behind La Sagrada Familia. Fantastic chef - and yet again precise, cool service - must be a Barcelona trait.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic oasis in the most central location”
Reviews.Author: baer_ke
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very central at all day long lively La Rambla, close to Plaza Catalunya. Therefore one is always in the middle of everything and can reach shopping, sightseeing, city tour busses, plenty of restaurants and even the waterfront in short walking distance. Travelling to the airport can be done very easily via the airport bus (costs ca. 4 EUR pp) which goes to Plaza Catalunya - then ca. 5 min. walk to the hotel. The hotel itself is fantastic. Great service, extremely clean (it seems they are cleening all day long) and it offers a fantastic roof terrace with pool and bar. The terrace is the perfect place to escape a bit from the vibrating city life - you can just relax at the pool or lay in one of the roof terrace couches and enjoy some drinks or food. The pool bar is open late night and they also offer breakfast up there but one has to pre-order that the day before. - That seemed a bit odd and they were not flexible if you just wanted to take the breakfast there in the morning without preordering. Another advice: as you stay so central there is always cabs going along outside the hotel you don't need to order that via the hotel - some cab drivers charge up to 6.20 EUR for coming to the hotel after being called - even though they just drive around the corner ... So, just stop a cab at the street, works all the time.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful retreat in the heart of Barcelona!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travellingtwosome21
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from our honeymoon in Barcelona I felt I had to write a review of the 1898. As with any hotel booking there is always some trepidation, especially for such a special occasion, but the 1898 fulfilled all the criteria on our list. Wonderful service, beautifully decorated, spotlessly clean and a cool haven from the heat of the streets. The roof terrace was a wonderful place to spend time reading a book and although the hotel was nearly full it was never over crowded. The pool was perfect for a cooling off dip and the views over the roof tops of the city a delight. We had our breakfasts on the roof terrace most days and although fairly expensive at 21.5 euros we found that we were full for most of the day, plus the pleasure of eating in the morning sunshine seemed worth the price tag. The 1898 is not a budget break in Barelona and would probably not appeal to all, but for a romantic escape or special treat we would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Classy & Expensive”
Reviews.Author: BrazAustralia
Reviews.Content: The title of this review is a bit of a give away... Position- spot on- right in the guts of La Rambla...initial perspective, lobby etc, very classy, expensively done, very stylish. The reception people were a tad cool I thought, not overly burdened with a service ethic. We arrived around 1pm, and were told that check in was at 3, and felt that they didn't really try and help us in what we might do for 2 hours. They weren't rude or anything ,just didn't really seem to care too much. Anyway, our friends booked into their room- a "normal" one with a view over a alley way/stairwell thing, and we went to our superior room- v expensive at 420 Euros, but very well appointed, lovely big king size bed, superb pillows, and a sun terrace. good for entertaining. All a bit small for the $$$ however- comparing it to the room we had in a Paris hotel afterwards. We were on the 5th floor, out the back, overlooking a plaza that got a bit noisy later in the days. Faciities are very good, the gym/ pool complex in the basement was very groovy, as was the bar/ pool area on the roof- warning- don't try and dive in the pool, it is tiny and only knee deep, really there for true dipping as opposed to anything else. Yes, drinks are expensive, but the 360 degree view is superb. The service levels stayed the same over the 3 nights we were there- cool, standoffish- they don't help people in off the street with their luggage for example- they stand back and wait for you to come to them! Didn't eat there, too many choices outside. All in all, as I've said above. I think it was expensive for what we got, I think you may as well just get an "ordinary" room, a fair bit cheaper. I wouldn't stay there again, as much to do with the overall attitude as much as the value- they are linked of course.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: JD3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so good that I have no complaints at all.The location is so good, as others have said.It was close to Playa Catalunya where we picked up the hop on/off bus, and to the train. It was an easy walk to the beachfront too, where we had a nice lunch in Port Vell. We stayed post cruise for 3 nts. We were at the hotel by 9 am, and our room was ready.We loved our room, and it was big by European standards.It had a really comfortable king size bed with a pillow menu available.Our room had a french door that went out to a little patio that was furnished with a table and 2 chairs.We had a tub/shower combination, and lots of nice amenities including slippers and robes. The best part of the hotel was the rooftop terrace and pool.There is a bar up there as well.The views over the city are amazing and there are plenty of lounges and tables.It was really nice up there at night as well. All the staff we met were very helpful, whether it was to give directions and maps, to recommending restaurants and calling for reservations. Our package came with breakfast included, and it was good.This buffet has so much on it, but they will also make you eggs to order.It also includes cava and wine, although I don't know who would want that for breakfast. I would definitely stay here again if traveling to Barcelona again.To me it was perfection!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, need to iron out some faults”
Reviews.Author: paaluz
Reviews.Content: The Hotel 1898 is located in the former buildings of the Philippines Tobacco agency of Spain, a trading company. This makes for a truly nice and genuine old building, where the insides have been ripped out and redone completely. Absolutely everything inside is new, including the newly carved out parking garage. We arrived to check in without any problems, after first having some quarrel with the GPS. The street La Rambla is not a valid GPS destination for this hotel, after calling the hotel we were told the street address is Pintor Fortyun 1, and the GPS guided us to the front door. The location is on the main tourist street in BCN, apart from the scores of cheap-flight tourists hanging around the location can't be more perfect in BCN. After check in we ordered parking for the car a bit pricey at 23 € per night. But the garage is right under the hotel, amazing for such an old building and I was guided in by the bellhop. The room is probably too small for its price category, but very tall and nicely done. Very clean, and always magically cleaned when we were out. The A/C was found inside the closet not difficult to find but a bit difficult to read the screen. After shivering through the night with an overzealous A/C I decided to read the manual and discovered how to run it proper. Room was quiet, apart from some low hallway noise. Not a nuisance. There's plenty of channels on the TV, but not all of them were as according to the manual. Nice to have Fox Series to watch in the evening after the spa. We did not feel the 20 € breakfast was a good enough value to eat in the hotel. On the roof is one of the major assets of this hotel, a smallish pool and a very nice bar. The pool is good for a dip in the heat and there is several beds along the rooftop. Ample amounts of towels and a complimentary bathrobe makes the lack of changing area near the pool a non-issue. In the bar, there's no a lot of perfection, in spit of the staff effort. They are courteous and friendly, but not very professional. Also, the drinks are very off on the recipe, like the strawberry daiquiri. Nice selection of cheeses on a plate along with a bottle of good red wine is a much better bet in the not very comfortable large divans. The spa in floor -1 is nice, with a warm and comfortable spa pool. Steam sauna is still out of order, and the Finnish sauna was not hot enough at 70 degrees Celsius and low humidity. At the business centre, there's the usual Americans hogging the computers chatting along with home base in Kentucky or where ever but fortunately there is enough of them to go around. I had to print, sign and fax a contract in the evening and none of these actions were an issue. WiFi in the room was very slow and needed a login and password from the desk to function. All in all, this is a 4/5 because there's some issues that need to be corrected. They have an almost perfect building and location but partly fail on details and prices. This does not mean that the hotel should be avoided, however.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vintotinto1
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel, Reception were so friendly, supplied us with maps and even highlighed places of interest. The breakfast is lovely and very varied.The rooms are beautiful, spotlessly clean.The pool and roof bar are lovely and give you fantastic views of the city Only slight negative is there are bars beside the hotel, it's not soundproofed enough so the sound carries and can disturb you through the night. Highly recommend this hotel if you fancy a relaxing base for sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: BoomerBanker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed this hotel. I have stayed in Barcelona before on business trips and this time I was at the Hilton for a meeting before moving to the 1898 for three nights. I was not at all disappointed; we were in a standard room facing the courtyard so no view but it was very quiet considering you are right in the middle of all the action on the Rambla. Staff was highly courteous and allowed us to check in at about noon which was terrific. Needless to say, with the current exchange rate of about 1.65 dollars to the Euro, it is not cheap (about $450 a night) but it's one of the nicer hotels I've stayed in, and I've been to quite a few. The rooftop view is great, just be careful as a few drinks will set you back at about $18 a pop. The location is spectacular... I have heard the Meridian across the street is also very nice at about the same price or higher, and the 1898 has a lot of history to the building. The "mood lighting" as described in other reviews is nice. Bathrooms very pleasant. Internet access is free in the business center on the second floor (called Floor 1). Not much nightlife in the bar, mainly due to the fact that the weather was so great that everyone wanted to be outside. Have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “The reviews don't lie! Chilled and elegant boutique style, exudes class”
Reviews.Author: JohnDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: This for me proves what Trip Advisor is all about - having read the reviews booked it - and it was everything I hoped for. When you pull up first impressions are superb, elegant yet not too formal. Fit-out is superb, top materials and workmanship. Room was only just big enough as a single but well fitted out especially bathroom (no bath though). Rooftop terrace bar and pool was breathtaking - like something from an LA movie, ultra chilled and cool, had drinks there later in day too. Obviously dependant on weather so summer is the time, especially since you are in the city! Location is probably unbeatable. I am so going back here with my wife, was there with clients who were impressed. Staff professional and helpful. Difficult to have a gripe about anything (no in-room movies is the most I could think of - even though I didn't want one) A real find!

Reviews.Title: “impeccable”
Reviews.Author: vesperalley
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in the heart of Barcelona. We stayed at Hotel 1898 in June 2008 for 2 nights. We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel but the rooms are a little small, especially at £350 a night. We had a terrace so that helped, otherwise we would have felt too squashed in. We stayed in room 526, which was on the 5th floor, facing the back of the building. The rooms were extremely clean and always had fresh towels and bed linen. The bathroom was lovely and with me being 6'2 the bath was ample. As for the rest of the hotel, the spa in the basement was nice, but the water in the pool was extremely cold. Almost to the point of shivering, the steam room was not working either! We found that it would have been nicer if someone from the hotel had shown us around first as it was a little off putting just walking round free roam. The roof top bar/pool was ok. The bar is extremely expensive, £15.00 for a gin and tonic. The pool on the roof is very small, the photos on the hotel website make the pool out to be bigger than it actually is, also there is no where to change on the roof so if you are wanting a quick dip in the pool, forget about it. You would have to walk back through the hotel dripping wet. Also we couldn't find any dry towels on the roof on 2 occasions. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as for €20 it seemed expensive. Plus the hotel has a door into the Starbucks next door so we just went there {be warned though that in Barcelona none of the Starbucks Menus had a translation so unless you are fluent in spanish/catalan you might just have to guess}. We had drinks in the reception area of the hotel, but again very expensive and the quality was nothing special. They had very little choice if you didn't drink alcohol, which is the norm in Barcelona from what we found. We found that the hotel staff didn't really speak to us much, even though they had door staff and reception staff. This was a little off putting. We were able to check in at 12 o'clock which was nice. The music system in the room didn't work at all and the TV was almost unwatchable, very fuzzy! for £350 a night you would expect these things to work. The pillows and bed were lovely though. Very gay friendly in the hotel, we had no issues with that. If anyone has any questions feel free to contact me x

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: SW2
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, stylish hotel. The staff are very efficient and friendly. The rooftop bar and pool area is lovely; unfortunately the weather was fairly overcast during our stay so we didn't sample the pool but cocktails up there were a very civilised way to start and end an evening. Only disappointment was that our room overlooked the central courtyard and so natural light to the room was limited.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bemac19
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and wonderful roof top bar

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but top notch quality.”
Reviews.Author: Blondii
Reviews.Content: Finally, a hotel worth its star rating. The interior of this hotel was every bit as nice as the exterior. It exuded understated elegance. The location was excellent right in the center of everything on Las Ramblas. The staff was very friendly and helpful too. The reception, bar, and sitting areas were very classy with leather seating, club chairs, and 1930's style of decorating. The business center was outstanding with 4 computers with free internet access, leather furniture, and a conference table. Again, very classy. The rooftop bar and pool area was great. The spa and pool area in the basement was top notch. I had the silk feet massage and it was wonderful, but too short. The breakfast buffet was pretty good. You could special order eggs, which was nice. It wasn't worth 20 euros, but typical pricing for western Europe. We booked a superior room. It was very clean and quite lovely with quality features: king size bed with a selection of pillow types, plasma TV, wood floors, light dimming switches, room safe, robes, slippers, etc. The bathroom was in marble with a nice rainfall showerhead. Although not huge, the bathroom was above average compared to other 4 and 5 stars we have stayed at. There were several complaints on tripadvisor about room noise, but our room faced the side street and was very quiet. We payed an average of 315 euros per night which is very expensive by American standards. We have stayed at less expensive 4 and 5 star hotels in other major European cities only to feel disappointed in the end. We were very pleased with our selection this time.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel we ever stayed.”
Reviews.Author: AnnieBrando
Reviews.Content: I have booked this hotel for my husband's special birthday treat, so my expectations were very high, I wanted everything to be perfect. And to be frank, it probably was. Although quite pricey, the location is fantastic, the hotel is very modern and furbished in elegant, understated style. We stayed in the standard room, which was not large, but still a decent size and airy, certainly not pokey or dinky. I was worried about the noise from La Rambla, so asked for quiet room at the back when booking and our room (No 404) fitted the bill perfectly. In fact, we got really good night's sleep (the bed was large and very comfortable) and did not wake up before 9 am. We skipped the breakfast, at 20 euros, it's expensive and you can eat like a king at plenty of cafes in the neighbourhood or at the Bouqeria market. The rooftop pool and terrace are just fantastic, great to unwind in late afternoon to catch the last of sunshine before going out in the evening. The same goes for the grotto pool, sauna and the gym in the cellar. The reception staff was very helpful, they secured us a last minute reservation at Hisop on Saturday night. I cannot fault the cleaning or other services either. The toiletries in the bahroom also contained complimentary toothpaste and shaving kit, which was a nice touch, now when you have all these flight hand luggage restrictions on liquids and sharp objects. If you can afford it, this is the ultimate choice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelQueeny
Reviews.Content: I regret not having got round to writing this review sooner, because more of you may have been pursuaded to visit this fantastic hotel before now. Where do I begin? If you are looking for a place with style, elegance and amazing hospitality H1898 is the place to visit. An expensive hotel but worth every penny. I treated my other half to an all expenses paid weekend in Barcelona for his birthday. I rented a convertible and we drove up from the south of Spain. Upon arrival at the hotel the doorman and my other half parked the car in the underground car park (payable daily) whilst I checked in. I had contacted the hotel in advance to organise some special extras such as rose petals on the bed and a massage each. They had also booked us a table with amazing views at Torre de Altamar http://www.torredealtamar.com/ - dont even think about eating anywhere else, even if it is £100 per head. This is the BEST restaurant in Barcelona! Just be aware you need to go in a glass elevator to reach it. Not the best thing when you are scared of heights as I am. I didnt even need to remind the guy in Reception of the extras I had arranged, he whispered that all was in hand. When we arrived in the room, there waiting for us was a complimentary bottle of Champagne, complimented by the rose petals and the mood lighting... the impact couldn't have been better. I had booked an executive room which was perfect, we had lovely views of las ramblas from the 4th floor and standing out on the balcony in the H1898 dressing gowns and slippers and sipping champagne in the sunshine watching the hussle and bussle in the street below was a moment in itself. The street performers who did notice us up there, gazing down, must have thought we were royalty, and we certainly felt like it. Then we come to the bed.... OH MY GOD. It was so big we could both sleep like star fish and not touch, and wow I cant tell you how comfortable it was. I had the best nights sleep of my life. The hotel is classic, sophisticated yet modern. Lovely leather sofas fill the lobbey yet the walls are covered by ceiling to floor black and white photographs of modern subjects such as a very tangled power line. Very small, menial faults I would probably point out if I had to tell you something bad may be that a couples massage wasn't possible because they only had one member of staff working in the spa at a time, a hot english breakfast would have been nice although the spread was out of this world, the serenity of the swimming pool in the basement was ruined by two unsupervised teenagers but then we only used it when waiting for the massages. But dont let any of these points influence you because they are nothing compared to the positives about this amazing hotel. The hotel was so amazing we actually only made it to Barcelona Zoo & the aqarium but then art or spanish history wasn't appealing to myself or my spanish boyfriend so it didnt matter. Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel I have ever stayed in and I am extremely fussy!

Reviews.Title: “save your money and goto arts or gran marina”
Reviews.Author: danny_morgan
Reviews.Content: I was staying in this hotel with work it is in a nice location just off Ramblas nice spa pool and roof top bar but I found the Rooms very small and not 4* could not swing a mouse never mind a cat !! The staff in the bar at recpion were not Friendly constant struggle to get served , We ate in the hotel resturant which was terrible and the service was bad , The breakfast was the same small buffett which kept runing out staff forgot out tea and coffe order twice in the end we give up on the breakfast. There is no doubt this is a nice building in a good location but they have staff and attuide problems For a little more money play safe go the Hoted Gran Marina or the Arts.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to explore barcelona”
Reviews.Author: scbrown
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the opportunity to visit Barcelona recently without the children, and so I wanted to book a quality hotel that would not disappoint. I chose the hotel 1898 mainly based upon tripadvisor reviews and we thought the hotel was absolutely fabulous. The location is as near perfect as you could find being on La Rambla. It is convenient to the Plaza de Catalunya which has the departure point for the two tourist bus companies as well as shops and restaurants. La Rambla is always extremely busy but the hotel althought located on this street is like an oasis from the bussle of the throngs of people. Indeed when relaxing in the lobby of the hotel it is hard to imagine that outside it is so busy. There were two things we particularily enjoyed at the hotel. The first was the rooftop terrace. People in their reviews constantly refer to this terrace but it really is that good. The views were outstanding and it is so relaxing. The second thing we enjoyed was the spa in the basement: what a lovely way to enjoy an hour or indeed two. The spa was very clean and tidy and in the pool area the jacuzzi beds and water jets were so much fun. We booked a superior room and my first impression was that it was a little bit smaller than I had imagined. However the quality of the room was evident to see in both the fittings and style of the room. The bed was very wide and there was a choice of four types of pillow. The room had a sound system that gave a choice of continuous music to whatever type you found relaxing as well as a lighting system that allowed to select for different moods/requirements which I found quite good. The reception staff were helpful in chosing restaurants and had books showing the decor and menus of several. We chose one called Barkeno and if you like fish I can highly recommend it . It is also within walking distance of the hotel. The hotel is not inexpensive but if you are looking for a good 4 star hotel then in this location it is well worth the expense. I certainly would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, roof pool and stylish rooms - poor service”
Reviews.Author: DepDawg
Reviews.Content: I chose 1898 on the basis on TripAdvisor reviews and as usual was not disappointed - the location, just off Las Ramblas near Placa Catalunya is central and excellent. The hotel is quirky and full of history but styled recently very similar to the Hotel du Vin chain in the UK (good). The hotel is clean and well appointed and rooms are (for city centre) well sized with air conditioning in room, free internet, and good bathroom. The staff I met did slightly let down the hotel. I realise they are full all year, deal with tourists and transient business travellers every minute of every day, but regardless, they are in the service business and the couldn't care less disinterested attitude to any question (neither complaints or compliments) in both English or Spanish, was the only thing that let this otherwise excellent hotel down. Didn't try any hotel food at all - this is Barcelona and there are great restaurants (try Barceloneta for fish or Comerç 24 for tapas). Would I go back - yes - so that says it all.

Reviews.Title: “Overall two thumbs up for Hotel 1898”
Reviews.Author: chitownguy1
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1898 is a unique, trendy property in the heart of the action, Las Ramblas. We booked the hotel for three nights starting Monday April 28th. We didn’t arrive until 4:15 PM and so the 3 pm check-in time was a non-issue. We had reserved a superior room and we were given Room 445, facing Las Ramblas. - Ok, so for those that have commented on the noise factor in past posts and for those who may be concerned about this – it is a real issue if you have a room facing Las Ramblas. When we checked in, I specifically asked if the room faced Las Ramblas and was told yes, to be fair. I asked for a different room facing another street but was told there were none available. The noise was not a factor on Monday evening or Tuesday evening – keep in mind we were out until 2 AM or so ourselves and once we hit the pillow we immediately passed out! So, no worries there. On our last evening, we were in bed quite early by Barcelona standards – 11 PM –and by now it was Wed of course. There was constant noise all night long and admittedly it was pretty loud at times – seemed like there was an actual rave happening down on the street below! My fiancé and I laughed it off in the morning – it wouldn’t keep us from staying there again – for reference we are thirty-somethings who aren’t terribly conservative but don’t party until dawn anymore either. Another point on the noise – the Metro runs underneath the hotel (at least it feels like it must) – every 15 to 30 minutes you can feel the train passing by…feels like a 1 or 2 on the Richter scale actually. Did we sleep through that every night? Absolutely. Did you wonder what the hell it was the first or second time it happened? You bet. On to the wonderful traits of Hotel 1898…the lobby and rooms are of spectacular design and feel. The designer did a great job of combining modern amenities with an Asian twist (building housed the old Filipino tobacco company in case you didn’t know). The lobby is amazing, complete with a sitting area and bar. The dark hardwood floors and green/black color scheme is really cool. Room 445 is a Superior Room and provided considerable more space than a standard room (we peaked into a standard room being cleaned as we walked by). There were two twin beds pushed together to form a double which was a little annoying. Another negative was no iron in the room. As an American I think we just needed to get used to this concept, that's all. However like Casa Fuster we checked through Travelocity and assumed there were irons in the room - not the case. Anyway, I digress. I know a couple of other reviews talked about things being stolen from the room - a non-issue with us although we used the in-room safe religiously. The bathroom was very nice with rainfall showerhead, bidet and toiletries. My fiance liked the full length mirror against the bathroom door as well as mirrors above the bathroom sink and behind you on the back wall. Altogether we were very pleased with the room. It had a nice layout and was very clean and stylish. The rooftop terrace is awesome – a pool slightly larger than that of Casa Fuster’s (where we stayed prior to the Hotel 1898) and a bar on the rooftop with posh, comfortable seating all around. Definitely a huge plus. The basement spa and exercise facility are also quite nice. Compared to Casa Fuster this was far superior. The exercise room had 2 treadmills, 2 bikes, a stairmaster and a weight bench with some dumbbells. The basement pool was more of a spa pool with a couple of jaccuzzi-type massage chairs and a few shower-type waterfalls. There is a sauna and a steam room as well as two showers. One can also book massage although we opted not to do so. We certainly enjoyed the basement pool on two different occasions in the afternoon after a long day of walking. The service of the staff was definitely above average. However, keep in mind we had just come from the Casa Fuster where service was far superior. Hotel 1898 staff just weren't quite as overly accomodating is all, although we didn't find fault with anyone at all. As I posted in my Casa Fuster review, it was more of a 'we provide the info, you do the work" type of scenario. The staff did book a taxi for a 6:30 AM departure upon checkout without issue. Location, location, location. Noise comments aside, one cannot beat the location of Hotel 1898 if being in the thick of the action is your thing. The hotel is right across the street from Le Meridien and, although we didn't go inside and although Le Meridien has recently been renovated, Hotel 1898 certainly appears to have trumped the Le Meridien. More importantly, the hotel is 5 minutes or less from La Boqueria, 5 mins from the Barri Gottic (if that), and perhaps 10-15 minutes to Born. We loved this about the hotel. By the way, we never felt the least bit unsafe leaving/returning to the hotel. It was a sanctuary from all the action going on just outside the front and side doors. We would definitely stay at the Hotel 1898 again. A very cool place.

Reviews.Title: “Once more in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Coolmark
Reviews.Content: We usually go to Barcelona few times on a year on business. This time we went to 1898 hotel. It is great! is 4 stars hotel and it would has to be a 5 stars hotel! The building is an ancient condomine remodelated. Spacious rooms and quite areas. The ambient is classic and luxurious. The restaurant is high class and they've got a good concierge service in it. Location is wonderful. It is on the middle of Ramblas, where downtown is. You've got good connections and all fancy shops are nearby. We usually make the reservation through ww.gumtrip.com. They've got a good hotels choice and competitive rates.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: USCGirl5
Reviews.Content: The Hotel 1898 was amazing. Every detail in the hotel is incredible, starting with the gorgeous rooftop bar, amazing spa/bath facilities, and non-stop Charlie Chaplin movies playing in the stunning lobby. The staff was terrific, the beds huge and comfortable. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. I literally had not a single complaint (and I'm a difficult, picky traveler!). Just book it!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid but...”
Reviews.Author: blafwasa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and the spot is ideal: you're IN the city. But the service is totally different with so many rooms for improvement it became not acceptable. Room cleaning was not done at 4:30pm! Room cleaning involves your active action: there is always something missing! Spa really need to be cleaned (avoid the hammam). Breakfast service is unefficient say rude and even if food is abudant, avoid quality. Do you want an umbrella, they do not have - Do insist: they have some! And finally, rooms are really noisy! The price is the one of a 5stars in BCN. But you pay for the place as the service is an up-3stars. Prefer the Neri or Le Méridien or, for excellent service: La Florida or the Arts (but then forget the city!).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: hersoton
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in Sept 07, choosing it after seeing it was located right on Las Ramblas, and No1 on Trip Advisor for Barcelona. Never got round to reviewing it, partly because it was just as good as everyone said and there was nothing to add. But now I see it has slipped to No3 - probably because other people who loved it thought the same! So I have to set the records straight and say just how fab it is!!! Stayed here for two nights at the beginning of a cruise starting from Barcelona, and for one night at the end. The rooms were great and exceptionally well equipped. Luxury bathrobe, cute 1898 monogrammed slippers, and lovely toiletries come as standard. Also welcome was a kettle and tea making facilities (so rare in Europe), as well as very useful fridge, safe etc. Beds were huge and very comfy, and the bathroom with state of the art shower was also fab. The lobby with its huge seating area and ground floor bar are a great place to relax, and lovely and cool in contrast to the heat of Las Ramblas outside. But the highlight has to be the open air roof terrace with fantastic views of Barcelona, rooftop pool (small but great for cooling off), roof top bar and a huge range of sunbeds, al fresco four poster 'beds' (yes really!), sofas etc. A stunning place to relax with a drink, or a book, or even take a snooze - day, evening or night. There is also a basement indoor spa which we only looked at briefly, but would be a great place to relax during a winter stay. The dining room also looked inviting although we didn't sample its fare, and breakfast looked great but wasn't cheap (so if you are a breakfast fan look for a breakfast inclusive package). We also loved Las Ramblas - don't expect the chic of Paris or you will be disappointed. But for buzz and atmosphere its hard to beat - a huge range of bars and resturants, street entertainers and market stalls leading down to the port. Nearby squares are inviting, with yet more resturants and some great shops and tapas bars - the Calamari seemed to be consistently fantastic wherever we tried it. And the huge glasses of Sangria have to be seen to be believed!! On the waterfront (just at the bottom of Las Ramblas, turn left when you reach the water and walk for about ten minutes) there are some fabulous seafood resturants, and a great bar situated on a boat which is a stunning place for an early evening drink. From here its only fifteen minutes walk or so to the beach; the close proximity of beach and city is one of many things that make Barcelona so unique. Here there are another huge range of resturants to choose from - our favourite undoubtedly the Carpe Diem Lounge Bar - yet more al fresco 'beds' where you can sit and lounge with your drink and even eat dinner - totally surreal!! And from here its only another ten minutes or so walk to the Olympic Marina with a huge range of resturants and nightclubs - and a taxi rank to get back to the hotel if your feet aren't up for the walk home! Other things we loved included Gaudi Park - amazing architecture and fabulous views over the city. A bit of a walk from the nearest underground stop but well worth it. We also loved the sensational Fountain of Montjuic that does a fabulous 'Sound and Light' show around 9pm every Thursday to Sunday evening in Summer (Fri and Sat in Winter) - nearest Metro stop Placa Espanya. And finally no visit to Barcelona would be compete without visiting the Sagardia Familia and taking the lift to the top. This unfinished cathederal is simply unique - a truly amazing place. Its difficult to describe just why its so good; you just have to go there and see!!! Queues for the lift were long when we were there, but worth every minute of the wait. Overall I can only highly recommend both Barcelona and Hotel 1898. Only one disadvantage. When you say to a taxi driver at the Airport or wherever you would like to go to 'Hotel Eighteen Ninety Eight' they look at you completely blankly - since of course it woud be said completely differently in Spanish!! So unless your Spanish is excellent, have a pen and a piece of paper to hand - as soon as you write down 1898 they get it straight away!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, well-situated”
Reviews.Author: nickmichael
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at H1898. We wanted a top-end establishment in the heart of the touristy part of the city, and we picked the 1898, well, to be honest, because of the tripadvisor reviews - I think it was no. 1 in popularity at the time of booking! The reception was slightly disappointing - in spite of my having given my credit card details when booking, the clerk insisted on taking a photocopy of the card, something I have never encountered before. The room (we took a 'superior' room) was superbly furnished (it must have cost a bomb to kit out!), with mahogany furniture, exotic parquet flooring and a gorgeous all-marble bathroom. Everything was spanking new, and not a sign of shabbiness anywhere. I particularly liked the lighting 'modules', whereby you can choose a programme such as 'Welcome', 'Ambience', Read', or 'Night'; I wish I had installed such modules when recently building our house, but had never heard of them or imagined them before. At night the room was quite noisy. This didn't bother us as we wanted a room right on La Rambla, and sleep well through noise; but the window was ill-fitting, and it sounded as though it was open all the time. The hotel could well do a bit of work on soundproofing, which could be far more effective. The bed was very comfortable, but I could have done with sheets and blankets rather than duvets, which are far too hot (I often end up taking the duvet out and sleeping under its cover only). The bathroom was luxurious as I have said, but why only one tiny cake of soap? It looks mean amidst all the luxury. The bath taps were complicated to work out: there were three of them, all with different functions, and the porter could have given an explanation when he brought the bags up. The service at reception was excellent (although we only asked for restaurant bookings in town a couple of times). Otherwise the reception staff were perfectly helpful and friendly. The spa was delightful (although I was hoping for a jacuzzi temperature!). We didn't check the roof terrace and pool as it was far too cold. Breakfast was fine, but perhaps a trifle dear. We had the small breakfast: coffee, tea or chocolate with ready-made salami sandwiches, or croissants and pastries, for €9. The large breakfast (strangely called 'continental' - which for me is a limited meal) looked excellent, but very expensive (€20 I think) and we didn't want to fill ourselves up before lunch. I was disappointed by the fact that there was nowhere (apart from outside on the roof) that I could smoke. Most hotels have a smoking room or you can smoke in the bar, but I was banished to a sleazy bar in the Plaça Reial to indulge my naughty habit (I can hear righteous non-smokers cheering). But there seems to be no reason why the beautiful and unused marble hall giving on to the side-entrance (La Rambla entrance) should not be set aside for smokers. The situation is perfect for the tourist, being smack in La Rambla, and almost everything you want is within not unreasonable walking distance (Park Guëll apart). The price is perfectly normal and reasonable for what the hotel is - no arguments there. All in all a good experience, and tripadvisor's reviewers were absolutely right. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Give us a break”
Reviews.Author: CorkCharles
Reviews.Content: Charlie Hill, Cork Ireland. Stayed two nights 8th and 9th April 2008 The hotel is well situated, clean with a good mix of old and new decor, The Spa and indoor pool are very good. However, do not accept allocation of room 522 if at all possible. On the morning of the 10thApril, at 8 A.M. it became the noisiest hotel room in Barcelona, the noise coming from the corridor outside our door and it was impossible to have a lie in. It rather spoiled our impression of the Hotel, we will not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 1898--Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Louisvillian
Reviews.Content: My daughters (ages 15 & 20) and I stayed three nights in this exceptional hotel last week. It is wonderful. The decor is beautiful, the service is friendly and competent. The rooms are very nice with the key feature being fabulous bathrooms. We really liked the terrace bar on the 7th floor, among the most inviting places to relax that I've ever enjoyed. The looby bar is quiet and relaxing as well. We ate at the restaurant one night, rather than venturing out into the rain, and really enjoyed the food and the professional service. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Escape”
Reviews.Author: NYTOME
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived, we were not that excited. Had to carry our bags across Las Rambas ( a zoo) and came in the door off Las Ramblas....not greating. And checked into the room- seems small. HOWEVER, as we stayed, and explored and got to know the staff, and the restaurant and the business center and the QUALITY of all of the amenities and service, it became one of my most favorite hotels in the world. I think because it is just off Las Ramblas, the lobby is even more inviteing- a peaceful retreat from the crazy street. Was absolutly worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: delaprut
Reviews.Content: Very good experience. Stayed there for a long weekend with my wife. The hotel room was great (I had a privilege room), and the hotel is very conveniently situated (right on La Rambla and very close to Placa Catalunya). On the minuses side, its proximity to La Rambla makes it a bit noisy and you can hear the metro each time it passes by. However, this was not really annoying because I was sufficiently tired after walking through Barcelona to have a good sleep. Don't miss the La Boqueria, which is about 3 minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Spa”
Reviews.Author: chuckdigg
Reviews.Content: We loved the spa! The water was warm w/ massaging waterfalls, a sauna and steam room. We spent a couple hours each night we were there relaxing in the pool. Definitely the highlight of the stay. The location is amazing, right on the Rambla but the rooms were still quiet. The rooms themselves were a good size - enough room to spread out, the bathroom was large with a great shower/tub! The only draw-back of the stay was the bed. Not comfortable at all and surprising in such a nice hotel to have such sub-par sleeping accomadations. The roofdeck was gorgeous. Unfortunately, it was a bit chilly when we were there so we weren't able to take advantage of the outdoor pool, but it gives us reason to come back again in the summer:) The staff was polite and very helpful with restaurant and store recommendations. Everything about our stay was fabulous. Besides the bed, I would have upped my overall rating to "excellent."

Reviews.Title: “We loved the underground spa! Would return when we go back to Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: MsAnnaNOLA
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very comfortable and sylish, yet relaxed. We were there in February 2008 so it was a little chilly but that made for a wonderful experience at the underground spa and pool. We left our rooms in our robes and slippers with our suits already on. We liked the fact that the spa is co-ed and we could participate in the sauna and steam room as a couple. Most places are segregated by sex which makes for a lonely time when on vacation with your loved one. The rooftop pool looked fabulous and it is too bad it was too cold to go in the outdoor pool, although I understand we could have if we really wanted to. We did not eat at the hotel but there are many good places to eat in Barcelona. If you want something quick and fresh the Organic Vegetarian take away place on the corner was very good. Also try Cafe de L' Acadamia in the old town it was wonderful. Skip Mi Burrito y Yo - tourist trap worst paella ever. Skip La Fonda at Port Olympic - They served us a bottle of wine that was already opened and then denied it. ( I believe my own eyes!) You may also want to skip the 4GATS of Picasso fame. We didn't know what it was famous for when we went. They were so rude to us, we and the people behind us walked out without even trying anything. It is best to have a food book available, many restaurants don't have English menus nor do they speak English. We had some problems ordering on a few occasions. With a good book in hand you will have some great meals!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rbosl
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Excellent location. The rooms were well appointed. Despite being right on the Ramblas the rooms were exceptionally quiet. Roof deck was beautiful and very peaceful. Spa was outstanding. The spa pool was magical. Complementary tea 5/7pm was great. Front desk was very helpful. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Kezzamundo
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1898 is an excellent hotel and situated near La Ramblas giving it a wonderful location to explore Barcelona. We stayed in a Colonial Suite which (although quite pricey) comes with its own huge private terrace and heated swimming pool which we took full advantage of. The Spa in the hotel is excellent and I would encourage guests to take full advantage of it when they stay. Our room was big, comfortable and quiet and we had an excellent stay. The only thing that may have let the hotel down was the food. Breakfast was fine and there was plenty of choice for everyone. We ate dinner at the hotel and although the food was of the highest quality it was almost as if the chef was trying too hard to be original with his dishes which resulted in some very strange combinations and one bad stomach ache. Overall, we had a great time and would recommend it. Also, as this is not well advertised, the train to and from the airport is free, and makes travel to and from the city a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “very romantic place to stay but be careful !!”
Reviews.Author: chrisyfur
Reviews.Content: my girlfriend and i went to the hotel 1898 for a 5 day stay and it was all what we wanted !! it was so romantic and the staff there were lovely apart from one member of staff at the bar ! but that doesn't matter, the thing we loved was the fact that we were in the middle of the most amazing city and all that hustle and bustle outside but you would never know which is great if you want to relax!! the only problem we had with the hotel was that we booked a deluxe room which we didn't end up staying in as the room it self was very small and the balcony only had a brick wall and no view so we didn't fancy looking at the wall for days so we asked to be moved, with it being busy they only had superior room which i would like to add was great it didn't have a balcony but it had two windows that opened up onto the great sound and views of la ramblas and the room was a lot bigger then the first room!! we would without a doubt book this type of room again also we were impressed the way the room was cleaned twice a day , we only had breakfast once at the hotel which was nice but not great as we tend to like English breakfast however there is still a lot to choose from we also had dinner which was really nice but plz be warned a medium cooked steak is more like rare cooked steak in England so if u don't like blood be warned !!! if u want a great place to eat with a lovely romantic view try totre dell mar in port vell ask Dani in the reception of 1898 he will book it for you.(hes great) if you book this hotel or any other hotels in Barcelona plz watch your bags and wallets as mine was stolen while we were site seeing but we still had a great time and would return to this great city in a flash there's so much to see and do but i wouldn't take children here as we would say its a adults holiday .

Reviews.Title: “Great location poor food noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: boatmusdir
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a terrific location, and the building and decor are superb. Our room was rather small, and almost windowless (just a very small window at one end) and whilst the bathroom was excellent, the room itself attracted all the corridor noise - especially tiresome when (after our 12 hour flight) the domestic staff started loudly and energetically cleaning the rooms at 7.15 am. The staff were pleasant and helpful, but the breakfast, although abundant, was poorly maintained - hot items eg.scrambled egs, bacon etc. were left to go cold, and bread was left to go stale. Worse, room service delivered exceptionally poor food - salad that had obviously sat for hours, fish that was old and oily, stale rolls, and an inedible hamburger. The cuisine of this hotel is distinctly poor, and more attention should be paid to sound proofing the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: audi58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel 1898 at the end of January for a work function. Before we got there, we had stayed at two other hotels just to bounce around town. Hotel 1898 was the best area to stay in. It is just off the La Rambla and an excellent location. It had a beautiful bar, and lounge area. The staff were friendly and spoke English, which was a help. We took the metro from the Airport, which was an adventure, Bottom line, we brought to many bags. It was an easy trip, with a change at the main station to get to downtown. No one seemed to speak English, so your pretty much on your own. We even stopped the Policia who rode the metro, and they did not speak English either. Needless to say, we took a cab on the way home. There is a Grocery Store near by and a Pharmacy, just ask the front desk. Suggestion: Get some Euro's at the airport, you will need them as soon as you get into town. There are quite a few ATM's on the street, but we did not use them. There is a Starbucks right next door to the Hotel. But because of the Euro conversion, be prepared to pay about $6.50 for a Latte.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience, Perfect Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: dougfromnj
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful stay. They upgraded us to a room with a deck b/c it was our honeymoon to start which we very much appreciated. The room was wonderful, very modern with a beautiful deck where we spent a lot of time. The decor was very modern, more like the Omni than the Ritz. The location in Las Ramblas is PERFECT. Right in the middle so you can either walk up to Placa Catalunya, walk across to the Gothic Quarter, or walk down to the water. We love to walk so this was the best location as we walked to many places from here such as the Picasso Museum and La Padrera. Our routine was to run around the city, come back and sunbathe on the gorgeous roof deck, then take a dip in the roof pool or go to the basement where they have an awesome grotto like pool. The roof was even better at night to grab a drink with some ambient lighting and views of the city. Front desk was helpful with food recommendations and how to get places. Everything about the hotel was beautiful. Very nice staff. I hope to go back to Barcelona one day, and if I do, I can't imagine staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Proudsy
Reviews.Content: Prior to staying at H1898 I had read some impressive reviews on this site; I have to say I was not disappointed - the Hotel was perfect in every respect; Room - fantastic, Staff - friendly & caring - nothing was too much trouble for them, Ambience - very relaxing and welcoming, Spa - just perfect for relaxing after a day on the pavements! - all combined to make a very memorable weekend.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in the center of old-world Barcelona.......!”
Reviews.Author: LovinLifeinMontreal
Reviews.Content: We realize this review is almost two years late, but like they say, "better late than never". My wife and I stayed at the 1898 for 9 nights in April, 2006, and found this hotel exceeded every expectation we had based on other reviews and their web site. It was located right in the middle of the old city, had an understated elegance, and the staff could not be more informed, helpful and professional. The rooms were very nice, clean and comfortable and had gorgeous marble bathrooms. The decor was also nicely done and high quality materials could be found throughout the hotel. As well, the bar located in the lobby was a nice place to unwind after a long day touring, and the bartender made us the best Sangria we had ever had. Our rooms were located on the inside of the htel, overlooking a beautiful atrium, and were very quiet. Overall, a fantastic experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and beautiful surrondings”
Reviews.Author: KatelynnIreland
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel from reviews I had read and was not disappointed. The staff are excellent in a really understated way and I hope they are well thought of due to their wonderful presentation and manner. I loved the bed, the pillows, the pools and the wonderful location. I loved the style of the hotel, very old world. I cannot say enough about it, I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back - loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BoddingtonB
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, beautiful interior, roof terrace / cocktail bar / pool, a genuine sense of class... no question where I'll be heading back to when next in Barca.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis from the hustle and bustle of the Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: buttsy
Reviews.Content: we were there for a long weekend and the location and standard of the hotel made the weekend for us. It was great to be able to walk off the Ramblas straight into the hotel, where peace and tranquillity was the order. The staff were both courteous and efficient and the bar service was excellent. Some may consider the rooms on the small side, but they are furnished and decorated to a very high standard and to be fair, you will not spend a lot of time in them if you want to take in all the sights and experiences Barcelona has to offer. I have recommended the hotel to both family and friends and will definately stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “weekend brake”
Reviews.Author: Michaelkh
Reviews.Content: we went 2 couples away for a extended weekend getaway, and wanted too bee in the middle of it all, wee wanted at the same time too be in a place where things seemed too be of a good standard. Everything was perfect, the rooms-especialy the restaurant that you have too try, expencive but worth it, the spa area and swimmingpool is built in true harmony too the concept, as well as the decoration all around, the bar is a plecent place too spend an hour or two. We have stayed a lot of places around the world, and this hotel takes the cake. Eapecially because they have succeded with the story and athomespfere.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarcHumphries
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in June 2006 for my wife's birthday. Simply loved the place from the first minute! Classy decor, very chic rooms superb breakfast and a great location right on Las Ramblas. Just down from Placa Cataluyna and opposite all the pet stalls in Las Ramblas. If you don't like this hotel you don't like life!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent except the front desk”
Reviews.Author: DanielleM
Reviews.Content: The hotel 1898 is ideally located on the Ramblas. It has been beautifully refurbished. Rooms are nice, privilege rooms are superb. Everything is 4 stars level except the front desk. During our both stays in this hotel, we were disappointed by the low level and the lack of friendliness of the staff at the front desk. The service you are expecting from a 4 stars level is nil. Examples : You need tickets for the Opera (Liceu) : "it is at walking distance, do it yourself". Ordering a taxi 2 hours ahead for the dinner on 31st December : "take the metro, it is not possible". Ask for a small hour late check out time on the first January : "impossible". It is rather hostel style than 4* level. Pity because it is the only weak point. Fortunately very unusual in this category of hotels in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: NanitaSmith
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Spain and we used concierge.com to obtain info about the best hotels in Spain. Barcelona was our first stop there and our stay at 1898 was absolutely wonderful! The rooms were beautiful with both modern and traditional design. The bathrooms were large with a large shower. We were centrally located to all of the sites and right on La Rambla. We were able to walk to almost all places (esp. if you like walking). We would definitely stay here again if we were to return to Barcelona. Stan & Jo

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Bump88
Reviews.Content: We went to Barcelona for our wedding anniversary. We chose this hotel after reading the reviews on here and were not disappointed. The location is excellent right on La Rambla, but the rooms (or at least our room) are still very quiet, we couldn’t hear the street at all. We paid extra for a “deluxe” room which was a bit smaller than I was expecting, but still very nice with everything you needed. The spa area was also very good with a small pool, jacuzzi’s, sauna and steam room. This was great after a busy day sightseeing. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: RachPach
Reviews.Content: I found Hotel 1898 through the reviews on Tripadvisor. It was the first time I used the site and I have used it for each Trip since. The hotel is situated on Las Ramblas a bustling main tourist street in Barcelona. Its a great location and a walk up the pedestrian path through the centre of the road gives an interesting sample of local life with the bird markets, and a large food market a short distance from the hotel. Las Ramblas is a great place to enjoy a drink in the evening. Hotel 1898 is an outstandingly beautiful hotel. The interior design is beyond reproach. When I viewed the photos of the grotto style inside pool I thought that it could not live up to my expectations. But it was gorgeous and the roof top pool area with bed style seats was equally difficult to drag myself away from. I sampled some of the starter style nibbles at the rooftop bar/cafe, although they were pricey they were delicious. I regret that I did not try the restaurant in the hotel but will do so on my next visit. I would probably opt for a breakfast included deal next time as there is nowhere good nearby for the hearty breakfast I was looking for. I didn't find the cafes etc on Las Ramblas to be very good. I was only in Barcelona for a few days and am ashamed to say that the hotel was so relaxing that I did not experience as much of Barcelona as I hoped! One restaurant that I did go to was Los Caracoles, it was recommended in my tourist book but I ended up stumbling upon it while on a walk. I've attached some photos of it, it had a charming atmosphere and delicious seafood. Rooms were small but beautifully formed, bathrooms marble with refilled luxury toiletries. Service was good and I had no complaints during my trip. This is the best hotel I have stayed in to date. Every time I have begun to book a trip anywhere since and have to search through the average reviews of other 4/5 star hotels I wish I could pack Hotel 1898 up and take it with me!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pantani
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights over New Year, it was our second trip to Barcelona, and as we had such a great stay at the 1898 last time we stayed there again. We could only get a Standard room this time, but whilst the room was noticably smaller, it was still very nice. Everything about the hotel was just as good as our first visit. Still don't like the 3pm check-in, but our room was available at 1-30pm, so no complaints. Wanted to add a short review of a Restaurant called El Choquito, it is on Las Ramblas on the opposite side to the hotel, about 70 yards closer to the port, our experience was terrible, the service was awful, the food very moderate indeed and the prices very high, so don't go near it, it was a terrible mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: snowdome
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel by myself for 2 nights after reading previous reviews.It was a delightful experience.All the staff are charming and the rooftop pool terrace was particularly lovely.I am planning to stay again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with others. Absolutely Fab!”
Reviews.Author: acavenezia
Reviews.Content: could not agree more... all posts are correct. This hotel is fabulous... only stayed one night but loved it. Rooms are simply stunning!!! cannot say more...very comfortable hotel..... im glad i listened to the others....

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: 2-goodtimetravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Colonial suite and was worth every single Euro. The room and hotel was one of the best we have ever stayed in (The hotel Intercontinental in Hong Kong was as good) . We intend to go back and stay again. The rooms swimming pool was too cold but that was changed as soon as we asked. Do yourself a favor and book the Colonial suite. Dennis Burkhartsmeier

Reviews.Title: “the best value for the money in BCN”
Reviews.Author: cmm3
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights in Barcelona following ThanksGiving a few weeks ago. Two of those were spent at the Hotel 1898 and I have to say that I would have spent my entire stay but they did not have availability for all four nights – unless of course you count the Colonial Suite for 1500 Euro a night, which is – regretfully – outside my budget for Barcelona. I also spent two nights at the Casa Fuster which was also very nice, but much more expensive than the 1898. In the end, although I liked the Casa Fuster better than the 1898, I really cannot fault the later for very much. Although the hotel truly falls short of a 5-star property, it is probably the best value in Barcelona – euro for euro – hands down. I had a Superior room which was large, comfortable, and contained a number of great amenities. I also really enjoyed the “maritime” themed decore that was echoed throughout the hotel. Instead of cheesy hotel art there where nautical charts, maps, and old photographs a There was a fairly large marble bathroom with a full bathtub. It’s definitely not the most luxurious bathroom I have seen, but it did the job and was certainly spacious enough for one person. Although there were two sinks, you really had to squeeze to accommodate the second person. Most noteworthy was the “automated” lighting system. I have seen this many times before, at other hotels but I was really impressed with it at the 1898. One button turns all the lights on, one turns them all off, one keeps the bathroom lights on and a small “nightlight” and there are modes for TV watching, reading, and more. Other hotels attempt to do this but I always find myself manually turning on various lamps, unplugging others, and generally cannot seem to make use of the automated lighting features. I also got to make use of the indoor pool which I absolutely loved. I never made it to the gym section – which was small but stocked with a few treadmills, elliptical machines, bikes and light free-wieghts. While I was swimming I noticed a number of people using the equipment – so people do actually get good use out of the gym. This whole section looked like it had just completed renovation and looked brand new, swimming in the indoor pool as the temperature outside dropped a few degrees every day was a dream. I did not make it to the rooftop pool but it looks fantastic from the other trip advisor pictures. There is a bar up there in the summertime, but it was closed at the end of November when I was staying there. The breakfast was also standard 4-star fare. I did notice a number of exotic fruits like dragon fruit and passion fruit which I wasn’t expecting to find but for 19 Euro a person I can’t say it was any better or worse than your standard over-priced hotel continental breakfast. I wouldn’t pay for the breakfast again. One evening after I was tired from a full day of sight seeing and wanting to rest before heading out for drinks, I decided to eat dinner in the main restaurant of the hotel rather than head out. I walked in at 8:45 and there was not a single person there. Just 2 or 3 bored waiters. Needless to say, I walked right out and went to the restaurant next door to the hotel – I think it was called “111.” I wish I would have avoided the hotel’s restaurant b/c seeing it empty like that left me with a disappointed feeling about the hotel in general. Although the 1898 offers so much for the money, I don’t believe it really could be a truly deluxe 5-star property. Although everything was very nice, it was obvious where a few liberties had been taking in order to save money and be able to offer the value. The furnishings had this low-cost feel to them, almost like what IKEA would offer if they went the maritime traditional look. Sure, it looks great in a catalog and on a website, and at the end of the day it gets the job done, but there are certainly better options (for more money, of course). My biggest complaint however were the towels in the bathroom. Although there were many of them and the bath towels were extremely large, they felt like towels you are given at the local gym when working out. Either they had been washed way too much or I have been spending too much time at the Four Seasons and have gotten used to soft towels. I don’t know. How hard could it be to provide soft towels? And speaking of the Four Seasons, I thought the mattress could have been a bit softer, but I find that firmer (and slimmer) mattresses are the norm in Europe and so this was not unexpected. I should say that the choice of pillows was a very nice touch thought I did not have an opportunity to take advantage of it. Although I have gone on and nit-picked a little above and I have decided not to give the 1898 5-out-of-5, I want everyone to know that the above negatives are totally minor. I would stay at the 1898 again a thousand times! It is the perfect choice for a hotel on the Ramblas. It is so close to Placa Catalunya and a perfect starting point from which to enjoy the city. There is even a Starbuck’s attached to the lobby for all those who are homesick but want to avoid McDonalds et al. – but watch out: At a worse than $1.50/Euro exchange rate on the street, those white chocolate mochas will cost you dearly – as will everything else. The old adage “you get what you pay for” is certainly true, if you want a truly deluxe experience, 225 Euro per night for a superior room will simply not get you there. Instead you get an experience that approximates the 5-star deluxe hotel which for most – and at those fantastic prices, is more than enough.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: erikalicious
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel 1898 and absolutely loved it! The location was awesome (on the upper Ramblas). The rooms were very cozy with clean lines, dark wood and the most amazing terrace. Very modern amenities with traditional Spanish architecture, kinda like Barcelona, old & new mixed together! Great bath with separate soaking tub, fluffy robes and slippers. Comfy lobby with overstuffed leather sofas and great ambiance, staff was very helpful and such a nice retreat after long days of exploring the city! The rooftop terrace and pool has amazing views of the city and very nice loungers. The pool & spa is very nice. Note: Get a room with the terrace, you won't regret it! Be sure to visit the La Boqueria and have Pinotxo serve you up a tasty treat! Amazing city, fabulous hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel,”
Reviews.Author: dollyw
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, very modern. The reception area is lovely, nice bar & lovely big couches to lounge on & have a drink. Our room was really nice, a bit small, but it was spotless clean. Huge bed, bday in the bathroom. The pool area is really nice & relaxing, it is also a bit small, but really nice. Sauna & steam room also. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, it is right on Las Ramblas, but be careful, as there are lots of pick pockets & lots of ladies of the night approching men, not shy about it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vickso1979
Reviews.Content: This is a truely fantastic hotel - one of the best we've ever stayed. Its plush but not pretentious and the decor is fabulous. We ended up in Barcelona by accident (budget airline problems at Stansted) and had only planned to stay one night - this hotel was so good we stayed for three. Both the roof top pool, bar and four poster loungers and the pool/spa in the cavernous basement of the hotel cannot help but induce a state of total relaxation. What a find and worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for its calm efficiency”
Reviews.Author: zenovya
Reviews.Content: From the moment you push though the revolving door off the Rambla till you wake in the morning, peace and tranquility reign at this lovely hotel. The staff are friendly and have marvellous suggestions for tapas bars and restaurants. The room was spotless and cleaned punctiliously every day of our three night trip. The spa is a welcome treat at the end of a day walking the streets and the view from the roof swimming pool as the sun sets was brilliant even in November (if it was a little chilly out of the pool). We were on a room only basis so cannot comment on the food though there were so many restaurants and bars around that there was no need of hotel food. All in all, a top recommendation for a Barcelona hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was the start of a great honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: xzabion
Reviews.Content: I intially booked a room at the Jazz hotel, but they over booked and sent me to Hotel 1898. What a gorgous hotel. Rooms were a bit small but had much extras. Very comfortable and the location was the best, in the middle of the strip where everythings at. I give the hotel 2 thumbs up if the price doesnt scare you.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 1898”
Reviews.Author: yonnya
Reviews.Content: I'had been twice in this beautiful hotel and I had experienced both rooms,Classic and Superior.The location is perfect,all the facilities are simply excellent and the service too.The next time I'll go to Barcelona I'm sure I will book it again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: Ameweb
Reviews.Content: I work for hotels so I know what I am talking about. I staid 3 nights in the 1898 in Barcelona. I had booked a Superior room by Internet. First of all, the location is great: you can do whatever you want as you are staying in the middle of the Rambla. The hotel has a car carp 5located in the basement) which is very safe and where you won't damage your car. It was not very hard to find the hotel from the highway as you just have to find the city centrer.... Check-in: nothing special, nice staff but not very original. All are very elegant. The Lobby looks great: modern, stylish, comfortable ... exactly what you see on the website. The room: it was a Superior Room;, 4th floor. It looks that my room was the only one with a small balcony... nice if you want to have a panoramis view on the Rambla. The room is great: large and comfortable (no surprise if you look at the website). LCD TV on the wall (26 inches), radio, free wifi, 20 international and national channels etc etc... On of the great thing is the 4 programmed ambiances that you can choose for the lignting.... that's nice !!!!!! Bad point: you can hear/feel the underground and some noise of the Rambla, but that was not a big problem for me. Bathroom: nice, complete and modern. I just had an issue with the cold water....
