Terrace: roof terrace with heated swimming pool: G R E A T Basement swimmingpool + SPA: G R E A T + G R E A T nothing to pay for the spa except massages and manual treatment. Water beds and swimming pool are so nice !!!!! This 4 star hotel could easily have 5 !!!! A very good address for Barcelona !

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tarida2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel 1898 for a couple of nights en route from Ibiza to England. Having left home at 5.00 am we arrived at the hotel at 10.30 am and expected to have to wait a few hours to check in. But no, our rooom was ready and we checked in immediately, much to our delight. We had booked a Standard room which we expected to look out onto an internal well, but actually it looked out onto a side street, so was really interesting, but still quiet, given that the hotel is actuallly on La Rambla. The room was gorgeous, with a HUGE bed, and a really well equipped bathroom. Everything in the hotel we sampled (the bar, the spa, the pcs in the library, the room service) was great and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. Add that to the fact that its situation makes it so easy to visit the sights of Barcelona, and I really couldn´t recommend a better place to stay. Jan & Graham M, Ibiza

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to beat this !”
Reviews.Author: mignles
Reviews.Content: For value for money in Barcelona, this hotel will take some beating. The efficiency and friendliness of the staff; the cleanliness and comfort of the rooms; the facilities and the situation of the 1898 are all beyond reproach. The front-desk and bar personnel all speak perfect English and all the maids, the bell-boy and other staff whose paths we crossed, all greeted us with a smile and a "holà". The rooms were spotless and the beds very comfortable - you even have a choice of pillow! The bathrooms are wonderful and bathrobes are slippers are at your disposition. The roof-terrace and pool, the basement spa-pool are all to be experienced. The bar area abounds with comfortable sofas. The hotel is right on the Ramblas, very close to the Liceu metro station. We will return here as we loved our stay - you will feel the same.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and its location”
Reviews.Author: SABL09
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 3 nights shortly before our US departure based on the many favorable reviews. The Hotel succeeded in exceeding our high expectations! We arrived late evening after a longer than planned trip from Madrid. We were warmly welcomed and immediately put at ease. The Hotel is located right on La Rambla however it is a world away in the peace and tranquility inside. Our rooms (superior) were small but so well designed that size wasn't a factor; they were extremely comfortable and quiet. Staff were available and very friendly and helpful. The roof top offers a beautiful view of the city and though it was too cool for us to swim in the pool, we did enjoy a drink at the bar while we watched the sunset over Barcelona. The Hotel location is perfect and we walked everywhere. Can't say enough about how positive our experience was!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikh43
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1898 is outstanding and even after decades of business and leisure travel qualifies for one of my personal 'top ten'. The decor is an exciting blend of old (it's the 1898-built HQ of a colonial tobacco company) and new - sensitively and stylishly brought right into the 21st century with a blend of Scandinavian style and top notch interior decoration with great attention to detail. The rooms have almost every possible facility - and we stayed in the cheapest (interior view rooms are actually best if you want a quiet night). Plasma screen TV - even in-room tea/coffee making facilities - rare in Europe outside the UK. Rooftop heated outdoor pool with a view to die for over the city. Indoor cellar pool, spa and sauna - all free. Service immaculate - friendly, helpful and unfailingly courteous. Position ideal for the tourist - right on Las Ramblas and a very short walk from Plaza Catalunya (metro, airport buses, tourist info and tour buses). I can't comment on the food as we ate out - spoilt for choice in Barcelona. This is not the cheapest hotel - but by no means the most expensive and great value for money if you want a little treat. I am usually super-critical but can find little to fault here - and I have absolutely no connection of any kind with the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “H 1898 is superb”
Reviews.Author: AFRScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in a Superior room (on the net it says "Deluxe") which is well worth it as it looks out to the Ramblas with a step out balcony (normal rooms are a little on the small side). Unfortunately, the Metro's rumbling noise can be heard & felt on the 4th floor. The Spa is small but lovely, roof top bar closes at the end of Oct. though the warm, small (more a plunge) pool is still available. Amazing views & lots of large loungers all around the roof to relax on. Staff is professional & on the ball. The bar lacks a bit in "speed" - you wait & wait & wait if there are 2 people being served before you. Excellent b/fast buffet in a very large, swish b/fast area. It comes at a price though but if you're willing to pay for an excellent hotel....We have booked again already !

Reviews.Title: “Style and luxury on the Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: BlueBananaSkin
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from 4 nights at the 1898. I relied on the comments and ratings from Tripadvisor and they were spot on: The superior room is easily big enough for all but (possibly ?) the North American market, which does after all like things really BIG. The hotel bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept on. Normally I long to be back in my own bed, but this one was just perfectly comfortable - not too hard and not too soft. Very dark curtains means you can sleep all morning and not realise it! (yes, I did...) Dimming room lighting: bit of a gimmick, but very nice touch once you get used to it Linen was crisp and heavy cotton, and changed daily. Towels were changed twice daily (dont go here if you are an eco-warrior!) Shower and bath taps: I noted the comments on TA: its really not rocket science - there is one dial for temperature, one for shower/bath tap, and one for small shower head on sep pipe. There is no need for further instructions, IMHO Noise: had a room overlooking ramblas (room 444). Could hear some noise through double glazing (occasional police siren, some traffic) but never enough to disturb or prevent sleep. Benefits of overlooking ramblas outweigh noise problem. If you're a VERY light sleeper, go for internal room. Spa and pools: superb. Dark cellar pool was atmospheric, roof terrace pool superb location with view of city. Roof terrace probably comes into its own in the summer months, though... Location: cannot be beaten Decor: stylish, modern, bit on the dark side, but it all works well together. Staff: Faultless. made restaurant reservation, confirmed my existing reservation, left note in my room to say they had done it. always courteous and polite. multi-lingual. Top tip: no need to get concierge to arrange a taxi - they ring for one and by the time it arrives, it already has several euros on the clock. Just walk 5 yards onto Ramblas and hail one - never took me longer than 30 seconds.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Pie
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had a 'girls' week' in Barcelona. The location of this hotel was excellent for us as most of the main sights were within walking distance. The accommodation was luxurious with very well appointed bathrooms. I do not know if it was our shower but we had a problem getting the water temperature to a high enough level. We had booked bed and breakfast and breakfast was entirely satisfactory. Many people have mentioned the rooftop pool and although it looked very nice we were never able to get sunbeds round it as they were always taken when we went up. This may be due to the fact that there are not that many beds. The pool in the basement is nice to visit. The bar on the roof is lovely and it is nice to have a drink there in the early evening. Although the hotel is situated on La Rambla there is no noice in your room due to the excellent soundproofing. If I was returning to Barcelona I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “H1898 - elegance from the past, great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_2008
Reviews.Content: My stay at the H 1898 recently was great from beginning to end. It took me back in time with old world feel (over 100 yrs ago was home to the Phillippine Tobacco Co!!) but a hotel with all the modern features a business or holiday traveller needs. The indoor pool is unreal---as well as the views from up on top of the hotel! The location for checking out the old town is unbeatable. Staff very friendly. I hear they have other hotels in town... I will be checking them out next time in Barcelona. Jeff

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: adav16
Reviews.Content: Everything about Hotel 1898, from the decor to the service and facilities were outstanding. When we arrived at 7 AM, we went up to the roof terrace, found a bed and took a nap. The downstairs pool/ jacuzzi was perfect for soothing the feet after a long day of walking. The "superior" room was certainly large enough for two. There was plenty of storage, robes, slippers, large tub, excellent climate control. Even the "balcony", just enough to stand on, but provided a bird's eye view of the goings on in Las Ramblas. Quiet too, except I was able to hear (feel) the sound of the subway. Never did it keep me awake - perhaps a higher floor (we were on the 3rd) would help. Never used the restaurant - so many bakeries and cervesarias nearby, and the Boqueria Market. Don't buy the mango juice from the stalls in front. They charge 2 euros - the ones farther back to the side only charge 1 euro. Staff was professional, and provided everything we asked for - which was plenty! Excellent restaurant advice. Two of note: Neyras on Via Laietana 41 - easy to find - both tapas and regular menu. We ordered off the regular and were impressed. Also, El Pintor (Sant Honorat 7) in Barri Gotic off Placa Jaume. So incredibly good we went back for a second dinner before we left. Have the hotel make reservations for you! Try the salted cod with honey, pine nuts & raisins. Try the profiteroles. Seriously. Also, we found success by never taking the Turistic Bus. The bus/subway is so cheap, easy and clean. Why go all over the place when you can only really see 2 or 3 sights a day? Why wait on that horrible line? Take the 24 bus from Placa Catalunya to Park Guell. Take the subway to Sagrada Famiglia and then walk the "Ruta de Modernisme" following the signs in the sidewalk along the Diagonal. Take the green line Subway to the funicular up to Montjuic and see Joan Miro and the National Museum of Catalan Art. Walk through the Barri Gotic and make sure to see the Roman ruins in the basement of the Museum of le Ciutat of Barcelona. ARTICKET: if you like art, history & architecture, buy it. For 20 euros, you get entrance to 7 museums (Picasso, Joan Miro, La Pedrera, etc. - it pays for itself after three) Buy it at the tourist info center below Placa Catalunya. (Look for the "I" sign) Best thing: if you have the Articket, you can skip the long line at La Pedrera. Just give the ticket to the gate guard. She will get it stamped for you and you have just saved yourself a 30 minute wait!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service, Nice Building”
Reviews.Author: awtiger1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at the Hotel 1898 in early Oct. 2007. I am a frequent business traveler both within the US and internationally and have experience with many hotels (Four Seasons, Starwood, Ritz Carlton, etc...). Hotel 1898 is part of a chain of upscale boutique hotels in Spain. The pluses are that the hotel is in nice condition with clean rooms and good looking common spaces (including 2 pools). Our experience was ruined, however, by the incredibly unhelpful staff at Hotel 1898 who seemed to go out of their way to be outright rude to us - for instance, my wife called to ask if the conceirge could make a dinner reservation for us. Four hours later, we had heard nothing so she called again. The concierge responded by snapping that they were very busy and would call when they got around to it - by the time they did, the restaurant was fully booked. Another major problem was that the Hotel was simply mismanaged - although the check-in time was 3pm, the hotel refused to check us in at that time saying that the rooms were not clean. We were not able to check in until over two hours later and the hotel offered us no recompense for this significant inconvenience aside from one drink at the bar. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone as the service is horrendous.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 1898 - Luxury and Location”
Reviews.Author: DesignerDoll
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a trip to Spain, including Barcelona, where we stayed at the Hotel 1898. We had read several reviews of this hotel; most were positive, some were not. We would absolutely recommend this beautiful hotel for adults travelling without children. The hotel's central location on the La Rambla was perfect, and after a busy and crowded day signhtseeing, the hotel's quiet and sophisticated interior was like a calming oasis for us. Although we did not eat in the hotel, we made use of the luxurious roof deck, with its pool and deep upholstered chaises (in some cases, as large as full sized beds) to read and relax. The sunsets were glorious from the roof and the roof bar served fabulous cocktails. Yes, the drinks were pricey, but certainly in line with a hotel of this quality. Our room faced a side street off La Rambla, which was great since there was a three-day festival going on during our stay, resulting in huge crowds and lots of activity. Although our room was a bit small, it had a high ceiling and luxurious appointments. We were especially impressed with the lighting and dimming control system and how well buffered we were from the noise outside. Our stay cost us $2,200.00 USD for four nights and five days in a Superior room. We had read previous reviews which were critical of the hotel's staff. We found the staff to be curteous, friendly and very helpful. Since we were arriving in Barcelona early in the morning, the hotel made arrangements to have our room ready for us earlier then the normal check-in time, secured our luggage and made a safe available for our use. With reference to the safety within and without the hotel, the staff stressed using the room safe for our valuables and being "aware" of the people around us in the streets while touring the city. We never had any problems or felt unsafe in Barcelona. Our favorite place to eat a light and scrumpous breakfast was Escriba, only as few blocks from the hotel. Be realistic about prices since the US Dollar is weak compared to the Euro. Expect to pay around $30.00 USD for two mini quiches, coffee, bottles of water and one (fantastic) chocolate croissant. You should make dinner reservations for popular restaurants or expect to wait until 10:00 p.m. or later to have dinner. We would suggest purchasing the one or two day tourist bus pass which provides an excellent overview of the city. You can get off and back on the bus as often as you like during a twelve hour period, allowing you to visit sites of interest for as long as you wish. Barcelona is a city not to be missed, especially if you appreciate fantastic architecture, both old and new.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed and Returned on the same trip!”
Reviews.Author: Barcaboy
Reviews.Content: Expensive but worth it. Beautiful rooms, spacious public areas and a great roof pool and bar. It's right on La Rambla, so, either book in advance and ask for a room at the rear of the hotel or put up with a little noise until 2 AM. The windows are even made to seal out the noise. We started our trip at the Hotel 1898 and liked it so much that we reserved an additional night at the end of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps Too Much?”
Reviews.Author: SteveBarker
Reviews.Content: This was one of those hotels where it is difficult to tell the staff from the guests and I felt the staff were doing us a favour. The location is perfect and the hotel facilities excellent. The rooftop bar and pool is fantastic and the inside pool in the basment too. I did'nt use the restaurant apart from breakfast, but once again the staff were not too helpful. Some reviews mention small rooms. This was not the case for me. My room was pretty big with a high ceiling. I looked out onto an internal well so there was no view and it was tough to tell the time of day or the weather. Many other rooms on other floors had this view to the well too. The room was very high tech. Lighting, had several settings rather than just on and off. There were no instructions or channel listing for the television or video channels. The bathroom was very luxurious although the controls for the bath/shower were difficult to programme - simly becasue there were lots of taps and controls. Despite the luxury, I dont think I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great....but they need more rooms with double beds!”
Reviews.Author: Wuffa
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very beautiful....well designed and a real oasis in the busy city centre. Conveniently located for everything with a fantastic roof top bar and pool which was a great place to recharge your batteries in the sun after a mornings shopping. The spa was excellent as well for a hotel of this size! The only complaint is that they dont have many rooms with double beds....catering it seems for dual occupancy business travellers.....so make sure you reserve one when you book. We were offered a room with a double but it was MUCH smaller and apparently this ones they have get taken early! We would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: roxanneEDH
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I went to Barcelona before sailing on a 12 day cruise. The hotel was easy to get to and the staff was very friendly. The rooms were small, but very normal for European standards. The hotel was clean and decorated like a boutique hotel in San Francisco. We absolutely loved our stay and would definitely return! Just beware of the expensive drinks at the rooftop bar, my drink was 20 euros!!! Very overpriced, but still worth it to look out over the city at night.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 1898”
Reviews.Author: Pivec
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the H1898 for 5 nights starting Sept. 12, 2007. Did take a superior room. Some comments are shown below. 1) The taxi was 21 Euros from the airport. The fare was 28 Euro from the hotel to the airport--traffic was heavy in the morning. Did tip. If you request a taxi at the front desk and they call for one, the flag drops when the taxi driver receives the call. We did this once and when the taxi arrived at the hotel, the fare was already 4.5 Euros. 2) The front desk was very nice and helpful. Most spoke English. We are in our middle 60's and my wife has difficulty walking because of back surgeries. We asked to see a few rooms to see which bathroom would work out the best. They showed us 3 rooms. We picked room 344--overlooked the La Rambla. Windows cut out most of the street noise. 3) Room was very clean. Two twin mattresses were placed together. In the tub/shower, the top knob determined if the water came out of the spigot or the 8" shower head. The lower knob determined the water temperature. The bathroom had a hair dryer and a towel warmer rack. The room was equipped with a light dimming system--very unique. 4) The Hotel has 4 free computers for your use on the first floor. 5) We did not try the breakfast. We did not think it was worth 19 Euros(26US$)/person. The room was supplied with complimentary instant coffee, teas, and a water heater. There is a Starbucks next door and a grocery store on La Rambla 1 block toward Plaza Catalunya. We picked up OJ, rolls at the bakery, and with the instant coffee,had breakfast in the room..There is a small refrigerator in the room. Afternoon tea complimentary in bar area between 5:00PM-&7:00PM. 6) The roof top, with pool, is very nice. Cost of a beer is 6 Euro. Spa treatments avaliable, but pricey. 7) We made use of a taxi to see the various sights. Fare between 6-8 Euros. We made use of Bus 59(on the La Rambla) to get to the cable car. The cable car cost 12.5 Euro/person--round trip. Did eat at the top. Great view of the port and city. 8) For dinner we ate along the La Rambla. A number of the restaurants had a daily fixed price menu--9 Euro--3 courses. One night we went to an up scale seafood restaurant along the seafront--El Cangrejo Loco. (Crazy Crab) The upstairs had an excellent view of the sea and beach. We had salad, fish(Seabass supreme and Monk), and wine. Professionally prepared and presented. Cost was 100 Euro including tip. [--] 9) We did go to a Flamenco show with buffet dinner. Cost was 69 Euro/person. [--] Located at La Rambla 35--Walking distance from hotel. Would stay at the hotel again. Suggest you purchase a book by Rick Steves--Spain. Note: Be Careful. If you use a debit card, watch which one you use. I used a MasterCard and a Visa. If you use the Mastercard you are charged a 3% surcharge. At the ATM, if you withdraw 300 Euro, we were charged an extra 11US$. With the Visa, I was charged 1US$. We spent 5 nights in Barcelona and then flew to Malaga. Spent 7 nights along the Mediterranean Sea in Torremolinos at the Melia Costa del Sol. If there any questions, please do not to hesitate to Email.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 1898 - Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Greyhughie
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 1st wedding anniversary here recently and we had the most fabulous experience. We always wanted to go to Barcelona as it is a beautiful city steeped in history. The hotel staff where brilliant to say the least, nothing was a problem and any requests we had before arrival and during our stay where sorted with no fuss whatsoever. The hotel is situated in La Rambla ( City Centre), its an historical building redesigned wonderfully whilst keeping with the character. The reception, rooms, spa, swimming and eating facilities are top notch. Put it like this, when searching hotels websites, everything looks amazing, when you get there, sometimes its not what you originally thought it to be - Hotel 1898 however is everything its made out to be. Would strongly recommend it, and will most definitely revisit! Ps: Check out the roof top pool and bar - Very interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the luxury”
Reviews.Author: sarahbeingsarah
Reviews.Content: First thing about this hotel is the location, right on the Ramblas, loved it. Downsides are:The rooms are a little small and there's no view or balcony; check in is at 3 which is a bit excessive, everywhere else it's 12. The upsides way outweigh the downsides, though. The staff are very helpful and speak good English, which is a relief when you're travelling around Europe and you only speak English. The luxury level is amazing. The beds are great, really comfortable, and so are the pillows. There's a spa in the hotel which was wonderful and the rooftop bar is a great place to relax after a day's sightseeing when you want to wind down somewhere close to bed. The food at breakfast was great and there was plenty of it. The hotel is close to a metro station and easy to get to the beach, too. All up, I'd recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooking notice 1 day before arrival”
Reviews.Author: DeanoUK
Reviews.Content: Ok so I never actually stayed at the hotel, but if this is how their service operates then they deserve the 1 star rating - as does Opodo who I booked through. Booked the hotel for two nights over a month and half a go - money taken, and all booked up according to Opodo. 18 hours before depature and Opodo call to say the Hotel is overbooked and that they can't get us a room, and the Hotel is offering hotels of much less quality to stay in instead. Awful.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Durell72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and absolutely loved it. All staff were very friendly from the reception staff to the maids. We had a superior double room with city views on 6th floor. Beds were really comfortable and the room had heavily lined curtains so the room was dark with no sunshine waking us up in the morning! Very modern decor, great bathroom with lots of supplies including toothbrushes & paste, shaving razor etc. We didn't hear any noise at all considering we were on La Rambla - what an ideal location. The roof top terrace was great after a day sight seeing - great sunbeds and towels supplied. But better still was the spa and pool in the basement. Couldn't recommend this hotel enough - I've been telling everyone about it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diwinny
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous , we arrived in Barcelona to learn that the city was celebrating it's largest festival. The city was mainc and the hotel was just a haven of peace and tranquility. It's location was superb, right in the heart of the city and just of Las Rambals. The hotel decor is stylish and beautiful. We arrived early and were lucky that our room was ready. The room itself was there standard room. It wasn't large but beautifully decorated and well equipt for everything you would need. The bathroom was well stocked with toiletries, and included bathrobes and slippers. The hotel offer a special pillow service so that you can change your pillow if you have a particular preference. I particularly liked the light controls located next to the bed, at the touch of a button you can change the lighting to relax mode, reading mode etc. The facilities were excellent , the roof pool and terrace was spectacular, and lovely just to sit and have a drink . The basement pool was equally impressive and very relaxing. I even used the gym which was adequate for a quick workout. Breakfast is served on the first floor and there was a wide choice of food available from cakes to cerals,and juice to cooked sausages, bacon and scrambled eggs. All the staff were polite and very helpful, I would not hesitate to come back again it really deserves a five star rating, and I have already started to recommend it to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Suparuku
Reviews.Content: For those who do not really like the indepth, nitty-gritty, I will just sumise for you right at the start. The hotel is beautiful. It's very clean, the staff speak excellent English and will answer any queries helpfully upon arrival. Right! Here's the broken down summary for those who like a thorough review. The best way I can describe it, is that it is like having complete luxury brought to your hands. You feel as though you are being treated just by being there. The maids were constantly cleaning around tables, glass (in the lift), toilets and you know that their standards are high when it comes to cleanliness. The bedroom came with en suite with toilet (and one for the men) shower, sink, shower cap, shaving foam, razor, body lotion, bubble bath, manicure set, hairdryer, robes, slippers (robe and slippers to be taken to the Spa), mini fridge, desk, box of paper and writing matrials, flat screen TV (with access to CNN and BBC News in English). The beds were very comfortable, and you are given a choice of 3 pillows to choose from, depending on which postion you sleep in. The bedding was very clean, and very contemporary. There are blankets in the cupboards incase you get a bit chilly (which we did, as the air-con came on just before we went to bed and we were unsure as to how to use the control for it). The maids did visit at about 9pm to change towels each day - which sometimes did become a little frustrating if you did want an early night they would knock until you answered the door. We did not see the need for this as we had our rooms cleaned and they changed the towels already that day, so sometimes they did not need changing. The hotel has access to the Internet and they do have a business suite however I did not visit this section of the Hotel and could not comment on the efficiency of service. Oh and in your room coffee and tea facilities are provided. Although, there are only 2 small pots of milk given and these were not replenished during our stay although other drinks sachets (i.e. coffee, tea, sugar) were. The Spa is such a fantastic thing they have on offer. We found that after a day of shopping, you would get back and feel exhaused. So to be able to use a steam room, sauna, theraputic shower and pool was like a dream come true! We found that between 7-9 the pool was empty and it felt lovely to have the peace and quiet. The pool has 2 seats, which you can sit on and activate the bubbles so that you have a kind of massage while sitting. The speed is rather fast though so you do need to hang on! The pool also has another corner dedicated to these massaging pulses of bubbles and also 2 "fountains" which are good for shoulder massages when standing up under them. There is also a gym facility which was also empty between 7-9pm. Towels are provided when using the Spa/Pool area but you do need to take your robe and slippers with you. There is also a shower downstairs in this area if you want to shower and change before going back to your room. The roof is also very modern and relaxing. There is a bar where all drinks are served. You can either pay there or you can charge it to your room. On one day while sitting upstairs we were given complimentary vegetable crisps to have a munch on while drinking which was an added bonus! There are sofas with cusions upstairs along with sunloungers and this was never busy so there was plenty of privacy for you, and those who prefer a topless tan (as was the case each day of our stay!). To get to the roof pool and bar, there is only 1 lift of the total 3 that get there. So if you are on the ground floor, and wanted to go to floor 7 (where it is situated) then sometimes you had to go to 6 first, then go up again to 7, which became a little tiresome. The hotel itself is situated right in the heart of La Rambia, which is a busy centre for both traffic and people. Although we could not hear the traffic or people from our rooms we could hear the music playing from the roof top bar until early hours which did actually keep me awake one night (this was without our bedroom door being open). Also our bedroom had one window, facing onto a wall of other apartment windows. We could actually see into the guest toilet opposite our apartment (not through looking, you could very easily see through) which I found a little discomfortining about the design for privacy of others. All in all an excellent stay with excellent facities and we will definately be returning

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_JT
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1898 is in the most ideal location, right on the Ramblas, within walking distance of Placa de Catalunya, the port end (Colon), Placa de Gracia & the Metro station. Rooms was modern & clean, but very small (no balcony, poor view), and we weren't offered an upgrade, and couldn't be bothered to change after waiting for the room to be ready for hours (there's no leeway on the 3pm check-in time, and we got there at 9am, having just dis-embarked a cruise). Loved the cool dimming light options! Service was otherwise good, at the desk, bars, restaurant and pool area. Would recommend the Barcelona Turistic Open Top hop-on hop-off bus (19 Euro for one day, 23 Euro for 2 days).

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: plainchoc
Reviews.Content: great location, room size was fab and the amenities in the hotel were great very centrally located but would definitely recommend using the sightseeing bus to see the sights

Reviews.Title: “cracking hotel”
Reviews.Author: jayne777
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel after reading the reviews on here and a recommendation from a friend, and can honestly say we weren't disappointed. the location is spot on, just off la rambla, and the room was fantastic. we were thoroughly impressed by the size and cleanliness of the room, and it was very nicely done out. the room service was spot on, and we found the staff to be very helpful. we were told by our friend to ask for directions to the tapas bar they recommend, and we loved it there so much we went back the next night!! we loved the rooftop bar, which was especially nice after a hard day's shopping and sightseeing! yeah the drinks aren't cheap, but then again they aren't cheap in london either and i think thats the kinda price you'll pay in a big city. they do a mean margarita which is well worth the money though!!! theres a metro stop nearby and its only a short walk to the harbour where you can do boat trips and theres a lovely shopping mall too. if you're looking for a good hotel with a central location, decent breakfasts, nice rooms and helpful staff then you found it here!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Delta1978
Reviews.Content: We're a mid-30's couple from a large North American city who stayed at the Hotel 1898 from Sept 5 - 7, 2007. We found the hotel and room to be very comfortable and nicely designed. The front desk staff was excellent and very helpful. We loved the roof top patio / lounge. What a great place to relax after a busy day of sight seeing. The location - right off La Ramblas - is ideal if you want to be within walking distance to pretty much everything, but it wasn't noisy at all. We would definitely recommend this hotel to people looking for a nice, stylish hotel in the heart of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great sanctuary in choas of La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: doubty
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading reviews on this site and had high expectations! We arrived a little earlier than the 3pm check in but had emailed them in advance to let them know. The receptionist was astounding and told us that no-one had ever arrived early in Spain!! Hence our room wasn't ready and he could give us no time of when it would be! We did however get our swimsuits out of our case and enjoy the sun and the rooftop pool and bar! We had booked an upgraded room with a balcony. The room itself was large and spotlessly clean, and the balcony was huge - plenty big enough for a party!! Our room once at the back of the hotel and was very peaceful. The spa was also a great feature of the hotel giving you a great chance to unwind after a day of sightseeing and lazing on the beach. It really was a great way of calming down after the choas of the return walk home via La Rambla. The location of the hotel was great - central to all attractions, about 15-20 mins walk to eiher the beach or segrade familia. The service in the hotel is little more than functional, the reception team are very matter of fact, no smiles or friendly welcomes! This was similar throughout the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel due to its great facilities, location and cleanliness. However dont expect fantastic over the top service and be prepared for the prices at the pool bar (8 euros for two glasses of coke!)

Reviews.Title: “Like the ARTs without the view of the sea and stupid high price !”
Reviews.Author: mcinradlett
Reviews.Content: Quite simply dont bother looking anywhere else - stay here. You WONT be disappointed ! This place has the class of the ARTs hotel at a fraction of the price and in my view its in a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantatic Place..indifferent staff”
Reviews.Author: jonjonOttawa
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and we were most impressed with the location and rooms. If you are booked into a courtyard room take note that the courtyard is merely a large air shaft with some potted plants and it tends to be a little dark. We were advised to book that type of room as we were told the outside rooms tended to be affected by the street noise. The only negative one could say is that the staff tends to be a little stiff, unfriendly. We had asked for a wake up call to get to the airport and despite confirming the time it was made an hour late. We had also booked a van to get 4 people and bags to the airp[ort and again confirmed with the front desk t that it was ordered and would be there. The van did not arrive and the staff didn't appear to care. The only response was "that it was raining"....

Reviews.Title: “The best in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: CriticalView
Reviews.Content: Truly great stay at Hotel 1898 - if you are headed to Barcelona there should be no other choice. Great location - easy access to all major tourist spots - neighborhoods and subways. Clean and chic interiors - great amenities - roof top pool and bar is incredibly cool with great views and stylish setting - indoor spa is unique and very chic with great mix of services - solid business center - rooms are not huge - but very well thought out decorated and clean. Two pane windows so even though we had a partial view of las rambla where on the 3rd floor and the hotel next door was under construction - noise never bothered us at all. The hotel is in the mix of Las Rambla - but it feels quiet and secluded while still being right in the mix of the city. And if you don't like crowds you should not go to Barcelona any way. Easy walking distance to the Boqeuria market - the contemporary art museum - the Gothic quarter and Picasso museum - Placa Catalan and all the other major neighborhoods - plus 2 minute walk to two major subway stations that can take you anywhere you else you might want to go. I travel all the time stay at 5 star (Four Seasons etc) - this is just as good as any 5 start hotel. When we get back to Barcelona - we will stay here without a doubt - its not cheap - but its well worth the money - cant think of a single thing I would change. The perfect place to say for a visit to this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: contented_wanderers
Reviews.Content: Let me make this clear from the start, Hotel 1898 is not cheap. However, it is gorgeous. It is very stylish and chic without being all trendy and aloof! The reception staff were very helpful every time we spoke with them. They provided lots of eating recommendations and had three or four books worth of menus and pictures to help choose. The only issue was with the staff at the roof top bar who didn't seem very keen to come over and get you more drinks (although we could have gone up and got them ourselves if we weren't lounging on the big sofas in the sun!). We had a deluxe room which had it's own balcony. That was a definite advantage and we ate breakfast there each morning (although we did buy our own from the supermarket a few doors down rather than pay the 19 euros each the hotel wanted). The bathroom was a reasonable size with a lovely deep bath, and a huge shower head. Also the room was very clean and was serviced well each day. The food in the restaurant was superb and the service extremely friendly. The complimentary appetizer was delicious, and the other courses were just as good. It was the nicest restaurant we ate at although we were a bit unorganised at booking other restaurants - which is advisable if you want to go to a top level restaurant, we missed out on one promising venue because they were jam packed all evening. After reading other people's comments about the noise level from La Rambla we were a bit worried about being able to sleep. But there was no noise issue with our sound proofed room (which of course won't work if you open the window - there's no need as the room was very well air conditioned!). We slept soundly each night in the huge bed which you can customise with the pillow menu!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, top notch facilities”
Reviews.Author: moultonmm
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay at the hotel 1898 specifically because of the reviews found here in trip advisor. My wife and I had high expectations of the city and the hotel. Those expectations were met. We found that most of what people wrote about were true: -The rooftop pool is AMAZING. 360 degree views of city and sea. -The underground pool is AMAZING. If you look up through one the small skylights, you can actually see the trees of Las Ramblas and people walking by… -The room (Classic) was smaller than most American rooms, but -GREAT none the less. Bathroom was one of the nicest I have ever been in. Drapes completely block all light. -The décor was unique and luxurious. Love how the stairway halls light up as you walk up or down. -Location is amazing, very close to the gothic area, right on las ramblas, close to metro. -Maids were noisy early in the morning, but because of this forum we knew that might happen. --My wife said you had to hold the button on the hairdryer. --Front desk spoke English well, most were very nice, one or two standoffish (anomaly). --Staff at both bars were very nice, drinks expensive though. Side notes: Starbucks next door, Grocery Store 20 yards away (for bottled water, etc.). Do not eat on Las Ramblas—overpriced and not as good as side street restaurants. Taller de Tapas was very good, but Restaurante Meson Pirineos was by far the best place we ate over 7 days. We bought the Barcelona Top 10 book and it was the best purchase we could have made for our trip—maps, places to see and eat were all right on. For drinks after dinner go to the Schilling, lively crowd, good atmosphere. Cabs are cheap, less than 5 euro from hotel to beach/clubs. 30 euro to and from airport. When leaving, the hotel was very good about having cab there, and there was no difference in cost from our arrival trip. Have fun and enjoy the spa and pillow menu.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: liefs
Reviews.Content: We booked in to this hotel and stayed in their junior suite. We were blown away by it. It is worth every penny. The staff are friendly and very efficient. We had a knock on the door after we got into the room and were greeted by a comp bottle of bubbly and an enormous fruit basket! The breakfast is pricy but you get to choose from a huge selection of food and eat as much as you want so you can get your moneys worth. The roof top terrace is very special with a coktail bar and lots of comfortable double bed like sofas to lounge on and watch the sun go down. The location is brilliant, you are in the heart of everything with shops and restaurants on the doorstep. The hotel room was very quiet despite being central. We will definately head straight back to this hotel when we return to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It. Refreshingly Different.”
Reviews.Author: ixon
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at this hotel for three nights and it is a cracking hotel. It has everything you would expect from a city hotel but with the added bonus of a touch of class. From the welcoming lobby area to the roof top bar with views across the city this hotel hits the spot. The spa area is in the basement and set out underneath brickwork arches and its well worth a look even if you do not use the facilities. The use of large photos as pictures and the colour schemes around the hotel make for a refreshing change from the identikit hotels you sometimes find in cities these days. The room was lovely and the level of cleanliness in all areas of the hotel was outstanding. The biggest compliment i can give is that after a hot day pounding the streets of Barcelona you look forward to returning to Hotel 1898.

Reviews.Title: “stylish and central”
Reviews.Author: bedfordmclain
Reviews.Content: Loved this centrally located hotel. Great style, comfortable rooms, lovely bathrooms (with real showers--not so easy to find in Europe) Basement pool was perfect for relaxing before late dinners in town. Easy to walk to all sites. Our kids loved it too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: buca1uk
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed at this hotel in November, what a pleasent stay it was. I had met my girlfriend for a few days from a flight from New York, it was her birthday and we were going out that night, however i had no clean clothes. I asked the reception if they could assist and within 5 hours they had cleaned and ironed my shirt and trousers. Great service. The rooms have a great style and most have wireless connection, so great for staying connected! The beds are really comfy..Great location just of La Ramblas, so within walking distance of gothic area and subway..if we go back we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, loved it.”
Reviews.Author: PBosman
Reviews.Content: Unique experience. We stayed here for two nights, August 1&2. I've seen many hotels over the years, both for business and leisure, ranging from Eur20/night to Eur500/night. H1898 beats them all. Easily. Very distincitive in every respect, from the beautiful lobby to the indoor pool and great rooms (nicely decorated, high ceilings, huge bed, excellent pillow service). Best of all is the rooftop terrace with great 360 view of Barca...and a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LotsaTraveling
Reviews.Content: We just returned home after a 4 day stay at the 1898 Hotel in Barcelona. We had two rooms, each with a somewhat different decor, but both were quiet and extremely comfortable. We were impressed by the helpfulness of the staff, the unique features of the rooms (e.g., multiple different lighting settings), the convenience of the computers in the business center, and the wonderful location (right on La Rambla and within walking distance of many sights, restaurants and shopping venues). The rooftop pool was perfect for those wanting to sun themselves and the indoor pool was equally relaxing (and uniquely designed). We have traveled many times, in many countries but this hotel will remain one of our favorites!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrMcAl
Reviews.Content: Beauitful hotel in a central location leaving you not more than a few minutes from eveywhere you would want to be. Beautiful entrance to the hotel and rooms brillant as weel. Although we opted for a standard room it was spacious and well presented. Excellent pool on the roof terrace! A must! And basement pool with sauna, etc! Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't do better”
Reviews.Author: daisyfleur
Reviews.Content: I booked this at the last minute - at a bargain price too. I didn't have high expectations after previous Barcelona hotel experiences BUT - WOW!!!!!! This place is amazing. FANTASTIC LOCATION, BEAUTIFUL DECOR (Wonderful air-con! - Do NOT consider a hotel without air-con in summer in Barcelona!), STAFF were unobtrusive and helpful. There is a spa with many wonderful sounding treatments but we were there for only a short stay but I would advise finding out about the spa before you go - a chocolate massage sounded divine! After several trips to Barcelona I won't be staying in another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Some postives...some negatives...”
Reviews.Author: ford45
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel 1898 for two nights...the front end of a cruise and thene again on return. Location is excellent, and the hotel offers great rooms, amenities in the room,and a very calming atmosphere , after a day in the city. However, front desk service was indiffernent. They forgot our wake up calls (both rooms) which could have been a real problem since we had a flight to make on one occasion and despite pre-booking a cab the evening before in order to get to the airport in time, they seemed to care less when it didn't show up....I would suggest to the front desk that a smile sometimes goes along way when dealing with the public...at least pretend you care !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, all the amenities!”
Reviews.Author: MDO_NYC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights as part of our honeymoon in Spain, and we had a great time! The rooms were very fashionable, and the hotel amenities were excellent- we used the rooftop pool every afternoon. The location is great for sightseeing- although La Rambla can be VERY crowded during the summer. The staff were very accommodating. Overall, it is a very modern hotel, with all the best features and little touches (even the lighting system in the rooms)- we have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Tranquility in the madness of Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Douzer
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights in the 1898 celebrating my 40th Birthday. Being No1 on trip advisor was the reason we booked this hotel. We read the very few negatives on here and this is what i think. You will always get people who are never satisfied with anything, you know the type. they are at the reception desks screaming at the staff about the slightest issue, no wonder then they get nothing sorted because lets face it, no place or event in the world is perfect and i suppose the true test of a hotel is how they react when things go slightly wrong because hey this is the reality of every day life. So firstly we got to our room, great room but right outside the elevator, based on previous comments i didnt want to settle in the room and find i could hear the elevators through the night (im a light sleeper) so we went down to reception straight away and explained.(by the way they have removed the lift bell on those floors now anyway) we got a better room issued immediately ! Result ! But you know what, if you speak politely without attitude and explain the issue, 99 times out 100, you get it sorted, and thats the point about the negatives reviews here. Next we ordered some bollinger off the menu at 80 euro's, good price i thought, when we got the bill it had 130 euro's on it, on checking the menu i had been given an old menu, no problem sir the correct price is actually 130 euro which i have to charge you but what i will give you is free drinks for the rest of the night !!!(we drunk easily more than twice the diff)- result No 2. Next morning we ordered 2 types of breakfast, they only brought one, on ringing the kitchen they apologised and the other was with us within 3 mins - result no 3. The reception were very helpful with ordering taxis( you cant be charged double going to the airport because they are all on meters NB previous review) and booking restaurants, in fact they got us into a restaurant that was full because they regularly send customers there. We didnt really do any site seeing, it was relax in the sun, wine and dine break and the hotel is perfect for that. The Ramblas outside the hotel is madness in august, it is so busy, so when you step back into the hotel it is like an Oasis of calm and tranquility, and for the previous comment about the bar been quite - what do you want when you have been in crowds of people all day ! certainly not queueing with hoards of noisy people at the bar. If your looking for the better bars and restaurants then turn left has you come out the hotel onto the Ramblas and walk couple of 100 yards up, this way you get away from all the tourists coming off the boats and getting trapped in the Ramblas restaurants which are poor food/high prices. 2 places were excellent, a traditional tapas bar called Alfonso for lunch and theTralaguz restaurant for a big night meal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jbohun
Reviews.Content: Everyone has said it all already!!! Stay here...the only painful part is the price of the cocktails...but after your 3rd amazing Mojito..you will not care!!!! We book thru their website and found a package that included break for only 10 euros more a night...totally worth it! GO NOW...and have fun!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Womble9
Reviews.Content: We only stayed in the hotel one night before we joined a cruise ship for our honeymoon. But the hotel was great, the room was lovely - very stylish, the bathroom was fantastic and we even had a little terrace area with a table and chairs even though we had booked one of the cheapest rooms. We ate dinner that night on that terrace using room service (we were so tired!) which was brought to us in very efficient time. The menu is a little basic but tasted great! We then walked around the city the following morning to get a taste. The location of the hotel is great and gives you a real feel for the city. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: CatEastYorkshire_uk
Reviews.Content: We returned from Barcelona last weekend - it was our first visit and a special occasion, celebrating my husbands birthday. It was a surprise booking for him and the hotel was discreet in all correspondence since my booking earlier this year. I booked a superior room and it exceeded all expectations. We had views around the city, our bedroom opposite the Cathedral. The hotel is situated on La Ramblas, but you would never know as our room on the 6th floor was well sound proofed and tucked back with views of the luxurious suite privatepool terrace below. It was an oasis amidst an exciting and lively city. The hotel was exceptionally clean, the facilities including the roof terrace and spa were superb, the room finished to a high standard and the service was very friendly at all times and nothing seemed to be too much. We will certainly return as we managed to have a long weekend with a good mix of rest, sun & evening relation on the roof terrace, cool drinks by the pool, sight seeing and excellent food & wine. The only point we would make is book your own taxi to the airport from outside the hotel, the taxi company charged us nearly double the fare when we booked through the hotel to return to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Blessed oasis of calm and order”
Reviews.Author: EnglandMary
Reviews.Content: Within 30 minutes of arriving in Barcelona, at the Franca Station cafe in fact, we had a bag stolen containing our passports, tickets and driving licence, Do be careful in Barcelona - crime is rife! Anyway went straight to the 1898 and the receptionist let us book into our rooms although it was only 11 o'clock, then called us a taxi to get to the British Consulate to arrange emergency passports. After a dismal afternoon trudging between the police station and the consulate what a relief to return to the sanctuary of the 1898. Great rooms, room service and rooftop pool. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsC63
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the beginning of August for three nights. I emailed the hotel a couple of days before our arrival to check that the booking was confirmed and mentioned that we were celebrating our wedding anniversay. We were over the moon when we arrived and had been upgraded from a standard to a superior room! It was gorgeous - the decor is really sleek and modern and the room was quite spacious. The rooftop terrace and pool is a fantastic bonus - just what you need after a morning's sightseeing. A great way to chill out and relax in the sun for an hour! The spa in the basement is small but immaculate - loved the jacuzzi water bed! Staff at the hotel were all friendly and helpful, especially those on the roof terrace. Amazingly ,bar prices seemed quite reasonable when compared to every other bar and restaurant we visited! Barcelona is definitely not a cheap place to visit! I cannot recommend this hotel enough - we will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LMtraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1898 is a very beautiful hotel in the heart of the market section of Las Ramblas. Everything you could possibly need is within two blocks of the hotel. The rooms are all high tech, spotless, and beautifully designed. They are small by American standards, but not an inch of space is wasted. We stayed in two superior, double rooms. The beds were big and comfortable and you have your choice of pillows. The bathrooms are large and gorgeous - all marble and chrome, with towel warmers and showers with full bathtubs. Everything is state-of-the art, which meant that sometimes we had to call the front desk to figure out how to get things to work. The common areas are open, beautiful and inviting. Staff is professional and friendly and you can always find someone who speaks English. There is a small swimming pool on top of the hotel, with a bar and a deck from which you can view all of Barcelona. The hotel is on a part of Las Ramblas that is packed with tourists, but it is fun to walk down the street and see all of the street artists and visit the vendors. The surrounding streets are lined with stores, good restaurants and cafes. We only spent one night in Barcelona en route to somewhere else, but Hotel 1898 was one of the highlights of our trips.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: 1lfc
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Lots of hisortic features have been thoughtfully blended with all the modern touches you would expect and more. Roof top pool and bar area is the highlight but be sure to check out the indoor pool which is prettty special. Paying the extra for a delux room which comes with a great private terrace is essential. Nominally a 4 star hotel i believe. Strange as it is better than nearly all the 5 stars i've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed Hotel 1898”
Reviews.Author: Francois_Verhaart
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel 1898 for 2 nights at the end of July for a long weekend. The hotel, located in a beautifully restored old building in a very central location, looks new and well-kept. The (standard) room, while not very big, had a clean and fresh feel to it. The bathroom was nice with a great shower and good water pressure. The reception staff was very friendly and helpful and spoke English very well. On our last day we were able to extend our room stay until 6pm for about 40% of what we paid for a full night. Maybe not cheap, but it allowed us to fully enjoy the day and freshen up before heading back to the airport. We particularly enjoyed the rooftop pool and lounge area. It was very warm when we were in Barcelona and after some sightseeing in the city, it was a great place to relax for a few hours and have some drinks. That brings me to the only negative thing of this hotel. The prices for drinks on the rooftop were excessive; we paid almost 15 euros per drink for a rum & cola and a mojito. We also used the indoor pool downstairs, which is beautiful. We will definitely come back here for our next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sixnohit
Reviews.Content: This was a magnificent hotel. The entire staff was extremely cordial. From the bellhop to the check-in to housekeeping. The hotel is absolutely beautiful. It's almost like a hidden gem. It's right off La Rambla. The rooftop bar is spectacular. THEY HAVE BEDS!!!! My friend and I hung out and had some beverages and just chilled out and enjoyed the view of Barcelona at night. We had a room with a balcony that looked over into 3 restaurants with outdoor seating. We kept the door open just to hear the hustle and bustle at night. Once it was bedtime, we closed the doors and we didn't hear anything. The rooms are absolutely gorgeous. There was only 1 thing I didn't like about the room. The bathtub was too damn high LOL. I thought I was going to fall everytime I got in and out of the shower. Oh and there were about 52 knobs to turn on the shower. Like I said, these were minor details. When I return to Barcelona, I'm DEFINITELY staying at H1898. Oh by the way, you get the cutest little slippers. I will add photos later.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel247
Reviews.Content: My wife and I reviewed quite a few hotels on line before choosing Hotel 1898 and I am so happy that we picked it. The hotel can be summed up simply - A centrally located, clean, very chilled/modern hotel with excellent/attentive staff and very good facilities. We have stayed in quite a few hotels in Europe and we both agreed that it is one of the best. I would highly recommend a deluxe room with a private terrace, its well worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Barcelona Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Temail66
Reviews.Content: 4 rooms prior to July 8th cruise - this hotel is great. Location, amenities, staff, all fantastic but the hotel roof pool/lounge was stunning, we enjoyed it each of the 3 days we stayed and even stopped by on our flight back home 2 weeks later for a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Msafiri1
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent, and stylish base from which to explore the city. Given the comfort levels and facilities (eg a pool in the basement), we thought the room rates were very reasonable but think that this may change as this new hotel becomes more popular. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay- Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: whammer14
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel in great location. Please disregard any negative critiques as they are probably from stuffy clientele. The hotel is a 4 star property that I would consider 4.5! Thank you very much for our fanatastic 3 day recent stay Jim H in Atlanta, GA

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed by 1898”
Reviews.Author: Samantha2007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at 1898 July 3 - 5, 2007. My overall assessment is that it was not worth the price. The room was very tiny and without a patio it was close to claustrophobic. We tried to change rooms, but no luck from the front desk. Only one suitcase could be opened at a time. However, the location is convenient We went to the opera, just a few minutes walk away. We saw Manon. Even if you're not an opera fan, Barcelona is the place to see one. The Opera House is exquisite. Make sure you buy your tickets on-line in advance. We had them sent from the opera to the hotel and they were waiting there for us on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Central, fantasic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveller69
Reviews.Content: This hotel very well placed being on La Rambla. Close to the main square and shopping ares and close to the beautiful harbour area. The hotel is very chic with good sized airy, well decorated rooms with large plasma TVs. The bathroom was also spacious (as far as hotel bathrooms go) with marble units and, very important... a proper glass shower screen rather than a shower curtain. The roof terrace is very nice and kept clean although the small pool is very cold. The pool in the basement is great but a little dark. It's more of a spa pool than a swimming pool with it's small size and above average temperature. The staff were very friendly and helpful and all spoke good English (I don't have any Spanish). The bar is well stocked but a little expensive, but there are bars all around the hotel. It's a mixture of the big AND the little things which make this hotel great... from the decor and friendlyness of staff to the choice of 9 different types of sleeping pillows. The next time I'm in Barcelona, I'll definately be staying at Hotel 1898.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Asaptraveler
Reviews.Content: Went to Hotel 1898 for a pre cruise stay. Well, I must say that this is one of the finest hotels in Barcelona. What a great location, right on La Rambla. The staff, and amenities in the room were first rate. We also loved the rooftop pool, and the special grotto on the ground floor featuring a complete spa pool, gym, sauna, and steam room. There are great restaurants in the area as well so don't be afraid to venture out and explore this magnificient city. We would definitely return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Our second visit....says it all.”
Reviews.Author: JTJD
Reviews.Content: Our second visit to the hotel....5 nights in September 2006 and 7 nights July 2007! Says it all really! However, just to note that it appears children are now accepted as guests at the hotel, this wasn't the case on our first visit. We noticed that as a result the roof top sun terrace was much noisier and the small pool a little overcrowded.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel AND Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Go Travel Europe
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel and felt they also provided great service. Our luggage didn't arrive for several days and the front desk was so helpful in contacting the airline on our behalf, even calling the airline on their own without us asking, and then reporting to us on what the latest info was from Air France. They also called a taxi for us for our very early morning check out. The Boqueria Market is just down La Ramblas and is an absolute must for eating and people watching. A Starbucks is connected to the hotel lobby and the computer center on the second floor has four computers with free internet. We rented bikes and had a tour from Budget Bikes which is also off La Ramblas and Calle Unlo. It was one of the best things we did in Barcelona. You can just rent the bikes or take a guided tour. A delicious, reasonably priced and very popular restaurant is in the Placa Reial square off La Ramblas called Les Quince Nity. Get there early or you'll find a big long line. We had a great experience at Hotel 1898.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with indifferent staff !”
Reviews.Author: ffnoddy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the 1898 on the basis of previous reviews and arrived with Great expectations ..... maybe I should've taken the novel, because the expectations were only partly realised ! The hotel is in a fantastic location right on La Rambla & within walking distance of loads of Barcelona's attractions. The 1898 is beatifully presented with all of the facilities you may need for a short stay. The room was as we requested, spacious, well equipped and very clean, although the views were pretty dissappointing. The rooftop pool is a must after a day wandering around Barcelona trying to figure out how Gaudi persuaded builders to start his wonderful projects & you'll get the views you'll wish you had from your room here. The restaurant is good & the wine massage in the underground spa is a must. We only ordered room service on our last morning, which was very nice, although a little late. But the glass of Cava with breakfast more than made up for it ! We did have a few issues with the service at the hotel though. The lock on our door was faulty, which resulted in the room being left open by the maid a couple of times .... fortunately nothing went amiss. When we reported the problem, we were surprised to find that the staff felt we were ruining their day by interupting more important things they had to do! Not the service I'd expect from a 4 star. Concierge facilities were pretty much non-existent, so take a guide book ! ..... when we tried to get the hotel to order a taxi upon our departure, we felt it would've been easier to wander the streets of Barcelona for a couple hours in the blazing heat, dressed in a ski suit, holding aloft a sign in spanish saying 'I hate taxi drivers' !! However ......... Don't be put off staying here. The hotel is great despite the majority of the staff & we did still have a great time ...... probably due to the sangria from the bars on La Rambla ! If the staff smiled every now and then and did as you asked this would be a fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The 1898 - A Fair Assessment...”
Reviews.Author: JonathanB777
Reviews.Content: I rely on tripadvisor quite heavily on selecting a hotel to stay in but it is always important to read between the lines of the various comments. The reviews of the 1898 range from the sublime to the underwhelmed and in fairness both are fair descriptions but also true of any other ranked hotel in Barcelona. This is an extremely comfortable hotel which is fantastically well appointed. If staying in summer the ability to get away from it all and sunbathe by a roof-top pool may for many make it worthwhile in itself. There is also a well equipped gymn and OK Spa. We never had breakfast in the hotel (20 euros ahead!) but worth missing for all the excellent alternatives on the doorstep. The rooms are very comfortable and fully equipped (although the plasmas volume is set to such a low maximum volume that you can't hear them even in your own room). The gentleman who said it was a bit soulless in the bar and reception areas is correct and some of the staff (especially the bar man) could definately have done with a happy fix. All that said this is probably still a good choice for a few days stay in a simply breathtaking city. If you book a room make SURE you get a small balcony at least (we asked to be moved) and I imagine not looking over La Ramblas itself. If you are looking for the hotel to "Make your Stay" then this may disappoint (as probaly will most others). If you are looking for a fine place to explore and enjoy then it has much to recommend it. P.S I am being very nice by not mentioning that they took 25 minutes to bring our bags from our room when our taxi meter was running (i'm not proud I would rather have brought them down ourselves!)

Reviews.Title: “Uneven service, loud housekeeping, but a nice property.”
Reviews.Author: eju-DC
Reviews.Content: We had a three-night stay here from June 19 for our wedding honeymoon. Our "superior" room had a nice large patio, but the room itself was small (more like the classic rooms from the picture). Noise was an issue -- not because of Las Ramblas, but because the chattering housekeepers would laugh up a storm in the hallways early every morning (before 9 AM). More generally, service was uneven: sometimes friendly, sometimes surly. (1) Doorman did not help us with our bags upon depature, even after seeing us carrying them. (2) Doorman told us a cab would take 10 minutes, even though walking one building over enabled us to get one ourselves in 1 minute. (3) Housekeepers were extremely noisy in the hallways as mentioned above. (4) Spa/gym attendant required us to put plastic booties over clean sneaker in order to view the gym, so as not to scuff the floors (which makes no sense in a gym). For 350 Euro/night, guests deserve better service.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: travelmom333
Reviews.Content: I wavered between choosing a hotel based upon a local business owner's recommendation and my own search and Trip Advisor. I couldn't have been more pleased with my own search. Following a horrific beginning to my trip (business trip where my luggage was lost and my credit cards, passport and money stolen) where I stayed at a terrible HUSA hotel, I felt as if I had died and gone to heaven when I finally arrived at Hotel 1898. The hotel is beautiful, elegant, clean, professional and exceptionally located without having to be in the middle of the Las Ramblas noise and craziness. I stayed in one of the "quiet" rooms overlooking the courtyard and it was perfect. My daugher likened this hotel to an elegant cruise ship with the dark wood trim, plush carpets and brass hardware along the hallway. The room was spacious by European standards and was well equiped including very nice toiletries, bathrobes and slippers and tea service. The beds were comfortable although not plush. Internet connection was brisk and there was a good sampling of english language TV stations. The hotel is in very close proximity to the metro and around the corner from Las Ramblas although very quiet and secluded. The lobby has a tea time and cocktail hour but I never saw much action there. There is a roof top deck but my daughter and I were out exploring until late so never had a chance to use it. We had the American Breakfast served to our room. Service was prompt and for those longing for a good American Breakfast, this was it! It was so plentiful, we only needed one tray for the 2 of us. If you are going to Barcelona, search no more. Hotel 1898 is an experience everyone should have. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it has been cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: CIARB
Reviews.Content: We were expecting to be staying in a truly remarkable hotel given the recent reviews (making it the No.1 hotel in Barcelona) and the price. Whilst it is an excellent hotel in so many ways it is also a soulless sort of place - the lounges, bars and restaurants were practically empty for the whole duration of our stay. Whilst we don't like crowded hotels, this one was more like a morgue than a hotel. Management needs to have a rethink, because the hotel has the makings of a great hotel - but it will never be that so long as they serve mediocre food and overpriced drinks, and have second rate staff performance. By way of example, the male receptionist who greeted us was the most miserable soul I have had the misfortune to meet for quite a while. We are used to staying in 5* hotels worldwide and the 1898 unfortunately misses the mark by quite a wide margin, both on price and service; I find it hard to believe that, according to Tripadvisor reviewers, it is Barcelona's finest - I guess it deserves a ranking of about #10 at best - but there again I haven't sampled the others yet.

Reviews.Title: “Fab choice for Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: AvidHolidaymaker
Reviews.Content: Booked Hotel 1898 based on previous TA reviews and was not disappointed! It's all been said before - what more can I add?! If you arrive at the airport, just take the airport bus from immediately outside the Terminal door (3.90 Euros per person) as it takes you right into Plaza Catalunya and it's just a short walk round to La Rambla and a couple of blocks down on the right you'll find the hotel. The Hotel is actually an old building (which used to house the Philipine Tobacco company) but was beautifully restored just 2 years ago. We paid 199 Euros per night for a classic room (supposedly their most basic but it was perfect). Our room faced onto an inner courtyard and was very peaceful. To re-iterate previous reviews, all the positive points of the Hotel: location, interior design, spacious public areas, lovely rooftop terrace, beautiful rooms and bathrooms, immaculately clean. Two (very tiny) negative points - (but in no way should it stop you from booking!): the hairdryer was a bit cumbersome and awkward to use, and, while the rooftop terrace is a huge asset in a city centre hotel, the number of loungers is a bit limited. However, after a day's walking & sightseeing, this is a lovely relaxed area with cushioned benches to flop with one of their marvellous glasses of sangria! The breakfast was 19 Euros each - a bit pricey but the quality was excellent (cereals, freshest of fruit, pastries, breads, smoked salmon, cheeses, meats, omelettes made to order etc.) We also used the Royal Hotel just up the road - good value at 9 Euros but not quite the same quality. There is also a Starbucks attached to the hotel if you just fancy a coffee and a muffin one morning. Further down La Rambla, La Boqueria food market is wonderful for a walk round - and you could just pick up fresh fruit, pastries etc there! 4 restaurants tested and definitely able to recommend, none too far from Hotel 1898: 1. Can Culleretes, C/Quintana 5 (oldest restaurant in Barcelona and cheap too). 2. Taller de Tapas, C/Argenteria 51 ( very busy but good tapas). 3. Els Quatre Gats, C/Montsio3 (full of character and live music too). 4. Les Quince Nits, Plaza Reial (popular with the locals too). Things to do (some obvious!): open top bus tour (23 Euros for 2 days with Bus Turistic), walk down La Rambla watching all the street entertainment, take the lift to the top of the Columbus monument, visit some of Gaudi's buildings (Casa Batllo, La Pedrera, Sagrada Familia), visit the Museu D'Historia for a great insight into Roman Barcelona, visit Poble Espanyol to see the different Spanish styles of building and see the different crafts, tour round FC Barcelona stadium. I actually think Barcelona would be a great place to take children too - apart from the places already mentioned, there's the beach, zoo, aquarium etc! I will definitely go back, and will definitely book Hotel 1898 again! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “disappointing. 5* building run as 2-3* hotel”
Reviews.Author: meovcorse
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the begining of June having chosen it after reading the reviews on this site but were very disappointed. On the positive side, the location is unbeatable, the decor beautiful and the hotel very clean. But..... We arrived well after check in time but our room was not ready and had to wait nearly half an hour for it. We were given a chit to take to the bar for a complementary drink whilst we waited. We went to the bar which was unattended, there was no bell or any way of attracting attention. We could here the staff in the room behind the bar so, after 7 or 8 minutes, we politely called out to them. We were very surprised (and shocked) when a male voice shouted back "wait a minute". A couple of minutes later a female opened the door, poked her head out, and again said "wait a minute". It was a further 2-3 minutes before we eventually were served. We booked a de-luxe room which was small, as we expected having read the reviews here, however, it was the terrace that really disappointed us. We selected the de-luxe room specifically for the terrace which was not only much smaller than expected ( the ones either side of ours were much bigger) but also instead of the stone balustrading shown in the pictures, we had a solid wall facing us which not only allowed us no view, but also made it dark and quite dingy. There was no seperate shower cubicle as some other rooms seem to have. Our room was by the elevator and there was the constant noise of the elevator pinging and of other guest laughing and joking throughout the night (fault of the room not the guests). Having missed eating one evening we discovered that room service finished at 11pm. There was absolutely no food available in the hotel after this hour. I have never before come across a hotel that couldn't russle up at least a basic sandwich, even if nothing else. Breakfast was the worst part of the experience. It was very poor but pricey (19 euros). Having sat ourselves down and having waited several minutes, we had to call the attention of one of the waiters, who had totally ignored us up to that point, to ask for tea and coffee. When it eventually came, nearly 10 minutes later, the coffee was fine but tea was a cup of hot water and a point at the teabags on the table. No milk and when requested, hot milk was brought. I should mention that the room was not even half full so there was no excuse of being busy or them being rushed off their feet. The cooked food was not only not freshly cooked, but the pre-cooked food was placed on a normal, unheated counter therefore it was barely warm and very unappetising. This is truely the worst breakfast, food and service, that I have received anywhere, including in 3rd world countries and travelodges! There were several other niggles that I won't mention now.
