I wondered afterwards about the great reviews that have been given here and realised that had we: 1. arrived an hour later - we would not have known that our room wasn't ready and would not have gone to the bar and experienced the problems there. 2. been allocated a different room, there are clearly better de-luxe rooms - we would not have been disappointed with the terrace. 3. been allocated a room away from the elevator - we would not have been woken up several times a night or been aware that some guest were experiencing that. 4. not missed our evening meal - we would not have wanted food at midnight therefore we would not have known that it was not available. 5. not had breakfast in the hotel - we would not have known how bad it was. Had none of the above things occurred we would have gone away having feeling that we had stayed in a well located, clean, beautiful looking hotel. We would have been unaware of the shortcomings of it, and, in ignorance, given it an undeserved very good, review. Maybe we were just unlucky with our room allocation, but unless you have been there before and specifically request to have or ask not to be given a particular room, you can't know whether you have been allocated a good or a poor room. A good hotel should offer a consistently good experience, which ever room you are in or whatever time/period you stay there in. Hotel 1898 does not offer this consistency. We may have been unlucky BUT SO MIGHT YOU BE!!! The building has the makings of a 5* hotel but unfortunately it is run like a 2-3* one.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but some issues”
Reviews.Author: JzW
Reviews.Content: As others have noted, the rooms are very, very nice and the location is perfect. We had a 3rd floor superior room on the Ramblas and the room was nicely furnished, large and comfortable. The rooftop deck is great even if the pool is a bit small for actual swimming. However... 1) You can hear the rumbling of the metro at night and 2) You can hear creaking and popping in the walls or air conditioning system? (loud enough to wake me at 4AM and I'm a heavy sleeper) and 3) the staff is hit or miss - some are very friendly, others are brusque. I have to believe that for the money, there are other hotels with nice rooms and locations that don't have the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “No wonder it's the tops!”
Reviews.Author: camdencalling
Reviews.Content: Thanks reviewers! Definitely a great choice! Visiting Barca for a friend's wedding in the Gothic quarter, this hotel was the obvious choice. I've stayed in Barca several times before in the Rambla area but this hotel is streets ahead of the others. A superb conversion of an old building, well and truly sound-proofed and with fabulous facilities for a hotel in this position, it is hard to find fault with it. Possibly some may find the rooms a bit on the small side and rather dark. But dark is the theme of the hotel throughout and is extremely smart. Our room looked inwards onto a courtyard and directly into several other hotel rooms but that wasn't a problem - better that than having street traffic. Rather silly controls for the lights (letting the designers lose is a dangerous thing sometimes!) meant that you had to have both bedside lights on or off at the same time. But on the plus side, the rooftop bar area with a small pool and masses of lounging space has superb views all over Barcelona, and downstairs in the basement, the small pool has jet corners for getting out the aches after too much shopping in La Rambla. Breakfast is expensive at €19 but with so many fabulous cafes and the fabulous, famous food market next door, who needs it! Altogether a superb city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All round excellent”
Reviews.Author: cardiff010
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel following the reviews on tripadvisor - what a relaxing place amongst the chaos of Barcelona! Firstly, it is placed just off Las Ramblas. The reception area is just a fantastic area, with large windows, even larger leather sofas and friendly staff. We booked a superior room which had two sets of double opening doors looking over the city rooftops. The room itself was beautiful, wooden floors, comfortable king bed, large wardrobe. The contemporary bathroom was entirely marble with a large bath and a separate shower cubicle (no light in there so couldn't be used though). Room service was excellent. We felt completely happy with our choice of hotel. You must visit the marina/waterfront, its a beautiful area and so well looked after. Take the cable car from the mountainside to the harbour - eye popping views and photo opportunities! We would definately return here - well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: hotelguruoslo
Reviews.Content: Like most other reviewers here, I have to agree that the quality, comfort, location and style of this hotel are the best in Barcelona. The rooftop pool and cabanas are reason alone to stay here. Although it is getting pricey (the first time I stayed there a superior room went for 170E, now it's 300), it is still worth the cost for the quality you get. If you can afford it, do it! Another very hip hotel 2 blocks away is the Casa Camper. Check my review there as well.

Reviews.Title: “This one compares to the best”
Reviews.Author: tommytraveller
Reviews.Content: What a gem right in the middle of Barcelona, on the Ramblas. Its stylish, clubby look is an oasis of peace and quiet, in the bedroom, on the roof aside the pool or in the basement in the indoor pool and spa. This is top notch in every aspect. The beds are solid and comfy with a choice of 4 types of pillow. The safe, plasma and tea making all good touches and the bathroom luxurious green marble- the shower rose is the biggest I have seen!! Even down to the Etro toiletries, this is such a classy place! Please dont got there, it might become even more popular and they will push the prices higher!! I am going back!

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to its reviews”
Reviews.Author: Philipat
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this property alone for 2 nights on my way to visiting a friend in Andorra. I selected the property based on the rave reviews and was most disappointed. The hotel is trying so hard to be hipper than hip but at the end of the day, the value is very poor. The room was just OK and smaller than a typical 5-star hotel. The electrical socket in the bathroom doesn't actually do anything and when I called for help they just took my shaver and plugged it into a socket on the floor in the bedroom. Same for making morning coffee in the room. Hmm?! I paid a very high rate which did not even include breakfast. Upon check-in they went out of their way to point this out to me and that breakfast was available in their restaurant at 23 Euros. I passed. OK the location is geat but there are other properties at lower prices equally well located. Overall. I found the hotel quite pretentious but very ordinary and poor value for money. I have given a lot of thought to why the reviews of this property are so good and I can't really figure this out. I do spend a lot of time in Asian hotels where far better rooms are generally available at far lower rates in 5-star properties. Perhaps I am spoiled for choice by this. It's not really the price. i don't mind paying a high price but I do expect value and this hotel simply did not deliver. I would definitely not stay here again or recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Histroy meets La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: UschiSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a business meeting held an the Hotel 1898. Overall, a great experience. Hotel rooms are okay size with beautiful wood floors and marble bathrooms. Also, the Etro products were nice. And the rain forest shower a great way to wake up. I stayed at a room on the 6th floor with a private patio. What a great experience! I would recommend this hotel for all travelers. It has a quite and tranquil athmosphere and you are just in front of one of the busiest areas: La Rambla and Barrio Gotic. I would go back anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great stay”
Reviews.Author: ReluctantPeninsulan
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1898 is right on Las Ramblas, centrally located near two metro stops. When we arrived at our room, we were very happy with its size, cleanliness and layout. We had a peek-a-boo view of Las Ramblas, which worried me a little - it can get loud at night, and we happened to be there at a time when drunken British soccer hooligans were out all night long singing their little soccer songs on Las Ramblas. But the windows are double-paned, and the lager louts did not disturb my sleep. There is a very cool indoor pool, sauna and exercise area in the basement of the hotel. The staff of the hotel were friendly, helpful and knowledgable. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: orpicardat
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel after all the great reviews we read about it but it really did not live to its reputation. For the money we paid for this hotel, staying in the superior room, we were not so pleased. I think it's overrated. The room that we had, had a sink with a very slow drain and we called to have it fixed and nothing was done. There was one employee, though, that was super nice. He moved us and our luggage and belongings when he found out that someone missed our request for a nonsmoking room at the time of reservation. The rooms aren't really sound proofed and being next to La Rambla, it was hard to have a good sleep. The food wasn't great either. We had the New Year's eve party at the Eurostar Grand Marina Hotel and stayed there one night and it was less money and more amenities like 2 toilets, and bigger room and the food for that party was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hotel 1898”
Reviews.Author: Scottflex
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful stay at the beautiful elegant decorator haven Hotel 1898. The rooms were well appointed, immaculate, marvelously decorated and absolutely sexy. The marble bathrooms were awesome. Hallways were a work of art. Black, white and grey marble with co-ordinatling stripping on the walls. Amazing! Beds were firm and comfortable. This hotel is centrally located on La Ramblas. I wouldn't stay anywhere else after discovering this gem. Breakfast buffet was disappointing and expensive. Laundry service was super. Called for a pressing and someone came within 5 minutes for pick up, shirt was returned within 10 minutes...well pressed and only 4 euros. Can't wait to return. I understand why this hotel is #1 on Tripadvisor in BCN. Had dinner at Neichel, a Relais & Chateaux restaurant, excellent food, ambiance, service and experience.....highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best ever”
Reviews.Author: JoesBrigade
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and picked this based on Tripadvisor reviews. We were not disappointed as, whilst it isn't the cheapest hotel, the facilities and the staff are extremely good. The rooftop pool and comfy seats were a really oasis after a busy day and the views were fantastic. The rooms, and in particular the bathrooms, were of the highest standard but the best of all was down in the basement. The pool may have been small but it was never too busy and, on top of excellent sauna and steam room, the pool had 2 water jets, the jacuzzi jets and jets in metal loungers in the pool to massage yourself with. You cannot fault the quality of the hotel decor and the location is in the middle of Las Ramblas and so easy to go in either direction. Drinks were a bit expensive and whilst breakfast at 19 euros may be expensive for some, there was a Continental option at 9 euros. One of the best and easiest hotels we've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “just better than expected”
Reviews.Author: soboman
Reviews.Content: ultra modern, very clean, great location, front desk very helpful. would stay at this hotel on my next visit. you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: swcosguy
Reviews.Content: Had 3 wonderful nights at this hotel. We booked a privilege room which was roomy and exceptionally clean. Our window was facing La Ramblas but once the windows closed you couldn't tell there were thousands of people on the streets below. The location was perfect and convenient. Service was also very good and the decor was hip but classy. The bathroom was huge and the shower/bath combo were the best. After a not so great night at a nearby hotel the previous night...Hotel 1898 was a welcome and pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 1898”
Reviews.Author: benton1220
Reviews.Content: My DH and I stayed here for 3 nights pre cruise 04/30/07- 05/03/07. We booked this hotel based on trip ad visor reviews. It is a really "good "hotel but not the best I have ever stayed at. We booked a superior room which was lovely, but very small with only one window looking out into the back court yard.The bathroom was really beautiful with a really cool shower and enormous bath towels. Very hard mattress but was so tired from walking all over Barcelona was able to sleep well. We did not eat the breakfast for 18 euros. Many places to eat around hotel. Ate at the Attic restaurant right across the street, need a reservation for sure. Next year when I return to BCN I will probably try another hotel there are many to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Location x 3, design and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: J.P.Hernes
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel based on Trip Advisor rating and experience from sister Hotel Jazz (which is more modest and less expensive). The experience lived up to our expectations. As we were a large family group, and we got one suite upgraded to a roof-top suite with a private pool, it actually surpassed our expectations! One thing to remember if you have the pool though, there are other rooms above your terrace, so it´s not for skinny dipping... The kids also tried the roof-top and inhouse pools, among which the indoor pool was the favourite. To have a roof-top terrace with lots of nice sofas, chairs and tables - and a pool, right above the Ramblas, well it´s hard to beat! All rooms were nicely furnised in a comfy and modern style. The staff was young, courteous, friendly and helpful. Breakfast was nice (and as others say - expensive...) and with a large selection of tasty food and drink (bubbles for breakfast?). We´ve tried the Arts, Jazz, Grand Hotel Florida and other hotels in Barcelona - but I think we´ll go for the Hotel 1898 the next time as well. The price / location / hotel combo is proably the best in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Fantastic for a small business meeting”
Reviews.Author: totallydiamonds
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel in a febulous location. We chose to run Customer council of top CEO's at this hotel and it worked perfectly ! The staff are attentive, food creative and REALLY tasty and it is the cleanest hotel I ahve ever been to! The staff seem to be cleaning every minute of the day - its spotless... Pillow menu in the bedroom is a nice touch and the bedrooms are just great Two very small but important faults... Cooked items at breakfast were cold - it cant be rocket science to find a way of keeping breakfast warm!!! Come on this is not difficult And please please get some better plastic glasses for the roof terrace - i promise you, you cam buy really good plastic glasses now! I would however HIGHLY recomend this hotel , and also the Restaurant Quo Vadis round the corner - the settng looks nothing but the food is tops - our clients feasted on , King Prawns, Steak & wild strawberries and raspberries for dessert !!

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: DeeEstuary
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel booked on the strength of reviews on Tripadvisor, fantastic location. We stayed here for 3 nights in early May. There have been a few complaints about the expensive breakfast but if you like a large breakfast like we do it is well worth it. Just one minor complaint about breakfast - the 'hot' food is barely luke warm (but still very tasty), surely the hotel can find a better way of keeping the food hot? The roof top pool and terace is great but be warned that the pool is not heated! Very refreshing on a hot day, but otherwise could be a bit of a shock. The downstairs pool (heated), sauna and steamroom were very good, and quiet. Now - just a plea on behalf of he mime artists on the Ramblas, PLEASE - if you want to photograph them give them a euro or two (or even a few cents), they are very entertaining and go to an awful lot of trouble to make up etc, but it did annoy us people trying to sneak a photo then walking off without paying them anything.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !!!”
Reviews.Author: PaulaJ0
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel !!! I took my fiance for a surprise 40th birthday present and what a brilliant time we had. The hotel is grand without being too pretentious. I booked directly with the hotel (which is cheaper than through an agency) and explained that this was a special occasion and could they allocate an extra special room. When we checked in I mentioned this and although our booking was for a classic room, we were placed in a fabulous room with its own terracing (room 202). The room itself was maybe not the biggest but the attention to detail cannot be faulted. The choice of lighting, the digital radio, the tea/coffee facilities (but take some teabags along if you need your fix first thing in the morning!), the bathroom is stunning and not to mention the spa, pool and steam rooms. What an absolute pleasure it was. Las Ramblas is an experience, the city bus tour a waste of money as its much nicer to walk to attractions. We will certainly be going back to Barcelona and will stay at Hotel 1898 again. Have fun !!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short break”
Reviews.Author: Coffeeman1960
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3-night break in early May. The H1898 is a well-presented modern boutique-style hotel in an absolutely fabulous central location on Las Ramblas. Despite the busy location the hotel was an oasis of calm and our room (which faced into a central courtyard/atrium) was quiet whatever the hour. We found service to be pleasant and prompt; the wonderful breakfast extensive and reasonable value at 19 Euro; the public lounge areas comfortable and impressive; the rooftop lounge/pool area fantastic (though with so much to see we didn't have much time to use it); and the basement pool/spa well presented (even if the pool was a little on the cool side). If we were being critical we might say that the hotel is a little dark, mainly due to the style and finishes (our room saw little daylight) and the room and bathroom could have been larger. Overall I would heartlily recommend this hotel. Given the wide choice available in a city like Barcelona we chose it for it's high tripadvisor rating. If you do the same we don't think you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “"I'll be back!!!"”
Reviews.Author: adethomp
Reviews.Content: We went to Barca a couple of years back and had our stay spoilt by an overrated shabby hotel. Needless to say, our experience prompted us to be a bit more thorough in our hotel research since then and it was time to return to what has now become our favourite short break destination. Our research led us to this gem of a hotel situated as near as can be to the centre of Barcelona and unlike our previous hotel encounter in this magnificent city, this hotel did live up to the hype. From the friendly helpful concierge who greeted us at the door we knew we were in for a good stay. The staff were always falling over backwards to help, and when I wasn't too sure of my skills with the Spanish language, most of the staff spoke good English and were always polite and welcoming. The room was very well appointent with a large double bed, lcd tv on the wall, good sized bathroom with power shower and small balcony. Although as expected in the middle of the city, the views were of other buildings, this was a welcome touch. The rooms were very clean and toiletries and mini bar were well stocked. Unfortunately it was a bit cold in December to test out the rooftop pool so I am unable to comment on that but would expect that if it is in keeping with the rest of the hotel, then it would be just as good. It is in a great location for shopping, site seeing and eating out. I no longer need to look for a suitable hotel for when I return to Barcelona as I will be staying at Hotel 1898 every time.

Reviews.Title: “My best hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: muffingem
Reviews.Content: This was my best hotel experience ever! The rooms are state of the art, the staff helpful, the location perfect, and don't miss the pool, set in the foundation of a 19-century building complete with massage chairs in the water! If this is a four-star hotel, then all others are 3 stars and below!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, Loved it, Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Ronaldobiscottini
Reviews.Content: I agonised for quite some time about which hotel to book for our 3-night stay in April (back yesterday - depressed!). Once I had seen 1898, I kept coming back to it and booked it once I had gotten my head around paying so much for the hotel (£156 per night incl breakfast). Well, my wife and I were not disappointed - FANTASTIC. Here is the good stuff: The decor in the hotel is exquisite, so tastefully done that you could while away many hours just chilling in the lounge or bar. Our room was small but perfectly formed, really classy decor again, great bed, a choice of pillows(!), plasma tv, great bathroom etc etc. Everything you could possibly want. What made the hotel for us was actually what was above the hotel, i.e. the rooftop deck and pool - awesome. I'm afraid some of the Barcelona attractions took a back seat each day as we chilled with our sangrias by the pool, with the mild din of la rambla in the background. Yes, the drinks were expensive, but worth it in our opinion. The basement spa area was also really nice, although we only used it once because the weather was so nice! The location is also great, right on the rambla for convenience, but once inside, you would never know it. Not so good: Some people mentioned noise in their reviews which concerned me, as I am a light sleeper. I was woken two of the three nights, but that was by people coming back to their rooms. I never heard the maid service etc at all and this wouldn't stop me staying here again. Better sleepers probably woudln't have heard anything. I didn't find the staff to match up to the overall 5 stars (although still 4 stars). For example, we sent an email in advance requesting a quiet room and never got a response, and generally the level of servive could I think be a bit better. Summary Overall, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel, especially if you want to stay somewhere where you can happily spend some time relaxing, rather than charging around Barca. I would thoroughly recommend staying somewhere (if not 1898) that has a rooftop pool. Final point - due to my estensive research beforehand (AKA procrastination), I recognised quite a few hotel names as we explored Barca. Montecarlo is right opposite 1898 and looked nice from the outside - again, great location. Passed Casa Camper on last day, near the University, looked nice. Torre de Catalunya is right next to Sants station and too far out of the action in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Hotel - Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: JHG47
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in April of this year. The hotel is in an excellent location on Las Ramblas. The room was a good size with plenty of space. Tea/coffee facilities were provided and the minibar was fully stocked. The restaurant and bar are fine especially after a long day's sight seeing. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was expensive at 19 euros per person but you could have as much as you liked. The weather was rainy so we didn't use the roof terrace or pool but this would have been a plus point in good weather. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend the hotel to anyone wishing to travel to Barcelona. The hotel was a bit pricer than most but we considered it money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: svr48
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here with our two children in late March. The location is excellent and the hotel wonderful. The indoor swimming pool and the rooftop terrace, also with pool, are delightful. We booked the hotel based in part on the glowing TripAdvisor reviews and were not disappointed. It is not cheap but is well worth the cost. Chicago, USA

Reviews.Title: “Understated but wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: only1joa
Reviews.Content: if you blinked you would miss this hotel. no big sign, even our taxi driver hadn't heard of it. booked this hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor for my sisters 21st birthday surprise. was worried i would be dissapointed with the hotel considering the price. I should not have worried and my sister loved it. yes you probably pay a bit extra for being right on the "Las Ramblas" but its worth it, its a great central location. the rooms are lovely, we stayed in one of their "classsic" rooms which are the cheapest and it was lovely and clean, nicely decorated, big comfy bed, gorgeous bathroom with fantastic shower. I stayed in another 4-star hotel in barcelona, which was more expensive, not on the las ramblas and not as nice. I would deffinately reccommend this hotel and probably more to couples and groups of adults than families.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but Not Exceptional Value”
Reviews.Author: Al_and_J
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days at this hotel last week (the week after Easter). I would say the hotel is perfectly adequate for a 4 star hotel, with reasonably-sized rooms and adequate service, but perhaps not quite the "top notch" status as some other reviews might suggest. Although we have no real complaints about the hotel (it justifies its 4-stars), we are not convinced of the premium it seems to command. (It would, for example, have been cheaper for us to stay at the Claris, the Sofia Gran or the Hilton Diagonal Del Mar - all 5 star hotels). What you're paying for, I guess, is its very central location at the heart of town, and close to attractions/amenities such as the ramblas, the gothic quarter and near to transport links. It also has a panoramic roof terrace, with good seating and an outdoor pool (which was surprisingly warm at this time of year), as well as a small (and stone cold) indoor pool and spa. However, there is only one restaurant, and one bar (based round the lobby) and one cafe (not counting the resident Starbucks). The restaurant is competitively priced (at least in hotel terms), but was surprisingly devoid of guest, as it is very easy to eat out (which we did on a couple of nights). The breakfast buffet has a diverse range, and is good value if included in your booking. Overall, this is a competent and well-located hotel, particularly if you can get a competitive rate (which was hard for us, even three months out). However, for the price of 230 euros/£160, it's not quite in the same league as (for example) the Plaza in New York, Claridges in London, or the Shangri La's in Asia. (It's more akin to the Malmaison boutique chain in the UK - but perhaps costing slightly more, with fewer extra touches.) Having said this, though, our stay was pleasant and comfortable, and our only complaint (if that's the right word), is that they sting you 16 euros to advertise one of their flaky umbrellas when it rains. (Guests staying in the hotel opposite were treated to complimentary "Meridien" golf umbrellas.) As for Barcelona, if this is rated as one of the best hotels, then all the other 4 (and 5) star hotels in the city must be considerably wanting. We observed that, although we speak three different languages, it definitely helps to speak Spanish (and specifically the local Catalonian dialect), else you tend to be treated as a second-class citizen with all but the most service-conscious locals (who are few and far between, from our experience). Petty theft in the area also seems surprisingly common - we even met a well-travelled couple who got their handbag/purse stolen by thieves who threw pidgeon poo at them (and used it as a distraction for robbing them).

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel located at the centre of the action”
Reviews.Author: TSYChelmsfordUK
Reviews.Content: The 1898 is a good, modern, efficient hotel located at the top of La Rambla. It seems to have been recently refurbished, and to a high standard. The rooms are dark wood in decor and have an excellent lighting and air-con system. The spa downstairs is adequate. The pool is small but comfortable, ditto the gym. One let-down is the bar area, which is long and narrow and a bit soulless, but as you've got literally hundreds of fantastic bars on your doorstep in Barca it's not a problem. Even though it's located in the heart of La Rambla, the interior rooms are extremely quiet, so sleeping is not a problem. I took my 75-year old mum to the hotel and she slept no problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “An Easter treat!”
Reviews.Author: emmamaria
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 3 nights at this hotel over Easter having been upgraded from its sister hotel Jazz, which we orignally booked, due to a computer booking problem. What a treat! The hotel is at the top end of the Ramblas close to Plaza Catalunya and is a tranquil haven away from all the activities outside. This is an excellent hotel with high standards of customer service, presentation and cleanliness. Huge comfy sofas in the lounge area nice to sink into with a drink from the bar. Prices are expensive compared to bars off the Ramblas but nice to have a night cap before retiring for the night. Took the continental breakfast served in our room which was good value at 9 Euros including croissants, pastries, rolls, jam, toast, yoghurt, fresh orange juice, coffee, more than enough to keep you going. Rooms were very smart with wooden floors, plasma TV, turn down service at night with free dish of chocolates, also slippers and robes provided, and choice of 4 pillows. Also the hotel smelled lovely throughout! We will book this hotel again when we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Wiltshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over easter and it is an excellent hotel. Good service, good quality rooms with little touches like bathrobes, slippers, mini-bar and mood lighting. Rooftop terrace was good place to wind down with a beer/wine after doing the usual touristy things with great views, nice sized pool and comfy seating. Bar is a little expensive but no more than other hotel bars on the main street. Ok for a drink before going out or retiring. Location is also good giving easy access to galleries, port, shopping and of course restaurants and bars. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Unicyclist
Reviews.Content: We visited over the first weekend of April 2007 having seen the good reviews written here, and weren't disappointed. Everything about the hotel was excellent. This must be the quietest city-centre hotel I've ever stayed in - we weren't woken by the usual emptying of bins at 0300, nor by traffic in the morning. The place was immaculately clean, and the staff attentive and helpful. Even the price we paid from a discount website was reasonable. The location is about as central as it's possible to get, even if the tourist scene on La Ramblas is rather tacky. The receptionist provided a useful map of the city centre on arrival. Free internet access was fine and fast with a good signal in our room on the fifth floor and in the public areas. We didn't try the restaurant, as BCN is full of restaurants and bars of all types and standards - it was fun to browse from bar to bar on tapas.

Reviews.Title: “Huge WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: maxtravel4me
Reviews.Content: I was booked and had to stay at Le Meridien, across the street, for one night, but I kept looking at the Hotel 1898 because it is just so elegant, especially compared to Le Meridien. Needless to say, I quickly moved and was thrilled. This is a 5 star for Barcelona since hotels there are just so so, in general, but this one is on par with some of the best hotels I have stayed at. The place is brand, spanking new. It is immaculately clean (there are cleaning people everywhere), and it defines form and function (as opposed to many Spanish newer hotels which focus on form rather than function). I was so very impressed with every aspect of this hotel (and I can't say enough about how picky I am) that I wanted to post my thoughts asap. If you are going to Barcelona, this should be your first place to check for rates if you want a place in the center of town, beautiful big, clean rooms (I am not sure what happened with the previous reviewer but all the rooms I saw--211 was the size of a small apartment--were great), and an incredibly warm and welcoming staff. If you don't value these aspects, well, try Le Meridien...

Reviews.Title: “Nice but worth it ???”
Reviews.Author: ItchyFeetIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in H1898 last weekend - beautiful decor and fab location but at €700 + VAT for three nights in March in a "compact room" I'm not sure I'd go back for a few reasons. With such a fantastic city as Barcelona to see we spent very little time in the hotel but when we did it was REALLY REALLY noisey. The rooms have wooden floors so you hear people walking about in the rooms above and beside you, the areas besides the elevators were marble with the same result and the "bing" everytime the elevators stopped at our floor was also a bit loud. I'd reserved the room directly with the hotel in early January and requested an early check-in but when we arrived we were told that it wasn't possible because it was a busy weekend - it was 11.45am Friday morning. We had to come back at 3 to check-in. Disappointing given the request was made months before directly with the hotel and the less than apologetic attitude of the receptionist. That said the guys behind the bar in the hotel were great fun and make a mean cocktail (even if its pricey by Barcelona standards) and the pillows were amazing...but next time we'll stay in an apartment which seems to be the preferred option of quite a few people

Reviews.Title: “Service hiccups and very noisy!”
Reviews.Author: LGA23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel 1898 March 26-31 and was disappointed. In fact, I'm writing this at 2am the night before a long trans-Atlantic flight back to the States because I can't sleep! It sounds like there's a club in my room ... it's so loud that I can sing along with the music when my head isn't about to explode from the club beat. Apparently, there's a nearby club that literally "rocks the house" on the weekends. BTW, they're currently playing "Flashdance" so the club has questionable music taste. The hotel itself is reasonably nice but the service doesn't match the decor. Other reviewers have noted the location but, believe me, there are lots of hotels in the same location to choose from - it doesn't have to be this one. My primary purpose of being in Barcelona was business and, as such, my key complaints are those of a business traveler looking for service and efficiency ... definitely not what I found: (1) I wasn't offered a map of the city when I checked in (2) I had problems with temperature control in my room. I spent a couple of warm days in the room before calling the front desk to look at the AC, which they said was turned off .... why, they couldn't say. It certainly wasn't obvious the AC was turned off because it's tucked into a side of the closet that requires a sleuthing operation to find. (3) The hair dryer is one of the worst I've ever seen ... It feels like no exagerration to say it weighs a ton and you have to hold down the button continually to keep the dryer on. I had dents in my thumbs after I finished drying my hair. (4) In general, I had a lot of problems with noise .... there was a lot of hammering away in different parts of the hotel during the day and housekeeping was always really loud. I had to call the front desk twice about noise just so I could sleep away some jet lag for 1 hour in the late afternoon. (5) It's impossible to get a taxi at the hotel. This is a real issue for people staying at the hotel for business reasons. I was late to a conference 2 days in a row because it took so long to get a taxi. The hotel apparently has no special relationships with taxi companies. (6) I had to call the front desk to get information on accessing the Internet. I don't understand why this wouldn't be explained at check-in or on a sheet/placard in the room. I spent 5-10 minutes searching for this information in the room before I finally gave up and called the front desk. (7) The hotel gym is missing one of the set of two weights that I use in my workouts. The weight was missing all week so it didn't seem like anyone was in a hurry to replace it. This may seem like a minor issue, but it added up to a general inattention to the detail that creates a good hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - a great hotel in a brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca004
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. We booked a standard room for a long weekend as a bit of a treat, and it was well worth the money. We called ahead and asked to be on a high floor and at the front (after reading comments about the noise from the club below), and were given a fantastic room with a view over the Ramblas. The room and bathroom were big, the bed huge, and the decor throughout was stylish without being desperately trendy. The location could not have been better; we felt pleased to be back there whenever we returned. We were on the third floor - you could hear the club below, but only vaguely. The service was great, and the sense was that you were an appreciated guest. We are pretty fussy (!), and we loved this place. PS. Shop around for the best room-rate as prices seem to vary quite widely.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but..”
Reviews.Author: notrevo
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel and rooms (a matter of taste I guess from other reviews). Yes they are a bit small but hey it was spotless and well appointed. We stayed there for our 25th wedding anniversary and had a great time in Barcelona and at the hotel in general. There was a problem with the hot water and it took me three attempts to persuade reception / maintenance to do anything about it. The bar is great and the staff very friendly, there was always someone cleaning something so everywhere was spotless. The stay was not excellent in my opinion as we had a room with a marble floor outside and you could hear everyone walk past and the maid service trolly sounded like a tram coming down the corridor. I have to say the room cleaners were very noisy and did not seem to respect the fact that people wanted a lay in in the mornings! If I went again I ask for a room away from the lift and maid station, apart from that it is a really nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved, Loved Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: minijaffacake74
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 17 to 20 March and loved every minute of it. Definately the nicest hotel we have ever stayed at. The lobby/reception/bar area is gorgeous. The roof top deck was a fantastic chill out area, but was a bit too windy when we were there to try out the roof top pool. We did spend a couple of hours in the basement spa pool and had it all to ourselves which was wonderful. We had booked a classic room which is listed as having an inner atrium courtyard view, however, when we shown to our room 606, on the 6th floor, we actually had an outside view, overlooking some of the private terraces of the rooms below. It wasn't a bad view by any means and as we were expecting an inside room then to have an outside view and be able to see the sun was a bonus. The room was lovely, very clean, king size bed, minibar (for which the prices were very reasonable), kettle, bathrobe and slippers. I had pre-ordered a bottle of Cava to be brought to the room and this was delivered within 5 mins of being shown to the room. It did take us a few minutes to work out how the shower worked and it was a day before we realised there was an aircon control in the cupboard. The room became stiffling hot and we thought the aircon was not working. We called recepton and someone was at the door within 2 minutes to show us how to work the aircon unit. The breakfast was divine, there was so much to chose from although I wouldn't be able to justify paying 18 euros each so thankfully this was incuded in the rate we paid for the room. Our only real critisism is the cost of the drinks in the bar. Yes you expect them to be on the expensive side but 25 euros for 2 glasses of sangria is a bit on the steep side and we didn't order any more drinks in the bar after that. Also there is a distict lack of English TV channels. Dont get me wrong, we weren't there to watch TV, but a couple of nights were shattered after all the walking we did and it would have been nice to go back and chill in the room after dinner and watch a film. Other than that, we cannot fault this hotel and when we go back to Barcelona we will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms very disappointing and noisy”
Reviews.Author: NikonKing
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that this hotel is in one of the prime spots for a holiday or break in down town Barcelona. In the day within walking distance of the Barri Gotic, shops and other attractions. At night the hotel sits right on La Rambla with bars, clubs and restaurants. We rate the hotel highly on quality and ambiance, the lobby and bar area are very chic. The room was a BIG disappointment €300 a night and you could barely walk around the bed and lack of opening window and dark décor made it even more oppressive. The quality of the room and fittings was high, the room was very clean but it really smelt unpleasant and the a/c didn't work. Worse still the nearby fire door had no closer, so it slammed all night and despite substantial amounts of cocktails we had almost no sleep for the three nights. The reception desk crew where pretty disinterested and did nothing about the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel - worth the £151 without a doubt”
Reviews.Author: HappyMarc
Reviews.Content: I stay in Barcelona quite often but this hotel made this trip really memorable. The staff are genuinely friendly and helpful and the rooms are a decent size. The decor is amazing (classic modern) Complimentary slippers, bath robe and water, decent minibar without the daft electronic tagging so you can shove a bottle of wine in yourself. The TV is flash but lacks channel variety and there are no fils if you are stuck in for a night. The location is excellent yet the rooms are really quiet, I will be back whenever I can afford it.. Attic restaurant across the road is nice for lunch too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location; Not Quite as Good as Prior Reviews”
Reviews.Author: katie243
Reviews.Content: While pleased with the 1898, I was dissappointed given the reviews I perused before booking there. The room we had - a superior room - was beautiful and looked over La Ramblas. Our luggage was delayed a day and the front desk staff was disinterested at best; restaurant recommendations were mechanical: they had a few restaurant cards in a drawer at the front desk and fished one out when an inquiry was made. Staff seemed to have little interest in getting folks to the right place for their budget-tastes. Perhaps it was a language issuebut it did not spoil an otherwise wonderful stay, location is perfect and booking on the hotel website gave us the best rate which included a fabulous breakfast (otherwise 19 euros per person). I´d recommned but you need to do your own homework re: restaurants; tours etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with a great spa”
Reviews.Author: trustytravellerFrome
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel which couldn't be more central but was still lovely and quiet. The spa and roof top pool really make this hotel and are just what you need after a long days sightseeing. Our room was comfy, spacious enough and the bathroom had a great huge rainwater shower head and bathrobe, slippers, nice toiletries etc. The only downside of the room was a rather dingy view over the back streets rather than the rambla that we were hoping for but it was nice and quiet probably because of this. A few eating out tips - Bar Ra behind the market is great for breakfast (as is the market itself), the bar next to the hotel is FAB and you can dance until 3am but don't eat in the Taxidermista restaurant (it was in our guide book as recommended but we thought it was terrible). Also despite what everyone says about the pick pockets we felt really safe although we were careful and didn't use the underground; we used the open top buses to get around as you can jump on and off as many times as you like. The bus from the airport was great too (only @ 4 euros) and dropped us off in Placa Catalunya which was only 5 mins from the hotel. All in all a great 3 day break!

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews, the 1898 is really very good.”
Reviews.Author: MT&FT
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 nights at the end of February and were very impressed. The location, the staff, the decor, the pool, the roof terrace and the price were superb. Having never been to Barcelona before we chose the 1898 after reading the reviews and also for it's location. Barcelona itself was fantastic. We would recommend a trip to the Picasso museum, Park Guell, the Sagrada Familia (such a breathtaking place) and La Pedrera. We also managed to get tickets for FCBarcelona at the Nou Camp, an amazing place. Eating wise we'd recommend Taller de Tapas, Attic (right opposite the 1898), La Fonda and La Veronica. We'll be back one day and will happily stay at the H1898 again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: FamilyT-Stokesley
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a short break in Barcelona with my Husband who had fortunately booked hotel H1898, based upon previous trip advisor reviews. We were not dissapointed, the public areas are decorated beautifully and are a lovely place, to sit and relax with a drink from the bar. On the first night we arrived there was live jazz in the bar which only added to the atmosphere. Our room was lovely; modern decor, spotlessly clean and the bathrobes, toothbrushes, shaver were nice finishing touches. We had breakfast in the hotel on both mornings of our stay and I would recommend taking the time to enjoy a leisurely breakfast in the dining room which over looks the Rambalas. The food was good, with lots of typically spanish dishes including a great tortilla. The hotel is in the centre of the Rambalas yet is quiet and peaceful inside, check in and check out, was quick and efficient and the staff were helpful and polite. I would highly recommend this hotel, my only regret is that we couldn't stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ruthL36
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel 1898 for 4 nights - it was great. The reception areas were great, which created a very good impression upon arrival. We arrived early, but the hotel were able to allocate the room with the minimum of delay. We got an interior room on the third floor. Whilst a Ramblas view would have been nice, the room we got was excellent. Spacious, well set-out, clean and tidy. As was the bathroom. The rooftop pool was great - and you get great views up there. Obviously, in February its not really sunbathing weather but there is a spacious "leisure" area on the roof that would be ideal for relaxation. The basement spa was also excellent - the facilities available were great. We never tried the hotel restaurant (plenty of places to eat nearby) and only used the hotel bar once. To be fair, it was pretty pricey - but not excessive. We would stay here again - and would recommend it to anyone planning a trip to Barcelona. Fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not quite perfect / weird smoking policy”
Reviews.Author: GAP15
Reviews.Content: First of all, the 1898 is an excellent Hotel with a brilliant location right in the centre of Barcelona. I booked it based on the previous very positive reviews. Basically I agree with them, but I would like to share some additional observations that led to my overall positive but not perfect experience. First of all, the reception staff was slow and very inflexible the day I arrived. Basic questions could not be answered and the check-in was tedious. I had reserved a non-smoking room: when I asked the receptionist, I was told that the whole hotel is non-smoking but that all rooms are equipped with ashtrays. Isn´t that a contradiction? In effect, when I arrived in my room and I found the ash-tray on the table and one could tell that somebody had smoked in this room some time ago. Furthermore there was one small burn-whole in one of the pillows ==> definite evidence. I metioned that during check-out but nobody could give me a plausible explanation. The check-out also took an eternity and I was requested to give the "fiscal number" of my company that I had to procure from my assistant back in Germany. I was told that this is general policy in Spain but had never been asked for it in other Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location and a bit more..”
Reviews.Author: Scotscouple
Reviews.Content: My brother & I stayed here for two nights last week for the Barcelona v Liverpool match and our high expectations based on reviews prior to our departure were more than met. We arrived well before the normal check-in time and were delighted that our room was already available to us. The decor in both the hallways and the room was very tasteful. I am guessing that the hotel has been refurbished within the last year. The spa and pool area in the basement was also a great bonus (we didn't venture to the roof pool). We didn't eat or drink in the hotel so I can't comment on the bar / restaurants. A short stroll from the hotel takes you to the transport hub of Plaza Catalunya and the sights of the Barri Gotic. Overall everything about this hotel was ideal for our trip and if returning to Barcelona I'd definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “nearly perfect”
Reviews.Author: enrico-Italia
Reviews.Content: I have just spent four nights in a privilege room at hotel 1898. The decor of the hotel is magnificent if you like some old colonial, richly done, feeling. Room, at least mine, is enough large and cleverly furnished. Service is great, even if not all staff members speak fluent english. Facilities accurate and cool, meeting rooms great and of safe intimacy. Location, it's probably hard to be more central, directly on the ramblas. The only disturbing thing some squeaking noises in the ceiling, caused I guess from airconditioning system that may be enoying if someone is used to deep silence. For the rest a great place to stay, one of the most charming hotels I have been to and definitely a place to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DuncanScotland
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on the trip advisor reviews and was not disappointed. The rooms were fab, staff extemely pleasant and helpful, excellent location, nice spa area, the roof top pool and terrace were ideal for summer visitors. Wouldn't hesitate recommed Hotel 1898.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: MurphyArmagh
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, we booked it because it was the top rated hotel by trip advisor reviews and we were not diappointed!!! It is in a brilliant location, walking distance from many lovely restaurants and sightseeing oppurtunties. The liveliness of Las Ramblas is hard to beat. The staff were very helpful and professional, the rooms were kept to a great standard. We stayed a classic room and it was gorgeous, with a beautiful bathroom. From our window we could see down to rooms below us that had a gorgeous balcony with decking and lovely furnishing, if anyone is booking it would be worth while paying the extra for a room with the private balcony! the rooftop pool was beautiful. We also enjoyed the indoor pool, sauna and steam room. overall I would throughly recommend this hotel to make any trip to barcelona even better!!

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel so far....”
Reviews.Author: adamll
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 1898 over the weekend - the best hotel Ive stayed in and Ive stayed in some top places - classic room was classy so need to upgrade. decor fantastic style with great bar area with chilled leather sofas - sun terrace awesome and underground spa a must relax after walking around the sites of Barc! Recommend for the romantic, drinker or philosopher! will be back once other euo cities explored.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel on the Rambla”
Reviews.Author: SueGreenhalgh
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews on Trip Advisor we booked this hotel and weren't disappointed. We went with two friends and arrived early but our rooms were ready. We had rooms next to each other with an outside view although we hadn't paid for this. The hotel lobby and bar are beautifully decorated, and the theme is continued into the rooms. The rooms have plasma screen TV, wooden floors and a great lighting system, good sized bathroom and generous toiletries. The towels are changed twice daily and your bed turned down. There was a wide choice at breakfast and I thought it was good value. The roof top garden and pool area was lovely but the weather wasn't warm enough to use the bar area although the pool is heated. There isn't one negative thing to say about this hotel. It is a 4 star but you really should go before they realise it is a 5 star hotel and increase the price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Franmc
Reviews.Content: In a wonderful location on bustling las ramblas, this hotel acts as a serene oasis in Barcelona. The communal areas are luxurious and tasteful. The only reservation we has about the stay was the small size of our room - only one chair was provided and when we requested a second chair, we were told to sit on the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: carl555
Reviews.Content: We booked hotel 1898 after reading the reviews on tripadvisor. The hotel is in a great location right on the La Ramblas. The rooms are a little on the small side but very nicely finished with everything you could want. We didnt try the food, chose instead to try the local restaurants. Overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Stunning Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sophdoph
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 day city break, picked H1898 based on reviews on this website, and was not at all dissapointed. On arrival the reception staff were friendly (nothing special but nice nonetheless) and concierge took our bag to our room. The lobby was beautifully appointed, as was the bar and all public areas of the hotel. We stayed in Room 442, a superior room, which was extremely comfortable and spacious, the bed was the largest I have ever seen! We had a small balcony looking on to Las Ramblas - we didn't find the noise a problem. The bathroom was amazing, the hotel slippers and bath robes were a great touch and there was a plentiful array of toileteries! The best parts about the hotel had to be the spa downstairs - beautiful swimming pool with theraputic water beds, lovely steam room and sauna - and the amazing roof terrace with heated swimming pool (which we managed to go in at about 5pm at night, which shows how warm it was considering its February!). We had breakfast twice, (19 euros regardless of whether you stick to continental or not) the selection is amazing but it is overpriced. That was probably the only minor downside, to this otherwise superb hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!- what a luxurious hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: traceyhorsham
Reviews.Content: We had a two night break in Hotel 1898 in January this Year. I booked the hotel through Expedia as the deal was fantastic. We found the hotel easily and the staff were very friendly. The room was full of mod cons and was very luxurious. It is located on the ramblas, however we were not disturbed by any noise. The rooftop pool- WOW!!! and the loungers make it feel like a different world, looking out over the city. I would recommend emailing the hotel if you have any requests as ours was actioned without any problems. What can I say - we will return to Barcelona and WILL stay here again as you could not fault anything. A hotel well worth the cost. Dont miss it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: TxMbr
Reviews.Content: We were VERY pleased with our stay in this hotel. Besides having the perfect location central to everything, it's the staff that makes this extra special. They were all very attentive and accommodating. Every attention to detial has been made from the motion-detecting lights to the cushiony rooftop with amazing veiws. Everything is very clean and cozy - the hotel has a way of seeming like a boutique hotel even though it's large. I'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “1898 - Luxury and winter swimming”
Reviews.Author: Knowledgebuilders
Reviews.Content: One of our best hotel experiences ever. A well-heated rooftop pool meant good swimming even in chilly December. As far as we could tell, this is the only hotel in central Barcelona that provides this. With a comfortable large room on the next-to-top floor (room 610) it was like having a large pool and terrace for ourselves. Very helpful staff. There is considerable variation among rooms within a class, so try to get a look at the possibilities or discuss them with the staff. Contrary to what Expedia was saying, "superior" rooms don't have balconies or terraces. They are the same as standard rooms except for an outside view. The next grade up from superior, which we took (can't remember what it's called) gets you a considerably larger and nicely appointed room.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous 1898”
Reviews.Author: reallyimpressed
Reviews.Content: This is a exceptional hotel.Elegant and sophisticated.Friendly and brilliantly located on Las Ramblas just two minutes from Airport bus drop off point. Good restaurant,pool,internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Even the cheapest room ("Classic") was great!”
Reviews.Author: LKP-VA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on TripAdvisor reviews, and we were not disappointed! It is a beautiful hotel, with nice, helpful staff, and located very conveniently on La Rambla, up near the hub of the Plaza Catalunya. We arrived exhausted from our flight, and were shown to our room (we booked their cheapest room, a "Classic"). It was beautiful, quiet and comfortable, facing onto the beautiful interior courtyard, and we had a pleasant nap before setting out later to explore Barcelona. We also visited (but ultimately did not use) the downstairs spa (it was a little too popular!), and its pool is in a grotto that is unusual and pretty. We also went to the rooftoop, where their outdoor pool was open and heated (some were swimming in it, but the December night air was a little too chilly for us!). Both locations were beautiful and well appointed for relaxation. The day we left, we were able to leave our luggage with their front desk while we explored the city a little more, and the staff was very helpful in our decision as to how to get back to the airport. I would definitely stay here again if ever in Barcelona (Barcelona, by the way, was the highlight of our trip to Spain). A very good experience. Lisa from Williamsburg

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we have stayed in, anywhere”
Reviews.Author: euanfullerton
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Hotel 1898 from 26th - 30th of December 06, and had decided to stay there having read reviews on this site, and we were not disappointed. We stayed in a Superior Room, which boasted one of the largest and comfiest beds we have ever had. The room was easily large enough, and the bathroom, and particularly shower were great. We used the leisure facilities every evening and they were all fantastic especially the pool and its massage beds. My girlfriend also had one of the massage treatments on offer, and she said it was lovely. We did not eat in the hotel, instead choosing to get breakfast and dinner out in the streets. All in all we are delighted we chose to stay at Hotel 1898, and are already seriously considering going back in the summer for some warmer weather.

Reviews.Title: “New Year at H1898”
Reviews.Author: EdMcC
Reviews.Content: Just back from 2 nights (30/12/06 - 2/1/07) at the H1898. We booked it largely because of Tripadvisor reviews and, in all, it more than lived up to expectations. The decor throughout the hotel is something else and the service attentive and unobtrusive. Our room was beautiully decorated, comfortable, spacious and quiet. The only disappointment was the relatively early closure of the bar on New Year's Eve and on New Year's Day evening. It seemed that there was only 1 poor guy serving, with the bar closing at 1am or so. Not what one would have expected and a missed opportunity for the hotel to make a lot of cash from the willing residents. However this was a only a small disappointment in anotherwise super hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Truly great”
Reviews.Author: NN&PN
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Le Meridien before walking across the street (appr. 3 meters) and having a look at the H1898. Totally different level of property. Makes the Meridien look like a 3-star hotel. We quickly switched to H1898 and stayed for a night. Everything from the breakfast, the room, the service, etc. is great. The only flaw to mention is that the subway must be passing by just under the hotel, making some noise every now and then. Not enough to wake you up though. Don't miss the heated pool and the terrace. Great view.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: UKMuffy
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a fantastic 2 night stay at Hotel 1898. It is in an ideal location, right in the middle of Las Ramblas. Originally we had booked a superior room, but saw the rooms below had decked terraces, so asked if we could change, and it was no problem. For 45 EUR extra per night we were shown to a huge room, with a big terrace with 4-seater table, and a raised double daybed. It was warm enough to have breakfast on the terrace both days. The bathroom was a great size, with hugh bath, and a separate shower. This room was definitely worth the extra money, for a special treat! The spa facilities are great. The pool is under a brick archway, and is very atmospherically lit. Along with the sauna and steamroom, they also have a water massage bed which is free for guests to use, and it was a real bonus after a day of pounding the pavements of Barcelona! The staff were really helpful, and always seemed to be there when you needed them, but faded into the background when you didn't. Our room was tidied and cleaned when we got back from sightseeing, and the bed was turned down each night whilst we were in the spa. Bar Lobos, round the back of the hotel, was fabulous for drinks and tapas on saturday night, but there was an hour wait for a table inside. That was fine though - we just decided to take our drinks and eat outside. I would definitely stay here again, for the very central location, the level of service, the lovely room, and the spa facilities.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: paynebyname
Reviews.Content: A great hotel overall that I could not recommend highly enough. The rooms must have been cleaned two or three times a day, the cleaning staff always smiled and had the courtesy to look up, the rooms were modern and classic at the same time, the bathrooms without fault, the facilities were excellent including the spa which was just fantastic and it's positioning could not have been better. I would find it hard to consider another hotel if I went back to Barcelona bearing in mind how comprehensive it is. My full trip report for my 3 day break in Barcelona can be found on [----] under Holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Book it, this hotel is great”
Reviews.Author: MrTwick
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for two nights in November. Had an outstanding experience. Great value for money, booked room through lastminute.com for £100. The Spa facilities were the highlight for me. Room was superb and I would still stay here if the price were double. Breakfast worth doing once although is a little expensive at $18 but the selection is vast. There are plenty of places nearby to take breakfast and the fruit market is on the your doorstep. Great hotel, great location.

Reviews.Title: “We just loved it!”
Reviews.Author: City-Break-Lover
Reviews.Content: Yet again, Trip Advisor helped us find a really excellent hotel to stay in. The staff were very helpful, it was spotlessly clean, the decor was unusual and very striking. We had a room overlooking La Rambla and the sound proofing worked really well. The breakfasts were a real feast - the choice was amazing and everything was topped up really quickly. It was not cheap but it was part of the whole experience. The lounge area has really great seating and just looked so striking. The hot chocolate served at the bar was to die for! I had a really good massage at the Spa and loved the swimming pool and the different features in the pool. The roof top pool was wonderful with views across Barcelona. It would be hard to fault anything - we really hope to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: desbaxter
Reviews.Content: this hotel rates as 4 star but it has stunning decor and helpful friendly staff making it much more.it is ideally located and has nice pools and the rooftop area is great.the deluxe rooms are a bit bigger but worth it.we had a room with balcony over las ramblas; great views and the double glazing keeps most of the sound out though not the subway! breakfast is not worth the 18 euro price (you can't eat enough) but theres plenty of places nearby. overall highly recommended! derek baxter desmondo90@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: palcowburn
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for my 2nd anniversary. The hotel was of a very high standard. The rooms were of a decent size and clean. We went for a superior room which we thought was worthwhile as we think that its much better than the standard room. The bed was huge and the tvs were plasma however there is only a couple of english channels. The swimming pool and spa & gym are of a good standard aswell. As far as barcelona is concerned we found that the city was just ok. We much prefered cancun in mexico and london to barcelona. There was a bad smell round most of the city and the standard of restaurants can only be described as poor! The only decent place we ate at was called something pizza which was an italian on the opposite side of the road then left about 200 yards cant remeber the name. Please avoid a place called the bello italia its the worlds worst restaurant completely digusting and no im not exaggerating. The zoo in barclelona was a very good day out and the sagrada familia is also very impressive. Overall we enjoyed our stay but wouldnt go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for an elegant stay (Member in Surrey, UK)”
Reviews.Author: Beverstone
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona for three nights. Since we had booked the opera, the 1898 (being such a short walking distance from the Liceu) was an obvious choice. We found it to be a highly elegant, modern and friendly hotel. And was excellent value when compared with the high prices often charged here in the UK But there are a couple of points prospective visitors might like to keep in mind. Firstly the breakfast is not cheap. But if you intend to have a really good meal to see you through much of the day, then I certainly recommend it. But if, like me, you prefer a very light snack you could do better to go along the road towards the Liceu and enjoy a coffee and an excellent pastry for a fraction of the cost. Also the bar is expensive and not good. We paid a high price for our dry martini (which we didn't object to given the status of the hotel) but it was not a particularly good one (being too ice-melt diluted) and came without any customary cocktail 'nibbles' that enhance the occasion and one could expect at this price. So having a drink was a rather 'triste' experience , which we certainly did not repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon 10/23/2006”
Reviews.Author: BSIAVELIS
Reviews.Content: We started our honeymoon in Barcelona at Hotel 1898. It was a hip hotel in a great location. I did find it humorous that the only Starbucks in Barcelona was attached to our hotel...yes, a guilty pleasure of mine in the US, but the last thing I wanted to see in Spain! Our room was lovely with a great terrace. Our bartender was very sweet (Lucas). The library was nice with two computers and free email. Classy hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: ScratchyBadger
Reviews.Content: Following a string of excellent reviews on TripAdvisor we decided to splash out and book a Deluxe Room for our week in Barcelona. The room was a good size and the terrace at around 12ft by 12ft, containing 2 sun loungers and table/chairs for 4 people was superb. This type of room is on the 5th floor and is overlooked by non-terrace rooms on the 6th floor. We overlooked a side street so the noise of La Ramblas was only background when on the terrace and non-existant inside the room itself. The room was always spotless, the highest level of cleanliness I have ever come across in a hotel. The staff even come back to the room in the early evening to check on the room and turn down the bed. The bathroom is large and has a great shower. Bathrobes and slippers are also provided. Although the rooftop pool is unheated and a bit small, it is adequate for a splash around and there is plenty of space on the roof to stretch out and relax in the everlasting sun. The communal spa facilities inside the hotel are also a bit small, but if you time it right you can get pretty much exclusive use of the steam bath and sauna. Breakfast is extra at 18 euros per person. The buffet is vast and fresh, catering for all tastes, the only comment being that if you go in the last 90 minutes of breakfast (after 9:30am) availability of food and cutlery etc. becomes restricted and the tables begin to get closed as the staff set up for lunch quite early. So be prepared to share a table with other guests! It can take a while too to get served coffee at breakfast - it can take up to 30 minutes and a few repeated requests until the coffee appears, but on one day we only had to wait 5 minutes. The one day we decided to have breakfast served on the terrace in our room. For no extra cost, you get a choice of four breakfasts, selected by ticking the options on a card that is hung outside the room the night before. Unfortunately for us, it turned out to be a poor experience as the breakfast arrived very late, we had less than half the breakfast delivered and had to wait a further 40 minutes for the rest to come. When it did arrive, the order was still not complete. The evening meal at the hotel restaurant was superb and worth the money, though the hotel did bump up the bill by adding extra glasses of wine that we had not ordered. Following a few recommendations on TripAdvisor, we tried "The Attic" restaurant over the road from the hotel. The food was pretty good and fairly priced compared to the rest of La Ramblas, but they tried the age old trick of adding extra items to the bill and when you ask for the bill out comes a round of coffee. After over 40 minutes of asking for the bill half a dozen times and dodging the coffee, we eventually settled up at the correct price. We did have a problem with the guests in the room next door throwing food on our terrace and one night a lit cigarette thrown onto our terrace whilst we were asleep did cause some minor damage. But the hotel was receptive to our concerns and also responded to a post midnight loud music complaint very well indeed. Again, credit to Jordi! Overall, the hotel is stunning and the rooms are fantastic, but the general level of service is a bit disappointing for a hotel of this standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Norwegiantraveller
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I have stayed at in Barcelona. Stayed there for three nights in October 2006 with my wife and friends. The hotel has an excellent roof terrace, quite lobby and lobby bar, nice (although small) room and nice pool in the basement. The staff was service minded, and fixed those few things we needed assistance to arrange. A perfect place to start exploring the main areas of Barcelona, most of the attractions is in walking distance from the hotel. If you like tapas with seafood Cal Pep, Plaça de les Olles, 8, is a must. Be there early, the lunch is served from 2 pm and dinner from 8 pm. Walk from the hotel, through Barri Gotic, and down to the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: T&BG
Reviews.Content: All we can say is if you're thinking of staying here, book this hotel. We spent one night here after a 10-day cruise in Oct. 2006 and it was just what we needed to unwind. The rooms are bigger than you'd expect in Europe, with nicely appointed bathrooms and comfortable beds, which my husband discovered are adjustable. The spa in the basement is unreal and includes an indoor pool. The spa treatments are resonably priced. There is a rooftop pool with a bar and amazing views. The lobby is spacious and comfortable, sit down and you won't want to leave. Hotel 1898 is right on Las Ramblas, but it's not a noisy hotel. It's just a few blocks from La Boqueria, a must see if you're visiting Barcelona. Luca, the bartender, recommended an amazing restaturant, Made in Italy. The food was the best we had our whole vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a discount”
Reviews.Author: toeringchick
Reviews.Content: Thanks to other reviews about where to stay we chose 1898, this proved to be a success as I had wanted something special for my husband and I as this trip was to celebrate our anniversary. From the moment we entered the hotel the staff were friendly and helpful. What a suprise when we were shown our room, it was beautiful. Everything had been catered for and the cleanliness was amazing. We stayed in the basic room, which was all I could afford and I had a slight apprehension this may be equivalent to a broom cupboard. This was definately not the case and for the two of us it was more than adequate, especially as the break was not being spent in the room but in the beautiful city. The swimming pool and health spa were clean and well equipped. Overall I would stongly reccommend this hotel as a base for a stay in Barcelona as it is ideally situated on Ramblas for access to all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: fro5tie
Reviews.Content: Outstanding Hotel, decor superb, rooms of the highest standard. Could not fault this hotel in any way. Roof top views stunning. Highly recommend staying here. You will not be the slightest dissapointed

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the good reviews”
Reviews.Author: mspw
Reviews.Content: Thankfully the other reviews of this hotel have largely been accurate. I stayed there in early September in a "superior" room for a week and was not disappointed (overall). Highlights: 1: Decent rooms (but I was glad I followed other reviewers' advice to book a "superior" room - it costs more for a reason - its usually a room on the outside of the hotel as opposed to the smaller standard rooms overlooking the inner atrium. The standard rooms' dark walls and small dimensions suffer further from the dingy atrium that restricts most of the natural light). Our room was at the back of the hotel with a balcony overlooking a cafe - not a great view, but pleasant and much quieter than those overlooking the Ramblas. 2: Decent Spa in the basement. Not great when kids were allowed in (supervised), but very quiet in the mornings and early afternoons. The pool wasn't very large (the picture on the hotel's own web-site was accurate), and could do with being warmer, but it was ok in conjunction with the steam room and sauna and there were several spa treatments available. 3: Very nice roof terrace. Although the pool was unheated and you needed to get there early (late afternoon) to grab a large sofa or four-poster bed sun lounger on the west side of the building to catch the last of the sun. 4: 24 hour internet access - albeit in the business centre on the 1st floor. Lowlights: 1: Variable customer service - usually very pleasant but hardly overeager. They have a concierge service but nowhere near the level of service of some other hotels (although this is after all only four star) - they were fairly unenthusiastic when asked to phone a restaurant to tell them we were delayed; and room service also seemd a bit put out about being called after they had overlooked re-supplying tea and coffee! Having said that, I did ask them to arrange for flowers, wine and fruit to be in our room on arrival, which they did, and I was never charged !(surely a mistake). 2: The hotel food was hardly much to rave about. The hotel breakfast is only worth the price if you can eat your weight in breakfast items - we found it much better and infinitely cheaper to buy anything we wanted in the supermarket over the road from the side entrance of the hotel. 3: Availability of food and drinks on the roof terrace was limited. Again, the opening hours of the bar varied a great deal and you were better off taking your own drinks and food up there - a bit of a hassle in a four star hotel! 4: You had to call room service for hot water or milk and there no irons were provided, only an ironing service - ok if you trust your clothes to someone else, but far from convenient when you're in a rush to get out - suffice to say the travel kettle and iron other reviwers advised came in really handy! Those gripes aside, the hotel is very well located, even if the Ramblas is a little tacky. We had no hassles from any beggars, and never felt unsafe at any time of the day or night even though we were often returning at 3 or 4 am. Overall, the hotel was well worth the money which is probably why its so popular even though its not a 5 star hotel. Having seen other hotels I was about to book - Casa Camper (dark, dingy and inhospitable!) and Hotel Neri, where I popped in for a few drinks as friends were staying there, I was not disappointed. A few Barcelona recommendations: Breakfast in the cafes at the rear of the hotel (on Carrer del Carme); great tapas at, "Taller de Tapas" near Santa Maria del Mar church, and even better pancakes around the corner on Passeig del Born. Clubs: Danzatoria in Tibidabo (food and wine was really good although expensive, the club attracts a well-heeled 20 to 30 crowd and is spread over a garden area and several floors of a mansion type house, with a pretty wide range of music (for Spain!)), Shoko is a bit more "low rent" as its in the Port Olimpic area on the beachfront, but is one of the better clubs there. Club 13 / Tarantos in Placa Real was a lot grittier, but the live bands and largely local crowd make it well worth a visit. Try the web-site [--] for more.
