Idling away a few hours (or days) in el Born's boutique antique, gift and clothes shops was fantastic, as was visiting Gaudi's Sagrada Familia and Casa Mila, but I would avoid the more touristy shops and restaurants on the Ramblas (including "Attic" restaurant across the road from the hotel - it comes recommended by some but the service and food was pretty poor quality), as well as any restaurant on Carrer de la Princesa (poor quality overpriced seafood) or anywhere in Port Olimpic (although if you want a quick snack at a "subway" or "Pizza Hut" Port Olimpic is the place to go!!) The Maremagnum shopping centre in Port Vell is also full of tacky gifts and high street rubbish. Cabs are not too expensive, but the metro was ideal - it was cleaner, cheaper and more frequent than the london tube and usually quicker than a cab if you don't mind not seeing the sights as you travel. The 3 official guided bus tours that start from Placa de la Catalunya are also well worth a try. If you have time, a tour on each takes around 2-3 hours or so, and you get to see virtually everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in best location”
Reviews.Author: pedro3gb
Reviews.Content: A 5 minute walk from the airport bus stop leads you to this new hotel at the top end of The Ramblas - right opposite Le Meridien. On entering by the revolving door you notice the beautifully stylish sofas and chairs in herringbone and stiped fabrics. The decor may be classed as 'historic' on the nn website but its not at all old fashioned or chintzy. The reception staff are friendly and helpful and carried out little tasks such as charging a run down mobile phone. The main lobbly is also brilliantly stylish with loads of seating, artwork, model ships in cases etc. Rooms are something else and everything is high quality. The floors are solid mahoghany and green marble in the bathroom, matt laquered wardrobes and doors, double twin bed with a selection of four different types of pillows, bathrobes and slippers and a wide selection of quality toiletries, even totthbrushes, paste, shavers, and shaving cream. Coffees and teas were provided but if you want hot water and milk you have to ring room service. You do get a silver flask full of hot water with silver jug of milk within about 5 minutes. We did not take breakfast in the hotel as $18 is quite expensive if you eat small breakfasts but all around are great cafes where you can get a perfectly adequate one for under $5. Farrgi is a good bet for this. Alternatively try one of the half slices of paw paw, dragon fruit or mango wrapped with spoon from thye market just down the street. The bar, like many hotel bars was quiet and two whiskies came to $14 - not excessive bearing in mind the quantity you get in Spanish establishments. This hotel seems to be the same price with every booking agency so not worth shopping around.

Reviews.Title: “A few niggles”
Reviews.Author: Petitchapeau
Reviews.Content: Had a three day break in Barcelona.........drove there, so found locating hotel a tad difficult, as don't have sat nav and signage incredibly discreet. Car Park great, although at 20€ a day it should be. Missed the speakerphone on exit, and tripped up on the none slip floor! Would have liked kettle, but understand reasons why they don't have one. Check with staff for location of Air Con controls. We spent two days altering the sound system (which didn't work) in an effort to adjust temp. The very friendly reception staff sent a 'lad' up to show us how to work it and we were somewhat embarrassed to discover that the controls were in the cupboard by the safe!! B/fast pricey at 18€, but a very good selection including sparkling wine. There is a café on the other side of the Rambla which is cheap and cheerful with great coffee. The Moka I think. Great location, very clean, good bathrooms and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “You will love staying here!”
Reviews.Author: djclaire
Reviews.Content: WOW WOW WOW!! My boyfriend and I treated ourselves to 2 nights of luxury in this hotel situated right on La Rambla in Barcelona! It was a sight for sore eyes after all the driving we had done around France and Spain! Right from the time you walk in the door, you know you are going to have a great time here, and it really is a haven from all the hussle and bussle of the busy street outside. Through the revolving doors and the bellboy takes your luggage to your room.... We stayed in a Classic room (the cheapest option) with breakfast as an optional extra (for a charge of course). This room really was as described in the literature just a nice quiet place to be. Wooden flooring and panelling really did give this a touch of class. Green marbled bathroom with `rain` shower head made for the best shower I have had to date! Bathrobe and slippers made you feel right at home here. Other great touches- a pillow menu, minibar, flat screen TV (family friendly channels), mood lighting. Our room 206 had its own mini terrace with dining table so you were able to eat out there or smoke if you are a smoker. I would not recommend this particular room for children therefore. Of course, if you get bored of fiddling with the mood lighting, you can always take a dip in one of the hotel`s 2 pools- the rooftop pool with views over the city and mountains, or the basement pool with its mood lighting and hydro beds! There is also a small gym and massage facilities (at an extra cost). Breakfast was a very civilised buffet affair with absolutely everything to choose from. You certainly wont leave here feeling hungry! Summary: I cant wait to return!! You wont be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 1898 vs Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: azazaz
Reviews.Content: THE BEST BARCELONA HOTEL! Stayed at Hotel Monte Carlo 3 days pre-cruise and 1 post cruise night at Hotel 1898. Hotel 1898 wins hands down. I wish we'd booked this hotel for all of our days in Barcelona. I'm very particular where I stay and I could not find one thing I'd change about the comfort and convenience offered. The rooms were much smaller than Monte Carlo but it was large enough to meet our needs. We were in a premium room with a small balcony that overlooked Las Ramblas and there was absolutely NO street noise when the balcony door was closed. I did see some interior rooms that were very small so booking premium for a few dollars more is definitely worth it. I don't understand how Le Meridian gets away with charging so much more for their rooms when 1898 is directly across the street for so much less. We ate dinner at their restaurant one night and it was definitely gourmet quality, a little expensive but the ambience made it well worth it. The drinks on the rooftop patio were around 12E each, but they were large enough to qualify for two drinks and they did not skimp on the alcohol. There is also topless sunbathing so if you're offended avoid it. Can't wait to go back to BCN and I now know which hotel choice we'll be making in hotels if we ever get the opportunity to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: LRKTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel 1898 is probably the best hotel I have ever stayed at. Great location and impressive facilities - from the room, to the lobby and bar, to the rooftop pool and basement spa! The hotel was a quiet oasis from all of the craziness going on on the Ramblas for which it is located. Until you step outside you would never know that you are in such a central location. We just had a classic room, but found it to be a nice size. It was well designed and comfortable. The staff seemed helpful (particularly hot and flirty bellboys!) and took a charge off my bill at checkout for a mini bar service that I did not use. The spa area on the basement level was worth the cost of the room! It was a great way to rejuvinate after a day of sightseeing. Would definately recommend this hotel and stay here again when in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Really Impressive”
Reviews.Author: mrgekko
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the 1898 at the start of October 2006. It's a fantastic hotel - in many respects a 5* experience, though perhaps falling short of an official rating on one or two technicalities. Things that you may find useful when considering booking are : * Roof Terrace - Gloriously quiet with panoramic views of the city, nice bar, but no food. (note you can zip out and get a salad in 5 minutes and bring it back without any eyebrows raised!) *Concierge - are very efficient and booked us into some "unbookable" restaurants at short notice (including Moo which is a must if you want to indulge!). Also left a note in our room confirming this had been done * Location - is possibly as good as it gets. You can pretty much get anywhere you need with ease. Bus-service reliable and easy to work out. We explored a lot and the only cabs we got were to and from the airport. * Agree with the earlier post about the noise from the maids which is quite loud (but the earliest we heard was 9.00am and our room was right opposite one of their base rooms). The rooms were spotless though. * Spa - Pool small but fun, sauna and steam rooms both fine, clean etc. Again if you want to indulge massages were very good. * Price - in response to the other poster who said that the hotel charges for everything, i'm a little surprised. True that there is no kettle in the room but my wife and I asked a few times at the bar for hot water and milk which was provided for no extra cost. Maybe it was the room service delivery element that caused them to be charged. Also, breakfast cost is pretty competitive for a hotel of this standard and of good quality. I've stayed in similar hotels across the continent where a similar spread has been a lot more expensive. Overall, this place is highly recommended and all the positive reviews below, which prompted us to book, are spot on! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Blissful experience with Hotel 1898!!”
Reviews.Author: *travelbug983*
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this hotel purely based on the impressive reviews we read on the excellent tripadvisor, which has never failed us! I can say that we found the reviews to be a true representation of the place- great hotel, ideal location and wonderfully atmospheric. Even the negatives were on point- watch out for the early morning wake up call from noisy housekeeping staff- two mornings in a row we had a woman barge into our room at 7.30 in the morning!! However, the positives definately outwayed the negatives and we will be booking again- and i can't wait!!

Reviews.Title: “classy and quiet”
Reviews.Author: francishint
Reviews.Content: perfect place to stay a week-end and discover the heart of barcelona. The situation is very central: all the main tourist attractions are within a few minutes walk and it is a convenient situation to go out in the evening and enjoy the night in Barcelona streets. we stayed there during a very special week-end (Merce or Virgin Mary celebration on 24 sept 2006) with lots of noise in the streets during the night and we were pleasantly surprised to have a very quiet room. we had a "classic room", which was not big (according to US standards), but spatious enough (according to European standards), with everything my wife wanted (clean batchrooom, bathrobe, hair dryer...) we agree with all previous comments on the interior design and decoration: in one word, splendid! the breakfasts are exceptional ones, with everything you may wish (including local champagne); of course for a rather high price (€18 per person) and the terrace on top floor has a very good view on Barcelona definitely one of the best hotels we ever visited, and we will certainly go back there as soon as we can

Reviews.Title: “They charge for EVERYTHING!”
Reviews.Author: Danspoon
Reviews.Content: The hotel it's self is bautiful, very elegant and in an amazing location, plus if you get a ramblas view, your stay will be very memorable, however, they charge a fortune for everything. We had coffee in our room but no kttle, so you ask for hot water which they brought up, but I also asked for milk in my coffee (no UHT in the room), 6 Euro's! 6 Euro's for milk in my coffee!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Booterstown
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband for 10 nights in August 06 and we were not disappointed. The style and ambiance of the hotel is quiet and relaxed, and whilst staff are friendly, they keep a respectful distance. The decor is new and the hotel is very clean. Our room was well attended and although our classic room was a little on the small side, it was very quiet and the bathroom (especially the shower!) was fantastic to return to after a day around Barcelona. However, for us the real advantage of this hotel was the spa/pool in the basement. This was often very quiet and we were able to rejuvenate at our leisure. The location of the hotel was also very convenient as it is centrally located and within easy walking distance of many sights. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who will be visiting Barcelona and if I return to this city I will definitely be booking my stay at Hotel 1898!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: largie100
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three day break at Hotel 1898. What a fantastic find, great location being right on La Ramblas, fantastic facilities, wonderful rooftop pool and a small but perfectly adequate indoor pool. If I had one critiscism it would be that they need to extend their spa treatements, having said that I had a wonderful massage and felt thoroughly relaxed. I would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 1898, Lovely Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: parny
Reviews.Content: A truly lovely hotel. Arriving into the Foyer you definately get the wow factor. The hotel room was lovely and very clean, however we noticed there was a leak in the bathroom so we were upgraded to a superior room which was at the front of the las ramblas but too noisy for our liking so we were moved back to a classic room. The location was excellant. The spa was out of this world (see photos) and the rooftop pool was a gem, lovely for relaxing after a day of sightseeing. Before choosing this hotel we read some tripadvisor comments that mentioned noisy services, namely air conditioning and plumbing. These can be a bit noisy depending on what room you get (light sleepers beware). Overall an outstanding hotel. Well recommended and in an excellant location. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: bal7sois
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful time at the Hotel 1898. We stayed there for three nights in mid August before a cruise. We picked it based on the reviews we had read here and we were not disappointed. The Room: We had opted for one of the Deluxe rooms with a balcony. I don’t know if it was just the luck of the draw or if it was because we mentioned it was our honeymoon but we ended up with a room with a giant balcony (it was much larger than the neighbouring ones). It had a double lounger, two single loungers and a table that could have sat eight. It would have been very easy for us to throw a party out there had we wanted too. It made for a welcome retreat when the roof top lounge area was crowded. The room itself was great. It was a good size although not particularly large. It was very clean and stylish. The flat panel tv was a nice touch as well as a good space saver. Our bathroom was surprisingly bog with both a bathtub and a separate shower stall. The Hotel: All the public areas were just amazing. The lobby was very luxurious. The roof top pool area had great views and lots of their loungers. Being at the spa pool was like swimming in a wine cellar and seats with the water jets were just the thing after a hot day of sight seeing. The Service: We had absolutely no complaints about the service. When we arrived they were able to give us our room right away even though it was 11:30 and check in wasn’t supposed to be until 3:00. Because it was our honeymoon they sent up a complementary bottle of Cava. The clerks at the front desk were very helpfully with restaurant recommendations and directions. Also, on our first night there the air conditioning mysteriously stopped working in the middle of the night. We called the front desk and we had someone there looking at it in less than five minutes and luckily he was able to fix the problem about as quickly. Food: The only food we had at the hotel was the special Hotel 1898 breakfast, which we ordered form room service on our last day. It was pricey but it was a tonne of food and done very nicely. We didn’t eat at the restaurant mainly because the menu was a little ordinary and we wanted to sample the Catalan cuisine. Other reviews had mentioned the Attic that was right across the street from Hotel 1898. We really enjoyed it. The food was fantastic and the prices were incredibly reasonable. Quibbles: Our only real complaint with our stay there was that we had a service door next to our room that banged loudly whenever it closed. This was not a problem at night but was disturbing when sleeping late or napping. A more minor complaint was that the air conditioner controls were inside of the closet and very hard to read. A flashlight would have come in handy. Also, be aware that bar in the lobby is very expensive compared to bars along La Ramblas. Overall we loved our stay at the Hotel 1898. We cannot wait to go back for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, the pool on the roof is an Oasis”
Reviews.Author: adlr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. I would and have recommended it to anyone. The pool on the roof in summer time is an Oasis and considering where the hotel is based it is a quiet and private.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GavandClaire
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at Hotel 1898 and have to say that the hotel lived up to all of our expectations after reading the reviews. It was most definitely more 5 star than 4 star with the rooftop pool and day beds being a very luxurious feature and the views from there- WOW! and at 165euros a night was a bargain! The room was spacious ( we stayed in room 308) and although a little dark ( it being a coutyard view room) it was very quiet and pleasant- peace and tranquility away from the hustle and bustle of the Ramblas. The bathroom was fabulous with a great shower ( the biggest shower head I have ever seen) and plenty of towels, bathrobes, slippers and complementary toiletries. The bed was huge and comfortable and the different lighting very relaxing after a hard days sightseeing,eating and drinking. The only criticism I have is that we requested an iron but were advised that they only offer a laundry service. The indoor pool, gym and steam room/sauna were more than adequate. We chose not to eat in the hotel instead opting for the many resaurants/ Tapas bars and market nearby. Breakfast - the market for its choice of fresh fruit and a very handy starbucks next door. Dinner- Dont eat til late -10pm earliest. We tried many restauarants but one of our favourites was 'set portes- passeig d'isabel ll 14'. Its been there since 1836 and has queues out the door so you have to book. The paella was delicious. Will definitely stay again at the 1898 - a real treat!

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona oasis”
Reviews.Author: tolhurst
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 2 nights in early August following Trip Advisor recommendations and were not disappointed. The location could not be better and although we arrived late in the evening, it was service with a smile. Our standard room was not large, but provided the peaceful rest we were looking for. Breakfast was very adequate and many ate in the restaurant in the evening as the outside restaurants were very congested and busy. The hotel is basically new and oozes charm and atmosphere, The features which make this establishment stand out include ; the silent Charlie Chaplin movies showing in the foyer which make this area a calm oasis from the busy world outside; the fantastic roof top pool and lounge area and the modern ( although somewhat dark) decor of the interior. A great deal of planning has gone into the design and development of Hotel 1898 and all concerned should be congratulated . The staff were very attentive and helpful. Thank you all for a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Perch1
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 4 nights at 1898 with my girlfriend and got to say we were both very impressed. Stayed all over the world but the difference in this hotel is it's ability at key times to take you away completely from the bustle and noise of its central city location. Our room was third floor and had a balcony with side view of Ramblas which was fantastic for early evening atmosphere however has completely soundproof when it was time to call it a night. One thing though - we requested king bed and got twin beds which led to some interesting complications. Roof top area had a tranquil, relaxation feeling and the lift took you straight from there into the basement " cavern" spa area and gym which again was faultless. Would recommend this hotel to anyone - can't wait to go back to Barcelona to stay there! Didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on food, however ate in El Gran Cafe in the Gothic area ( great atmosphere and food ) , Los Caracoles ( a favourite apparently - great but very busy - be prepared to " mix it up a bit " ) and Cal Pinxo Palau de Mar in the harbour ( very romantic but the most stuck up waitresses ever encountered ! )

Reviews.Title: “Excellent = 110% Recommended - Can't Beat It!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tashyj
Reviews.Content: Stayed Aug 11-13 2006. My Boyfriend and I love 5 star and this Hotel impressed in every facet. Go for the Premier room - ask for 601 this room was fantastic. Great Decor, everything is in top condition and the hotel could not be in a better location right in the middle of everything and 1 minute walk to the metro. The underground pool was beautiful and the top deck lounges were great too. The staff were the friendliest I found - David and Martha were outstanding in assisting with every tip and location. 10 out of 10 for this joint.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: pecanman2
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in the best location. Bathrooms and bedrooms are awesome but the beds are like sleeping on a slab. Staff was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: daviduk
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in fantastic position on Los Ramblas. Would recommend it unreservedly. Stayed for 5 nights in August and thoroughly enjoyed it. Bedroom was a decent size with very good air conditioning and beautifully designed. We upgraded online and I would guess that the cheapest rooms are quite small. Ground floor reception/lounge/bar area excellent Rooftop pool area with spectacular views over city. Another (indoor) pool and gym in basement Free internet access Starbucks next door

Reviews.Title: “pure indulgence”
Reviews.Author: bjwales
Reviews.Content: opted for this hotel after reading all the great reviews and was not disappointed! Have travelled the world and this hotel comes up top in luxury - choice of pillows depending on the position you sleep!! Breakfast is worth the added cost as it is pure heaven - homeade pancakkes etc could have stayed all day there!! Great location and the roof top swimming pool and a cold lager just topped off a great holiday!! great location for the sightseeing bus and central for the shops! Will definetly return!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Oceans14
Reviews.Content: A friend advised my to book the 1898. And am I glad she did. The colonial style, the locaion and the staff - it`s all just great! I stayed in a junior suite and found it well worth the money. And they even have some great suites too. Each of them with it`s own plunge pool! I am coming back.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, nicely decorated, service and atmosphere needs approvement”
Reviews.Author: Fiech
Reviews.Content: We stayed in July in this hotel at the Ramblas instead of going to Arts (sea side 5 star) again, because of reviews on tripadvisor. The 1898 at the Ramblas is nicely decorated an still brandnew. We had a fantastic room with a lounge terras, and this really gives THE touch to our 4 days trip. I priorly arranged some flowers and the reception assited me very kindly. The reception is actually also the concierge service. This brings me to one important point for all of you who are spoiled by 5 star services. They really do not offer this. It is really a 4 star and sometimes even a 3 star. The reception staff is 6 stars, really, but the rest is...mmm. Roomservice do not want to bring any food or drinks to the roofterras. The bar on the roofterras is not opened until 1700!!! although there inroom brochure says it is opened from 1200 to 0100. So no service at all at the roof and the splonge pool is only 1.20 deep and very small. In the evening for drinks; no music, no barsnacks, no nuts, no glory, no atmosphere. To bad, cause it has potential! The bathroom is small and has no seperate shower. It's good, not excellent. They do not speak english at the health/beauty club and it is short of staff, so no pedicures for us. This is a great hotel when you book the room with the outside lounge erea. Decoration is hip, the atmosphere is not. So it is recommended, but do not expect 5 star service, they do not make the extra mile. High potential though!

Reviews.Title: “Unreal”
Reviews.Author: Harveymtl
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel in Barcelona, and you are smart, you'll stop right now and book and the 1898 Hotel. First class hotel. It is a four star, however should be a five star. Only complaint is the size of the rooms was quite smaller, but the hotel in general more than made up for it. Location is unreal, Price was a bargain, pool in the basement was gorgeous, and a pool on the roof which was breathtaking. This hotel, single handidly made Barcelona a better experience on my vacation (Barcelona btw even with a motel 6 is gorgeous).

Reviews.Title: “1st Wedding anniversary at Hotel 1898”
Reviews.Author: Louis99
Reviews.Content: I have just spent a long weekend at Hotel 1898 in Barcelona with my wife to celebrate our first wedding anniversary and I have to say that that I couldn't have selected a better spot! The hotel is only rated as 4+ star according expedia, but is definitely better quality than some 5 star hotels I have stayed in. The facilities were next to none, with the pool and bar area on the roof especially enjoyable in the Catalonian sunshine. The decor throughout the hotel is a very tasteful colonial style with lots of dark wood. All of the fixtures and fittings are of a very high quality and our room had a large wall mounted flat screen tv. When I travel on business I don't usually order breakfast , as I always find it to be over-priced and/or dissapointing. The breakfast at the 1898, however, was very good value for money (€18) and the food was both excellent and plentiful. The only (very minor) critisism that I would have, was that although the price of most drinks at the bar was average for this type of hotel, (e.g. a G&T was about €8, a beer about €4), when I ordered two glasses of sangria at the pool bar the price came to a whopping €25, which I think is highly overpriced for cheap red wine with lemonade! However, this aside I cannot fault the hotel in any other way and of course I got plenty of brownie points from my wife for having picked such a great venue for our anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Great!”
Reviews.Author: Johnny1066
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights in the 1898 Hotel. Probably one of the best value for money experiences I have had. The room was very comfortable, the place spotless and the staff attentive and professional. I would not hesitate to recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - will be going back asap!”
Reviews.Author: elsabran
Reviews.Content: A colleague and myself stayed at 1898 at the beginning of July for a work trip. We both work in the fashion industry and would be bringing clients back to the hotel so we needed somewhere that would impress - and it certainly did. Because the hotel is newish, we managed to get quite a good rate on the room. It was around the same price as some of the more traditional hotels on La Ramblas but you got so much more for your money. The hotel is really modern but has an old school charm, for example dark oak walls and marble floored bathroom. It adds a cosy feel without losing the sleekness. Oh by the way, bedrooms have a free pillow menu! Breakfast was great and catered for all the health freaks to full on english breakfast and cakes. Location could not be better - you're right in the middle of the centre but we were never disturbed by noise since the rooms are sound-proof. I was on a work trip so only managed to check out the rooftop pool once but it was so lovely sitting on the deck with a cocktail. The views of the city were great and it was so quiet from where we were - you would forget you were in a busy city. I had a full body massage which was so relaxing that I almost fell asleep at dinner later on! We will be going back next year and so will our clients - everyone loves it!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Lou16
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel & very helpful staff. Rooftop pool and sofas amazing and the Spa pool in the basement is worth a trip too!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: flyboy78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from July 3st till Aug 3rd. Stunning building in an amazing location. The entrance off La Rambla is beautiful, what a first impression! The rooms were great, fantasic decor, nice flat screen TV. Wonderful shower. The attention to detail is exceptional. As for the now famous rooftop pool, well it really does live up to expectation. You need to experience it, that's all I'll say. Indoor pool is great too, very very relaxing. I thought breakfast was pricy at Euro 18. Also bar can be expensive, but you would expect that. Didn't sample the food, purely because I didn't fancy any of it. Hotel staff were VERY friendly and VERY helpfull. You must go there, it really is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Out-of-SFO
Reviews.Content: We just spent three nights at 1898 and were very pleased in all respects. As it is located on La Rambla, we were concerned about noise and had therefore requested an interior standard room. We were shown to our room on the third of six floors, which had two large outward opening windows overlooking a small inner courtyard with potted plants at the base. Because of that, the room was a little darker than exterior rooms or those exterior with terraces, but we preferred that over potential street noise. Location was great, though in a very touristy area. You can walk to all of the main points of interest, and we did not have any trouble hailing a cab either. One real bonus is the Boquiera Market, which is about a block further down La Rambla -- incredible outdoor covered market for meats, seafood, fruits, bar-style restaurants. We bought some food there and brought it back to the room one day. Do watch for pick pockets there and on La Rambla generally, as you would in any highly congested area where it is easy to get distracted by all of the goings on. Spain overall felt very safe, certainly safer than large cities in the US, but like anywhere petty crimes of opportunity will occur. The hotel occupies what was formerly the headquarters for Compania de Tabacos de Filipinas, which was built in 1881. It was completely redone 8 months ago and provides an interesting mix of very modern high-end furnishing and wall treatments but the original fascade, high ceilings (in rooms too) and ornate details. Because it is so new, it has not yet been written up in the guidebooks; however, I expect that when the new editions come out that this hotel will be right at the top. While we paid 150 euros per night without breakfast, a room of our standard room's quality combined with the overall luxe feel of the hotel and its full range of amenities would easily fetch $350-450/night in San Francisco or New York. The rooftop deck, which has a very modern lounge-y feel with built-ins and other freestanding seating areas, is lovely with views out over the city in all directions. It was especially welcome in the evenings during our stay becauses it was so hot during the day. The pool located on rooftop is on the small side, but nice for cooling off and lazing around. On the floor below the streel-level reception desk is another pool/spa facility, which is pretty amazing. Apparently the stone and brickwork arched ceiling over that pool is part of the original building and was uncovered during the renovation. It feels like you are in ancient roman bath or a wine cave, but the new pool itself, which is larger than the rooftop pool, has jacuzzi jets, two overhanging waterfall type fixtures, and two stainless steel lounge chairs that are submerged in the water with pinhole jets in the backs/seats. There is an adjacent steam room and sauna, as well as a glass enclosed air-conditioned exercise room with treadmill, etc. Plenty of towels, water, changing facilities, etc. All of the above is free to hotel guests. The rooms were handsomely decorated (peeked in a few others while being cleaned), complete with large plasma tvs with good array of English channels, in-room music system, and room lighting that allows you to dim the lights to various levels at the touch of a button (modes: welcome, relax, reading, nighttime). The bathroom was all forest green marble with both hand-held shower hose and rainfall showerhead. It was initally a bit confusing to figure out how to go from tub faucet, to hand-held, to rainfall mode. There is a towel warming rack, which was great for laundry. Plenty of toiletries, hair dryer, etc. In closet safe, fridge, etc. I couldn't, however, get an iron when I inquired about it, though they did have laundry service. They offer pillow service as well, which I tried. The room came equipped with hypoallergenic synthetic pillows, two each: one longer bolster-type and then one larger European square pillow. The card in the room offers several other pillows, including down and memory foam. We tried those two, and the housekeeping staff left the originals as well, so we could go back and forth between them. As others have noted, the rooms have two twins pushed together, which does appear to be common in Spain. It makes for spacious king, but isn't ideal. Air conditioning, which we needed worked very well. However, there was a consistent intermittent mild bonking noise, which we finally realized only occurred when the air was on. I would imagine that it was specific to our room, and it wasn't a big deal. There is a large, nicely decorated computer room -- think clubby with sofas, music, great lighting, magazines while you wait. There are two computers with printers, all free of charge. There is no concierge to speak of, though the reception desk attempts to fill that roll. The front desk employees' affect could afford to be a bit more friendly, but they weren't actually negative or surely. I guess I would summarize their mode as slightly cool. Overall, one of the nicest hotels that I have stayed in; hip but not at the expense of comfort. I'd definitely go back and highly recommend it. I wish that every city that I visit had a hotel as nice as this one and at similar rates. While there are three rooms with private pools on the corners of the fifth floor, and others with private terraces, I wouldn't hesitate to stay in a standard interior room as we did, as the overall hotel amenities are so wonderful that you will be very happy with the communal outdoor areas. The hotel is not cuurently very busy from what I can gather, which I think is due to the fact that it is so new. It would an overnight success in Manhattan or LA, or any urban setting in the US for that matter. Best way to book, according to the hotel, is as we did, through their website nnhotels.es. They have several hotels in Barcelona, including Hotel Jazz, which is also highly rated by tripadvisor reviewers. We saw it as we were riding by in a cab one day, but did not actually go in.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the 1898!”
Reviews.Author: NCreviewer
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe room at the 1898, and the extra money meant we had a private terrace - which was almost as big as the room! It had 2 lounging sofas built into the walls as well as a table, shrubs, and complete privacy. We enjoyed eating breakfast on the terrace, and one night we bought food at the market and ate dinner outside, too. I also used it to sunbathe. Yes, it costs more - but we were on our honeymoon and we wanted a great space to hang out, and we were very pleased! We also very much enjoyed the rooftop terrace and pool. In general, we thought the hotel was great - the housekeeping service was very good, and the front desk was helpful with our requests (ask them to call you a taxi, which only takes about 10 minutes, because they are a bit hard to hail). We had the breakfast in-room twice, it was great! We were also pleased to be greeted by a complimentary bottle of cava upon arrival. We never heard noise from the other guests or from the street. The location of the hotel is great and we would definitely go back (although it was pricey). We were disappointed that the king-size bed was two twin beds pushed together (but I gather that is relatively typical in Europe?) and we found the lack of a clock in the room to be puzzling. We also found the temperature in the room to be inconsistent - sometimes we froze and sometimes we were warm.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: mogstown
Reviews.Content: We spent an excellent three nights at this hotel last weekend, which I chose based on the recommendations from this website, and I have to say, we were not disappointed! I had booked us a deluxe room (direct with the hotel through their website) which certainly had a wow factor, and an amazing private terrace (about the same size as our bedroom) from the double doors in our room. The view from the terrace (we were on the fifth floor) was great and there were table and chairs, and padded benches to sit on and laze around. We requested a bottle of champagne in our room for arrival, and this was done without any fuss, they even sent me the champagne list in advance so that I could choose. The room was lovely, the bathroom fantastic, believe everything everyone is saying about the shower - absolutely great, nothing like anything I've seen in the UK. The lighting in the room was also very good with four levels of lighting available. Despite others' comments, we did have breakfast in the hotel on two mornings. I felt that it compared very well in price to the breakfasts in full service hotels in the UK, and there was a great variety in the buffet (though the cakes looked a little rich for that early in the morning!!) The concierge was very helpful in supplying us with a map of Barcelona, even going so far as to point out which roads to avoid in the midday sun, and which ones had the best shade. We did have a slight issue with the bar service on the Saturday evening. Before we went out to eat, we thought it would be nice to have a drink in the bar, but the bar team member did not acknowledge us, and we waited, and even though he was attending to someone else, he did not even acknowledge us, or smile, or say hello, so we decided to go somewhere with a little more friendliness and warmth. The only other issue we had was on our last night, when we could hear running water, and so we couldn't sleep. The night porter came to our room, and heard the noise, but was unable to solve the problem (still not sure what it was, could have been coming from room above?) but he did offer us a room move, but as we were checking out in the morning, we declined. He handled it well, but no mention of a reduction in the rate to compensate our wakeful night. Still, we did love this hotel, the roof terrace is great, with fantastic views, and a good opportunity to relax after walking around a very hot Barcelona. Towels are supplied, so just bring your bathing suit. The location of the hotel is excellent, and we would recommend it to anyone looking to be pampered. I'd recommend the deluxe level room which was very good. We'd go again, and we're hoping to visit this lovely hotel and fabulous city again later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous spot”
Reviews.Author: JanCh2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 1898 from 21st to 23rd july. Excellent position , half way down the Ramblas. Lovely hotel, nice decor and furnishings, excellent staff, really comfy room and bed. Our room had a balcony overlooking the side street but was very quiet. We had breakfast in the room and it was excellent. will definately go back. We ate in the restaraunt and the food was one of the best we had, the other being La Forma in Zona Olympica near the Casino.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Service could Improve”
Reviews.Author: nickstar33
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a wonderful weekend in Barcelona staying at the Hotel 1898. The hotel is superb- set in a great location and the rooftop pool is awesome. I reserved a classic room as when I called to enquire I was told that the Classic rooms which sit on the inner courtyard were all exactly the same size as rooms in the next category up, so I booked one of these thinking we wouldn’t spend a great deal of time in the room anyway. However when I was shown to my room (room 510) after waiting 20 minutes, it was small, dark and awkwardly shaped, and looked nothing like the images on their website. A bed was pushed up against the tiny window making the room even darker. I checked the floorplan on the door and this room was indeed smaller than the other internal rooms as it was on the corner by the lifts, so I called reception to change the room. As no other Classic rooms were available I had to pay an extra 50 euros per night for the privilege but the Superior room ( room 635) I now had was terrific – light, bright and airy with a street view. The hotel 1898 have no dedicated concierge- and I was told that all the reception staff could assist with any query, but when I asked them to recommend a restaurant for dinner I was sent to an overpriced tourist trap on the beach with terrible food and awful service. This wasn’t helped by the inaccurate directions they provided. Taxis also seem to be quite difficult for them to organise (perhaps due to the location), but we were always kept waiting ages or were advised to walk. If you're looking for a great - and cheap - seafood restaurant, then try La Paradeta on C/Comercial 7 about a 15 minute walk from the hotel. Superb seafood, served refectory style. Choose from glistening mounds of clams, mussels, squid, spider crabs and whatever else the boats have brought in, let them know how you’d like it cooked (grilled, steamed or a la marinera), pick a sauce, buy a drink and wait for your number to be called. . I would recommend Hotel 1898 as a great place to stay, especially for the wonderful rooftop terrace and the central location but don’t ask the staff for tips or advice and make sure they don’t put you into one of the small and dark corner rooms on the inner courtyard. Oh, and watch out for the 2 elderly gentlemen standing by reception – I have no idea what their role was as they never spoke, never assisted with anything, never did anything in fact, but they were always there- management perhaps, but what they were managing I do not know?

Reviews.Title: “Best Value to money. Great people”
Reviews.Author: xeron
Reviews.Content: I frequently stay at the Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton hotels. Although the service isn't quite at the same level. It's very good. The staff are personable, helpful and expressed a sincere degree of actually wanting my trip to be an enjoyable one. The rooms are well worth the money. They are modern, clean, well airconditioned and well proportioned. I stayed at the hotel for almost seven days and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone considering staying in Barcelona. I believe that the same group also owns the Hotel Jazz,

Reviews.Title: “Sensational!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: everypicture1971
Reviews.Content: I think I would have to say that this is the best hotel I have ever stayed in,and I thought that the Bellagio in Las Vegas would take some beating. The hotel was once an old tobacco exchange and the decor is in keeping with this old colonial style.The first thing that hits you(apart from the very welcoming air conditioning)is the beautiful lobby and its sumptious leather couches and gorgeous high end furniture and fittings.You simply know that you are in a quality establishment . We opted for a premium room(265euros per night although this will go up in the coming months as Summer peaks) .It was worth every penny.The room was just fantastic with your every need catered for,from the wall mounted plasma television,to the luxurious bathroom(with beautiful high end toiletries,dressing gown and slippers).There was various light setting that I have never seen in a hotel room allowing you to control virtually everything from your bed.You even had a brochure denoting the various pillows you can order that are condusive to the way in which you sleep(incredible I know).All this is complemented by a beautiful wooden floor and fantastic decor.You could be forgiven for spending the whole time in your room. If you do drag yourself out of your room then you may have difficulty in dragging yourself from the pool and roof top terrace with a bar and very attentive staff. Coming back to the hotel from our various sight seeing trips we headed straight to the basement and into the spa pool,sauna and steam room,that was simply luxurious ,and absolutely spotless with staff everywhere cleaning and replacing the free bottled water. We didn't eat in the hotel aside from breakfast(which isn't included in the price),which was excellent. The surprising thing is that the hotel is a 4star luxury and the le Merriden across the street a 5star and double the price.I have stayed in le Merriden hotels and they aren't a patch. We will without doubt return.This truely is a fantastic hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel for weekend break”
Reviews.Author: dee090
Reviews.Content: First of all - a big thank you to everyone who previously reviewed this hotel and bothered to recommend it on this website. Based solely on the reviews, we booked to go for a 3 night stay. Thought the hotel was great. Wonderful location on La Rambla. Stylish decor in public areas and bedrooms. Quiet room despite location. Staff all friendly. Fantastic to have rooftop outdoor pool and loungers and also indoor basement pool with gym, steam room and sauna (free to hotel guests). Would definitely stay at this hotel again. Had a brilliant weekend break and hope others who visit Barcelona and stay at Hotel 1898 enjoy a similar experience.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fijidrama
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location, right on the ramblas, but we were not disturbed at all. The rooms are lovely, comfy bed and good sized towels in the bathroom. We even had a balcony which we were not expecting. The spa in the basement is fab - really nice pool with lots of bubbles which you can control - either sitting on the steps or on a lounger in the pool. The steam room and sauna were also a welcome suprise. The pool at the top was also lovely, although the one time that I went to use it, they had emptied and were refilling it! However all around the pool were great loungers with cushions, including two king size bed benches which are very easy to fall asleep on! Also towels available around the pool. Would highly recommend this and would definatley stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel - we loved every minute!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a perfect five night break to Barcelona. It was our first trip to the city and Hotel 1898 had been recommended us. We booked directly through the hotel (the availability was far better than on various travel websites) and the price was great too. From the minute we arrived we were delighted with our choice. We couldn't fault anything about the hotel. We were upgraded on arrival and our room was fantastic - full of small touches to make it extra special. We didn't eat our meals in the hotel but made full use of all the rest of the facilities, all of which were above expectation. We spent early evenings relaxing on the huge sunbeds by the roof top pool with its fanastic views and had a massage, sauna and swim in the basement spa - again the service was impeccable and the little touches - sunlounge style jacuzzi chairs in the pool, waterfall showers - made all the difference. The location is ideal for exploring all of the main tourist areas - the metro is a 2 minute walk, although we walked nearly everywhere. The hotel is so quiet you wouldn't know you were on the main tourist drag. I am not a fan of major tourist areas but La Ramblas is great for people watching and street shows (although I would not eat anywhere - there are far nicer restaurants not far away down the side streets). The hotel is extremely reasonably priced for what are more than 4 star facilities and service. We loved every minute of our stay at Hotel 1898 - we will definitely be returning to Barcelona and wouldn't even consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Totally perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vanessamunnings
Reviews.Content: Every now and then you come across an hotel which goes the extra mile and hits perfection. In my opinion, this is exactly what the H1898 does. The location is very central - not far from the adorable El Born and Boqueria - and I would advise booking one of the de luxe rooms. The private terrace is totally to die for and is one up on the more expensive junior suites. Have breakfast brought to your room and enjoy it on the decking, with your priovileged bum on the wonderful cushions. I travel a fair bit for business and you really notice the little touches that make an hotel exceptional. This is defintiely one. As such, we are going back for my boyfirned's birthday this weekend and Ihave booked 15 rooms to take some VIPs there in August! Only gripe was that they were a little touchy with me as I checked out half an hour late as I could not tear myelf away from the rooftop pool!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was great - can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great. Wonderfully furnished and the pool and deck area on the top floor was great for that well earned bit of relaxation after walking around Barcelona for hours. The hotel is very central on Las Ramblas. Las Ramblas is very touristy now - and well worth avoiding. Don't eat there as the restaurants aren't very good and are expensive. However, this wouldn't stop us from staying at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Oasis”
Reviews.Author: amtalbot
Reviews.Content: The hotel was top notch. The service, accommodations and food were all excellent. The roof top pool (with great lounge and bar) should not be missed for the views and relaxing atmosphere. This area, as well as the entire hotel are a nice escape from the hustle & bustle of Las Ramblas. The staff are all fluent in Spanish & English. This made my stay even more enjoyable as I'd been in the French countryside prior and had a difficult time with language interpretation. It was the little things (heated towel racks, high powered blow dryers, light settings at the touch of the button that include "read", "relax" & "welcome" as their level indicators, that really made the rooms special as well. I would HIGHLY recommend staying there and will myself again.

Reviews.Title: “1898 is a perfect base for Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: CSUK2008
Reviews.Content: Ok...Where do we begin! I need to set the context for this trip. It was our 11th wedding anniversary on June 24 2006. My wife and I have been together since we were both 19 years old; we have been together for about 20 years  This was our first visit to Barcelona and I had planned this as a surprise trip. My wife knew that we were going somewhere, but she did not know exactly where. As we drove up the M1 and she thought we were heading for the Lake District or something like that. Flights Ryan Air - 10/10 you pay for what you get. We flew from Luton Airport to Reus, with Ryan Air. Both out-bound and return flights were on time and trouble free. My wife didn’t even know where we were when the plane touched down at Reus. She thought we were in South of France because the pilot mentioned the Pyrenees. It was really funny (by the way I did not blind fold her, but she did have to wear headphones and promise not to look at any of the flight display boards). On both flights we managed to get window seats, sitting together! By the way this was not by fluke. If you don’t know the form, here are some tips on what to do: •Check in desk - Get in the Queue before the check in desk actually opens. This will increase your chance on getting a boarding number between 1-90. If you get there about 2 hours and 15 minutes before the flight you should get you a good number. •Check in early – The check in desk opens two hours before the scheduled flight. Have your photo ID with you and a copy of the email from Ryan Air confirming your flight. •In the departure lounge sit near the gate, they call you up by number order, Families with kids first and then boarding card numbers 1-90, the 91-180. Gate 2 (Luton) Out-bound and Gate 5 (Reus) Return. If you are brave enough, start queuing up about 5 minutes before they actually tell you to. This will increase your chances to getting on the plane early. •From there on it’s a foot race, so wear your running shoes  A coach runs from Reus – Sant Station and Sant Station – Reus; the coach timetable coincides with the Ryan Air Flights. Cost 18 Euros return trip. 1898 Hotel: 10/10 (it is more 4 ½ star than 4, but not quite 5 star) •Brilliant location, •Lovely interior, petty good quality finish and I am a construction manager by profession.! •Helpful staff / professional Marti, Adrian and I think Laura - they gave us a map of Barcelona and advised us where to visit. They even made and confirmed restaurant reservations for us. •Brilliant facilities – I loved the roof terrace! Check the views •Room 206 – rear facing court yard balcony - rooms 201 – 206 I think have balconies •Quite to sleep in a night and well sound proofed, it was even quite when the balcony door was open. •Biggest shower head you will ever see! •Shower was easy to use – although from previous reviews some people struggled to works it out. •Top tap turns the shower and bath tap, off and on, but you have to depress the button to switch between the shower and bath •Middle tap – temperature •Bottom tap – mini shower head •€2.00 for 200ml of water from the mini bar (steep), so go to the sweet shop on the opposite side of the road on La Ramblas, about 300m down heading towards the harbour. €1.30 for a big bottle and keep it in the fridge. Top quality hotel….I will not be staying anywhere else if I return. Central and you won’t have to waste your time travelling too and from the hotel. Restaurants & Clubs we visited: 7 Portes Restaurant – it’s not all that great Rating = 6/10 I booked this with Top Table before we left. I hear it is the oldest restaurant in Barcelona. Lovely establishment, with smartly dressed waiters, poor service (our fault – had we spoke Spanish we might have had a better experience); the manageress spoke good English but the waiters did not. Average food – the menu sounds better that the actual quality of the food. Despite the non English waiters, had the food been tastier the restaurant would have 9/10, the food let it down. La Vinateria del Call – Great Tapas Traditional Catalonia Tapas bar Rating = 9 /10 La Vinateria del Call is Located in the Gothic area about 3 minutes from the square. Don’t be put off by the way it looks from the outside. The staff are warm and helpful and Jordi spoke very good English (they have English menus). The Catalonian house table wine was about €7.00 a bottle and we even purchased a bottle for €6.00 to take back to our hotel. We had stuffed mussels, stuffed mushrooms, mixed minced/ground meats (hot dish), tomato bread, mixed Tortia and wine. We were the only English speaking people in the restaurant, as this is a place where Catalonians go to eat, traditional (although I heard that Tapas is not a traditional Catalonian dish). Jamboree -Club We boogied on Saturday night, got to Jamboree about 1:30am in the morning after dinner at 7 Portes and a stroll down the beach. The music was Hip-Hop (some old school), little bit of R&B. Worth visiting if you like black music. Upstairs – was pop and disco, it was packed on both floors and the crowd were cool. Sight we visited: La Sagrada Familia – Still under construction and another 33 Years left, brilliant architectural detail. Guell Park– Get off a Vallecara Station (to experience the 600m walk up stairs and outside escalators; it’s a trek so you have to be fit to make it; I have ever been up a road sooooo steep). Lessop Station on the other hand is an easier and a more casual stroll to the park, better if you have a medical condition, but it is about 1200m away. La Ramblas– Nothing much to see, except for watching the world do pass you by whilst sipping on Sangria , lots of food places to choose from, the market is near and so is the Gothic Area and La Ramblas leads down to the beach and harbour The Beach & Harbour – only visited this at night after eating at the 7 Portes restaurant, look great at night but not too sure what it looks like during the day. All in all, 1898 is awesome establishment. The Le Meridian (opposite) is probably as good, but probably twice the price. Good luck canutesimpson@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: waterstone
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights here at the end of June/early July, in a superior room without breakfast included. The room was large and looked out on what appeared to be an alleyway. I believe there was some sort of small restaurant with a patio there, and there was occasional noise as a result. However, it was generally very quiet, and I'm not especially worried about the view. The furnishings and decor are contemporary, though the materials used seem fairly simple. There was a very comfortable king-size bed with nice linens and various pillows to choose from. To their credit, hotel management has installed hardwood floors in the entryway and main room. Air conditioning was excellent and the closet was large. There was a flat-panel wall-mounted LCD TV. The lighting, in its various settings, can be controlled from the bed. The bathroom is nicely done in green stone and was very roomy. Huge towels, constantly replenished toiletries (including toothbrush/toothpaste, razor/shaving cream, and the usual other supplies), plush bathrobes and disposable slippers were provided. The showerhead is about the size of a dinner plate and water pressure and temperature were excellent. There is a restaurant which is really not too bad. I had dinner a couple of times and found the staff to be very pleasant and helpful. The food, while not wildly creative (go to Abac, Moo, Cinc Sentits, Comerç 24, etc. for that), was tasty and featured good ingredients and simple preparations. I didn't spend a great deal of time interacting with the staff or using the spa. The lobby area is somewhat dark but tastefully decorated. Features of the old Compañía General de Tabacos de Filipinas building have been carefully preserved. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and colleagues. The clientèle wasn't upper crust (if that matters to you), and there seemed to be a number of small tour groups booked in as well. I only hope that the current standard of the hotel will be maintained.

Reviews.Title: “All Round Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JillT_6505
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading reviews on this site and we were not disappointed. My husband and I stayed with our 16 year old daughter and her friend. We treated ourselves to a "privilage room" and the girls had a "classic". Our room was about 50% bigger than theirs and had a beautifully large bathroom and overlooked the street, which in truth we didn't really look out at much! The girls room overlooked an inner courtyard and they said the room did feel quite dark most of the time. As other reviews have said the showers are fantastic, but hey they're only 8 months old, hope the standards keep up. Air conditioning was also very efficient. Needless to say the girls made great use of the spa facilites and the rooftop pool and sun lounge area was just out of this world especially after a hard days sight seeing. The breakfast is definitely worthwhile if you have the capacity for big breakfasts, otherwise it's an expensive waste when there are so many cafes etc right on your doorstep. Breakfast in the market is a must. The location too was perfect for us as we wanted to let the girls have as much freedom to explore on their own as sensibly possible, which they successfully did. We decided to eat in Attic, which is opposite the hotel, on our last night. It's a large restaurant and we arrived at about 8.30, quite early by Barcelona standards, they had a lot of empty tables including most of the window ones, but the girls had walked up the stairs first and requested a table for 4 and were being shown to a table right at the back of the restaurant, I asked if it was possible to have a table in the window at which I was told they were all reserved! I must admit my back went up immediately as he was not prepared to offer any other table, so I said thank you but not for us and went to walk out. Needless to say the maitre de stopped the waiter and asked why we were leaving and hey presto we got a table in the window. These tables were not reserved as we sat near the entrance and plenty of other people came in without reservations and got shown straight to these tables. After this minor glitch though I have to say the food and service were great. Happy Hols

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: MarylandTrvl4fun
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very clean. Rooms were exactly as dipicted. Pillow menu made my day. Across from Le' Meridien. Close to everything. Will be staying here again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of delight”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine World Traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my boyfriend in this hotel in May for 3 nights and we were both very impressed. Both of us travel quite alot and have stayed in 5 star hotels on numerous occasions. Hotel 1898 is every bit as good as any 5 star hotel and was magical from the moment we stepped into the foyer - very modern unique chic decor. The Charlie Chaplin slient movies playing on the LCD screen in the lobby is a novelle idea. We had a delux room on the 3rd floor that overlooked the street, as the windows were sound proofed we never heard any traffic at night. Although satellite TV, Sky News was about the only chanel in english. Bathroom was very large with beautiful marble work - bathrobe and slippers for both of us and they were very generous with restocking the toiletries every day. Down side if you want to have a tea or coffee you must order the hot water and as is often the case in warm climates - it wasn't very hot! The staff were all very helpful and were always smiling and polite.. The jacuzzi was wonderful, as was the indoor pool (although on the small side) and the sauna just perfect for relaxing on holiday. My boyfriend is a major Starbucks fan and was delighted to have one next door to the hotel - there's even a Dunken Doughnuts open 24 hrs a day a few doors down. Breakfast is definitely best from the market - again only 3 min walk from the hotel. Ours tended to be an unhealthy mix of delicious fruits and decadent chocolates!! Hotel is in a central location right on Las Rambles - within 10 min walk of the port area and only 2 mins from Placa Cataluyna where you can get a "hop-on-hop-off" city tour bus every 10 mins. Great way to get initial feel for the city. Shops were also in 3-5min walking distance of hotel. Would definitely recommend hotel and would love to return to it soon again - however I fear it will become very popular and the prices may increase too.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: MFSM
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely modern hotel right in the heart of La Ramblas. We found it on Expedia at an excellent rate. It´s directly opposite the Le Meridien and I´m sure is about half the price! It´s only five minutes away from the Gothic Quarter and to our delight, less than five minutes away from the Mercat Boqueria, which is a great place to have your breakfast (everyone must pay a visit to Bar Pinotxo for your morning cafe con leche!). I wouldn´t bother to eat breakfast in the hotel. Staff were professional and polite. Our room was a little on the small side but otherwise it was great. It overlooked the inner courtyard which was fine as I would think those overlooking the street would be noisy. The roof top pool is too small for laps but fine for a dip on a hot summer day. There are also lots of comfy sofas and ¨beds¨ for lounging about on the roof in the evenings when the day cools down. There´s cable TV though only about 2 channels in English and the rooms come with all modern amenities except you have to call for hot water if you want to make tea (no kettle in room). All in all, I would definitely recommend a stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: squoogle
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in a great location. The rooms are a good size with nice modern bathrooms. I would guess that all the decor has been done on the cheap as the furnishings whilst quite stylish were not particularly high quality. The facilities were great. There is a nice outdoor pool (too small to swim in) with many loungers too enjoy the sun in. It is a shame there are no shaded areas. In the basements there is a nice indoor pool with spa area which is nicely done. I felt the service was a little bit lazy. The hotel was not very helpful about our late departure and wanted to charge us 60 euros to keep the room late which we felt was excessive. Overall I would certainly recommend the hotel to anyone wanting a very good hotel without paying premium prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Central Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: DizLondon
Reviews.Content: After trawling this site and others, we went for this hotel for a short weekend trip to Barcelona. We went there on route to a friend's wedding so I was looking for somewhere central that would give us access to all the main tourist spots. The hotel is ideally located at the top of the Ramblas right opposite the beginning of the Gothic quarter. I found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. The room was small but really clean & contemporary in design. We overlooked the middle courtyard which was great for us as it meant we weren't disturbed by the noise on the Ramblas. The breakfast is fantastic if a little expensive (you're looking at around £15 for it). So, either make sure you give youself plenty of time to graze or head out to one of the coffee bars in the area to grab a coffee & pastry. The highlight of the hotel really for me was the rooftop pool - very peaceful and relaxing after a day's sightseeing. I would definitely recommend this hotel as a very good mid range option.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, calm, haven”
Reviews.Author: Scaggers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my partner for 3 nights over the May bank holiday weekend. The hotel is in a fantastic location on La Rambla and within walking distance of the port / beach. Despite it's lively location the interior of the hotel is calm, cool and chic - an oasis in the madness. The decor is modern and tasteful - all dark wood and monochrome with splashes of red - but has character as it has retained a lot of the period features during it's conversion. The rooms are a moderate size and everything is extremely clean. We went to the hotel wanting a relaxing pamper and weren't disappointed. The basement of the hotel has an indoor pool with jacuzzi and a sauna / spa / gym area. The roof of the hotel has an outdoor pool and numerous sunbathing areas with cushions (big enough for two). There is also a library with free internet access. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We didn't manage to eat in the restaurant (there was too much choice outside) but the hotel bar was a great place for aperitifs. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a romantic or relaxing break.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel 1898”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this wonderful hotel from 18th - 25th May 2006. This hotel is a 4 star hotel - we normally stay in 4 star hotels but this hotel was more like a 5 star. The décor in the hotel is beautiful - so tasteful. This is a relatively new hotel (November 2005), housed in an old building – some taxi drivers are still not aware of it – if you tell them the entrance is opposite the entrance to Le Meriden hotel on c/ Pintor Fortuny, they will get you there! The staff in the hotel were friendly and very polite, and spoke perfect English. The room was excellent with 4 settings of mood lighting and an excellent quiet air conditioning system. The room was comfortable, clean and extremely quiet. It also had wooden floors, a safe (big enough for a laptop) and a large plasma TV with satellite TV, but the only English channels available were Sky News and BBC News. The rooms were serviced twice daily, and the bed turned down in the evening! The sheets were changed every day and the towels twice daily! The shower was excellent. The buffet breakfast was absolutely delicious, an extremely wide choice and the coffee was wonderful! Breakfast was available from 7am to 11am. We ate twice in the hotel restaurant and although there wasn't a wide choice of menu, the food was excellent and reasonably priced. We didn't use either of the swimming pools or gym but they looked lovely. The hotel was well placed on La Rambla; close to the shops and a 20-minute walk from the marina. Other restaurants we can recommend in Barcelona are The Attic, which is directly opposite the hotel on La Rambla – we did have to wait quite some time for the food though. Restaurants outdoors by the Marina were good. We went to 2 other restaurants 7 Portes and Neyras, which were both highly recommended, but we were very disappointed with the quality of the food. (Maybe it was their chefs’ day off) we went to Neyras on a Sunday and had to wait an hour for the first course! We went to 7 Portes on a Wednesday and had the paella, which they are supposedly famous for, it was very salty and their recommended red wine was undrinkable, it was so acidic! I hope this review helps you to decide to stay at the 1898 Hotel on La Rambla – we can’t recommend it highly enough, you won’t be disappointed.
